div0.head: *l
div0.entryFree: l, la/mbda, or better la/bda (v. sub voc.), to/, indecl., twelfth (later eleventh) letter of the Gr. alphabet: as numeral l/ = 30, but l' = 30,000.

la_-, insep. Prefix with
intensive force, as in lakatapu/gwn, lakata/ratos; cf. also lai/-margos.

la/|a, = lei/a (
booty), Pi.O.10(11).44 (lai/+a codd. vett.), IG7.37 (Megara), cf. Hsch. s.v. laia/n.
la/ages: oi( xlwroi\ ba/traxoi, Cyr.
laan: . . kai\ qula/kion, e)n w(=| oi( h(ni/oxoi ta\s ma/stigas a)poti/qentai, Hsch., cf. Poll.7.116 (where the same thing is called sa/rgalos).
la/ana: e)pi/staton, Hsch.; i.e. la/a(na, = la/sana.
laaco/s, v. laoco/os.

la_a/rx-hma, atos, to/, dub. sens., e)n tw=| laarxh/（mati） e)[kteqh/tw] PTeb.64（
a).145 (ii B. C.).

la_a/rx-hs, ou, o(,
commander of a laarxi/a, Inscr.Mus.Ales.31 (iii/ii B. C.).

la_arx-i/a, h(,
division of native ma/ximoi,
settled in cleruchies, PTeb.61（
a).112, 62.258, al.(ii B. C.).
la_/arx-os, ou, o(, = laa/rxhs, PStrassb.91.2 (i B. C., in dat. -w|).

la=as, o( (also h(, AP7.491 (Mnasalc.), Nic.Th.45), acc. la=an （la=a Call.Fr.104), gen. and dat. la=os, la=i: dual la=e: pl. la=es APl. c., gen. la/wn, dat. la/esi, Ep. la/essi, all which forms occur in Hom., exc. la/esi, which appears in Epigr.Gr.455.2 (Bostra), IG14.499 (Catana): —also masc. la=os, o( la=o (sic) o(/de Inscr.Cypr.93 H.; acc. la=on Puchstein Epigr.Gr.p.76 (Memphis), Riv.Fil.56.224 (Cyrene); gen. la/ou S.OC196 (lyr.) codd. (cf. Hdn.Gr.1.109), Leg.Gort.10.36; acc. pl. la/ous Hes.Fr.115, Simon. ap. Sch.Il.Oxy.1087.40; dat. la/u+s ( = la/ois) Corinn. Supp.1.33 (fem.), cf. Serv.ad Virg. G.1.63:—poet. Noun (also in dialects, v. supr.),
stone, esp. of stones thrown by warriors, o(/son t' e)pi\ la=an i(/hsin Il.3.12, cf. 7.268, al.; l. a)naidh/s, of the stone of Sisyphus, Od.11.598; o(/s min la=an qh=ke turned her into
stone, 13.163, cf. Il. 2.319.
laba/: stagw/n, Hsch. laba/bhr: lakani/skh, Id. labanti/s, i/dos, h(, name of a vegetable, gloss on i)fu/a, Id.

la^ba/rgu^ros, on,
taking money, w(rologhth/s Timo 18.
labba/nw, = lamba/nw, Foed.Delph.Pell.1B14.

la/bda, to/, indecl.,
the letter l, Ar.Ec.920 (Sch.), Eup.359 (prob.), Pl.Cra.434c, Arist.HA514b18, Callias ap.Ath.10.453d, Phld.Po.2 Fr.42: the form la/mbda, Ar.Ec.l.c. cod. R, v.l. in Arist.l.c., etc., is incorrect. (Hebr.
lāmedh.）
labda^kismo/s, o(, (la/bda) a defect in pronunciation, Quint.Inst.1.5.32 (pl.), Diom.453 K.

labdoeidh/s, e/s,
formed like a

*l, o)stou=n l. the
os hyoïdes, Gal.18(2).957, Orib.25.8.1; r(afh/ the suture in the skull between the occiput and sinciput, Gal.UP9.5, Ruf.Onom.133; dia/gramma Theol.Ar.3. (lambd- is freq. written in codd. and is v.l. in Gal.UPl. c., Orib. l.c., but labd- Poll.2.37, 4.133.)

la/bdwma, atos, to/,
a figure like that of *l, Iamb.in Nic.p.14 P.

la^b-h(, h(, (labei=n)
handle, haft, la/ban tw\ ci/feos Alc.33.2, cf. D.27.20, etc.; labai\ a)mfi/stomoi, of a cup, S.OC473, cf.Ar.Pax1258. as a pugilistic term,
grip, hold, belti/wn ou)k e)/stin e)n ma/xais l. pw/gwnos Alexander Magnusap.Plu.2.18ob, cf. Plu.Thes.5; w(/sper a)qlhth\s l. zhtei=n Id.Fab.5: metaph., ta\s l. tou= farma/kou Gal.11.426. metaph.,
handle, occasion, mh\ meqh=|s to\n a)/ndr', e)peidh/ soi l. de/dwken Ar.Eq.841; l. ga\r e)nde/dwkas ib.847, cf. Lys.671, D. Prooem.2; w(s a(/pac pare/dwken l. Ar.Nu.551; w(/sper palaisth\s th\n au)th\n l. pa/rexe Pl.R.544b; o( lo/gos h(mi=n oi(=on l. a)podi/dwsin Id.Lg. 682e; l. paradido/nai ei)s e)/legxon Plu.Cic.20; ei)lhmme/nos h(\n prosh/kei l. u(po\ filosofi/as Id.2.78b; ei)lh/mmeqa labh\n a)/fukton Nicoch. 3 D.: so in pl., ta\s o(moi/as . . l. labei=n A.Ch.498; ei)s ta\s o(moi/as l. e)lh/luqas Pl.Phdr.236b; ta\ maqh/mata fai/h tis a)\n laba\s ei)=nai filosofi/as Xenocr. ap. Plu.2.452d, cf. D.L.4.10; e)n labai=s ei)=nai or gene/sqai to be at
grips, of wrestlers, Plu.Eum.7, 2.979a; ei)s laba\s h(/kein Id.Luc.3; of an orator, a)fu/ktous [dei= ei)=nai] ta\s l. D.H.Dem.18, cf. 20; laba\s a)ntilogi/as dido/nai
opportunities for refutation, Id.Rh.8.15; also in friendly sense, filikai\ l. Plu.2.660b.
attack of fever, Hp. ap. Gal.19.116.
taking, accepting, e)n a)rgu/rou labh=| A.Supp.935;
catching, of a ball, Gal.Parv.Pil.3.
turn, of a bandage, Id.10.432. Anat., in pl.,
insertions, attachments of muscles, Id.18(2).1006.
eye of a needle, Aen.Tact.18.10.
la^b-h/rois: potisthri/ois, Hsch.

la^b-i/dion, to/, Dim. of labi/s 11,
pair of tweezers, Dsc.1.68.7, Gal.12.687, PHolm.6.11. Dim. of labh/ 1, u(pode/rein dia\ tou= l. tou= smilari/ou Leonid. ap. Aët.6.1.

la^b-i^do/w,
seize with pincers, interpol. in Dsc.Eup.1.50.

la^/b-ion, to/, Dim. of labh/ 1,
haft, Str.12.2.10.
la^/b-iros: bo/qunos, Hsch.

la^b-i/s, i/dos, h(, = labh/,
handle, Gal.2.704;
hilt, LXX Jd.3.22, EM594.9. Act.,
holder, i.e.
forceps, Hp.Steril.244, Hermes38.282 (cod. Laur.), Apollon. ap.Gal.12.659.
clamp, clasp, Plb.6.23.11; l. sidhrai= Inscr.Délos 442 B 168 (ii B. C.).
tongs or
snuffers to trim lamps, LXX Ex.38.17 (37.23), Nu.4.9, v.l. in J.AJ8.3.7. = pura/gra, Cyr.

labra^gor-e/w,
talk boldly, brag, Anon.in Rh.159.2, 161.34.

labra^go/r-hs, ou, o(,
bold, rash talker, braggart, Il.23.479.
labra/zw, = labreu/omai, Nic.Al.160, Tz.H.1.743, Hsch.; also, = labro/omai, Lyc.260.
labra/kion [ra_], to/, Dim. of la/brac, Antiph.222.2, Amphis 35.
labra/kths, ou, o(, = labrago/rhs, Pratin.Lyr.5.

labra/nios, o(, epith. of Zeus in Cyprus, Myres
Cesnola Collection p.550.

la/brac, a_kos, o(, (la/bros) a ravenous sea-fish,
Labrax lupus, the
bass, Alc.107, Eup.150 (pl.), Diph.66.10, Arist.HA567a19, 591a11, Ptol.Euerg.1 J.; o( pa/ntwn i)xqu/wn sofw/tatos Ar.Fr.595; la/brakes *milh/sioi, prov. of greedy persons, Apostol.10.38, cf. Ar.Eq.361.
labr-ei/a: h( tou= lo/gou e)/klhyis, Hsch.; = h( fluari/a, Zonar.

labr-eu/omai, (la/bros)
talk rashly, brag, ti/ pa/ros labreu/eai; Il.23.474; mu/qois labreu/eai ib.478. labreu/ontai: r(e/ousi mega/la bouleu/ontai, qorubou=si sfo/dra, Hsch.

labr-hgore/w,
boast, Tz.ad Hes.Op.477.

labrobo/ros, on,
ravenously devouring, sto/mata Pancrat.Oxy. 1085.18.
labro/nion, to/, = labrw/nion, Hsch.:—also labro/i+on, Id.

labro/-omai,
rush violently, xeu=ma . . labrwqe\n sko/tw|
wild and dark, Lyc.705.

labro-po/dhs, ou, o(,
rapid of foot, rushing, xei/marre AP9.277 (Antiphil.).

labro-posi/a, h(,
excessive drinking, Hippiatr.8.

labro-pote/w, (pi/nw)
drink hard, AP5.109 (Marc. Arg.): c. acc., ku/likas ib.10.18 (Id.).

la/bros, on (also a, on Damocr. ap. Gal.13.917): in Hom. only of wind and water,
furious, boisterous, *ze/furos la/bros e)paigi/zwn Il. 2.148, cf. Od.15.293, Thphr.Vent.50; w(s o(/te ku=ma qoh=| e)n nhi\+ pe/sh|si la/bron Il.15.625; potamo\s . . l. u(/paiqa r(e/wn 21.271; o(/te labro/taton xe/ei u(/dwr *zeu/s 16.385: l. o)/mbros Hdt.8.12; kapno/s, se/las, Pi.O.8.36, P.3.40; pneu=ma A.Pers.110 (lyr.); pu=r E.Or.697; la/bron au)xe/n', of the Hellespont personified, Tim.Pers.84; simply,
huge, mighty, li/qos Pi.N.8.46; u(/data labro/tera, expld. by a)qrow/tera, Arist.Mete. 348b10: neut. as Adv., la/bron e)paigi/zwn . . *)/erws AP5.285.2 (Paul. Sil.). after Hom., of men,
boisterous, turbulent, esp.in talking,
hasty, Thgn.634; la/broi pagglwssi/a| Pi.O.2.86; l. sto/ma Simon. 177, S.Aj.1147; l. o)/mma E.Hel.379 (anap., s.v.l.).
fierce, dra/kontos labro/tatai ge/nues Pi.P.4.244, cf.E.HF253;
violent, impetuous, l. pro\s th\n e)piqumi/an th\n th=s trofh=s Arist.GA717a23 (Comp.); la/brw| xrw/menoi tw=| potw=| D.S.5.26; la/bros ei)s *ba/kxon o)lisqw/n AP11.25 (Apollonid.); lagnei=ai labro/tatai Ti.Locr.103a; e)piqumi/a Arist.GA717a28; *)/erws AP5.267 (Paul. Sil.); la/brw| maxai/ra| E.Cyc.403. Adv. la/brws
violently, furiously, [i(/ppoi] a)/nakta fe/rousi la/brws Thgn. 988 (cf. labropo/dhs, -sutos）; l. u(/ei Thphr.HP4.7.1; a)/nemoi kataigi/zontes l. D.S.5.26; a)qro/ws kai\ l. App.Hisp.18, cf. Hann.48; dido/nai [to\ o)cu/meli] kat' o)li/gon kai\ mh\ l. Hp.Acut.58, cf. Ph.1.452.
eagerly, greedily, l. diartama=n (of the eagle) A.Pr.1022; th=| brw/sei xrh=tai l. (of the lion) Arist.HA594b18, cf. Ph.1.71.—Poet. word, used also in Ion. and late Prose. [la_- by position in Ep.: la^- E.Or. l. c., HF861 (troch.), AP11.25 (Apollonid.).]
labrosia/wn: xortasmou= a)ko/smou, Hsch. (xortasmo\n cod.).

labrostom-e/w, (sto/ma)
talk boldly, rashly, A.Pr.329.
labrostom-i/a: h( dia/xrhstos lalia/, Hsch.

labro-su/nh, Dor.labro/-na_, h(, (la/bros)
violence, greed, AP6.305 (Leon.), Opp.H.5.366: also in pl., ib.2.130.
bold talking, Tryph.423 (pl.).

labro/-su^tos, on, (seu/w)
rushing furiously, A.Pr.600 (lyr.).
labro/-ths, htos, h(, = labrosu/nh, Muson.Fr.18Bp.100 H., Ath.7.310f; l. e)n tw=| pi/nein Id.11.484c.

labro-fa^ge/w,
eat greedily, D.L.6.28.
la/brus, = pe/lekus, Lydian word, Plu.2.302a.
labru/ssei: labreu/ei, Hsch.; also, = deilai/nei, Id.

labrw/nios, o(,
large wide cup, Men.503, Diph.80.1:—also labrwni/a, h(, Eust.1066.3; labrw/nion, to/, Men.24.4, Hsch. (labro/- cod.); cf. labro/nion.

la/buzos, h(, an unknown
spice-plant, Dinon 18.
la^bu^rinqoeidh/s, e/s, = -w/dhs, Vett.Val.276.31.

la^bu/rinq-os [u^], o(,
labyrinth or
maze, a large building consisting of numerous halls connected by intricate and tortuous passages: in Egypt, Hdt.2.148, cf. Str.17.1.37; in Crete, Call.Del.311, D.S.1.61: pl., sph/laia kai\ e)n au)toi=s oi)kodomhtoi\ labu/rinqoi Str.8.6.2; name of a building at Rome, IG14.1093; also at Miletus, Milet.7.56, Supp.Epigr.4.446 (iii/ii B. C., pl.). prov. of tortuous questions or arguments, w(/sper ei)s l. e)mpeso/ntes, oi)o/menoi h)/dh e)pi\ te/lei ei)=nai perika/myantes pa/lin w(/sper e)n a)rxh=| . . a)nefa/nhmen o)/ntes Pl.Euthd.291b; laburi/nqwn skoliw/tera D.H.Th.40; lo/goi laburi/nqois o(/moioi Luc.
Bis Acc.21; lo/gwn labu/rinqoi Id.Icar.29; of ant-hills, Gal.UP1.3; of the
rete mirabile Galeni, Id.5.608; of Lycophron's poem. AP9.191; as name of a philosopher, Luc.Symp.6.
any wreathed or
coiled up body, ei)na/lios l. the twisted
sea-snail, AP6.224 (Theodorid.); e)k sxoi/nwn l.
bow-net of rushes, Theoc.21.11.

la^burinq-w/dhs, es,
labyrinthine, contorted, a)stra/galos Arist.HA499b25; oi)/khma Procop.Arc. 4: metaph., do/ca Ph.1.192; e)rwth/seis Luc.Fug.10.
lagagei=: a)fri/zei, Hsch. (betw. lagaro/n and laga/ssai).

lagai/w,
release: inf. lagai/en GDI4982.4, 4989.6 (Crete): 3sg. aor. subj. laga/sei Leg.Gort.1.9, al.: aor. inf. laga/sai GDI4979.46, Leg.Gort.1.5; cf. laga/ssai.
lagani/zw, f.l. for galhni/zw, Hp.Morb.Sacr.13.

la/ga^non [la^], to/,
a thin broad cake, of meal and oil, like i)/trion, Diocl.Fr.116; l. a)/zuma LXX Le.2.4, cf. Matro Parod.Fr.4, Gal.6.492, POxy.1211.5 (ii A.D.), Ar.Ec.843 as cited by Ath.3.110a (po/pana codd. Ar.); l. thganisto/n J.AJ7.4.2 (cf. l. a)po\ thga/nou LXX 2 Ki.6.19); e(lku/ein l., cf. Lat.
tracta, Chrysipp.Tyan. ap. Ath.14.647e:—
Dim. la^ga/nion, to/, Id. ap. Ath.14.648a, UPZ89.2 (ii B. C.), PLond.2.190.34 (iii A. D.).

la^ga^nofa^kh=, h(,
lentil pudding or
cake, Bilabel *)oyart. p.11.

la^ga^ri/zomai, Pass., dub. sens., Ar.V.674 e)k khqari/ou lagarizo/menon, expld. by Sch. ta\ lagara\ e)sqi/onta, o(/ e)stin eu)/qrausta kai\ eu)telh= tina, i.e.
getting a poor living out of the ballot-box. prob.
scrape, Pherecr.121.
jog or
nudge with the elbow, = skaleu/ein, Hsch. (v.l. lagaruzo/menon in Ar.l.c., lagurizo/menoi in Pherecr. l.c.). intr. in Act., of the pulse, Archig. ap. Gal.8.662.
lagari/ttetai: metrieu/etai, Hsch.

la^ga^ro-eidw=s, Adv.
like a sti/xos lagaro/s (4), Eust.399.41.

la^ga^ro/-kuklos, on,
somewhat convex, of the lyre or cithara, Id.1464.64 (cf. lagaro/s 1).

la^ga^ro/-omai, Pass.,
to be or
become slack; potamo\s-ou/menos
in the act of thawing, AP9.56 (Phil.).

la^ga^ro/s, a/, o/n,
hollow, sunken, of an animal's flanks, X.Cyn.4.1; of the right ventricle, -wte/rh Hp.Cord.4; lagara=| . . th=| gastri/ Philostr. Im.2.21; ta\s l. (sc. gaste/ras) Ar.Ec.1167; l. ku/kloi
sunken, flattish, of the tortoise, Philostr.Im.1.10; l. popa/neuma (cf. lagari/zomai 1) AP 6.231 (Phil.): Comp., Hp. l.c.: Sup., kata\ to\ -w/taton in the
least defensible part, Plu.Cam.25.
slack, loose, au)xh\n l. ta\ kata\ th\n sugkamph/n X.Eq.1.8; of camels, D.S.2.54. Adv. -rw=s, i(ppasqei/s Philostr.Im.2.2. metaph., th\n po/lin a)nti\ lagara=s kai\ u(poso/mfou mesth\n e)poi/hsen a)glai/+as Them.Or.18.222d. Adv. Comp. -w/teron, opp. sfodro/teron, plh=cai th\n xordh/n Theo Sm.p.72 H.
thin, narrow, drumw=nes (cj.) X.Cyn.6.5; of columns,
lanky, D.H.16.3, Plu.Publ.15; of men,
emaciated, Thphr.HP9.10.3. in Metric, sti/xos l., opp. prokoi/lios, a '
thin-waisted' verse, with a short syllable for a long one in the interior, like Il.23.493, cf. Ar.Ec.1167, Plu.2.397d, Ath.14.632e, Sch.Heph.p.289 C. in Arist.HA622b23 (Comp., s.v.l.), where it is an epith. of spiders, some expl. it to mean
lank, meagre, some
agile, nimble. of plasters,
porous, absorbent, Orib.Fr.74. (Cf. lagai/w, Lat.
laxus, ONorse
slak-r, Engl.
slack: perh. akin to lh/gw.)

la^ga^ro/ths, htos, h(,
slackness, Hld.9.15, Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. lagaro/n. of a verse, v. foreg. 4, Eust.1464.63.
la^ga^ru/zomai, v. lagari/zomai.

la^ga^r-w/dhs, es,
sunken, flattish, Sch.Ar.Ach.245.
la^ga^/r-wsis, ews, h(, = lagaro/ths 11, Eust. 1103.18.
laga/ssai: a)fei=nai, Hsch. (cf. lagai/w). lagbato/n: a)natetramme/non, oi( de\ la/gan e)mba/llontes, Id. la/gga: h( th=| trofh=| didome/nh meri/s, Id.

lagga/zw,
slacken (= e)ndi/dwmi, AB106), Antiph.37, Phot.s.v. logga/sw: lagga/zei: o)knei=, oi( de\ laggei=, Hsch.; lagga/sai: perifugei=n, Id.; cf. laggarei=. lagganw/menos: periista/menos, straggeuo/menos, Id. laggarei=: a)podidra/skei, Id. laggeu/ei: feu/gei, Id.

laggw/n: o( eu)qu\s lanqa/nwn tou= a)gw=nos kai\ fo/bou, EM554.15.
trader, merchant, Cyr.
la/gdhn, Adv. = la/c, ta\ sw/frona l. patei=tai S.Fr.683.3.
la/geios [a^], a, on, = lagw=|os, l. kre/a Hp.Aff.43, Orib.3.3.6; kre/as la/geion Sor.1.51. (From Ion. lago/s = lagw/s.)
lagero/s: smi=lac, Hsch. *da/gesis: qeo/s (Sicel), Id.

la_ge/ta_s, a, o(, (lao/s, a(ge/omai) Dor.
leader of the people, Pi.O.1.89, P.4.107, S.Fr.221.12, Hsch. (-e/ths).
lagh( na/rios), o(, dub. sens. in IGRom.3.837 (Cilicia).
lagh/narxos: o( e)cousi/an e)/xwn tou= oi)/nou, Hsch. (lagi/n- cod., before la/gna).
la/ghnos, lagh/nion, v. lagun-.

la^gi^d-eu/s, e/ws, o(, (lagw/s)
leveret, Plu.2.971d, Ael.NA7.47.
rabbit, Str.3.2.6.
la^gi^/d-ion, to/, Dim. of lagw/s, M.Ant.10.10, Poll. 5.15.

la/gi^nos [a^], h, on,
of the hare, ge/nna A.Ag.119 (lyr.).

la/gion [a^] (not lagi/on, EM451.20), to/, Dim. of lagw/s,
leveret, X. Cyn.5.13. [a^ or a_?] a kind of
cup or
vase, Inscr.Deélos399 B 149, 461 Bb40, al. (ii B. C.).
la/gkata: pepathme/na, Cyr. (i.e. la/gb-). la/gkei: e)w/|kei, Hsch.

la/gkh,
lanx, Gloss.

lagki/a, h(, Lat.
lancea, D.S.5.30:—hence lagkia/rios, o(,
lancearius, CIG4004 (Iconium), Lyd.Mag.1.46.

lagki/ola (Lat.
lanceola), h(, = logxi=tis, Ps.-Dsc.3.144.

la/gkla, h(, = Lat.
lanx, dish, BGU781 v 18 (i A. D.):—Dim. la/gklion, to/, ib. iv 1, Gloss.
lagkru/zesqai: loidorei=sqai, Phot. la/gmata: i(era\ a)pa/rgmata, Id. la/gna: ka/mptra, kibwto/s, Cyr.

lagn-ei/a, Ion. lagn-ei/h, h(,
the act of coition, Hp.Nat.Puer.20, Arist. HA575a21;
semen, Hp.Nat.Puer.21, cf. Gal.19.117.
salaciousness, X.Mem.1.6.8, AP10.45.8 (Pall.): pl., Ti.Locr.103a.

lagn-eu/w,
have sexualintercourse, commonly ofthe man, Id.
Aër.21, al.:—Pass., of the woman, Id.Epid.5.25, Procop.Aed.1.9; pro/s tinos Id.Arc.17.
to be lecherous, Plu.2.136d.
la/gn-hs, ou, o(, Att. for la/gnos acc. to Phryn. 161, Phot. (but cf. Poll.6.188); voc. la/gna Eub.55; acc. la/gnhn Com.Adesp.388.

la/gn-os, h, on,
lecherous, lustful, prop. of the male (as ma/xlos of the female), Critias 44 D., Ti.Locr.104e; of animals, Arist.HA 575a20; of the female, la/gnhs gunaiko/s Anaxandr.60: irreg. Comp. lagni/steros Ph.2.307: irreg. Sup. lagni/statos Arist.HA575b30; but -o/tatos Choerob. in Theod.2.76 H., Hippiatr.33. Adv.Comp. -i/steron Ph.2.207, al.
la^go/-ghrws, gloss on mu/cos, Suid.; on mugalh=, Sch.Luc.Gall.24 ap.Bast Ep.Crit.p.169.

la^go-dai/ths, ou, o(, (dai/w B)
hare-devourer, A. Ag.123 (lyr.).

la^go-qh/ras, ou, o(,
hare-hunter, in voc. -qhra^ or -qh=ra^ AP9.337 (Leon.). a kind of
eagle, Hsch.

la^go-qhre/w,
hunt hares, Ar.Lys.789 (lyr.).

la^go-ktone/w,
kill hares, AP10.11 (Satyr.).

la^go-ku/mi_non [u^], to/,
a kind of cummin, = lagw/pous 2, v.l. in Ps.-Dsc.4.17.
la^go-na/th, gloss on lagw/puros, Gal.19.117.
la_gorei=s: e)kklhsi/ai, Hsch. (fort. la/gorsis). la^go/s, ou=, o(, v. lagw/s. la^gotrofei=on, v. lagwtr-.
la^go/fqalmos, = lagw/fqalmos, PMed.Strassb.p.6K.
lagro/s: krabba/tion, Hsch. lagroni/ths: ei)=dos plakou=ntos, Id.
la^gu/n-ion [u_], to/, Dim. of la/gunos, Diph.3.2, BGU1095.17 (i A. D.), Dsc.2.83 (v.l. -h/n-), Gal.10.835.
la^gun-i/s, i/dos, h(, Dim.of la/gunos, Plu. 2.614f.
la^gun-i/wn, wnos, o(, name for a parasite, Hardbottle, Ath.13.584f.
la^gu_noqh/kh, cj. for laxano- in Alex.Magn. ap. Ath.11.784b.

la/gu_nos [a^], o( (fem. in Thessaly, Arist.Fr.499, cf. Rhian.75, Ath. 11.499b),
flask, flagon, Diph.29, 60.8, Nicostr.Com.11, AP6.248 (Marc. Arg.): also in later Prose, Plu.2.509d (fem.), POxy.1294.6 (fem., ii/iii A. D.). a measure (perh. = *kni/dion), Ostr.43, 150, PFay.104.3 (iii A. D.), Eratosth. ap. Ath.7.276b (fem.):—la/ghnos is freq. v.l., arising prob. from Lat.
lagena, and admissible only in late writers, e.g. Gal.11.663. [u^ only in late Poets, AP11.298.]

la^gu_nofo/ria, ta/,
the flagon-bearing, a feast at Alexandria, Eratosth. ap.Ath.7.276b. laguri/zomai, v. lagari/zomai.

lagxa/nw, fut. lh/comai Pl.R.617e; Ion. la/comai (cf. la/cis) Hdt.7.144: aor. e)/la^xon Il.9.367, etc.; Ep. e)/llaxon h.Cer.87, v.l. for e)/llaben in Theoc.25.271; Ep. la/xon Il.4.49, al.; Aeol. opt. 1sg. laxo/hn Sapph.9 (laxoi/hn A.D. Synt.247.25); for le/la^xon v. infr. IV: pf. ei)/lhxa A.Th.376, 423, etc.: plpf. ei)lh/xei Pl.Phd.107d; poet. and Ion. le/logxa Pi.O.1.53, B.9.39, Emp.20.3, E.Tr.282 (lyr.), Hdt.7.53, Test. ap.D.21.82, D.H.4.83, etc., but not in early Att. Prose; 3pl. lelogxa^si （n) Od.11.304, Emp.102, but lela^/xa_si Id.115.5; part. lelaxw/s Phld.D.1.17; Dor. 3sg. lelo/gxei Theoc.4.40: plpf. e)lelo/gxei Luc. Am.18:—Pass., aor. e)lh/xqhn Lys.17.8, Is.9.24, D.38.20: pf. ei)/lhgmai E.Tr.296, D.30.34; 3pl. lela/xatai Perict. ap. Stob.4.28.19: c. acc. rei,
obtain by lot, of spoils, opp. e)cairei=sqai, Od.14.233, cf. Il. 9.367, etc.: generally,
obtain as one's portion, to\ ga\r la/xomen ge/ras h(mei=s 4.49; laxo/nta te lhi/+dos ai)=san 18.327; pro\s daimo/nwn o)/lbon Pi. N.9.45; me/zonas moi/ras l. Heraclit.25; moi=ran i)/shn, w(s au)toi/ per e)la/gxanon Od.20.282, cf. Hdt.7.144: with inf. added, e)/laxon polih\n a(/la naie/men I
had the sea
for my portion to dwell in, Il.15.190, cf. Pi.O. 6.34, A.Eu.931 (anap.); e)/lax' a)/nac dou/lhn s' e)/xein E.Tr.278, cf. 282 (lyr.); of a deity as presiding over one's life, e)me\ me\n *kh\r . . la/xe geino/meno/n per Il.23.79; tw= sklhrw= ma/la dai/monos o(/s me lelo/gxei Theoc. 4.40; dai/mwn o( th\n h(mete/ran moi=ran ei)lhxw/s Lys.2.78; w)= dai=mon, o(/s me . . ei)/lhxas Alciphr.3.49: also, esp. in pf.,
to be the tutelary deity of a place,
protect it. [*pa\n] pa/nta lo/fon . . le/logxe h.Hom.19.6; qeoi=si oi(\ *persi/da gh=n lelo/gxasi Hdt.7.53; pai= *(re/as, a(\ prutanei=a le/logxas Pi. N.11.1; of Athena, h(\ th\n u(mete/ran po/lin e)/laxe Pl.Ti.23d, cf. E.Or. 319 (lyr.), Ph.1576 (lyr.): metaph., a)ke/rdeia le/logxen qamina\ kakago/ros Pi.O.1.53: freq. of persons
who have a post assigned to them by lot, klh/rw| nu=n pepa/lasqe diampere/s, o(/s ke la/xh|si Il.7.171, cf. 179, 23.354, 862: c. inf., klh/rw| la/xon e)nqa/d' e(/pesqai 24.400; so pa/lw| laxei=n A.Th.55, Hdt.4.94, cf. 3.128; w(s e)n pu/lais e(/kastos ei)/lhxen pa/lon A. Th.376: abs., pro\s *qu/mbrhs e)/laxon *du/kioi
had their post assigned near Thymbra, Il.10.430; e)pi/, e)n pu/lais l., A.Th.423, 451, etc.; laxw/n alone, Hdt.3.128, etc.; l. tina\ dida/skalon
have him assigned to one by lot, Antipho 6.11. at Athens,
obtain an office
by lot, a)rxa\s laxei=n, opp. xeirotonhqh=nai (to be elected), D.57.25, cf.Ar.Av.1111; ou)demi/an [a)rxh\n] laxw\n ou)de\ xeirotonhqei/s Aeschin.1.106: more freq. c. inf., o( tw=| kua/mw| laxw\n polemarxe/ein
he who had the lot to be polemarch, Hdt.6.109; e)/laxon pro/teroi a)podido/nai Th.5.21, cf. 35; laxw\n . . i(eromnhmonei=n Ar.Nu.623; laxo/ntos bouleu/ein
when I became Member of Council
by lot, D.21.111, cf. 59.3, Pl.Grg.473e: c. gen., laxei=n tw=n e)cio/ntwn
to be chosen by lot as one of . . , D.21.133; also oi( tami/ai oi( laxo/ntes IG12.91.21; laxei=n basileu/s, e)pimelhth/s, i(ereu/s, etc., Lys.6.4, Din.2.10, D.57.47, etc.; e)pi/skopos tw=| kua/mw| laxw/n Ar.Av.1022; oi( pentako/sioi <oi(> laxo/ntes tw=| kua/mw| Lexap.And.1.96: abs., klhrou/xous tou\s laxo/ntas
those on whom the lot fell, Th.3.50, cf. Pl.Lg. 765c; tou\s laxo/ntas proe/drous SIG465.6 (Athens, iii B. C.); rare exc. in Athens, laxw\n i(ereu/s ib.762.12 (Dionysopolis, i B. C.), etc. as Att. law-term, lagxa/nein di/khn
obtain leave to bring a suit (esp. a private suit), prob. because the presiding magistrates decided the order of hearing by lot; l. di/khn tini/
against one, Pl.Euthphr.5b, Lg. 938b, cf. Aeschin.2.99; e)/gklhma/ tini D.34.16; to\n ei)lhxo/ta tou= klh/rou th\n di/khn the person
suing for the inheritance, Is.8.3: without th\n di/khn, ei)/lhxe me\n au(tw=| th=s qugatro\s th=s *eu)kth/monos w(s ou)/shs e)piklh/rou he
has claimed Euctemon's daughter . . , Id.6.46, cf. D.48.20; l. tini\ tou= sumbolai/ou Lys.17.3; l. fo/nou e)mautw=| D.21.120; also l. tw=| ui(ei= th=s e)piklh/rou
prosecute the claim on his son's behalf, And.1.121, cf. 124; l. di/khn tini\ ei)s tou\s *)amfiktu/onas xili/wn tala/ntwn u(pe/r tinos D. 59.98, cf. Isoc.16.2: abs., l. pro\s to\n a)/rxonta Is.11.33: metaph., tou= sw/matos [th=| yuxh=|] di/khn laxo/ntos Democr.159:—Pass., pro\s ou(\s ai( di/kai e)lh/xqhsan Lys.17.8; pro\ tou= th\n di/khn lhxqh=nai D.54.28: impers., tou/tois lagxa/netai
proceedings are taken, Id.23.76. c. gen. partit.,
become possessed of a thing, w(/s ken *)axilleu\s dw/rwn e)k *pria/moio la/xh| Il.24.76; e)/laxon ktere/wn Od.5.311, cf. Thgn.934, Pi.I.8(7).69, Fr.75.6, B.1.56, 9.39, Lyr.Adesp.53, Emp.102, 115.5, Democr.21; eu)= prapi/dwn laxo/nta A.Ag.380 (lyr.); xrush=s . . timh=s laxei=n S.Ant.699; ou)/ ti mh\ la/xwsi tou=de summa/xou Id.OC450; ge/nnas
a)fqi/tou laxo/ntes Id.Fr.278; diplou= bi/ou laxo/ntes E.Supp.1086; patrw/|wn ou) laxw/n not
having obtained thy patrimony, Id.Tr.1192; th=s eu)prepesta/ths teleuth=s Th.2.44; dei/pnou te kai\ u(/pnou lagxa/nomen X.Hier.6.9; also xqono\s laxei=n tosou=ton e)nqanei=n mo/non S.OC790; ga/mou me/ros laxou=sa Id.Ant.918; tu/mbou koino\n ei)lhxw\s me/ros Id.El. 1135; th=s gh=s to\ pro\s *no/ton ei)/lhxe *palla/s Id.Fr.24.8. abs.,
draw lots, kata/stasis h( dia\ tou= lagxa/nein gignome/nh Isoc.7.23, cf. D.S. 4.63, etc.; peri/ tinos D.21 Arg.2<*><*> 3, 4, Ev.Jo.19.24. causal only in Ep. redupl. aor. le/la^xon,
put in possession of a thing,
grant one
the rights of . . , o)/fra puro/s me *trw=es . . lela/xwsi qano/nta Il.7.80, cf. 15.350, 23.76: later this aor. is used intr. in AP7.341 (Procl.). intr.,
fall to one's lot or
share, e)s e(ka/sthn [nh=a] e)nne/a la/gxanon ai)=ges nine goats
were allotted to each, Od.9.160; ai)w\n dusai/wn e)/laxen E. Hel.214 (lyr.); o(/sois . . to\ swfronei=n ei)/lhxen Id.Hipp.80; to\ laxo\n me/ros e(ka/stw| tw=| qew=| Pl.Lg.745e, cf. Epin.992d; th\n pro\s *no/ton laxei=n fasi *deukali/wni Str.9.5.23.

la^gwbol-ei=on, to/,
place for catching hares, Suid.

la^gwbol-i/a, h(,
hareshooting, Call.Dian.2 (pl.).

la^gw/bol-on (parox.), to/,
staff or
stick for
flinging at hares, also used as a
shepherd's staff or
crook, Theoc.4.49, 7.128, Ep.2, AP6.188 (Leon.), D.H.14.2, etc.:—also lagwobo/lon, AP6.296 (Leon.).
la^gwda/rion, to/, Dim. of lagw/s, Ph.1.256,318.

la^gwda/ton koima=sqai sleep
with the eyes open, Steph.in Hp.1.94 D. (s.v.l.).
la^gwdi/as, ou, o(, a bird, = w)=tos, Alex.Mynd. ap. Ath.9.390f.

la^gw/|dion, to/, Dim. of lagw/s,
leveret, Ar.Ach.520, PFlor.177.13 (iii A. D.).
la^gw/dwn, on, gen. ontos, = e)cw/dwn, Hippiatr.115.

la^gw/eios, a, on,
of or
belonging to a hare, Opp.C.1.491, 519.
lagwi/+nhs: o)/rnis poio/s, Hsch. la^gwi/+s, i/+dos, h(, kind of bird or fish. Hor.Sat.2.2.22.

la^gw/n, o/nos, h(, also o(, Hp.Int.25, Aret.SD2.11: (lagaro/s):—
the hollow on each side below the ribs, flank, Hp. l. c., Ar.V.119<*>, Chaerem. 14.3, Arist.HA493a18, al.: freq. in pl. lago/nes,
flanks, Batr.222, E. IT298, Ar.Ra.662, etc.; lago/nwn o)sta=
iliac bones, Gal.2.507, cf. 772; prop. of men, but also of animals, E.El.826, X.Cyn.4.1, 5.10, Theoc. 25.246; qu/nnou lago/nes Antiph.132.5 (anap.). pl., in later Greek,
womb, Naumach. ap. Stob.4.22.32, lu/sis ai)ni/gmatos ap.Arg.E. Ph. metaph., any
hollow, koi/lh l.
hollow of a cup, Eub.43; lago/nessi fare/trhs AP6.326 (Leon. Alex.); pro/s tini l. tou= krhmnou= Plu.Arat.22; esp. of a mountain,
flank, D.H.3.24, 9.23, Cleom.1.8, Call.Fr.185 (pl.);
bank of a river, laia=| potamou= . . lago/ni AP6.287 (Antip.);
sides of a grave, IG14.2001; xqo/niai ib.7.117 (Megara).
la^gw/neia: lagou= kre/a, Hsch. la^gwobo/lon, to/, v. lagwbo/lon. la^gwo/s, ou=, o(, Ep. for lagw/s (q.v.).

la^gw=|os, a, on, contr. for lagw/i+os,
of the hare, kre/a Ar.Ach.1110; tri/xes Plu.2.138f; ta\ l. (sc. kre/a)
hare's flesh, Hp.Vict.2.46: and generally,
dainties, delicacies, zh=n e)n pa=si lagw/|ois Ar.V.709, cf. Ach. 1006, Pax1196, Telecl.32, Pl.Com.174.10, etc.
la^gwofo/nos, on, poet. for lagwfo/nos, Opp.C.1.154.

la^gw/-pous, podos, o(, h(,
rough-footed like a hare: hence, as Subst.,
ptarmigan, Plin.HN10.133; cf. lagw/s 11. a downy plant,
hare's foot trefoil, Trifolium arvense, Dsc.4.17, Gal.12.56. (-poun Dsc., Gal. Il. cc., but -pous Orib.15.1.11.)
la^gw/-pu_ros, h(, = foreg. 2, Hp.Ulc.15.

la^gw/s or lagw=s, o(, gen. lagw/ or lagw= （lagw=s, lagw=, acc. to Hdn.Gr. 1.245, 2.629); acc. lagw/n Ar.V.1203, Frr.212, 252, but lagw/ or lagw= X.Cyn.3.3 (this form is condemned by Luc.Sol.3, but cf. Ath.9.400a): pl., nom. lagw/| Eup. 143; acc. lagw/s Arist.HA619b9:—Ion. lago/s, ou=, Hdt.1.123, al., and so kaq' h(ma=s, Ath.9.400a; also in Dor., Epich. 60, and Trag. and Com., S.Fr.111, Amips.18, Alex.123, Philem.89.5:—Ep. la^gwo/s, ou=, also in X.Cyn.10.2 codd., Arist.HA606a24, EN 1118a18, Luc.Symp.38, etc., and cf. infr. 111, v:—
hare, h)\ kema/d' h)e\ lagwo/n Il.10.361; ptw=ka lagwo/n 22.310; pro/kas h)de\ lagwou/s Od. 17.295; toi\ d' w)ku/podas lago\s (Dor. for lagou/s） h(/|reun Hes.Sc.302; lagw\ di/khn like
a hare, A.Eu.26: prov., e)sti\n lagw/s, of a coward, Posidipp.26.9; lagw\ bi/on zh=n lead a
hare's life, D.18.263; deilo/teros lagw\ *frugo/s Prov. ap. Str.1.2.30; o( l. ou(=tos this
coward, Philostr.VA 4.37; lagw\s kaqeu/dwn, of persons feigning sleep, Zen.4.84, cf. X. Cyn.5.11; l. to\n peri\ tw=n krew=n tre/xwn, of persons seeking to escape imminent death, Zen.4.85. a bird
with rough feathered fcet, mentioned with the swallow, Artem.4.56, cf. Ant.Lib.21.5; cf. lagwdi/as, lagw/pous. a kind of
sea-slug, Lepus marinus, Epich. l.c., Amips. l.c.; o( qala/ttios lagwo/s
sea-hare, Aplysia leporina, Plu. 2.983f, Gal.11.688, al., cf. Nic.Al.465, Dsc.2.18. a constellation, Arat.338, Eudox. ap. Hipparch.1.2.20. a kind of bandage, tw=| lagww=| e)pide/smw| Heliod. ap. Orib.46.18.2, cf. 48.27 tit., Sor. Fasc.7. (Prob.
slack-ear, cf. lagaro/s, ou)=s.)

la^gw-sfa^gi/a, poet. la^gw-i/h, h(,
killing of hares, AP6.167 (Agath.).

la^gw-trofei=on, to/, Lat.
leporarium, Gloss. (also lagotr-, as Colum.8.1).

la^gw-trofe/w,
feed or
keep hares, Eust.1821.32.

la^gw/fqalmos, on, lit.
hare-eyed: hence,
unable to close the eye, owing to shortening of the upper eyelid, Dem. Ophth. ap. Aët.7.75, cf. Gal.14.681, Aët.7.2, Paul.Aeg.6.10; v. lago/fqalmos:—also lagwo/fqalmos, Eust.812.2; to\ l. this condition of eyes, Gal.19.439.

la^gw-fo/nos, o(,
hare-killer, epith. of a species of eagle, Arist.HA 618b28:—also lagwofo/nos (q.v.).

la^gw/-xeilos, on,
having a harelip, Gal.14.681.
la/danon, v. lh/danon.
la/das: e)/lafos nebri/as, Hsch.
la/ddousqh, Boeot., = la/zusqai, IG7.3054.6 (Lebad., iv B. C.).
ladoi/ato: lamba/noito, Hsch. (cf. la/zomai). la/domai: gnw/mhn ti/qemai, Id. la=dos, v. lh=dos.

ladre/w,
flow strongly, ladre/onti toi\ mukth=res Sophr.135.
ladwgenh/s: h( *)afrodi/th, o(/ti e)pi\ tw=| e)n *)arkadi/a| potamw=| *la/dwni e)gennh/qh, Hsch.
ladwni/s, i/dos, h(, = da/fnh, Gal.12.426.
laedo/s, o(, an unknown bird, Arist.HA610a9 (vv. ll. laido/s, libuo/s): prob. = laio/s (A).
laentia/rios: liqoco/os, Hsch.

la_ergh/s, e/s,
made of stone, Nic.Th.708 (v.l. eu)ergh/s).
lae/rkinon, to/, name of the plant karph/sion at Side in Pamphylia, Gal.14.72.

la_e/rths, ou, o(, a kind of
ant, Ael.NA10.42; a kind of
wasp, ibid. as pr. n., Laertes, the father of Odysseus, Od.1.430, al.:—also *lae/rtios, ou, S.Ph.87,417, etc.; *la/rtios, ib.402 (lyr.), 1286, Aj.1, etc.
lazi/nhs: xaradri/as, kallari/as i)xqu=s, Hsch. (cf. mazi/nhs).

la/zomai, Ep., Ion., and Megar. for lamba/nw, used by Hom. only in Ep. 3sg. impf. la/zeto （e)la/zeto only in Il.5.371), and 3pl. opt. lazoi/ato (v. infr.); Dor. imper. la/sdeo Theoc.8.84, la/zeu Id.15.21, Trag.Adesp.381:—Act., la/zw Achaean acc. to AB1095:—
seize, grasp, e)/gxos Il.8.389; pe/tron, ma/stiga, h(ni/a, 16.734, 5.840, al.; l. tina\ a)gka/s
take one in her arms, ib.371; o)da\c lazoi/ato gai=an
may they bite the dust, 2.418: metaph., pa/lin d' o(/ ge la/zeto mu=qon he
took back, i.e.
retracted his speech, 4.357, Od.13.254; also in Ion. Prose, pefuko\s no/sous la/zesqai disposed
to take them, Hp.Loc.Hom.1; o)du/nh la/zetai [to\n e)gke/falon] pain
seizes or
attacks it, Id.Morb.2.20.
receive, lazo/menos tw=n quome/nwn pa/ntwn ta\ de/rmata . . SIG1010.4 (Chalcedon), cf. 1011.18 (ibid., iii/ii B. C.). Ep., Ion., also la/zumai, e)pi\ bousi\n e)la/zuto . . *(ermh=n h.Merc.316; la/zutai th\n gonh/n
grasps it, Hp.Mul.1.10, cf.Aret.SD2.13; fo/bos [au)to\n] la/zutai Hp.Morb.2.72, cf. Aret.SD2.12: this form is alone used by Trag. and Com. (exc. in imper. a)ntila/zou E.Or.452), la/zusqe Id.Med.956, Ba.503; la/zusqai Id.HF943: c. gen., la/zusqe ku/likos Ar.Lys.209 (also in compds. a)nti-, e)pi-, pro-, pros-, qq. v.); Boeot. inf. la/ddousqh (q.v.).
la/zw, = lakti/zw, la/cas tra/pezan Lyc.137, cf.Sch.E.Hec.64; la/zein: e)cubri/zein, Hsch.
la/h: o)fqalmoi/, Cyr.

la_qa/nemos [a^n], on, Dor. for lhq-,
escaping wind, w(/ra Simon.12.3.

la/qargos [la^], o(,
bit of leather, Nic.Th.423, cf. Hsch. = skw/lhc, Id. v. lai/qargos.
laqasmo/s, o(, = lh/qh, Hsch.
la_qe/men, Dor., = lh/qein, Pi.O.1.64.
laqh/bas: ge/rontas, Hsch.

la^qhtiko/s, h/, o/n,
likely to escape detection, Arist.Rh.1372a21.

la^qi^-khdh/s, e/s, (kh=dos)
banishing care, ei)/ pote/ toi laqikhde/a mazo\n e)pe/sxon Il.22.83; oi)=non laqika/dea (leg. -ka/deon) Alc.41.3; *diw/nusos IGRom.4.360.15 (Pergam.), cf. Epic.Alex.Adesp.8.10, AP9.524.12, Plu.2.657d; l. te/xnhs i)dmosu/nh APl.4.273 (Crin.).
la^qi^/-nostos: o( bradu/nwn e)panelqei=n, Hsch.

la^qi^-ph/mwn, on, gen. onos,
banishing sorrow, prob. cj. for lusiph/mwn (q.v.) in Orph.H.2.11.

la^qi^/-poinos, on,
forgetful of vengeance, Hsch.

la_qi/ponos [i^], on, （lh/qh
forgetful of sorrow, S.Aj.711 (lyr.); bi/otos o)duna=n l. a life
forgetting, i.e.
free from, pain, Id.Tr.1021 (hex.).

la^qi^-porfu^ri/s, i/dos, h(, = porfuri/s,
which feeds in the dark, lbyc.8 (laqipo/rfuras and adoiporfurides codd. Ath.).

la^qi^/-fqoggos, on,
robbing of voice, epith. of death, Hes.Sc.131.

la^qi^-frosu/nh, h(,
forgetfulness, A.R.4.356 (pl.).

la^qi^/-frwn, on, gen. onos,
forgetful, heedless, foolish, Hsch.

la/qos [a^], eos, to/,
escape from detection, ei) la/qos e)/stai mou tw=| drasmw=| Astramps.Orac.89p.7H.
la=qos, eos, to/, Dor. for lh=qos, = lh/qh, Theoc.23.24.
la_qosu/na, Dor., = lh/qh, E.IT1279 (lyr., s.v.l.).
la/qra: ai( di/kai (Elean), Hsch. la/qra, la/qra|, v. la/qrh|.
laqr-a/dan, = la/qra|, Corinn.Supp.1.13.

laqr-aio/koitos, o(,
adulterer, fornicator, Vett.Val.75.16.

laqr-aiopra_ge/w,
deal secretly, Phld. Lib.p.20 O.

laqr-ai=s, on, also a, on Eub.67.8, Lyc.1198:—
secret, clandestine, a)/th l. A.Ag.1230; ei)sde/degmai phmonh\n . . laqrai=on, of a person, S.Tr.377; l. o(\s a)skei= kaka/ practises
secret frauds, ib.384, cf. Arist.EN1131a6; l. w)di/s one born in
secret child-birth, E.Ion 45; l. qa/naton e)pibouleu/ein tini/ And.4.15; l. *ku/pris Eub. l. c.: Comp. laqraio/teron, ge/nos Pl.Lg.781a. Adv. -ai/ws A.Pr.1077 (anap.), E.El.26, etc.: Sup., w(s ma/lista du/nantai laqraio/tata Antipho 1.28. l. th=s mhtro/s
clam matre, f.l. for la/qra| in Alciphr.3.27.
involuntarily, ou)=ra . . proi+o/nta l. Hp.Coac.136;
without obvious cause, l. teleutw=si Id.Prorrh.1.128.
laqr-aka/zwn: xalinagwgw=n (Sicel), Hsch.

laqr-epi/boulos, on,
secretly plotting, Vett. Val.10.30.

la/qrh| [a_^], Att. la/qra|, Adv., (lanqa/nw)
secretly, by stealth, o( de/ oi( parele/cato la/qrh| Il.2.515; a)nh/r, o(\s e)mi/sgeto la/qrh| Od.15.430; la/qrh| ktei/nantes
treacherously, 17.80; a)lla/ te la/qrh| gui=a baru/netai
imperceptibly, Il.19.165: in Trag. and Att., S.Aj.1137, OT386, Ar.Ra.746, Th.4.39, Pl.R.347b, etc. c. gen., la/qrh| tino/s
unknown to one, la/qrh| *laome/dontos Il.5.269; la/qrh| tw=n a)/llwn strathgw=n Hdt.8.112, cf. 9.90, S.OT787, OC354, Ar.V.347, X.An.1.3.8.—Freq. written la/qra, la/qrh in codd. and Pap., but la/qrai (i.e. la/qra|) in UPZ19.28 (ii B. C.) and in some of the best codd., as the Laurentian of Sophocles, also in POxy.16 of Th. l. c. (i A. D.):—other forms are
la/qra^, h.Cer.240, E.Fr.1132.28; laqrhdo/n, AP7.202 (Anyt.); laqrhda/, Luc.Cal.21; laqrhdi/s, Hdn.Gr.1.512 (-dws (sic), Cyr.).

laqr-i/dios [i^d], a, on, also os, on Vett.Val.16.6:— = la/qrios, Orph. A.888, Vett.Val.l.c., f.l. in Luc.
Bis Acc.33. Adv. -i/ws AP5.126 (Marc. Arg.), 261 (Paul. Sil.).
laqr-i^mai=os, on, = la/qrios, Vett.Val.117.26, Hsch.s.v.sko/tion.

la/qr-ios, on, also a, on Man.6.207:—later form of laqrai=os, kle/mmata S.Ichn.66 (lyr.); e)retmoi/ Pl.Com.3; e)piqumi/ai Men.535.7; fila/mata, eu)na/, Bion 2.6; of a person, e)p' ou)/ata la/qrios ei)=pen Call.Ap.105; l. game/ths Epigr.Gr.336.5 (Troas); of a place, l. na/pos Theoc.20.39 codd. (*la/tmion Wilamowitz): neut. pl. as Adv.,
secretly, Call.Del.241; la/qria me\n gela/oisa
treacherously (v.l. for la/qrh|), Theoc.1.96. *laqri/h, h(, epith. of Aphrodite, AP6.300.1 (Leon.).

laqro/-bolos, on,
secretly set, do/nac AP9.824 (Eryc.).

laqro-da/knhs, ou, o(,
biting secretly, laqroda/knai ko/ries, of the Grammarians, ib.11.322 (Antiphan.):—also laqro-dh/kths, ou, o(, Phryn.PSp.87 B.

laqro-koite/w,
live in secret marriage, and laqro-koiti/a, h(, Tz.H.1.441, 527 (pl.).

laqro/-numfos, on,
secretly married, Lyc.320.

laqro/-pi_nos, on,
drinking secretly, Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr.7.216.1 cod.

laqro-po/dhs, ou, o(,
stealthy-paced, AP 9.409 (Antiphan.).
laqrou=n: bla/ptein, Cyr.

laqrofa^g-e/w,
eat secretly, Metag.15.

laqro/fa^g-os, on,
eating secretly, Hsch.s.v.zopadaspi/das, zofoderki/as.

laqu^ri/s, i/dos, h(,
caper spurge, Euphorbia Lathyris, Dsc.4.166, Gal. 12.56, 14.208, al.

la/qu^ros, o(, kind of
pulse, chickling, Lathyrus sativus, Anaxandr. 41.43 (pl.), Alex.162.12 (both anap.), Thphr.HP8.3.1, Plu.2.286e: heterocl. pl. la/qura Babr.74.6.
lai/: e)pi\ th=s ai)sxrourgi/as, Hsch. (ai)sxrologi/as Phot.).
lai-, lais-, insep. prefix with intens. sense (cf. la-) in lai/margos, lai/skapros, lai/spais. lai/+a, v. la/|a.

laiai/, ai(,
stones, used as weights to keep the threads of the warp straight in the upright loom (cf. a)gnu/s), Arist.GA717a35, 787b26; or to move automata, in sg., Hero Aut.2.8, al.: nom. sg. le/a EM 558.57, lei/a Hero l.c., Spir.2.27: nom. pl. lei=ai Gal.4.564, al., Poll. 7.36: acc. pl. lea/s Hsch., laia/s Arist.ll.cc.
lai/ba: a)spi/s, tri/bwn, pe/lth, Hsch. lai/gmata: pe/mmata, oi( de\ spe/rmata, i(era\ a)pa/rgmata, Id., cf. Cyr., Phot. (la/gm-); v. lai=ma.

la=i+gc, iggos, h(, Dim. of la=as,
small stone, pebble, la/i+gges Od.5.433; la/i+ggas 6.95. generally,
stone, A.R.1.402, al.
lai/dhs: ai)xmalwto/s, Cyr. lai/dion: a)ristero/n, eu)w/numon, Hsch. lai=dos or la=|dos, v. lh=dos.

laidro/s, a/, o/n,
bold, impudent, Call.Aet.3.1.4, Nic.Th.689, Al.563, Max.438 (Comp.), Hsch.

*la_i/+eios, a, on,
of Laius, Arg.metr.ad S.OT

lai/qargos, on, said to mean
biting secretly (laqei=n, da/knw), i.e. without barking, of a dog, sai/neis da/knousa kai\ ku/wn l. ei)= S.Fr.885, cf. Orac. ap. Ar.Eq.1068; also, = laqrai=os, laiqa/rgw| podi/ Trag.Adesp. 227: la/qargos in Phryn.PSp.87 B.: lh/qargos, Hsch.
laiqaru/zein: lamurw=sai, diapra/casqai, Hsch.

laik-a/zw, fut. -a/somai (v. infr.),
wench, Ar.Eq.167, Th.57; laika/som' a)/ra, i.e. I'll do anything rather, Cephisod.3; ou)xi\ laika/sei; a vulgar form of execration, Strato Com.1.36.
deceive, Suid., EM555.15.
laik-a^le/os, a, on, = sq., Luc.Lex.12.

laik-asth/s, ou=, o(,
wencher, Ar.Ach.79:—fem. laik-a/stria,
strumpet, ib.529, 537, Pherecr. 149, Men.Pk.235:—also laik-a/s, a/dos, Aristaenet.2.16 (s.v.l.).

la_i+k-o/s, h/, o/n, (lao/s)
of or
from the people: hence,
unofficial, civilian, PLille10.4 (iii B. C.), PStrassb.93.4 (ii B. C.).
common (opp. consecrated), of bread, Aq., Sm., Thd.1 Ki.21.4(5); of a place, opp.
holy, Sm., Thd.Ez.48.15. as Subst.,
layman, opp. klhriko/s, Cod.Just.1.1.3.2, 1.3.38.2, Just.Nov.6.5.

la_i+k-o/w,
make common, desecrate, Aq.De.20.6.
laila^p-eto/s, v. lai=lay.

laila^p-i/zw,
agitate by storms, Aq.Is.54.11.

laila^p-w/dhs, es,
stormy, ou)rano/s Hp.Epid.1.4; l. u(/dwr rain
which falls in a hurricane, ib.6.4.17.
lai/las: o( mh\ e)k ge/nous tu/rannos, Cyr., Suid.; Lydian acc. to Hsch.

laila^fe/ths, ou, o(,
sender of storms, PLeid.W.8.21. (For lailapafe/ths, cf. a)nemafe/ths.)
laila/xei: yofei=, Cyr.

lai=lay, a^pos, h(,
furious storm, hurricane, bai=non e)remnh=| lai/lapi i)=soi Il.12.375; kelainh=| l. i)=sos 11.747; a)/nemos su\n lai/lapi pollh=| 17.57; *ze/furos baqei/h| l. tu/ptwn 11.306; *ze/furos mega/lh| su\n l. qu/wn Od. 12.408, cf. 426; o(/te te *zeu\s lai/lapa tei/nh| Il.16.365; w)=rsen e)/pi zah=n a)/nemon . . l. qespesi/h| Od.12.314, cf. 9.68; w(s d' u(po\ lai/lapi . . be/briqe xqw/n Il.16.384, cf. Semon.1.15; *no/tou lai/lapi Anacr.113; lai/lapi xeimwnotu/pw| A.Supp.33 (anap.), cf. LXX Jb.21.18, Plb.30.11.6; acc. to Arist.Mu.395a7, a
whirlwind sweeping upwards: metaph., e)/tlhs lai/lapa dusmene/wn AP7.147 (Arch.).—Not found in early Prose, but common later, cf. l. a)ne/mou Ev.Marc.4.37, Plu.Tim.28; spelt lai=lamy Sammelb.4324.15:—a form lailapeto/s, o(, occurs in Sch. A Il.11.495, Hsch.
lai=ma, atos, to/, dub. in Ar.Av.1563 (lai=tma cod. Ven., lai=gma (cf. lai/gmata) Bentley).

laim-agxi/a, h(,
starvation diet, f.l. for limagxi/a in Cael.Aur.TP1.171.
laim-a/zousin: e)sqi/ousin a)me/trws, Hsch.
laim-arge/w, = laima/ssw, Porph.Abst.1.53.

laim-argi/a, h(,
gluttony, Pl.R.619b, Lg.888a, Epicur.Fr.471; h( peri\ th\n trofh\n l. Arist.PA696b30.

lai/m-argos, on,
greedy, gluttonous, Id.HA591b1, Thphr.CP1.22.1, etc.; l. pro\s th\n trofh/n Arist.PA675a20. Adv. -gws, e)sqi/ein Stob.4.56. 34.

laim-argo/ths, htos, h(,
greediness, Ph.1.686.

laim-a/ssw, Att. lai/m-ttw, (laimo/s B)
to be grcedy or
hungry, Ar.Ec.1179 (lyr.), Herod.6.97; cf. laimw/ssw.

lai/m-astron, to/, '
greedy beast', term of abuse, Id.4.46, 7.18.
laim-a/w, = laima/ssw, Cyr., Hsch., Phot.; v.laimw/ssw.
laimhto/mos, on, = laimoto/mos, AP6.101 (Phil.).

laimi/zw, (laimo/s)
cut the throat, slaughter, bou=n Lyc.326.

laimo-da^kh/s, e/s, (da/knw)
throat-biting, a)ki/des AP6.5.2 (Phil.).

laimo-pe/dh, Dor. laimo/-da_, h(,
dog-collar, ib.35 (Leon.).
springe for catching birds, ib.109.8 (Antip.).

laimo/-rru^tos, on, (r(e/w)
gushing from the throat, sfaga/ E.Hel.355 (lyr.).

laimo/s (A), o(,
throat, gullet, in Hom. always of men, ba/le douri\ laimo
 u(p' a)nqerew=na Il.13.388; to
 d' *)oduseu\s kata\ laimo
 . . ba/len i)w=| Od.22.15; ou)/ pws a)
 e)/moige fi/lon kata\ laimo
 i)ei/h ou) po/sis ou)de\ brw=sis Il.19.209; l. a)pamh/seie 18.34: metaph.,
neck of a bottle, AP 9.232 (Phil.): also in pl., E.Ph.1092; so of animals, Id.Supp.1201, Ar.Av.1560.—Rare in early Prose, as Hp.Cord.2, but commoner later, as Luc.Nigr.16, Gal.15.656, Porph.Marc.33, Jul.Or.6.193b.

laimo/s (B), h/, o/n, = lamuro/s 11, Heraclit.Incred.2 (cj.), Hsch.: neut. pl. as Adv., laima\ bakxeu/ein
impudently, Men.106.

laimo/-tmhtos, on,
with the throat severed, ka/ra E.Ph.455; l. a)/xh
cut-throat woes, Ar.Th.1054.

laimo-to/mas, a, o(,
throat-cutter, prob. cj. for -to/mos, *perseu/s E.El.459 (lyr.).

laimo-tome/w,
cut the throat of, mh=la A.R.2.840; tina Str.7.2.3, Plu.Oth.2: abs., A.R.4.1601:— Pass.,
have one's head cut off, S.E.M.1.264.

laimo-to/mos, on,
throatcutting, xei/r E.IT444 (lyr.); si/daros Tim.Pers.142; sfagi/s AP6.306 (Aristo). proparox. laimo/tomos, on,
with the throat cut, E. Hec.208 (lyr.);
severed at the throat, kefala/ Id IA776 (lyr.); *gorgou=s l. a)po\ stalagmw=n the blood dripping from the Gorgon's
severed head, Id.Ion1054 (lyr.).
laimwdw=: drapeteu/w, Suid. laimw/rh: h( lamuri/s, Id. = prutanei=on, Cyr.
laimw/ssw, = laima/ssw, Hippon.76 (laima=| Bgk., metri causa), Nic. Al.352 (v.l. for laima/ssonta).

lai=na, h(, = Lat.
laena, Str.4.4.3, Juba 7.
la_i/+neos, a, on, = la/i+nos, Il.22.154, E.Ph.115 (lyr.), Theoc.23.58.
lai/+nqh: la/rnac liqi/nh, Cyr.

la/i+nos [a_], h, on, （la=as)
of stone or
marble, ou)do/s Il.9.404, Od.8.80; tei=xos Il.12.178; la/i+non e(/sso xitw=na thou hadst put on a coat
of stone, i.e. hadst been stoned to death, 3.57; of sculpture, Simon.110; l. ta/fos S.OC1596; mnh=ma l. E.El.328; a)/pelqe lai/+nwn staqmw=n Trag.Adesp.44. metaph.,
stony-hearted, la/i+ne pai= Theoc.23.20. [a^ only Epigr.Gr.314 (Smyrna, iii A. D.).]
lai+no/xeir: sklhro/xeir, Hsch.

la_i^nu^fh/s, e/s,
woven of stone, l. o(/de tu/mbos Mon.Ant.23.85 (near Adalia).

la=i+on ( la=|on), to/, Dor. for lh/i+on, Sophr.95 (pl.). lai=on, to/,
ploughshare, A.R.3.1335.

laio/pous, poun, gen. podos,
left-footed, Cyr.

laio/s (A), o(, a kind of thrush, prob. the
blue thrush, Petrocichla cyanus, Arist.HA617a15, Ant.Lib.19.3.

laio/s (B), a/, o/n,
left, laia=| me\n i)/tun proba/lesqe (sc. xeiri/) Tyrt.15.3; laia=s xeiro/s
on the left hand, A.Pr.714; pro\s laia=| xeri/ E.HF159; laioi=si
on the left, Parm.17; e)pi\ laia\ keklime/non Arat.160, cf. Heliod. ap.Stob.4.36.8; oi( to\ l. e)/xontes (sc. me/ros) D.S.13.99; e)s laia\n e)sio/ntwn xh=ra (Dor.) IG14.1721.3; th=| laia=| tou= deciou= labo/menos ke/rws Philostr.Jun.Im.4. (Poet., but not in Hom., who uses a)ristero/s: also in later Prose, ta\ dido/mena th=| decia=| de/xesqai th=| laia=| xeiri/ Prov. ap.Plb.38.10.9, cf. Jul.Or.2.57d, etc.) (Orig. laivo/s, cf. Lat.
laevus, Slav.
lěv[ucaron]: in Hsch. we have lai/ba, i.e. lai/va, = a)spi/s, because borne on the left arm; cf. lai=fa, lai=ta, lafo/s.)
laiosta/ths, = a)risterosta/ths, interpol. in Poll.4.106.

laiotome/w, (la=ion)
reap corn, Theoc.10.3.

lai=pos: ki/naidos, la/stauros, Hsch. laiptu/hron: a)napeplasme/non, i)sxuro/n, Id. lai/+s, Dor. for lhi/+s. laisainofo/ros: o(plofo/ros, Id. laisa/s: h( paxei=a e)cwmi/s, Id. lai/sasqai: kth/sasqai, Id. (Dor. for lhi/+sasqai).

laish/i+on, to/,
animal's skin with hair left on, used as a shield, boei/as a)spi/das eu)ku/klous laish/i+a/ te ptero/enta Il.5.453 = 12.426, cf. Scol.28.2: used by the Cilicians, Hdt.7.91.
lai/sitos: ki/naidos, po/rnh, Hsch.

lai/s-kapros, on,
very lustful, Hsch., Suid., EM558.39.
lai/s-pais: bou/pais, *leuka/dioi, Hsch.
lai=ta: pe/lth, Hsch.

lai=tma, atos, to/, poet. Noun,
depth or
gulf of the sea, me/ga l. qala/sshs Od.4.504, 5.174, 9.260; a(lo\s e)s me/ga l. Il.19.267, cf. Od.8.561; also alone, l. me/g' e)kpero/wsin 7.35, cf. 5.409, 7.276, Theoc.13.24, A.R.1.1299.
la/i+tos, la/i+ton, la/i+tron, v. lh/i+tos, etc. lai=fa: a)spi/s, Hsch. laifai/: a)naidei=s, qrasei=s, ktl., Id.
laifa/ssw, = lafu/ssw, Nic.Th.477. = yhlafa/w, Cyr.
lai/fh, h(, rare collat. form of sq . . Call.Fr.245.

lai=fos, eos, to/, poet. Noun,
shabby, tattered garment, a)mfi\ de\ lai=fos e(/ssw Od.13.399; toia/de lai/fe' e)/xonta 20.206: generally, l. lugko/s a lynx's
skin, h.Hom.19.23; of
bedding, h.Merc.152.
piece of cloth or
canvas, sail, Alc.18.7, h.Ap.406; kaqh/sein l. (metaph.) A.Eu.556 (lyr.), cf. E.Med.524, Or.341 (lyr.); stolmoi\ lai/fous A.Supp.715; stei/lasa l. ib.723: pl., S.Tr.561, E.Hec.112 (anap.), Aret.SD2.11, etc.: metaph., *)/arhs e)/qraue lai/fh th=sde gh=s E.Rh.323.
laifu/s: da/panos h)\ boro/s, Hsch.

laiyhrodro/mos, on,
swift-running, E.IA207 (lyr.).

laiyhro/s, a/, o/n,
light, nimble, swift, laiyhra/ te gou=na Il.22.204, al.; of persons,
light-footed, swift, 21.264; l. bele/essin ib.278; a)ne/mwn l. ke/leuqa 14.17; l. dro/mos, po/des, Pi.P.121, N.10.63, B.
Scol.Oxy. Fr.4.9; gna/qoi E.Alc.494; po/lemoi Pi.O.12.4: neut. pl. as Adv.,
swiftly, E.Ion717 (lyr.), Opp.H.1.237: regul. Adv. -rw=s ib.5.660.
lai/w, = la/w (B), Cyr.

la^ka/zw, = la/skw,
shout, howl, A.Th.186, Supp.872 (lyr.).
la^ka/qh [ka^], h(, f.l. for laka/rh (q.v.).

*la/kaina [la^], h(, fem. of *la/kwn, prop.
Laconian woman (Phryn. 321), *l. ko/rh Thgn.1002, cf. E.Hec.441, etc.: abs., of Helen, Id.Andr.486 (lyr.); *la/kainai, ai(, title of play by Sophocles: freq., esp. in Trag., Ion. Prose, and X., as fem. Adj., = *lakwnikh/, *l. xw/rh Hdt. 7.235; xqw/n, gai=a, ga=, E.Andr.151, Tr.1110 (lyr.), Hel.1473 (lyr.); li/qos Laconian marble, Luc.Hipp.5; po/lis E.Andr.194, 209; ku/wn X.Cyn.10.4; sku/lac Pl.Prm.128c; h( *l. (sc. ku/lic) Laconian cup, Ar.Fr.216.
la^ka/n-h [ka^], h(, Hellenistic form of Att. leka/nh, Suid.
la^kan-i/skh, h(, Dim. of foreg., Hsch.s.v. laba/bhr.

laka/ra or laka/rh, h(, a tree, prob.
bird-cherry, Prunus avium, Thphr.HP3.3.1, 3.6.1; vv.ll. peuka/ra, laka/qh: in Hsch. also laka/rth.
la/kas: fa/raggas, Hsch.
la_katapu/gwn [u_], on, gen. onos, = katapu/gwn with intens. prefix la-, Ar.Ach.664.
la_kata/ra_tos [a^r], on, = kata/ratos with intens. prefix la_-, Phot. (lakk- cod.).

la/kafqon, to/,
an aromatic bark, an ingredient of the Egypt. ku=fi, Paul.Aeg.7.22. (Perh. = na/rkafqon.)

la^ka/w,
burst asunder, si/dhros laka=| PMag.Par.1.3074:—Pass., e(/ws lakhqh=| to\ pe/talon PLeid.V.6.22.
la/ke [a^], v. la/skw.
*la^kedaim-onia/zw, = *lakwni/zw, Ar.Fr.95.

*la^kedai/m-wn, onos, h(, voc. -on v.l. in Pi.P.10.1:—Lacedaemon, the capital of Laconia, Od.13.414, etc.; also, Laconia itself, Il.2.581, Hdt.1.67, etc.: also as Adj., *dio\s *lakedai/monos Id.6.56; *l. gh=s E.Hel.474:—but regul. Adj. *lakedaimo/nios, a, on, of persons, Hdt.7.228, etc., *lakwniko/s being commonly used of things; but *lakedaimo/nioi a)ste/res Call.Lav.Pall.24.
lakeda/ma: u(/dwr a(lmuro\n a(lsi\ pepoihme/non, o(\ pi/nousin oi( tw=n *makedo/nwn a)groi=koi, Hsch.

la_kedw/n, o/nos, h(,
bawling, wild talk, Timo 65 (pl.).
la^kei=n, aor. 2 inf. of la/skw. lake/menai: fage/sqai, Hsch.

la^ke/rnion, to/, Dim. of Lat.
lacerna, cloak, Fouilles de Doura-Europos 378.

la^kero/s, a/, o/n, (la/skw)
talkative: expld. by ei)kai=os, Hsch.

la^ke/r-uza, h(, (la/skw)
one that screams or
cries, l. korw/nh a
cawing crow, Hes.Op.747, Ar.Av.609, A.R.3.929 (pl.); l. ku/wn a
yelping dog, Lyr.Adesp.135 (masc. lake/ruzos restored by Toup in AP9.317 for lako/ruzos).

la^ker-u/zw,
make a noise, EM555.30:—Med., Hsch. (lakera/zesqai cod.), Phot., Suid.
la^ker-wta/n: sunestalme/non, Hsch.

la_ke/ta_s, o(, the
chirper, i.e. the cicada, Ael.NA10.44.
la_ke/w, Dor. for lhke/w (q.v.). la/kh: r(a/kh (Cret.), Hsch. lakhdh=cai: diarrh=cai, Id. lakhqmo/n: o(\n oi( *)attikoi\ glwsso/komon kalou=sin, Id.

la/khma [a^], atos, to/,
fragment broken off, PLeid.V.6.22; o)/rous
cleft, Zos.Alch.p.186 B.; dub. sens. in Sammelb.4425 xi 24 (ii A. D.), BGU34 ii 3 (iii A. D.).
laki/dai: ba/llei, Hsch. lakidai/monos: yofou=ntos, h)xou=ntos, Id. lakidoforw=n: ou)x u(gih/s, Id.
la^ki^do/w, (laki/s) = sq. 1, in Pass., of lacerating sensations, Dsc. Alex.Prooem.

la^k-i/zw,
tear, Lyc.1113, AP9.117 (Stat. Flacc.):—Pass., ib.4.3b. 14 (Agath.); lakisqei\s u(po\ lu/kwn MAMA1.286 (Phrygia).
split, kala/mous POxy.326 (i A. D., lakh/sh| Pap.). = qwpeu/w (s. v.l.), Hsch.

la^k-i/s, i/dos, h(,
rent, rending, Alc.18.8 (pl.); mh\ . . e)n pe/plois pe/sh| l. A.Pers.125 (lyr.); e)mpi/tnw cu\n laki/di li/noisi Id.Supp.131 (lyr.), cf. 903: freq. in pl., laki/des e)sqhma/twn, u(fasma/twn, Id.Pers. 835, Ch.28 (lyr.); laki/des pe/plwn
ragged robes,
tatters, Ar.Ach.423: in late Prose, of the
rent or
gap made in a ship by the enemy's beak, D.S.13.99, 14.72.

la^/k-isma, atos, to/,
that which is torn: in pl.,
tatters, E.Tr.497.

la^k-isto/s, h/, o/n,
torn, rent, split, Antiph.181; mo/ros l. death
by rending, Trag.Adesp.291.

lakk-ai=os, a, on, (la/kkos)
from the cistern, u(/dwr l. Anaxil.3, Thphr. Char.20.9, Stad.12.

lakk-a/rios, o(,
cistern-keeper, Gloss.

lakk-i/zw,
dig a pit, Suid.s.v. e)la/kkise.

lakko/-pedon, to/,
scrotum, Aristag.6, Ruf.Onom.106; lako/pedon in Poll.2.172.

lakko/-ploutos, o(,
pit-wealth, Com. nickname of Callias, who was said to have found a
buried treasure, Plu.Arist.5: prov., of any rich man, Alciphr.1.9.

lakko-poio/s, o/n,
making wells or
cisterns, Gloss.

lakko-prwkti/a, h(,
lewdness, Eup.351.4.

lakko/-prwktos, on,
loose-breeched (cf. eu)ru/prwktos), Ar.Nu.1330, Call.Com.11 (cj. for leuko/-), Cephisod.3.

la/kkos, o(,
pond in which water-fowl were kept, Hdt.7.119. contemptuously, of the Sea of Galilee, Porph.Chr.55.
cistern, tank, Ar.Ec.154, Alex.174.9, LXX Ge.37.20; to\n l. suntri/yas D. 29.3.
pit, reservoir, Hdt.4.195;
pit for storing wine, oil, or grain, X.An.4.2.22, Macho ap.Ath.13.580a; o( l. tw=n leo/ntwn Thd. Da.6.7(8), al.: metaph., a)nh/gage/ me e)k la/kkou talaipwri/as LXX Ps. 39(40).2; katabai/nein ei)s l. ib.27(28).1, al.:—written la/kos, PCair.Zen.176.276 (iii B. C.). *kou/rtios l., = Lat.
lacus Curtius, D.H. 2.42. a kind of garment, l. xrwma/tinos Peripl.M.Rubr.6.
lakkoskape/rdas, = lakko/prwktos, Com.Adesp.1362.

lakk-osxe/as, ou, o(,
with hanging scrotum, Luc.Lex.12, Poll.2.172, Ruf.Onom.107. (Single -k- in Poll.l.c.)

lakk-o/w,
hollow out, PLond.2.191.10 (Pass., ii A. D.).

lakk-w/dhs, es,
full of pits, Gp.3.3.11.
lakopei=n: punqa/nesqai; lako/pion: puqi/on; la/kopoi: a)rxh/ tis, e)/nqa oi( kle/ptai kri/nontai, Hsch. la/kos: h)=xos, yo/fos, Id.

lakpa^t-e/w, for la\c pate/w,
trample on, Pherecr.136, prob. in Luc. Lex.10 (la\c pat- codd.).

lakpa^/t-htos, on,
trampled on, trodden down, S.Ant.1275 (lacpa/thton Eust., v.l. lewpa/thton).

lakti/zw, pf. lela/kti^ka Ar.Nu.136:—
kick with the heel or
foot, l. posi\ gai=an, of a defeated boxer, Od.18.99, cf. 22.88; flo\c ai)qe/ra lakti/zoisa kapnw=| flames
lashing heaven with smoke, Pi.I.4(3).66; kradi/a de\ fo/bw| fre/na lakti/zei my heart '
knocks at my ribs' for fear, A.Pr.881 (anap.); [e)/rws] l. kradi/hn AP12.16 (Strat.); to\n peso/nta lakti/sai
trample on the fallen, A.Ag.885; l. bwmo\n ei)s a)fa/neian
trample on the altar so as utterly to destroy it, ib.383 (lyr.); th\n qu/ran l.
kick at the door, Ar.l.c.; l. a)llh/lous Pl.R.586b; of horses, l. to\ lupou=n Arist.PA690a21; e(auto/n Pl.Grg.516a; u(po\ i(/ppou laktisqei/s X.An. 3.2.18: metaph., l. pollh\n xa/rin E.Rh.411; bou=s o( lakti/sas u(ma=s, of a clumsy-footed person, Herod.7.118:—Med. in act. sense, Mim. Oxy.413.65. abs.,
kick, struggle, Batr.90; of horses, X.Eq. Mag.1.4: freq. in prov. l. poti\ ke/ntron, pro\s ke/ntra,
kick against the pricks, Pi.P.2.95, A.Ag.1624, E.Ba.795, Act.Ap.26.14, etc.; so pro\s ku=ma l. E.IT1396.
la/ktima: la/ktisma, Hsch., cf. PGen.56.27 (iv A. D.).

la/ktis, ios, h(,
pestle, Call.Fr.178, Nic.Th.109.

la/kt-isma, atos, to/,
a kick, given or received, S.Ichn.213, Lyc. 835, D.S.4.59, Ael.Tact.19.2; l. dei/pnou . . tiqei/s
kicking away the table, A.Ag.1601.

lakt-ismo/s, o(,
kicking, in pl., Hsch. s.v. skarqmoi=s.
lakt-i/ssw, Tarent. for lakti/zw, Heraclid. ap. Eust.1654.25, cf. 824.28, An.Ox.1.62.

lakt-isth/s, ou=, o(,
one who kicks or
tramples, i(/ppoi l.
kicking horses, X.Mem.3.3.4; of a man, Plu.2.10c; lhnou= l.
treader of the winepress, AP9.403 (Maec.).

lakt-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
of kicking: h( l. (sc. te/xnh)
kicking in wrestling, opp. puktikh/, Oenom. ap.Eus.PE5.34.
la/kuqos, Dor. for lh/kuqos. la/kuros: stemfuli/as oi)=nos, Hsch.
lakxa/, h(, = a)/gxousa, Ps.-Democr.Alch.p.42 B.

*la/kwn [a^], wnos, o(,
a Laconian or Lacedaemonian, prop. of men, as *la/kaina of women (Phryn.321), Pi.P.11.16, Hdt.7.161, Th.3.5, Ar. Ach.303, etc. (never in Trag.): also as Adj., Laconian, lo/gos S.Fr. 176; pe/ploi AP6.292 (Hedyl.). *la/kwn, o(, a throw of the dice, Eub.57.

*la^kwn-i/zw,
imitate Lacedaemonian manners, dress, etc., Pl.Prt. 342b sq., X.HG4.8.18, D.54.34; *l. th=| diai/th| Plu.Alc.23; th=| fwnh=| Id.2.150b: hence,
speak laconically, ib.513a, etc.; =
titubo, Gloss.
act in the Lacedaemonian interest, X.HG4.4.2, etc. = paideraste/w, Ar.Fr.338, Eup.351.1.

*la^kwn-iko/s, h/, o/n, Laconian, a)/ndres Ar.Lys. 628, etc.; kleidi/on, a kind of key, Id.Th.423, cf. Aristopho 7.4, Men. 343; *lakwniko\n pne/wn Ar.Lys.276; braxulogi/a tis *l. Pl.Prt.343b; e)la/ttw e)/xein gh=n to\n a)gro\n e)pistolh=s *lakwnikh=s Prov.in Str.1.2.30, cf. Longin.38.5. Adv. -kw=s Diph.96; sunto/mws kai\ *l. D.S.13.52. as Subst., h( *lakwnikh/ (sc. gh=) Laconia, Ar.Pax245, etc. *lakwnikai/ (sc. e)mba/des), ai(,
Laconian shoes, used by men, Id.V.1158, Th.142, Ec.74, 269, al. to\ -ko/n
the state of Lacedaemon, Hdt.7.235; th=s o(mili/as to\ *l. Laconian fashion, Plu.Cleom.32. to\ *l.
Laconian steel, St.Byz.s.v. *lakedai/mwn. *lakwniko/n, to/,
female garment, diafanh= *l. LXX Is.3.23.
*la^kw/n-ion, to/, = *lakwniko/s 11.4, PGiss. 21.5 (ii A. D.).
*la^kwn-i/s, i/dos, h(, fem. of *lakwniko/s, gai=a h.Ap.410; qerapaini/des Max.Tyr.29.6.

*la^kwn-ismo/s, o(,
imitation of Lacedaemonian manners, esp. of their short and pointed way of talking, Cic.Fam. 11.25.2.
acting in the Lacedaemonian interest, X.HG4.4.15, 7.1.46.

*la^kwn-isth/s, ou=, o(,
one who imitates the Lacedaemonians, Plu. Phoc.10.
one who takes part with them, X.HG1.1.32. pl.,
dancers in a square figure, Timae.44.

*la^kwno-ma^ne/w,
to be mad on Spartan ways, Ar.Av.1281.

*la^kwno/-shmos, on,
with stripes in Laconian fashion, Poxy.114.7 (ii/iii A. D.), PTeb. 406.14 (iii A. D.).
la/l, name for the letter la/mbda, PLond.3.909a7 (ii A. D.).
la/labis: lai=lay, ktl., Hsch.
lala/ggh, h(, and lala/ggion or lala/gkion, to/, = la/ganon, Sch.Ar. Pl.138, Suid.s.v. kollu/ra.

la^la^g-e/w,
babble, Pi.O.2.97; mh\ lala/gei ta\ toiau=t' ib.9.40; of birds and grasshoppers,
chirrup, chirp, Theoc.5.48, 7.139; humorously, of the swallow which announces spring, Cic.Att.9.18.3 (dub. l.), 10.2.1, alluding to AP10.1 (Leon.); of Echo, ib.6.54.9 (Paul. Sil.).

la^la^g-h/, h(,
prattle, Opp.H.1.135.
la^la^/g-hma, atos, to/, = foreg., AP6.220.15 (Diosc.).

la^la^g-hth/s, ou=, o(,
prattler, Hsch.
la^la/zw, = lalage/w, w(/ste ku=ma l. Anacr.90; but lala/cai: th\n glw=ssan e)celei=n, Hsch.

la/lac [la^l], a^gos, o(,
babbler, croaker: a name of the green frog (ke/rberos), and of a bird, Hsch.; cf. ba/bac.
lalaxeu/omai, = laxno/omai, POxy.294.25 (i A. D.).

la^l-e/w,
talk, chat, prattle, e(/pou kai\ mh\ la/lei Ar.Ec.1058, cf. V.1135; h( me\n xelidw\n to\ qe/ros . . lalei= Philem.208; lalei=s . . a)melh/sas a)pokri/nasqai Pl.Euthd.287d: c. dat.,
talk to one, lalw=n e)n tai=s o(doi=s seautw=| Ar.Eq.348; au(toi=s Philem.11; pro\s au(tou/s Alex.9.10; l. peri/ tinos Pherecr.2, Ar.Lys.627; u(pe/r tinos Posidipp.26.3; opp. le/gw, lalei=n
a)/ristos, a)dunatw/tatos le/gein Eup.95; lalw=n me\n . . , le/gwn de/ . . D.21.118 (s.v.l.); lalei=n ti h(mi=n o(/pws a)\n h(ma=s u(/pnos la/bh| Thphr.Char.7.10: hence, generally,
talk, speak, S.Ph.110 (v.l.for lakei=n）; kainh\n dia/lekton l. Antiph.171; *)attikisti\ l. Alex.195.4. c. metaph., zwgrafi/a lalou=sa (of poetry), opp. poi/hsis siwpw=sa (of painting), Simon. ap.Plu.2.346f.
talk of, tina Alciphr.Fr.5.2; a)llh/lais lale/ousi teo\n ga/mon ai( kupa/rissoi Theoc.27.58; a(/macan Stoic.2.92:—Pass., pra=gma kat' a)gora\n lalou/menon Ar.Th.578. in later writers, = le/gw,
speak, lalei= ou)qe\n tw=n a)/llwn zw/|wn plh\n a)nqrw/pou Arist.Pr.899a1: freq. in LXX, Ge.12.4, al.; basile/ws e)nanti/on Ezek.Exag.118; pro/s tina Act.Ap.3.22, cf. Luc.Vit.Auct.3, etc.; peri\ th=s le/cews Phld.Po.5.32, cf. Rh.1.189 S., al.; xeirsi\n a(/panta lalh/sas, of a pantomime, IG14.2124: abs., ei)/ ti mh\ li/qos, tou)/rgon, e)rei=s, lalh/sei Herod.4.33, cf. 6.61; e)la/lhsen o( kwfo/s Ev.Matt.9.33:—Pass., lalhqh/setai/ soi o(/ ti se dei= poiei=n
it shall be told thee . . , Act.Ap.9.6.
chatter, opp. articulate speech, as of locusts,
chirp, Theoc.5.34; meshmbri/as lalei=n te/ttic (sc. ei)mi/), a very grasshopper to
chirp at midday, Aristopho 10.6; a)nqrwpi/nws l. Strato Com.1.46. of musical sounds, au)lw=| lale/w Theoc.20.29; of trees, v.supr.1.2; di'[au)lou= h)\ sa/lpiggos] l. Arist. Aud.801a29; of Echo, D.C.74.14: also c.acc. cogn., ma/gadin lalei=n
sound the ma/gadis, Anaxandr.35.
la^/l-h, h(, = lalia/, Com.Adesp.12a D. (pl.), Luc.Lex.14.

la^/l-hqros, on,
talkative, Lyc.1319, AP4.1.13 (Mel.), 12.136.

la^/l-hma, atos, to/,
talk, prattle, Eub.109, Mosch.1.8.
prater, S.Ant.320; poiki/lwn lalhma/twn E.Andr. [937].
a person talked about, by-word, LXX 3 Ki.9.7, al.
style, Nausiph. 2.
la^/l-hsis, ews, h(, = lalia/, Ar.Fr.803, AB438.4.

la^l-hte/os, a, on,
to be talked of, AP7.47.

la^l-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
given to babbling, Ar. Eq.1381.

la^l-hto/s, h/, o/n,
endowed with speech, LXX Jb.38.14.
talked of, EM588.54.

la^l-htri/s, i/dos, h(,
talker, prattler, AP5.236.7 (Agath.).
la^l-io/s, a/, o/n, poet. for la/los, AP5.148 (Mel.), 170 (Id.), 7.417 (Id.), IG14.1892 (i A. D.). (On the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.123.)

la^l-io/ths, htos, h(,
garrulity, Gloss.

la/llai, ai(,
pebbles, from their
prattling in the stream, restored for a)/llai in Theoc.22.39, from Hsch., EM555.47.
lallou=sa, misspelling of lale/ousa, App.Anth.2.681.9 (Egypt).

la^lo-ba^ru^-para-melo-ruqmo-ba/ths [ba^], ou, Dor. la^lo/-a_s, o(,
heavygoing discordant talker, Com.word in Pratin.Lyr.1.13 (s.v.l.).
la^lo/eis, essa, en, poet.for sq., AP9.122 (perh. Evenus).

la/los [a^], on,
talkative, babbling, loquacious, E.Supp.462, Ar.Pax 653, Pl.Grg.515e, Theoc.5.75; l. tro/pis, of Argo, Orph.A.709; l. gh=ras AP7.417.10 (Mel.); of women, dub.in Arist.Pol.1277b23; of birds, Id.HA536a24 (Comp.): metaph., la/loi pte/ruges AP7.195 (Mel.); l. kerki/s AJA17.162 (Cyrene); of the swallow, Arr.An.1.25.8; u(/dwr Anacreont.11.7; to\ l., = lalia/, Philostr.Im.1.5; of style, h( i)de/a tou= lo/gou l. ma=llon h)\ e)nagw/nios Id.VS2.30: irreg. Comp.lali/steros Ar.Ra.91, Alex.92, Men.416, Arist.HA l.c.: Sup. lali/statos E.Cyc.315, Men.164.
lalu/nei: pa/ssei, patei=, Hsch. la/mas: mu/cas, Id. (Cf. lh/mh: lama/s: mu=s cod.)

*la_ma^xi/ppion, to/, burlesque word,
little jockey-Lamachus, Ar.Ach. 1206.

la/maxos: a)/maxos, a)katagw/nistos, Hsch. la/mbai: ta\ xa/smata, h)\ oi( mo/noi tw=n a)nqrw/pwn, kai\ i)xqu=s, Id.; cf. la/mba,
sapula, Gloss.

lamba/nw, fut. lh/yomai （lh/yw only late, v.l. in LXX 1 Ma.4.18); Ion. la/yomai GDI5497.3, al. (Milet., iv/iii B. C.), 5597.11 (Ephesus, iii B. C.), corrupted to la/myomai in Mss. of Hdt.1.199; Dor.fut.2sg. layh=| Epich.34.2, Theoc.1.4,10, inf. lamyei=sqai PSI9.1091.19; Hellenistic lh/myomai PPar.14.47 (ii B. C.), CIG4224c (add.) (Telmessus), 4244 (Tlos), al.: aor. 2 e)/la^bon, Ep. e)/lla^bon Il.24.170, etc.; Ion. Iterat. la/beskon Hes.Fr.112, Hdt.4.78, 130; imper. labe/ Il.1.407, etc.; written la/be in Med. Ms. of A.Eu.130, but labe/ Att.acc. to Hdn. Gr.1.431: pf. ei)/lhfa S.OT643, Ar.Ra.591 (lyr.), etc. (dub.in Archil. 143); Ion., Dor., Arc. lela/bhka Hdt.4.79, IG42(1).121.68 (Epid., iv B. C.), 5(2).6.14 (Tegea, iv B. C.), also Eup.426; inf. lelabh/kein IG 42(1).121.59 (Epid.), PSI9.1091.7: plpf. ei)lh/fein Th.2.88, Ion.3sg. lelabh/kee v.l. in Hdt.3.42 (kata-); Dor. pf. subj. 3sg. (par-） lelo/nbh| GDI5087b1 (Crete):—Med., aor. 2 e)labo/mhn, Ep. e)ll-, Od. 5.325, etc.; Ep. redupl. lelabe/sqai 4.388:—Pass., fut. lhfqh/somai S.Ph.68, Th.6.91, kata-lelh/yomai Aristid.Or.54p.677D.: aor. e)lh/fqhn Ar.Eq.101, etc.; Ion. e)la/fqhn SIG58.8 (Milet., v B. C.), (kat-) GDI5532.7 (Zeleia), e)la/mfqhn Hdt.2.89, 6.92, 7.239 (-la/fq- by erasure in cod. B); Hellenistic e)lh/mfqhn IG14.1320, Ev.Marc. 16.19 (a)n-); Dor. e)la/fqhn Archim.Aren.1.13: pf. ei)/lhmmai D.24.49, Ar.Pl.455; but in Trag.usu. le/lhmmai, A.Ag.876, E.Ion1113, IA363 (troch.), Cyc.433, cf. Ar.Ec.1090 (dia-); so later pro-le/lhpte (sic) Supp.Epigr.2.769 (Dura); Ion. le/lammai （a)po-) Hdt.9.51, (dia-) 3.117; inf. a)na-lela/fqai Hp.Off.11 (acc. to many codd., Hsch.and Erot., -lela/mfqai vulg.); Ion.3pl. lelh/fatai An.Ox.1.268; Dor. pf.imper. lela/fqw Archim. Con.Sph.3, al.:—in the fut., aor. Pass., and pf. Pass. the
a is short by nature in Ion., prob. long in Dor. and in Doricized Hellenistic forms such as lamyou=ntai Test.Epict.5.14, la/myesqai IG5(1).1390.67 (Andania, i B. C.); it is marked long in Aeol. la_/myetai Alc.Supp.5.9:—of these tenses Hom. uses only aor. Act., and aor.Med. twice (v. supr.); the Homeric pres. is la/zomai. —The word has two main senses, one (more active)
take; the other (more passive)
receive:
take,
take hold of, grasp, seize, ma/stiga kai\ h(ni/a Od.6.81: freq. with xeiri/ or xersi/ added, xeiri\ xei=ra labo/ntes Il.21.286; xerma/dion la/be xeiri/ 5.302; xei/ressi labw\n perimh/kea konto/n Od.9.487; e)n xei/ressi la/b' h(ni/a Il.8.116; e)n xeroi=n l. S.OT913; dia\ xerw=n labw/n Id.Ant.916; e)s xe/ras E.Hec.1242; e)n a)gka/lais A.Supp.481, etc.; of an eagle, l. a)/gran posi/n Pi.N.3.81: c.acc. of the thing seized, l. gou/nata Il.24.465; but also c. acc. of whole, gen. of part seized, th\n pte/rugos la/ben
caught her
by the wing, 2.316; to\n de\ peso/nta podw=n e)/labe 4.463; gou/nwn labw\n kou/rhn Od. 6.142; l. tina\ th=s zw/nhs X.An.1.6.10, etc.: sts. c. gen. only, a)gka\s a)llh/lwn labe/thn xersi/ they
took hold of one another with their arms, Il.23.711:—freq. in Med., v. infr. B.
take by violence, carry off as prize or
booty, Il.5.273, 8.191, Hdt.4.130, S.Ph.68 (Pass.), 1431, etc.;
capture a city, Plb.1.24.11, 3.61.8; e)k po/lios . . a)lo/xous kai\ kth/mata Od.9.41; of lions, labw\n krateroi=sin o)dou=sin Il.11.114; i(/na dai=ta la/bh|sin 24.43; of an eagle, 17.678; of a dolphin, 21.24. l. di/khn
take, exact punishment, Lys.1.29,34, Isoc.4.181; poina/s E.Tr. 360, etc. (rarely for dou=nai di/khn, v.infr.11.1 e); l. timwri/an D.18.280. of passions, feelings, etc.,
seize, me/nos e)/llabe qumo/n Il.23.468; *)atrei/+wna . . xo/los la/ben 1.387; o(ppo/te ke/n min gui=a la/bh| ka/matos 4.230; to\n de\ tro/mos e)/llabe gui=a 24.170, al.; dh\n de/ min a)mfasi/h e)pe/wn la/be Od.4.704; tou\s *)aqhnai/ous qa/rsos e)/labe Th.2.92; a)/xos X.Cyr. 5.5.6; de/os Pl.Lg.699c; e)peidh\ kairo\s e)la/mbane when the occasion
came to them, i.e.
occurred, Th.2.34, D.C.44.19; of fevers and sudden illnesses,
attack, Hp.Morb.1.19, Th.2.49, Ar.Ec.417, etc. (cf. la/zomai, lh=yis):—Pass., lamba/nesqai no/sw|, u(po\ [no/sou], S.Tr.446, Hdt.1.138; e)/rwti X.Cyr.6.1.31, etc. (reversely of the person, l. qumo/n, etc., v. infr.11.3). of a deity,
seize, possess, tina Hdt.4.79:—Pass., th=| *(re/a| lamba/nontai Luc.Nigr.37. of darkness, etc.,
occupy, possess, eu)=t' a)\n kne/fas temenos ai)qe/ros la/bh| A.Pers.365.
catch, overtake, as an enemy, Il.5.159, 11.106, 126, etc.; l. tina\ stei/xonta qu/raze Od.9.418; zw=ntes e)la/mfqhsan Hdt.9.119; simply,
find, come upon, S.OT1031, E.Ion1339.
catch, find out, detect, Hdt.2.89 (Pass.); poi/w| labw/n se *zeu\s e)p' ai)tia/mati; A.Pr.196; to\n au)to/xeira tou= fo/nou l. S.OT266: freq. c. part., ka)\n la/bh|s e)yeusme/non ib.461; kle/ptonta *kle/wna la/boimi Ar.V.759; l. tina\ yeudo/menon Pl.R.389d; tou=ton u(bri/zonta labo/ntes D.21.97: with Adj., o(/pws mh\ lh/yomai/ se propeth= Men.Epit.570:—Pass., drw=s' e)lh/fqhs S.Tr.808; e)p' au)tofw/rw| deina\ drw=nt' ei)lhmme/nw Ar.Pl.455; lhfqei=san e)p' au)tofw/rw| mhxanwme/nhn ti Antipho 1.3; e)lh/fqh moixo/s Lys.13.66: in good sense, ou)k a)\n la/bois mou ma=llon ou)de/n' eu)sebh= S.Ph.1051. l. tina\ pi/sti kai\ o(rki/oisi
bind him by . . , Hdt.3.74; a)rai=on labei=n tina S.OT276 codd. c. dupl. acc.,
take as, labw\n pro/blhma sautou= pai=da to/nd' Id.Ph.1007; cumparasta/thn l. tina/ ib.675; tou\s *(/ellhnas l. sunagwnizome/nous Isoc.5.86. th\n *)/idhn labw\n e)s a)risterh\n xei=ra
taking, keeping Ida to your left (nisi leg. labw/n, e)s . . ) Hdt.7.42; e)n decia=| l. th\n *sikeli/an Th.7.1; l. to\ strato/pedon kata\ nw/tou
take in rear, i.e. be behind, Hdt.1.75; cf. a)pei/rgw 11.2, e)/xw (A) A.1.7. l. *(ellhni/da e)sqh=ta
assume it, Id.4.78, cf. 2.37; l. zugo/n Pi.P.2.93.
take food or drugs, Diocl.Frr.121 (Pass.), 140, Sor.1.125, Gal.15.469.
apprehend by the senses, o)/mmasin qe/an S. Ph.537, cf. 656; pro/sfqegma/ tinos ib.234; o(ra=tai, h)\ a)/llh| tini\ ai)sqh/sei lamba/netai Pl.R.524d.
apprehend with the mind, understand, freni\ l. to\n lo/gon Hdt.9.10; no/w| Id.3.41; th=| dianoi/a| Pl. Prm.143a; l. e)n tai=s gnw/mais bebai/ws X.Cyr.3.3.51; e)n nw=| Plb.2.35.6: abs., l. th\n a)lh/qeian Antipho 1.6; mnh/mhn para\ th=s fh/mhs l. Lys.2.3, cf. Pl.Phdr.246d, etc. with Adv. added,
take, i.e.
understand in a certain manner, tau/th| tau=ta e)la/mbanon Hdt.7.142; la/bete [tou\s lo/gous] mh\ polemi/ws Th.4.17; to\ pra=gma meizo/nws e)la/mbanon
took it more seriously, Id.6.27, cf. 61; o)rqw=s l. to\n filokerdh= Pl.Hipparch.227c; l. ti ou(/tw, w(=de, Arist.SE174b27, Rh.Al. 1423a4; o)rgh=| kai\ fo/bw| to\ gegono\s l. Plu.Alc.18: with para/ c.acc., lamba/nw se para\ bouko/lon . . PMag.Par.1.2434:—Pass., tri/tou kaqestw=sai e)pi\ prw/tou lamba/nontai
are used for the first person, A.D.Pron.78.22; with e)s, ei) e)s ko/rhn lamba/noito
be taken for a girl, Philostr.Im.2.32: less freq. c. dupl. acc., w(s mequstika\s l. [ta\s a(rmoni/as] Arist.Pol.1342b25, cf. S.E.P.1.179; th=s ni/khs a)=qlon th\n u(peroxh\n th=s politei/as l. Arist.Pol.1296a31; tou=to l. gigno/menon Id.Mete. 346a7; also l. peri/ tinos ti/ e)sti Id.EN1142a32, cf. 1140a24, al.: also c. inf., l. ti ei)=nai/ ti Id.Mete.389a29, al.: with a relat. clause, ou(/tw dei= lamba/nein, a)ll' ou)x o(/ti . . Id.Metaph.1053a27, cf. Str.2.5.1; ei)lh/fqw o( a)/dikos posaxw=s le/getai Arist.EN1129a31: in bad sense, pro\s de/ous l. ti Plu.Flam.7; pro\s a)timi/as Id.Cic.13; l. di' oi)/ktou E. Supp.194; but also e)n xa/riti kai\ dwrea=| l.
receive as a favour, Plb.1.31.6. in Logic,
assume, take for granted, a(/pan zw=|on lamba/nei h)\ qnhto\n h)\ a)qa/naton Arist.APr.46b6; l. ta\s peri\ e(/kaston a)rxa/s ib.53a2, etc.:—Pass., ta\ e)c a)rxh=s lhfqe/nta ib.26b30; ai( ei)lhmme/nai prota/seis ib.33a15, cf. Phld.Rh.2.46 S., Sign.35, Oec.p.5 J., S.E.P.2.89.
take, i.e.
determine, estimate, th\n cumme/trhsin tw=n klima/kwn Th.3.20; e)nteu=qen to\ me/geqos tw=n a(marthma/twn Lycurg.66; th\n timwri/an poqeinote/ran l. Th.2.42.
take in hand, undertake (cf. lhpte/on）, l. ti e)pi\ to\ swfrone/steron, opp. suntaxu/nein, Hdt.3.71; mhde/na po/non labo/ntes without
taking any trouble, Id.7.24; palaisma/twn l. fronti/da Pi.N.10.22.
take in, hold, to\ strato/pedon pezou\s l. peri\ tetrakisxili/ous
Plb.3.107.10. part. labw/n freq. seems pleonastic, but adds dramatic effect, labw\n ku/se xei=ra
took and kissed, Od.24.398, cf. Il.21.36: so in Trag. and Com., ti/ m' ou) labw\n e)/kteinas; S.OT1391, cf. 641; th= nu=n to/de pi=qi labw/n Cratin.141, etc. ingressive of e)/xwn （e)/xw (A) A.1.6), e(ta/rous te l. kai\ nh=a . . h)=lqon Od. 15.269, cf. S.Tr.259.
receive,
have given one, get, receive, prop. of things (AB 106), a)/poina Il.6.427; ta\ prw=ta 23.275; a)nti/poina S.El.592, v. infr.e; para\ basile/os dw=ra Hdt.8.10, cf. Ar. Eq.439; pro/s tinos S.El.12, etc.; a)po\ tw=n sukofantw=n X.Mem.2.9.4;
gain, win, kle/os Od.1.298, S.Ph.1347, etc.; a)reta/n Pi.O.8.6; ko/smon Id.N.3.31 codd. (v.l. e)/laxes Sch.); a)lkh/n S.OT218, etc.; pro\s to\ mnhsteu/esqai l. h(liki/an
attain . . , Isoc.10.39; l. no/ston E.IT 1016, etc.; l. th\n a)rxh\n th=s qala/tths Isoc.5.61; monarxi/an S.Ant. 1163; te/ryin Id.Tr.820; xa/rin Id.OT1004; ke/rdos Ar.Ach.906: also in bad sense, l. o)nei/dh S.OT1494; sumfora/n E.Med.43; qa/naton Id.Hel.201 (lyr.); ge/lwta mwri/an te
incur . . , Id.Ion600; ai)ti/an a)po/ tinos Th.2.18, etc.:—for l. qumo/n, etc., v. supr.1.2 et infr. 3.
receive hospitably, Od.7.255, cf. S.OC284 (e)/labes to\n i(ke/thn e)xe/gguon) which approaches this sense; kalw=s l. tina/
treat well, BGU843.10 (i/ii A. D.).
receive in marriage, Hdt.1.199, 9.108, E.Fr.953.27, X. HG4.1.14, Isoc.10.39, PEleph.1.2 (iv B. C.), Men.Pk.436; toi=s lamba/nousin e)c au)tw=n, i.e. those who married their daughters, SIG1044.14 (Halic., iv/iii B. C.); also of the father taking a daughter-in-law, tw=| ui(w=| l. tina/ Men.Pk.447. l. o)/noma, e)pwnumi/an,
receive a name, Pl. Plt.305d, Smp.173d. l. di/khn
receive, i.e.
suffer, punishment, Hdt.1.115; th\n a)ci/hn l.
get one's deserts, Id.7.39; di/khn ga\r a)ci/an e)la/mbanen E.Ba.1312; l. zhmi/as D.11.11. l. o(/rkon
receive an oath, Arist. Rh.1377a8; l. pista/ X.An.3.2.5, al.; l. lo/gon
demand an account, tinos for a thing, para/ tinos from a person, Id.Cyr.1.4.3, D.8.47. l. e)n gastri/
conceive, Hp.Prorrh.2.24; ku=ma l., of the earth, A.Ch. 128.
receive as produce, profit, etc., oi)=non e)k tou= xwri/ou Ar.Nu. 1123; [xrh/mata] e)k th=s a)rxh=s Pl.R.347b; l. e(kato\n th=s draxmh=s, o)bolou=,
purchase for . . , Ar.Pax1263, Ra.1235, cf. Nu.1395; po/qen a)/n tis tou=to to\ xri=ma la/boi; X.Smp.2.4. l. pei=ra/n tinos, v. pei=ra.
admit of, o( me/gas ki/ndunos a)/nalkin ou) fw=ta lamba/nei Pi.O.1.81.
admit, initiate, tou\s e)s ta\ th=s te/xnhs ei)lhmme/nous Hp.Decent.17. of persons conceiving feelings and the like , l. qumo/n
take heart, Od. 10.461: freq. in periphrasis, l. fo/bon, = fobei=sqai, S.OC729; ai)dw= l., = ai)dei=sqai, Id.Aj.345; l. o)rgh/n, = o)rgi/zesqai, E.Supp.1050: so generally l. a)rxh/n, = a)/rxesqai, Id.IA1124; l. u(/yos, e)pi/dosin, au)/chsin, = u(you=sqai, e)pidido/nai, au)ca/nesqai, Th.1.91, Isoc.4.10, Arist.GA732b5, etc.; l. kako/n ti Ar.Nu.1310; l. no/son
take a disease, Pl.R.610d; l. morfh/n, te/los, etc., Arist.GA762a13, 744a21, etc.; ai( oi)ki/ai e)pa/lceis lamba/nousai
receiving battlements,
having battlements
added, Th.4.69, cf. 115. c. inf.,
receive permission to . . , SIG996.6 (Smyrna, i A. D.). Med.,
take hold of, lay hold on, c. gen., [sxedi/hs] Od.5.325; th=s kefalh=s, tw=n gouna/twn, Hdt.4.64, 9.76; xeiro/s E.Med.899, etc.; tou= bwmou= And.1.126, etc.: c. dupl.gen., mou labo/menos th=s xeiro/s Pl. Chrm.153b.
seize and keep hold of, obtain possession of, a)rxh=s S.OC373; kairou= labo/menos
seizing the opportunity, Is.2.28; l. a)lhqei/as Pl.Plt.309d: rarely c. acc., to/n . . lelabe/sqai Od.4.388.
lay hands upon, xalepw=s lamba/nesqai/ tinos
lay rough
hands on him,
deal hardly
with him, Hdt.2.121. d/. of place, l. tw=n o)rw=n
take to the mountains, Th.3.24, cf. 106; *dh/lou labo/menai (sc. ai( nh=es)
reaching Delos, Id.8.80.
find fault with, censure, tinos Pl.Lg. 637c, Philostr.VA4.22. labe/sqai e(autou=
check oneself, Hld.2.24.
la/mbda, lambdoeidh/s, v. la/bda, labdoeidh/s.

*la/mia^ [a^], h(,
a fabulous monster said to feed on man's flesh, a bugbear to frighten children with, Ar.V.1177, Duris 17 J., etc. la/mia, h(,
a fierce shark, Arist.HA540b18, Gal.6.727, Plin.HN9.78; cf. la/mna, la/mbai.
la/mia [a^], ta/, = xa/smata, Choerob. in An.Ox.2.239 (where *loi/mia), EM555.50; cf. la/mbai, la/mos.

la=mma, atos, to/, =
vitta, Gloss. (pl.).
la/mna or la^lo/-h, h(, = *la/mia 11, Opp.H.1.370, 5.36.

la=mna, = Lat.
lāmina, PMag.Par.1.2153, PLond.1.124.26.
*la=mnos, *lamno/qen, *lamnia/s, Dor. for *lhmn-.

lamo/pths: o( e)pi\ thli/as, Hsch. (Prob. =
blear-eyed, cf. lh/mh: perh. l.: o)ptili/as; cf. o)ptili/asis.)

la/mos, =
ingluvies, Sch.Hor.Ep.1.13.10.

lampa^darx-e/w,
act as lampada/rxhs, IG12(5).173 ii 13 (Paros), BCH36.392 (Delos), CIG3498 (Thyatira), SIG667.62 (Athens, ii B. C.); of a woman, Ephes.3.151 No.68.

lampa^da/rx-hs, ou, o(,
holder of the office of lampadarxi/a, JHS7.150 (Samos), CIG (add.) 3886 (Eumenia):— also lampa^da/rx-arxos, IG12(5).176 ii (Paros), 11(2).203 A65 (Delos, iii B. C.), AJA19.446 (Opunt.Locr., iii B. C.).

lampa^darx-i/a, h(,
superintendence of the lampadhdromi/a, Arist.Pol.1309a19 (pl.), Rh.Al.1437b1, SIG1003.26 (pl., Priene, ii B. C.).
lampa^da/rx-issa, h(, fem. of lampada/rxhs, Ephes. 3.151 No.68.

lampa^d-ei/a, h(,
torchlight procession, Inscr.Prien.195.13 (iii/ii B. C.).

lampa^d-ei=on, to/,
torch-holder, IG22.1541.15,1543 (Eleusis, iv B. C.).

lampa^d-eu/w,
make into a lampa/s, D.S.20.7. Pass.,
to be lighted by torches, Sch.S.OC1048.
to be handed on like a torch (in the race), Ph. 1.478. Med., = lampadi/zw, Ael.Fr.286.

lampa^dh-dromi/a, h(,
torch-race, Sch.Ar.Ra.131 (pl.); cf. lampa/s (A) 11.

lampa^dh-fore/w,
carry the torch, run in the torch-race, Aristid.Or. 47(23).22, cf. EM244.40.
lampa^dh-fori/a, Ion. -ih, h(, = lampadhdromi/a, Hdt.8.98.

lampa^dh-fo/ros, o(,
torch-bearer, A.Ag.312, Ar.Fr.442, IG22. 1250, 2.965b28: -oi, title of play by Philetaerus; but also,
candelabra, JRS18.162 (Jerash, iii A. D.).

lampa^d-i/as, ou, o(,
kind of comet resembling a torch, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.201, Plin.HN2.90, Lyd.Mens.4.116. the star Aldebaran, Ptol.Tetr.23; called lampau/ras in Procl.Par.Ptol.33.

lampa^d-i/eios, a, on,
belonging to a torch, u(/splhc IG11(2).203 B96 (Delos, iii B. C.).

lampa^d-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of torches, dro/mos l. the
torch-race, Sch.Lyc.732.

lampa^/d-ion, to/, Dim. of lampa/s,
small torch, lampa/dia e)/xontes diadw/sousin a)llh/lois, of the torch-race, Pl.R.328a, cf. lampa/s (A) 11.2; labw\n ste/fanon . . kai\ l. Plu.Pyrrh.13, etc.
bowl of a lamp, LXX Ex.38.16（37.19), Za.4.2.
lint for wounds, Ar.Ach. 1177, D.C.68.8.
top-knot, coiffure of Theban women, Dicaearch. 1.19. kind of comic mask, Poll.4.151, 154, Hld.10.39.

lampa^/d-ios, a, on,
torch-bearing, epith. of the moon-goddess, PMag.Par.1.2557.
of a torch, pu=r Hld.1.18 codd. lampa^d-isth/s, ou=, o(,
runner in torch-race, to\ koino\n tw=n l. SIG1068.2 (Patmos, iii/ii B. C.), cf. 671 A10 (Delph., ii B. C.); subject of painting by Pyrrho, D.L.9.62. l. a)gw/n, = lampadhfori/a, Sch.Ar.Ra.131.
lampa^d-i/ths [i_], ou, o(, = foreg., Abh.Berl.Akad.1928(3).20 (Pergam., iii B. C., pl.).

lampa^do-drome/w,
run in the torch-race, Sch.Ar.V.1198.
lampa^do-dromi/a, h(, = lampadhdromi/a, AB228 (read -miw=n for -mi/wn).

lampa^do-dromiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the torch-race, l. a)gw/n, = lampadhfori/a, Sch.Pi.O.13.56.

lampa^do/-eis, essa, en,
torch-bearing, Orph.H.40.11.

lampa^do-poio/s, o(,
torch-maker, Gloss.

lampa^doux-e/w,
hold or
carry a torch, Ephes.2.20 (ii A. D.), Sch.Ar. Ra.1119.

lampa^doux-i/a, h(,
torch-carrying, Lyc.1179 (pl.).

lampa^/doux-os, on,
torch-carrying, bright-beaming, a(me/ra E.IA1506 (lyr.); l. dro/mos, l. a)gw/n, = lampadhfori/a, Lyc.734, Sch.Ar.Ra.131.

lampa^dofo/ros, o(,
torch-bearer, tou= basile/ws BGU1233.6 (ii B. C.).
lampa/zw, poet. for la/mpw, Man.4.318.

lampa/kti_s, h(, (a)kti/s)
shining, of Venus, Doroth.in Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.82.

lampa/s (A), a/dos, h(,
torch, A.Th.433, Th.3.24, etc.; peuki/nh l. S. Tr.1198;
beacon-light, A.Ag.8, 28, etc.; lampa/das a(/yasqai light
torches, Ar.Th.655; lampa/das tina/sswn, in Bacchic ceremonies, Id.Ra.340 (lyr.); used in festal processions, fai/nete tou/tw| (sc. tw=| *ai)sxu/lw|） lampa/das i(era/s ib.1525 (anap.), cf. Th.102 (lyr.).
faggot, Plb.3.93.4; any
light, lamp, lampa/des a)rgurai= LXX Ju.10.22;
wax-light, Plu.2.263f; l. khroxi/twn AP6.249 (Antip.); later of
oillamps, Ev.Matt.25.3. metaph., of the sun, Parm.10.3, S. Ant.879 (lyr.), etc.; h( 'piou=sa l. the coming
light, i.e. the next day, E.Med.352; of lightning, damasqei\s lampa/sin kerauni/ois Id.Supp. 1011, cf. Ba.244, 594 (lyr.); of the Cyclops' eye, Cratin.459.
meteor, Arist.Mu.395b11, D.S.16.66, D.C.37.25.
torch-race, = lampadhdromi/a, Hdt.6.105, X.Vect.4.52; lampa/da dramei=n, tre/xein, run
the race, Ar.V.1203, Thphr.Char.27.4; ta\s l. dramei=n IG22.1030.9; e)n tai=s l. dihgwni/sqai ib.1039.20; lampa/da fe/rein Ar.Ra.1087 (anap.); a)fieme/nhn th\n l. qew= see the start, ib.131; ta\s l. suntelei=n IG 22.1011.9; l. e)/stai . . a)f' i(/ppwn th=| qew=| Pl.R.328a; lampa/di nika=n win in it, And.4.42, cf. IG22.957, al.; lampa/da n. win it, ib.3.106, al.; oi( nikh/santes th\n l. ib.122, cf. Milet.1(7).203a14 (ii B. C.). metaph., of life, lampa/da ga\r zwa=s me dramei=n . . h)/qele dai/mwn Epigr.Gr. 231 (Chios); kaqa/per lampa/da to\n bi/on paradido/ntas a)/llois e)c a)/llwn Pl.Lg.776b. = luxni\s a)gri/a, Ps.-Dsc.3.101.

lampa/s (B), a/dos, poet. Adj.,
torch-lit, l. a)ktai/, of Eleusis, S.OC 1049 (lyr.); e(ortai\ l. Lys.Fr.105 S.
lampau/ras, o(, v. lampadi/as. la/mpeske, Ion. Iterat. of la/mpw.

lampet-a/w, = la/mpw,
shine, only in Ep. part. lampeto/wn
shining, o)/sse de/ oi( puri\ lampeto/wnti e)i/+kthn Il.1.104 = Od.4.662, cf. Hes.Sc. 390; a)/stra lampeto/wnta Id.Th.110; tei/rea l. A.R.3.1362.

lampe/t-hs, ou, o(,
the lustrous one, coined to expl. lampeto/wnti, Sch.Il.1.104:— fem. lampe/tis, idos, Luc.Trag.103: also pr. n. *lampeti/h, a daughter of Helios, Od.12.132; as epith. of Selene, Orph.H.9.9.

la/mph, h(, = lampa/s,
torch, A.Eu.1042 (lyr., cod. Med. e manu prima), E.Supp.993 (lyr., s.v.l.); so Herm., after Sch., took a)nh/lios la/mpa in A.Eu.387 (lyr.),
light not of the sun, i.e. nether gloom, but v. la/ph 3. = la/ph (q.v.).

lamphdw/n, o/nos, h(,
lustre, of the eyes, D.S.3.37 (pl.), S.E.P.1.45; xalkou= Plu.Aem.18; of lightning, Epicur.Ep.2p.45U.: metaph., Plot.5.3.8.
brilliance, Lib.Or.59.103; of ebony, Jul.Caes.307d.

lamph/n-h, h(,
covered chariot, S.Fr.441, Men.29, Posidipp.10, LXX 1 Ki.26.5; at Tegea, = a)ph/nh, Polem.Hist. ap. Sch.Pi.O.5 Arg.: Astrol., e)n i)di/ais l., of planets when in certain favourable aspects, Ptol.Tetr.51.

lamphn-iko/s, h/, o/n,
like a lamph/nh, a(/macai LXX Nu.7.3.

lamphro/s, a/, o/n, (la/mph 11)
covered with scum, slimy, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.117.
lamp-h/s, epith. of the sun, Doroth. in Cat.Cod.Astr.2.82 cod.
lamp-i/as: o( h(/lios, Hsch.
*la/mpos, o(, one of the horses of Eos, Bright, Od.23.246; cf. *fae/qwn.

la/mpouris, idos, h(, (ou)ra/)
fox, A.Fr.433, Lyc.344, 1393 (on the accent v. EM474.4). v.l. for lampuri/s in Suid.s.v. purilampi/s.

la/mpouros, on,
bright-tailed, epith. of foxes, Epic.Alex.Adesp.2.13; as a dog's name, Firetail, Theoc.8.65. (Prob. from lampro/s, ou)ra/, with dissimilation.)

lampr-augh/s, e/s,
lustrous, Man.4.415:—irreg. fem. lamprauge/tis,
Id.1.301, 4.201.

lampr-eimone/w,
wear white or
splendid garments, Charito 3.1.

lampr-ei/mwn, onos, o(, h(,
clad in splendid robes, Hp.Ep. 15.

lampr-i/zomai, Pass.,
to be made bright, Pempel. ap. Stob.4.25.52.

lampro/-bi^os, on,
living splendidly, Paul.Al.M.3.

lampro-eidh/s, e/s,
bright-looking, v.l. for lampro/s in Gal.UP8.6.
lampro-ei/mwn, onos, o(, h(, = lamprei/mwn, Suid., Phot.

lampro/-zwnos, on,
with bright zone, Hsch. s.v. a(bromi/tras.
lampro-moiri/a, h(, in pl., = lamprai\ moi=rai (cf. lampro/s IV), Cat.Cod.Astr.8(1).243, 8(4).207.

lampro/-pous, o(, h(, poun, to/, gen. podos,
bright-footed, Sch.DIl.1.538.

lampro/s, a/, o/n, fem. -h/ in Ep. (Il.17.269, Hom.Epigr.3.3), but -a/ in Hes.Th.19, 371:—
bright, radiant, of the sun and stars, l. fa/os h)eli/oio Il.1.605; a)sth/r 4.77; -o/tatos, of Sirius, 22.30 (and of the same, lampro\n pamfai/nh|si 5.6); lampra\ selh/nh Hes.ll.cc., cf. Th.7.44; pri\n h(me/ran l. gene/sqai D.H.3.27; of the eyes, S.OT1483, E. Hec.1045, etc., v. infr. 11.3; of metallic bodies, l. fa/loi, ko/ruqes, Il.13.132, 17.269: neut. as Adv., qw/rhkes lampro\n gano/wntes 13.265. of white cloths and the like ,
bright, lampro\s d' h)=n h)e/lios w(/s [o( xitw/n] Od.19.234; de/rma . . -o/taton leuko/thti Hdt.4.64; l. e)sqh/s, = Lat.
toga candida, Plb.10.5.1. of water,
clear, limpid, A.Eu.695, Hp.
Aër.5, X.HG5.3.19; of air, l. h)h/r Hp.
Aër.15; ai)qh/r E.Med.829 (Sup., lyr.). of sound or voice,
clear, distinct, Pl.Phlb. 51d, D.19.199; lampra\ khru/ssein E.Heracl.864; fwnh\ -ote/ra Arist. HA545a12; opp. f. a)safh/s, Id.Aud.801b22; lampro\n a)nololu/cai Plu. 2.768d; cf. la/mpw 1.2. metaph., of
