make a libation of wine, Il.1.463, Od.3.460; me/qu 12.362; also lei/bein (without oi)=non) Il.24.285; e)c a)sami/nqou ku/likos l. Cratin.234; esp. with a dat. of the gods to whom the libation is made, lei=yai *kroni/wni Il.7.481; qeoi=s Od.2.432; in full, *dii\ l. ai)/qopa oi)=non Il.6.266, cf. 10.
579: rare in Trag., sponda\s qu/ein te l. t' A.Supp.981; sponda\s qeoi=s l. E.Ion1033:—Med., sponda/s Id.Alc.l.c. like ei)/bw (q.v.),
let flow, shed, da/krua l. Il.13.88, 658, Od.5.84, 16.214; da/kru l. A. Th.51; e)k d' o)mma/twn lei/bousi dusfilh= li/ba （di/a cod. M) Id.Eu.54; di' o)/mmatos a)stakti\ l. da/kruon S.OC1251; th/kein kai\ l. (abs.) melt and
liquefy one's spirit, Pl.R.411b:—Pass., of the tears,
to be shed, pour forth, E.Ph.1522 (lyr.), X.Cyr.6.4.3; but also, of persons, lei/bomai da/krusin ko/ras
have my eyes
running with tears, E.Andr.532 (lyr.). of other liquids, ko/mai lei/bousin e)/laia
drip with oil, Call.Ap.38:—Pass., a)fro\s peri\ sto/ma lei/betai Hes.l.c., cf. Pl.Ti. 82d; o(/pla lu/qrw| l., tu/mbos l. me/liti, AP6.163 (Mel.), 7.36 (Eryc.): metaph., of sound (cf. xe/w）, qrh=non . . leibo/menon . . su\n kama/tw| Pi.P. 12.10. in Pass., also,
melt or
pine away, Ar.Eq.327 (lyr.), Plu.2.681b.—spe/ndw was nearly equiv. in sense, and was used in Att. Com. and Prose (exc. Pl.and X.ll.cc.).

leienter-i/a, h(, (lei=os, e)/nteron)
passing one's food undigested, Hp.
Aër.10 (pl.), Aph.3.22 (pl.), Gal.7.327, al.
leienter-iko/s, h/, o/n, = sq., Hp. Epid.3.8, Ruf. ap. Orib.5.3.4, 8.24.30, Gal.8.389.

leienter-iw/dhs, es,
affected with leienteri/a, koili/ai Hp.Aph.4.12.
lei+/zomai, Ion. and poet. for lhi+/zomai (q.v.).
leikna/rion, leikni/zw, lei=knon, ff.ll.for likn-. lei/krika: seirai/, sxoini/a, ple/gmata, Hsch. (Cf. le/krika.)

lei/kths, ou, o(, (lei/xw) = Lat.
cunnilingus, Sch.Ar.Pax883, Teucer in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).196.

leima^k-i/des, ai(, l. nu/mfai
meadow-nymphs, Orph.A.646 Ruhnk. (limnaki/dwn codd., limnai/wn Hermann).

leima^k-w/dhs, es,
like meadows, grassy, Hp.
Aër.18,24: Comp. leimake/steroi, f.l. for -kwde/steroi, ib.13.

lei=mac, a^kos, h( (not o(, Hdn.Gr.1.524), = leimw/n,
meadow, E.Ph. 1571, Ba.867 (both lyr.), Lyr.Alex.Adesp.22, AP9.788.10.
garden, Pherecr.109. = Lat.
limax, snail, Hsch.

lei=mma, atos, to/, (lei/pw)
remnant, residue, Phld.Herc.1251.6 (pl.), Plu.Nic.17, tou= paido\s ta\ lei/mmata
what was left of him, his
remains, Hdt.1.119; so, of persons, LXX 4 Ki.19.4, Ep.Rom.11.5. in Music,
interval of 256 243
left over when two to/noi of 9 8 are measured off from the dia\ tessa/rwn (4 3), Ptol.Harm.1.10, Gaud.Harm.13, 15, Adrast. ap. Theon.Sm.p.68 H., al., Procl.in Ti.2.168, 179 D.; misunderstood as the number 13 (256—243) by Plu.2.1017f, cf.Anon. ap. Theon.Sm.p.69 H. in Rhythmic, the shortest pause, l. e)n r(uqmw=| xro/nos keno\s e)la/xistos Aristid.Quint.1.18. in Medicine,
intermission in fever, Steph.in Gal.1.268 D.(sg.and pl.).
deficiency, mh\ gene/sqai mh/te daneismo\n mh/te l. peri\ tau/tas ta=s ei)sfora=s IG5(1).1432.9 (Messene, i B.C./i A.D.).

leimmatiai=os, a, on, in Music,
of the lei=mma 2, lo/gos Theo Sm. p.69 H.

leimo/dwron, to/, a wild plant, prob.
strangleweed, Orobanche cruenta, Thphr.CP5.15.5.

leimw/n, w=nos, o(,
any moist, grassy place, meadow, Il.2.467, etc.; a)mfi\ de\ leimw=nes malakoi\ i)/ou h)de\ seli/nou qh/leon Od.5.72; malako\s l. Hes.Th.279; baqu/s A.Pr.653; l. bou/xilos, bouqerh/s, Id.Supp.540 (lyr.), S.Tr.188: metaph., leimw=na *mousw=n dre/pwn Ar.Ra.1300; e)s leimw=na potami/wn potw=n into the smooth river-water, S.Fr.659; xuth=s leimw\n qala/sshs, of a sponge, AP6.66.7 (Paul. Sil.); plou/tou kai\ neo/thtos leimw=nas a)fqo/nous Pl.Sph.222a, cf. Phdr.248c.
flowers, *(=wrai leimw=nas bru/ousi Him.Or.1.19.
pudenda muliebria, E.Cyc.171. later, freq. metaph. for
any bright, flowery surface, as
a blooming face, a peacock's tail, Ach.Tat.1.19, 1.16;
an embroidered robe, l. o( peri\ ta\s e)sqh=tas Philostr.Im.2.1; also l. le/cewn, title of work by Pamphilus, Suid.Praef., cf. Plin.
HN Praef.24, Gell. Praef.6:—and as Dim. leimwna/rion, to/, Phot.Bibl.p.161 B.

leimwn-h/rhs, es,
belonging to a meadow, bota/nh Suid.

leimwn-ia/s, a/dos, poet. fem. of leimw/nios, nu/mfh l.
meadow-nymph, S.Ph.1454 (anap.), A.R.2.655; cf. leimaki/des, leimwn-ia/ths li/qos, o(, a stone
of grass-green colour, Plin.HN37.172.

leimw/n-ion, to/,
Statice limonium, sealavender or
snakeweed, Dsc.4.16, Plin.HN20.72; as an ornament, l. xrusou=n Inscr.Délos 442 B11 (ii B.C.).

leimw/n-ios, a, on, (leimw/n)
of a meadow, ka)po\ gh=s l. dro/soi A.Ag.560; a)/nqea Id.Fr.374; fu/lla Theoc.18.39; a)ra/xnai Arist.HA555b7; a)nemw/nh h( l.
Anemone pavonina, scarlet anemone, Thphr.HP6.8.1 (= a). a)gri/a, q.v.); also leimwni/a, h(, a thorny plant, prob. = sko/lumos,
golden thistle, Scolymus hispanicus, ib.6.4.3. (leimwni/a| is corrupt in S.Aj.601 (lyr.).)
leimwn-i/s, i/dos, poet. fem. of leimw/nios, D.P.756.

leimwn-oeidh/s, e/s,
like meadows, grassy and flowery, Ceb.17.

leimwn-o/qen, Adv.
from a meadow, Il.24.451:—also lei/mwn-qe, Theoc.7.80.

lei/couros, on,
gluttonous, Zonar.

leio/-ba^tos, o(, a fish,
skate or
ray, Pl.Com.137, Arist.HA566a32; another name for the r(i/nh acc. to Ath.7.312b: but distd. from the r(i/nh by Archestr.Fr.46. = o( o(malo\s to/pos, Suid. Cf. lew/batos.

leio-ge/neios, on,
smooth-chinned, beardless, Hdt.5.20.

leio/-glwssos, on,
smooth-tongued, flattering, Sm., Thd.Pr.6.24.
leio-qa^lassi/a, h(, a kind of radish, Thphr.HP7.4.2 codd.: but leioqasi/a is to be restored from Ath.2.56f, cf. Plin.HN19.76 (-thasium).

leio-ka/rhnos [a^], on,
smooth-headed, bald-headed, Poll.2.26.

leio/-kaulos, on,
smooth-stalked, Thphr.HP7.8.2.
leio-ko/nitos: h( telei/ws w(s ko/nis dialelume/nh, lei/ws ga\r telei/ws, Hsch.; cf.lewko/nitos.

leio-ku_mone/w,
to be upon a smooth sea, interpol. in Suid.

leio-ku/mwn [u_], on, gen. onos,
having low waves, qa/latta l. Luc.VH2.4, Scyth.11.
leio/-meros: taxudia/noios, Hsch. (post lei=on, fort. leio/poros).

leio/-mi^tos, on,
smoothing the warp, ka/makes AP6.247 (Phil.).

leionth=, h(, poet. for leonth=,
lion's skin, APl.4.185.

leiontopa/lhs [a^], ou, Dor. leio/-a_s, a, o(,
wrestler with a lion, AP9.237 (Eryc.).

leiopoi-e/w,
make smooth, file down a bone, Heliod. ap. Orib.46.11.29.
pound fine, Orib.9.40.2, Gp.20.26.

leiopoi/-hsis, ews, h(,
filing down of a bone, Heliod. ap. Orib.46.12.3.

leio/pous, o(, h(, poun, to/, gen. podos,
flat-footed, Gal.18(1).613.

lei=os, a, on,
smooth to the touch, [ai)/geiros] Il.4.484; l. w(/sper e)/gxelus Ar.Fr.218, cf. Eup.338; xh=mai, xhrambi/s, PCair.Zen.82.12 (iii B.C.), Hsch.s.v. xh/mh; ta\ traxe/a kai\ ta\ l. X.Mem.3.10.1; freq. in Pl., Cra.414b, al., Arist.Cat.10a17, etc.; also, of cloths,
smooth, plain, not embroidered, u(fanta/ te kai\ l. Th.2.97; l. u(/fasma Pl.Plt.310e; lei=a e)kpepoihme/na worked
smooth, of marble, IG12.372.134; also lei/a e)rgasi/a ib.372.165;
unsculptured, *)aqh/nhs e(/dos Call.Fr.105.4; of plate,
unembossed, fia/lai IG11(2).161 B27 (Delos, iii B.C.), Inscr.Délos 442 B78 (ii B.C.). in Hom., chiefly of
level places or countries, lei=os d' i(ppo/dromos a)mfi/s Il.23.330; e)n lei/w| pedi/w| ib.359; l. o(do/s Od.10.103, Hes.Op.288 (ap. X., Pl., etc., o)li/gh codd.); l. a)/rosis Od.9.134; lei=a d' e)poi/hsen made a
smooth place, Il.12.30; pedi/on l. Hdt.2.29; xwri/on leio/taton Id.7.9.b/; h( -ota/th tw=n o(dw=n Id.9.69; l. qa/lassa a
smooth sea, Id.2.117; l. xw/ra kai\ a)/culos X.Ath. 2.12; l. ba/seis
flat feet, Gal.6.856. c. gen., xw=ros . . lei=os petra/wn
smooth (i.e.
free) from rocks, Od.5.443, 7.282.
smoothskinned, without hair, of animals, Arist.HA582b35, LXX Ge.27.11; -o/taton tw=n zw/|wn e)sti\n a)/nqrwpos Arist.HA583a6; esp. of youths,
smooth-chinned, beardless (cf. lei/ac), Theoc.5.90, cf. AP12.13 (Strat.); also, of fish,
smooth, i(ppi/dia Epich.44; opp. lepidwtoi/, Arist.HA505a26; [galeo/s] the
smooth shark,
Mustelus laevis, ib.565b2, Opp.H.1.380; to\ l. Hp.Epid.3.14, 6.3.16; lei/h u(po/stasis a
smooth or
uniform sediment, Id.Coac.462; [ga/la] l. kai\ o(malo\n kai\ sunexe\s e(autw=| Sor. 1.91. metaph.,
smooth, soft, pneu=ma Ar.Ra.1003; of the sound of the voice, Pl.Plt.307a, Ti.67b, Phlb.51d; dia/lektos Phld.Po.Herc. 994.36; of the taste, Ti.Locr.100e sq.; also l. mu=qoi A.Pr.647; [to\] h(/mero/n te kai\ l. [tou= h)/qous] Pl.Cra.406a; l. pa/qhma, opp. traxu/, Id.Ti.63e; l. kinh/mata th=s sarko/s Epicur.Fr.411; l. ki/nhsis, Cyrenaic phrase for h(donh/, D.L.2.86, cf. Luc.Par.10, Alex.Aphr.in Top.94.32; l. h(suxi/h AP7.278 (Arch. Byz.); w(s -ote/rou e)le/ous u(pa/rcontos (sed leg. teleiote/rou) Plb.20.9.11; to\ l., = leio/ths, th=s e(rmhnei/as D.H. Lys.24; to\ l. kai\ o(male\s th=s sunqe/sews Demetr.Eloc.48. Adv. lei/ws
smoothly, gently, Pl.Tht.144b, Plu.2.384a; kai/ me kwti/llonta l. traxu\n e)kfanei=n no/on Sol. ap. Arist.Ath.12.3.
rubbed or
ground down, Dsc.1.3, al., PHolm.19.39; cf. leio/w 11: lei=on, to/,
fine sand, Inscr.Délos 500 A9 (iii B.C.). (Prob. leivos, cf. Lat.
lēvis.）

lei-o/stra^kon, to/,
smooth-shelled, a kind of oyster, Arist.HA528a21, Fr.304, Xenocr. ap. Orib.2.58.128.

lei-o/ths, htos, h(,
smoothness, opp. traxu/ths, spla/gxnwn A.Pr.493; xalinou= X.Eq.10.6sq.; kato/ptrwn Pl.Ti.46c; of the skin, Id.Grg.465b: in pl., Id.Ti.65c, Arist.PA648b6. of the voice or pronunciation, [fwnh=s] Id.GA 786b10, Demetr.Eloc.299; l. o)noma/twn D.H.Vett.Cens.2.2; th=| l. douleu/ein, of Isocrates, Phld.Rh.1.199 S. = D.H.Isoc.13.
leio-tri^be/w, = leio/w 11.1, Gal.12.423, Herasap.eund.13.39, etc.:— Pass., Dsc.1.7. (Written leotr-, PMag.Leid.W.1.25, and prob. in SIG1172.7 (Lebena).)
leio-tri^xe/w, = sq., Arist.HA595b26.

leio-tri^xia/w,
have smooth hair, Sophr.26.

leiouri/a, h(,
diabetes, Ruf.Ren.Ves.6.3 (restd. fr. Aët.11.1).
lei/ouros: ai)/louros, Hsch. lei/ousi, poet.for le/ousi, dat.pl. of le/wn. leiou/smata h)\
legou/smata: ei)=dos katafra/ktou, *gala/tai, Id.

leio/-floios, on,
smooth-barked, Thphr.HP1.5.2, CP5.7.2 (Comp.).

leio/-fullos, on,
smooth-leaved, Id.HP7.4.4; kra/mbh Eudem. ap. Ath.9.369e.

leio/-xrws, wtos, o(, h(,
smooth-skinned, Arist. ap. Ath.7.312f (o(mo/xrous codd.Arist.HA543a25).

leio/-w,
make smooth, Aq.Pr.28.23:— Pass.,
to be polished, smoothed, Arist.Col.793a16, Heliod. ap. Orib.46.12.2.
pound fine, triturate, Gal.UP11.8, PSI6.718.4 (iv/v A.D.):—Pass., Ruf. ap. Orib.8.47.4, Marc.Sid.83.
emulsify, levigate, ko/mmi Critoap.Gal.13.36, cf. Ps.-Democr.Alch.p.55 B.

leipandri/a and other compds. freq. written in medieval Mss. with leip- （leipo-, leif-) will be found, with few exceptions, under li^p （li^po-, li^f-): metrical evidence, where available, favours li^p-, which is also certain in lipotele/w: but leip- is certain in leipognw/mwn, and for many other words no trustworthy evidence of the spelling exists; cf. Choerob.in An.Ox.2.239.

leipognw/mwn, on, gen. onos,
lacking gnw/mones 11.6, oi)=s IG22.1357 (iv B.C.), cf. Ister 53, Poll.1.182, Luc.Lex.6, EM4.4, Hscb (Freq. misspelt lipognw/mwn in codd.)

leipte/on,
one must leave, abandon, E.HF1385, Pl.Cri.51b, etc.
leipu^r-i/a, leipu^r-i/as, leipu^r-iko/s, leipu^r-iw/dhs, v. lip-.

lei/pw, impf. e)/leipon Il.19.288, etc.: fut. lei/yw 18.11: aor. 1 e)/leiya, part. lei/yas Ar.Fr.965 (= Antiph.32), elsewh. only late, Plb.12.15.12 (par-), Str.6.3.10 (par-), Ps.-Phoc.77 (a)p-), etc.; uncompounded, Ptol.Alm.10.4, Luc.Par.42, Ps.-Callisth.1.44 (cod. C); also in later Poets, Man.1.153, Opp.C.2.33, and in Inscrr., Epigr.Gr.522.16 (Thessalonica), 314.27 (Smyrna), etc.: but correct writers normally use aor. 2 e)/li^pon Il.2.35, A.Pers.984 (lyr.), etc.: pf. le/loipa Od.14.134: plpf. e)leloi/pein (Att. -h) X.Cyr.2.1.21:—Med., in prop. sense chiefly in compds.: aor. 2 e)lipo/mhn Hdt.1.186, 2.40, E.HF169, etc. (in pass. sense, Il.11.693, al.):—Pass., fut. Med. in pass. sense lei/yomai Hes.Op.200, Hdt.7.8.a/, 48; also leifqh/somai S.Ph.1071, lelei/yomai
Il.24.742, Th.5.105, etc.: aor. e)lei/fqhn, lei/fqhn Pi.O.2.43; Ep. 3pl. e)/leifqen h.Merc.195: pf. le/leimmai Il.13.256, Democr.228, Pl.Ti.61a, etc.: plpf. e)lelei/mmhn Il.2.700; Ep. le/leipto 10.256: Ep. aor. also e)/leipto A.R.1.45, etc.:
leave, quit, *(ella/da, dw/mata, etc., Il.9.447, Od.21.116, etc.: with a neg., [sko/pelon] ou)/ pote ku/mata lei/pei Il.2.396; nin . . xiw\n ou)dama\ l. S.Ant.830 (lyr.); xersi\n u(/po *trw/wn lei/yein fa/os h)eli/oio, i.e. die, be killed, Il.18.11; l. to\n bi/on u(po/ tinos Pl.Lg.872e; l. bi/on, bi/oton, etc., S.El.1444, E.Hel.226 (lyr.), etc.; au)to/xeiri sfagh=| l. bi/on Id.Or.948. conversely, to\n d' e)/lipe yuxh/ Il.5.696, Od.14.426; to\n . . li/pe qumo/s Il.4.470; e)/peita/ me kai\ li/poi ai)w/n 5.685, cf. Od.7.224; li/pe d' o)ste/a qumo/s Il.16.743; yuxh\ de\ le/loipen (sc. o)ste/a) Od.14.134; nu=n d' h)/dh pa/nta le/loipen (sc. e)me/) ib.213; in these two last passages some take it intr.,
is gone, v. infr. 11.
leave behind, leave at home, paidi\ to\n e)n mega/roisin e)/leipes Od.13.403, cf. Il.5.480; esp. of dying men,
leave (as a legacy), *)atreu\s de\ qnh/|skwn e)/lipen polu/arni *que/sth| [to\skh=ptron] 2.106; pate/ri go/on kai\ kh/dea lugra/ 5.157, cf. S.Aj.973; pai=da o)rfano\n l. ib.653; l. a)/rrenas, qugate/ras, Pl.Lg.923e, 924e; l. eu)/kleian e)n do/moisi A.Ch.348 (lyr.):—also in Med.,
leave behind one (as a memorial to posterity), mnhmo/sunon lipe/sqai Hdt.1.186, 6.109, al.; lipe/sqai timwrou/s E. HF169; diado/xous e)mautw=| Plu.Aem.36, etc.
leave standing, leave remaining, spare, oi)ki/an ou)demi/an X.An.7.4.1; mhde/na Id.HG2.3.41, Pl.R.567b, etc.
leave, forsake, Il.17.13, etc.; l. tina\ xamai/ Pi.O.6.45; eu(/donta S.Ph.273; th\n au(tou= fu/sin l. ib.903; l. th\n ta/cin Pl.Ap.29a, etc.; l. e)ra/nous
fail in paying . . , D.27.25, cf. 25.22; l. dasmo/n, fora/n, X.Cyr.3.1.1, 34; l. marturi/an, o(/rkon,
fail in . . , D.49.19, 59.60, l. di/khn
allow it
to go by default, SIG134b24 (Milet., iv B.C.); loiba\s . . ou) li/pe
neglected them not, IG3.1337.8. conversely, li/pon i)oi\ a)/nakta they
failed him, Od.22.119. Math.,
lose or
drop something, i.e. have something subtracted from it, to\ KP lipo\n to\ BO the area KP
minus the area BO, Apollon.Perg.3.12, cf. Ptol.Alm. 10.4, al., Dioph.2.21. intr.,
to be gone, depart, Epigr.Gr.149.2 (Rhenea); v. supr. 1.1b.
to be wanting or
missing, ou)/ ti/ pw e)/lipen e)k tou=d' oi)/kou . . ai)ki/a S.El.514 (lyr.); ou)/pot' e)/ris lei/yei kata\ po/leis E.Hel.1157 (lyr.); to\ kakotuxe\s ou) le/loipen e)k te/knwn Id.HF 133 (lyr.); lei/pousin ai( e)k th=s kefalh=s [tri/xes] Arist.HA518a24; e)/ti e(/n soi lei/pei Ev.Luc.18.22; ti/ lei/pei tw=n e)pithdei/wn au)tai=s; Plb.10.18.8; ti/ ga/r soi lei/pei; Arr.Epict.2.22.5, cf. Diog.Oen.64; [ei)s th\n prokeime/nhn pragmatei/an] to\ u(f' ou(= gi/netai . . mh\ r(hqe\n ou) lei/pei
is not
needed, Marcellin.Puls.69: c. inf., lei/pei me\n ou)d' a(\ pro/sqen h)/demen to\ mh\ ou) baru/ston' ei)=nai
nihil absunt quin . . , S.OT1232: so c. gen., braxu\ lei/pei tou= mh\ suna/ptein Plb.2.14.6, etc.; pro/tasis th=s proeirhme/nhs lei/pousa u(poqe/sei a proposition
containing less in the hypothesis than that aforesaid, Papp.648.1: freq. with numerals, kefa/laion gi/gnetai mikrou= lei/pontos pe/nte kai\ de/ka ta/lanta Lys.19.43; ou) polu\ lei=pon tw=n e)nenh/konta e)tw=n Plb.12.16.13; trih/reis pe/nte lei/pousai tw=n e(kato\n ei)/kosi D.S.13.14: generally, panto\s me\n ou)=n lei/pei Pl.Lg.728a; o( lipw/n ib.759e; to\ lei=pon
what is lacking, Plb.4.38.9, etc.; esp. Gramm.,
to be incomplete, of a phrase, leipou/shs th=s fra/sews A.D.Adv.159.28, al.;
to be wanting, omitted, lei/pontos tou= kai/ Id.Conj.225.24: also c. dat., lei/pei h( "kei=nos" fwnh\ tw=| e_ Id.Adv.147.17. of the moon,
to be invisible (cf. leiyifah/s), Plot.2.3.5. lei/ponta ei)/dh, in Algebra, = lei/yeis,
negative terms, Dioph.1Def.10. Pass.,
to be left, left behind, a)/loxos *fula/kh| e)le/leipto Il.2.700; oi( d' oi)=oi lei/pontai Od.22.250, etc.; also o)pi/ssw, meto/pisqe, kato/pisqe l., Il.3.160, 22.334, Od.21.116; pai=des . . meto/pisqe leleimme/noi
left behind in Troy, Il.24.687; mo/na . . nw\ leleimme/na S.Ant.58, etc.; to\ leipo/menon bi/ou (v.l. biota=s) Ariphron 1 (= IG3.171). Math.,
to be subtracted: to\ a)po\ th=s *d*f leifqe\n u(po\ tou= a)po\ th=s *d*a poiei= . . , the square on *d*f
subtracted from the square on *d*a gives . . , Ptol.Alm. 10.7.
remain, remain over and above, trita/th d' e)/ti moi=ra le/leiptai Il.10.253; e)moi\ de\ lelei/yetai a)/lgea lugra/ 24.742; o)li/gwn sfi h(mere/wn lei/petai siti/a Hdt.9.45; o(\ pa=si l. brotoi=s . . e)lpi/s E.Tr.681; au)to/nomoi e)lei/fqhmen Th.3.11; e(/ws a)/n ti lei/phtai Id.8.81: impers., lei/petai
it remains, Pl.Tht.157e: c.acc. et inf., peplhrw=sqai/ me Id.Phdr.235c.
remain alive, polloi\ de\ li/ponto Od.4.495, cf. A. Pers.480, X.An.3.1.2. c. gen.,
to be left without, to be forsaken of, ktea/nwn leifqei\s kai\ fi/lwn Pi.I.2.11; sou= leleimme/nh S. Ant.548; but strato\n leleimme/non doro/s
which has been left by the spear, i.e. not slain, A.Ag.517.
to be left behind in a race, Il. 23.407, 409, Od.8.125; leleimme/nos oi)w=n
lingering behind the sheep, 9.448; lei/pet' . . *menela/ou douro\s e)rwh/n he
was left a spear's throw
behind Menelaus, Il.23.529; e)s di/skoura le/leipto he
had been left behind as much as a quoit's throw, ib.523; ki/rkoi peleiw=n ou) makra\n leleimme/noi A.Pr.857, cf. E.Hipp.1244; tou= kh/rukos mh\ lei/pesqai not
to lag behind the herald, Th.1.131; but a)po/ tinos
to be left behind by one, Il.9.437, 445; l. basile/os or a)po\ basile/os
by the king, Hdt.8.113, 9.66; lei/pesqai tou= kairou=
to be behind time, X.Cyr.6.3.29; th=s naumaxi/hs Id.7.168; th=s e)co/dou Id.9.19; but, lei/pou mhde\ su/, parqe/n', a)p' oi)/kwn
fail not [to come] from the house, i.e. follow us, dub. in S. Tr.1275 (anap.): abs.,
to be left behind, be absent, Hdt.7.229, 8.44.
come short of, be inferior to, tinos, like e)lattou=sqai, h(tta=sqai, u(sterei=sqai/ tinos, because the Verb has a comp. sense, Id.7.48, etc.; ou)k e)/sq' o(poi/as lei/petai to/d' h(donh=s
falls short of . . , E.Fr.138.3; lei/pesqai/ tinos e)/s ti or e)/n tini, Hdt.1.99, 7.8. a/ (v. infr. 4); peri/ ti Plb.6.52.8; pro/s ti S.Tr.266; kamh/lous taxuth=ti ou) leipome/nas i(/ppwn Hdt.7.86; cu/nesin ou)deno\s l. Th.6.72; plh/qei l. X.HG7.4.24; plh/qei h(mw=n leifqe/ntes Id.An.7.7.31; ou)d' e)/ti qhro\s e)lei/peto derkome/noisin, i.e. resembled . . , Epic.in Arch.Pap.7p.4: also c. gen. rei, leifqh=nai ma/xhs E.Heracl.732; ou)de\n sou= ci/fous lelei/yomai Id.Or.1041: Math., to\ e)ggrafe\n tou= perigrafe/ntos e)la/ssoni lei/petai the inscribed figure
falls short of the circumscribed by less than . . , Archim.Con.Sph.21: also c. dat. rei, leifqh=nai ma/xh| A.Pers.344: c. part., ou)de\n e)mou= lei/pei gignw/skwn X.Oec.18.5; le/leiyai tw=n e)mw=n bouleuma/twn
you come short of, understand not my plans, E.Or.1085; le/leimmai tw=n e)n *(/ellhsin no/mwn Id.Hel.1246: abs.,
to be defeated, Plb.1.62.6; u(po/ tinos AP11.224 (Antip.); lei/pesqai e)n [th=| a)goranomi/a|], Lat.
repulsam ferre, Plu. Mar.5, etc.: abs., in part., a)/ndras leleimme/nous
inferior men, A.Fr. 37; also, leipo/menoi
the poor, IG14.1839.7.
to be wanting or
lacking in a thing,
fail of or
in, c. gen., o)durma/twn e)lei/pet' ou)de/n S.Tr. 937; gnw/mas leipome/na sofa=s Id.El.474 (lyr.); leleimme/nh te/knwn E. Ion680; lel. lo/gou
failing to heed my word, S.Aj.543; mh=nas e(\c . . leipo/menos (sc. tw=n ei)/kosi e)tw=n) Epigr.Gr.519 (Thessalonica); also, l. e)n tw=| mh\ du/nasqai mhd' o(ra=n S.OC495; v. supr.3.
to be in need of, th=s sh=s bohqei/as A.D.Synt.289.28. (I.-E.
leiq[uglide]-, cf. Lat.
li-n-quo, Skt.
ric-, pres. 3sg.
ri-ṇa-k-ti 'leaves', etc.)

leipw/di_n, i_nos, h(,
past bearing children, Suid.

lei/r-i^nos, h, on,
made of lilies, xri=sma Dsc.3.102; e)/laion Gal.19.119.
like a lily, a)/nqos prob. in Thphr.HP3.18.11.

leir-io/eis, essa, en, prop.
like a lily, but in Hom. only metaph., xro/a leirio/enta
lily skin, Il.13.830; of the cicadae, o)/pa leirio/essan their
delicate voice, 3.152; of the Muses' voice, Hes.Th.41; *(esperi/des Q.S.2.418.
of the lily, ka/rh Nic.Al.406.

lei/r-ion, to/,
Madonna lily, Lilium candidum, prob.in Thphr.HP9.16.6; = kri/non, Dsc.3.102, cf. h.Cer.427, Hp.Mul.2.179, A.R.1.879.
polyanthus narcissus, Narcissus Tazetta, Thphr.HP6.8.1, 7.13.4, Dsc.4.158.
autumn narcissus, Narcissus serotinus, Thphr.HP6.6.9;
narcissus in general, ib.1.13.2.

leir-iopolfa^nemw/nh, h(,
omelet made with lilies, etc., Pherecr.130.8.
lei/r-ios, on, = leirio/eis, a)/nqemon Pi.N.7.79. of the voice, A.R.4.903, Orph.A.253. of the eyes of youth, o)/mmata B.16.95.

leir-iw/dhs, es,
like a lily, eu)wdi/a Thphr.HP3.13. leir-o/s, a/, o/n, = leirio/eis, of the voice, te/ttic glukeroi=s xei/lesi leira\ xe/wn IG14.1934f6.
lhri/as le/gousi ku/nas, ta\s katisxnwme/nas kai\ a)pobalou/sas tri/xas. h)\ to\n mikro\n lagw/n, Hsch. lei+sto/s, h/, o/n, v. lhi+sto/s.

lei/strion, to/, = li/strion,
tool for smoothing stone, IG7.3073.119, al. (Lebadea).
lei/teirai: i(e/reiai, Hsch. (Cf. lh/|teira). leiti=nos: pe/mmatos ei)=dos, Id. leitnei/a, dub. sens. in POxy.1740.12 (iii/iv A.D.). leito/n: bla/sfhmon, Hsch.
leitoreu/w (lei/twr), = i(ereu/w, IG9(2).397.1, 1228.3, al. (Thess.), Arch.Pap.9.215 (Egypt?).

leitourg-e/w, earlier Att. lhtourge/w IG22.1147.6 (iv B.C.), etc. (leit- 22.665.11 (282 B.C.)): pf. leleitou/rghka Lys.18.7, Is.6.60, Isoc.15.145: at Athens,
serve public offices at one's own cost, And.1.132, al., D.27.64: c. acc. cogn., l. ta\ prostatto/mena Is.6.61; du/o leitourgi/as D.50.9, cf. Lys.3.47; l. u(pe/r tinos
serve these
offices for another, Is.3.80, 6.64; ta\ leleitourghme/na
public services performed, D.21.169. generally,
perform public duties, serve the state, th=| po/lei X.Mem.2.7.6; e)k th=s i)di/as ou)si/as u(mi=n l. Isoc.8.13; to\ tai=s ou)si/ais leitourgou=n, o(\ kalou=men eu)po/rous Arist.Pol.1291a34; toi=s sw/masin kai\ toi=s xrh/masin l. Id.Ath.29.5; l. toi=s sw/masin D.21.165; to\ peri\ ta\s a)rxa\s l. Arist.Pol.1291a35; l. th=| po/lei tau/thn th\n leitourgi/an ib.37, cf. Plb.6.33.6; l. pro\s teknopoii/+an Arist.Pol.1335b28; a)/rxein kai\ l. POxy.1119.16 (iii A.D.). generally,
serve a master, c. dat., oi( e(ni\ leitourgou=ntes ta\ toiau=ta dou=loi [ei)si] Arist.Pol. 1278a12, cf. PSI4.361.15 (iii B.C.), Nic.Dam.4 J.; l. trisi\n a)ndra/sin, of a prostitute, AP5.48 (Gallus).
perform religious service, minister, e)pi\ tw=n i(erw=n D.H.2.22; tw=| *kuri/w| Act.Ap.13.2, etc. (Written lit- in Rev.Et.Anc.32.5 (Athens, i B.C.), etc., cf. leitou/rgion, leitourgo/s.）

leitou/rg-hma, atos, to/,
performance of a public service, D.H.6.40, Plu. Ages.36, POxy.1412.14 (iii A.D.), Jul.Or.1.21d.
performance of religious ritual, LXX Nu.4.32.

leitourg-hsi/a, h(, = foreg. 1, prob. l. in Philostr.VS2.26.1;
tenure of municipal office, POxy.1413.17 (iii A.D.).

leitourg-h/simos, on,
for service, skeu/h LXX 1 Ch.28.13.

leitourg-i/a, h(, earlier Att. lht- IG22.1140.14 (386 B.C.):—at Athens, and elsewhere (e.g. Siphnos, Isoc.19.36; Mitylene, Antipho 5.77),
public service performed by private citizens at their own expense, And.4.42, Lys.21.19, etc.; l. e)gku/klioi ordinary, i.e. annual,
liturgies, D.20.21; leitourgi/ai metoi/kwn, opp. politikai), ib.18.
any public service or
work, PHib. 1.78.4 (iii B.C.), etc.; o( e)pi\ tw=n leitourgiw=n tetagme/nos, in an army,
the officer who superintended the workmen, carpenters, etc., Plb.3.93.4; oi( e)pi/ tina l. a)pestalme/noi Id.10.16.5: generally, military
duty, UPZ15.25 (pl., ii B.C.). generally,
any service or
function, h( prw/th fanera\ toi=s zw/|ois l. dia\ tou= sto/matos ou)=sa Arist.PA650a9, cf. 674b9, 20, IA 711b30; filikh\n tau/thn l. Luc.Salt.6.
service, ministration, help, 2 Ep.Cor.9.12, Ep.Phil.2.30.
public service of the gods, ai( pro\s tou\s qeou\s l. Arist.Pol.1330a13; ai( tw=n qew=n qerapei=ai kai\ l. D.S.1.21, cf. UPZ17.17 (ii B.C.), PTeb.302.30 (i A.D.), etc.;
the service or
ministry of priests, LXX Nu.8.25, Ev.Luc.1.23.

leitourg-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for leitourgi/a, LXX Ex.31.10, al.; h(me/rai (in temples) PTeb.88.6 (ii B.C.);
ministering, pneu/mata Ep.Hebr.1.14: Subst. -ko/n (sc. te/los), to/, prob. a tax paid in lieu of labour performed, PPetr.2p.129 (iii B.C.), PTeb.5.49 (ii B.C.), al.:—in form leitourgiako/s Cat.Cod.Astr.7.209.19.

leitou/rg-ion, to/,
subsidiary action springing out of a trial, Plin.Ep.2.11,12 (lit- codd., cf. leitourge/w ad fin.).

leitourg-o/s, o(, (lh/i+tos, e)/rgon)
one who performed a leitourgi/a (q.v.), POxy.82.3 (iii A.D.), etc.; l. tw=n
e)n paisi\ leitourgiw=n CIG2881.13, cf. 2882, 2886 (Branchidae).
public servant, h( sta/sis tw=n l. [tou= *salomw=nos] LXX 3 Ki.10.5; of
workmen, carpenters, etc., oi)kodo/moi kai\ l. PPetr.3p.139 (iii B.C.), cf. Plb.3.93.5; at Magnesia, an official of the gerousi/a, Inscr.Magn.116.17; = Lat.
lictor, Plu.Rom.26: metaph., l. th=s xrei/as mou
ministering to my need, Ep.Phil.2.25.
private servant, LXX 2 Ki.13.18. in religioussense,
minister, [qeou=] ib.Ps.102(103).21, Ep.Rom.13.6, al.; tw=n qew=n D.H.2.22, cf. 73; tw=n a(gi/wn l. Ep.Hebr.8.2; qeoi=s litourgoi/ (sic) Rev.Et.Anc.32.5 (Athens, i B.C.);
attendant at sacrifices,
acolyte, IG3.1005, al. Astrol., leitourgoi/, oi(, astral gods
subordinate to the dekanoi/, Iamb.Myst.9.2, Firm.2.4.4, Mart.Cap.2.200.

lei/twr, oros, o(,
priest, a)rwgo\s l. Ath.Mitt.12.283 (Athens); lei/tores: i(e/reiai (fort. i(erei=s), Hsch.; cf. lei/teirai, leitoreu/w, o(molei/twr, lh|th=res, lh/twr.
leifaime/w, lei/faimos, v. lif-; cf. leipandri/a. lei/fhtra: lei/yana, Hsch.

leixh/n, h=nos, o(,
tree-moss, lichen, implied in Thphr. (cf. leixhnia/w). a kind of
liver-wort, that grows on damp rocks, Dsc.4.53; but i(/ppeios l., = i(ppoleixh/n, Nic.Th.945. a
lichen-like eruption on the skin of animals, esp. on the chin,
mentagra, A.Ch.281 (pl.), Hp.Aph.3.20 (pl.), Thphr.Sud.14 (pl.), LXX Le.21.20, Gal.14.75, Aët.8.16; also, of the ground,
blight, canker, A.Eu.785 (lyr.). in horses, the normal
callosity on foreleg, chestnut, Dsc.2.43 (pl.), Cael.Aur.TP1.138 (pl.).—In codd. freq. written lixh/n.
leixh/n-h, h(, = murta/kanqon, Dsc.4.144.

leixhn-ia/w,
have the leixh/n 1, of olives, Thphr.CP5.9.10.

leixhn-iko/s, h/, o/n,
for eruptions, troxi/skos Gal.12.832: -kh/ (sc. e)/mplastros) ib.835; -ko/n (sc. fa/rmakon) Orib. Fr.78, Aët.8.16, etc.

leixhn-w/dhs, es,
like the leixh/n, Hp.Epid.4.20, Gal.6.750, al.

leixh/nwr, oros, o(,
Lick-man, name of a mouse, Batr.202:—so also leixomu/lh [u^], h(,
Lick-meal, name of a mouse, ib.29; leixopi/nac [i^], a^kos, o(,
Lick-platter, ib.100, 230.

lei/xw, fut. lei/cw LXX Mi.7.17: aor. e)/leica A. (v. infr.), Ar. (v. infr.):—Pass., aor. part. e)k-leixqe/n Dsc.3.36:—
lick up, Hdt.4.23, A.Eu.106, Ag.828; l. dhmio/prata Ar.Eq.103; simply,
lick, a(/la Arist. HA580b31; bou=s o(plh\n l. Thphr.Sign.15. (Cf. Skt.
lih- 'lick', etc.)
leiyandri/a, h(, （lei=yis） = lipandri/a, Hsch., v.l. in J.BJ3.3.2, for leipandri/a or lipandri/a:—hence in later Gr., Adj. lei/yandros, Sch. E.Or.249; Verb leiyandre/w, Tz.H.1.779.

leiya^nhlo/gos, on,
gathering remnants, AP6.92 (Phil.).

lei/ya^non, to/, (lei/pw)
piece left, remnant, *)argou=s E.Med.1387: metaph., of a man, l. fi/lwn, *frugw=n, Id.El.554, Tr.716; to\ nu=n au)th=s [th=s gh=s] l. Pl.Criti.110e, cf. 111a; da/krua . . storga=s lei/yanon AP7.476 (Mel.); meidia/matos l.
traces of a smile, Chor.in Rev.Phil.1.230. freq. in pl.,
remains of the dead, lei/yan' e)kba/llein kusi/n E.Fr.469; lei/yana qano/ntos S.El.1113; ta\ l. tou= sw/matos Pl.Phd. 86c; bwmo\s l. fwto\s e)/xei CIG (add.) 4079b (Ancyra), al.; but l. tw=n a)gaqw=n a)ndrw=n
their deeds, good name, etc., E.Andr.774 (lyr.);
remnants of youth, Ar.V.1066 (lyr.); l. tw=n *)iliakw=n paqhma/twn
sequels to . . , Longin.9.12.

leiyeda^fi/a, h(, (e)/dafos)
loss of soil (by washing away), POxy.1911.98, 1912.129 (vi A.D.).

lei=yis, ews, h(,
omission, tou= a)/rqrou A.D.Synt.78.9.
failure, lack, a)gaqw=n Cat.Cod.Astr.8(1).182. Math.,
negative term in an algebraic expression, opp. u(/parcis, l. e)pi\ lei=yin pollaplasiasqei=sa poiei= u(/parcin
a minus multiplied by
a minus gives a plus, Dioph.1 Def.9: dat. lei/yei c. gen.,
minus, Id.2.21.

leiyi^-fa^h/s, e/s,
waning, selh/nh Max.455, cf. Heph.Astr.2.34.

leiyi^-fwte/w,
wane, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(2).108.18.

leiyi^/-fwtos, on,
waning, Paul.Al.M.4, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(2).107.13, al.:—also leiyi^/-fws, Vett.Val. 191.6, Eust.811.63; but h(/rwes . . liyo/fwtes (sic)
who have quitted the light of day, PMag.Par.1.1409.

leiyo/-qric, tri^xos, o(, h(, to/,
having lost their hair, me/rh Ael.NA14.4.

leiyo-se/lhnon, to/,
the moon's first or
last quarter, when it is hidden, Paraphr.Poet.
de herb.7.

leiyudri/a, h(,
want of water, Thphr.CP5.12.1, Plb.34.9.6, Str.16.1.10, D.S.1.52, Sammelb.4416.14 (ii A.D.): *leiyu/drion, to/,
a waterless district near Mt. Parnes in Attica, Scol.14, Hdt.5.62, Ar.Lys. 665.
lei/w, v. lw=.

leiw/-dhs, es, = lei=os,
smooth, even, Suid.
leiw-ko/rhs: o( telei/ws e)kkekaume/nous tou\s o)fqalmou\s e)/xwn, Hsch. (leiok- cod.).
leiw/lhs, es, = panw/lhs, IG12(1).737 (Camirus, vi B.C.); cf. lew/lhs: telei/ws e)cw/lhs, Hsch.

lei/wma, atos, to/, (leio/w)
pigment-powder, ta\ a)/krata l., ta\ u(dare/stera l., Thphr.Lap.55.
lei/wn, v. le/wn. lei/ws, Adv. of lei=os (q.v.). v. le/ws.

lei/-wsis, ews, h(, (leio/w)
trituration, siti/wn Gal.UP11.8, cf. 9, Erasistr. ap.eund.19.372; f.l. in Plu.2.129d.
levigation of a powder, Zos.Alch.p.177 B., al.

lei-wte/on,
one must make smooth, drepa/nw| tomh/n Gp.9.5.6.
le/kaios: o( a)potetalme/nos, Hsch. (post lekani/skh). lekale/os, f.l. for laikale/os in Luc.Lex.12.
leka/n-ion, to/, Ar.Ach.1110, Polyzel.4, Orib. Fr.88, v.l. in X.Cyr.1.3.4:
lekan-i/s, i/dos, h(, Ar.Fr.805, Plu.2.828a, Luc. Am.39:

lekan-i/skh, h(, Ar.Fr.805, Telecl.1.11. (Perh. fr. Bab.
lahannu.）

leka^no/-mantis, ews, o(,
dish-diviner, Str.16.2.39, Ptol.Tetr.181, Artem.2.69:—hence leka^no-mantei/a, h(, PMag.Par.1.221, Ps.-Callisth.1.1.

leka^no/-pwlis, idos, h(,
for the sale of dishes, stwi/+a IG12(2).14.12 (Mytil., dub.).

le/ka^nos, o(, or leka^/no-on, to/,
wine-bowl, leka/nou yukth/r IG22.1425.348; fort. lekanoyukth/r.

leka^noskopi/a, Ep. leka^no-i/h, h(,
the inspecting of a dish, in order to divine, Man.4.213.

leka/rion, to/, Dim. of le/kos,
little dish, X.Cyr.1.3.4 (v.l. -a/nia, pl.), Herm.Hist.2, Gal.18(1).240, Poll.10.86.

leki/q-ion [i^q], to/,
bean-meal, PHolm.19.41.

lekiq-i/ths [i_t] a)/rtos, o(, bread
made of pulse, Seleuc. ap. Ath.3.114b, cf. Carm.Pop.41.11.
leki^qo-eidh/s, e/s, = lekiqw/dhs, Hp.Morb.2.47.

leki^qo-pw/lhs, ou, o(, Suid.:—fem. leki^qo/-pwlis, idos,
peasepudding-seller, Ar.Pl.427, Luc.Lex.3.

le/ki^qos (A), o(,
gruel of pulse or cereals, ptisa/nhs Hp.Mul.1.109; fakw=n ib.52, cf. 2.192, Ar.Lys.562, Pherecr.22, Alex.258, etc.; defined in Gal.6.782. = fakw=n to\ e)/ndon tou= le/pous, Id.19.117.

le/ki^qos (B), h(,
yolk of an egg, Hp.Mul.2.205, freq. in Arist., as HA562a29, al.; smh=xe a)po\ l. Nic.Dam.4 J.

leki^qw/dhs, es, (le/kiqos B)
yolk-coloured, Hp.Epid.4.14, Thphr.HP 4.8.11, Aret.SD1.15, etc.
leki/s, leki/skion, leki/skos, v. le/kos.
le/kkh: xlai=na, Hsch. (cf. dekth/, lo/kkh):—also lakth/ (post lektoi/).

le/kos, eos, to/,
dish, pot, pan, Demioprat. ap. Poll.10.87, Hippon. 58, Phoen.2.2:—Dim. forms lek-i/s, i/dos, h(, Epich.126, Iamb.VP 26.119 (pl.); = paroyi/s, Hsch.; leki^qo-i/skos, o(, Hp. ap. Poll. l.c.:—hence leki^qo-i/skion, to/, a small measure or weight, Hp.
Acut. (Sp.）63, 69; cf. leka/nh.
le/krana, ta/, = a)gkw=nes, Hsch., Phot.; cf. o)le/kranon. le/krika: seirai/, sxoini/a, Hsch.; cf. lei/krika. lekroi/, = likroi/ (q.v.).

lek-te/os, a, on, (le/gw B)
to be said or
spoken, Pl.R.378b. lekte/on,
one must say or
speak, peri/ tinos X.Lac.2.12; [lo/gous] Pl. R.392a; o(/ti . . Arist.EN1145a15.

le/k-ths, ou, o(,
speaker, Gloss.

lekti/kion, to/, Dim. of Lat.
lectīca, litter, Alex. Trall.10.

lektiko/s, h/, o/n,
good at speaking, able to speak, X.Mem.4.3.1, Cyr. 5.5.46 (Sup.); h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh)
the art of speaking, Pl.Plt.304d.
suited for speaking, oi( l. tw=n lo/gwn speeches
in common colloquial style, opp. poihtikw=s sugkei/menoi, D.61.2; ma/lista l. tw=n me/trwn to\ i)ambei=o/n e)sti Arist.Po.1449a24, cf. Rh.1408b33. Adv. -kw=s
in prose, D.H.Comp.25.
related to expression, stylistic, o( l. to/pos the province
of expression, ib.1, 4; opp. pragmatiko/s,
of style, opp. matter, a)retai/ Id.Pomp.1; me/ros Id.Th.34. Adv. -kw=s
with the force of a word, of the termination -qen, A.D.Adv.195.16;
verbally, Stoic.3.214.

lekti/s, i/dos, h(,
litter, Sm.Is.66.20.
le/kto, v. le/gw (B), le/xomai.

lekto/s, h/, o/n, (le/gw B)
gathered, chosen, picked out, of stones, l. e/k gai/hs la/ous Hes.Fr.115.3; sto/los A.Pers.795; h)|qe/wn lektoi/ S.OT 19, etc.
capable of being spoken, to be spoken, e)/st' e)kei/nw| pa/nta lekta/ Id.Ph.633; kako\n ou) tlhto\n ou)de\ lekto/n E.Hipp.875; ou)/te l. ou)/te pisto/n Ar.Av.423 (lyr.): lekto/n, to/,
an expression (opp. mere fwnh/), A.D.Adv.136.32;
a word (with a meaning), Id.Pron.59.1, al.; ta\ l.
predications, Cleanth.Stoic.1.109; but later,
expressions, phrases (including statements, questions, commands, wishes, etc.), Stoic.2.58, 61, al.; coupled with prota/seis and a)ciw/mata, Plot.5.5.1.
lektri/th| qro/nw|: a)na/klisin e)/xonti, Hsch.

le/ktron, to/, (le/xomai)
couch, bed, Hom. (esp. in Od.); le/ktronde
to bed, Od.8.292: also in pl., Il.22.503, Od.20.58, etc.; Arc. for kli/nh acc. to AB1095. later, mostly in pl.,
marriage-bed, Pi. N.8.6 (sg.); parqe/nois gamhli/wn l. a)pei/rois A.Fr.242; le/ktrwn eu)nai/ Id.Pers.543 (anap.); le/ktrwn koi=tai E.Alc.925 (anap.); koi/tas le/ktron Id.Med.436 (lyr.); but to\ duspa/reunon l. S.Tr.791: hence gh=mai le/ktra tino/s wed one, E.Med.594; le/ktra prodou=nai, ai)sxu=nai, etc., Id.Or.939, Hipp.944, etc.; a)llo/tria, no/qa, dou=la le/ktra, of illicit connexions, Id.HF345, Andr.928, Ion819; cf. le/xos.
the fruit of marriage, a child, Agathyll. ap. D.H.1.49 (pl.).

lektroxa^rh/s, e/s,
enjoying the marriage-bed, Orph.H.55.9.
lekxw/, v. lexw/.

lela^be/sqai, v. lamba/nw. lela/qh|, lela/qonto, lelaqe/sqai, v. lanqa/nw. le/la_ka, lela/konto, lela^kui=a, v. la/skw. le/lammai, v. lamba/nw, le/pw. le/lasmai, v. lanqa/nw. lela/xhte, lela/xwsi, v. lagxa/nw. lele/gia: ko/xlakes, h)\ koxlw/deis to/poi, Hsch. lelepri/s: i)xqu=s poio/s, h( kaloume/nh fuki/s, Id.
le/lhka, v. la/skw. le/lhsmai, v. lanqa/nw. le/lh|smai, v. lhi/+zomai.

leli/hmai, old Ep. pf.,
strive eagerly, Il., but only in part. leli^hme/nos, l. o)/fra ta/xista w)/sait' *)argei/ous 5.690, cf. 4.465: as Adj.,
eager, ba/n r(' i)qu\s *danaw=n lelihme/noi 12.106, cf. 16.552: in later Ep. c. gen.,
eager for a thing, lelihme/noi h)pei/roio A.R.1.1164: also 3sg. plpf. with inf., au)dh=sai leli/hto Id.3.1158, cf. 646, 4.1009: 2sg. pf., leli/hsai a)kou/ein Theoc.25.196, cf. Orph.Fr.280.4: 3pl. plpf. leli/hnto prob. cj. in Id.L.118. in phys. sense, ai)qh\r e)kto\s e)/sw lelihme/nos
rushing, Emp.100.18.

lelikko/s, o(, a kind of
fish, Hsch. lelimme/nos, v. li/ptomai. lelixmo/tes, v. lixma/w.

lelogisme/nws, Adv., (logi/zomai)
according to calculation, l. o(/kws . .
Hdt.3.104; l. pra/ssoimi ma=llon h)\ sqe/nei E.IA1021; o)rqw=s kai\ l. Plu. Galb.5.
leloxui=a, v. le/xomai.

lembarx-e/w,
command a le/mbos, perh. metaph. in religious sense, IGRom.1.817 (Callipolis).
lemba/rx-oi: lipo/dermoi. （kai\ oi( e)folki/ois ple/ontes), Hsch. (cf. le/panos).
lemb-eutiko/s lo/gos, title of work by Heraclides 'Lembos', D.L.5.94.

le/mb-os, o(, a ship's
cock-boat, D.32.6: metaph., of a
parasite, o)/pisqen a)kolouqei= ko/lac tw|; le/mbos e)pike/klhtai Anaxandr.34.7.
fishingboat, Theoc.21.12.
fast-sailing galley, felucca, used either to precede a fleet, Plb.1.53.9; or as a light transport, Id.2.3.1, cf. 5.109.3, SIG569.19 (Halasarna, iii B.C.), PPetr.2p.64 (iii B.C.).

lemb-w/dhs, es,
like a le/mbos 11.2, ploi=on Arist.IA710a31.
lemei=sa, v. le/musos.

le/mma, atos, to/, (le/pw)
that which is peeled off, rind, husk, Hp.Mul. 2.117, Ar.Av.674, Alex.266.3; th=s . . sarkoeidou=s fu/sews l. Pl.Ti. 76a. i)xqu/wn le/mmata
scales, Poll.6.51. metaph.,
a mere husk, of one who has been swindled, Anaxil.33.5.

le/mna, h(, a water-plant,
star-grass, Callitriche verna, Thphr.HP 4.10.1.
le/musos or lemu/shs, ou, o(, Egyptian name of a kind of priest, Sammelb.1007 (i A.D.); cf. lemei=sa, PTeb.122.1 (i B.C.).

le/mf-os, o( (Hsch., pl.) or to/ (Tz.H.6.331), = ko/ruza, mu/ca, Lib. Decl.33.29, cf. Moer.p.251 P., Hsch. l., oi(,
putrescent carcasses, Phot., Eust.1761.18. Adj.
snotty, drivelling, Men.493, Epit. 344.

lemf-w/dhs, es,
drivelling, Sch.Luc.Lex.18.
lenti/kion, to/, = sq., prob. in POxy.1741.10 (iv A.D.).

le/ntion, to)/, = Lat.
linteum, cloth, napkin, towel, Peripl.M.Rubr.6 (pl.), Vit.Aesop.Oxy.2083.48, Ev.Jo.13.4, Inscr.Magn.116.34, BSA 27.228 (Sparta, ii A.D.):—hence lenti-a/rios, o(, prob.
attendant at the bath, IG3.1160.72, 14.2323:

lemf-u^fanth/s, ou=, o(,
towel-weaver, Supp. Epigr.4.541 (Ephesus).
le/ceo, Ep. imper. aor. Med. of le/xomai (q. v.).
lec-i/dion [di_], to/, Dim. of le/cis, Arr.Epict.2.1.30, Gal.13.575, etc.:— in Mss. freq. lecei/dion, which is called Attic by Choerob. in EM560.11, cf. Did.ib.230.10; but cf. o)fi/dion.
lec-i/drion, to/, = foreg., Sch. D.T.p.227 H. (v.l. -u/drion).

leci^qhre/w,
hunt after words, Plu. ap. Gell.2.9.

leci^kogra/fos [a^], o(,
lexicographer, EM 221.33.

leciko^s, h/, o/n,
of or
for words, leciko/n (sc. bibli/on), = le/ceis (v. le/cis 11.3), AB1094, Phot. tit.

le/cis, ews, h(, (le/gw B)
speech, opp. w)|dh/, Pl.Lg.816d; l. h)\ pra=cis
speech or action, Id.R.396c; o( tro/pos th=s l. ib.400d; ta\ le/cei dhlou/mena orders given
by word of mouth, Arr.Tact.27.2.
diction, style, h( e)nqa/de l. the
style used here (in courts of justice), Pl.Ap.17d; *mou/shs l. poetical
diction, Id.Lg.795e, cf. Arist.Rh.1410b28, Po. 1450b13, etc.; peri\ *le/cews, title of work by Ephorus, Theon Prog. 2.
a single word or
phrase, Arist.Rh.1406b1, Epicur.Nat.28p.4V., al. (pl.), D.T. 633.31, Plb.2.22.1, etc.; even a meaningless
word, such as bli/turi, Diog.Stoic.3.213; tai=s l. ke/xrhtai tai=s au)tai=s Plb.6.46.10; au)tai=s le/cesi or kata\ le/cin
word for word, D.H.Pomp.2, Plu.2.869d, Ath.11.493d, D.L.2.113; later e)pi\ le/cews PLond.5.1713.14 (vi A.D.), Vit.Arist.p.438 Rose, etc.; collectively, kratw= kai\ th=s l.
the very words, Ath.7.275b, cf. Epicur.Nat.28p.15V., Gal.12.403. kata\ le/cin
as the phrase goes, AP11.140 (Lucill.); para\ le/cin
incorrectly, Cic.Att.16.4.1. Gramm.,
a word peculiar in form or
signification: hence le/ceis is the older term for
a glossary, *(rodiakai\ le/ceis
a glossary of Rhodian
phrases, Ath.11.485e; cf. glw=ssa 11.2.
text of an author, opp. exegesis, Asp.in EN122.27, Arr.Epict.3.21.7, Dam.Pr.165, 169.

*leci^fa/nhs [a^], ou, o(,
Phrase-monger, title of dialogue by Lucian.
le/co, Ep. aor. imper. Med. of le/xomai.

leont-a/gxhs, ou, o(,
lion-strangling, voc. leonta/gx' w)=na (i.e. w)= a)/na) prob. in Call.Epigr.36.
leont-a/rion, to/, Dim. of le/wn, CIG4558 (Palestine), BGU781 iii 8 (i A.D.), Gal.12.773. as fem. pr. n., Epicur. ap. D.L.10.5.

leont-e/h (fem. of leo/nteos), contr. leont-h= (sc. dora/), h(,
lion's skin, Hdt.7.69, Ar.Ra.46, al., Pl.Cra.411a, Anaxandr.65: poet. leionth=, APl.4.185:—also leontei/a, Anon. ap. Suid.

leont-ei/a, h(,
ferocity, f.l. in Ps.-Polem.Phgn.1.17 (p.326 F.).

leo/nt-eios, a, on, also late os, on, v. infr. 3,
of a lion, th=s l. <dora=s> A.Fr.109; de/rma Theoc. 24.136; ste/ar Gal.13.631,al.
lion-like, du/namis Epich.[301]; bi/a AP9.221 (Marc. Arg.). h( leo/nteios po/a, = o)roba/gxh, Gp.2.42.3.
leo/nt-eos, a, on, = foreg. 1, ga/la dub. in Alcm.34.5.

leont-hdo/n, Adv.
like a lion, LXX 2 Ma.11.11.

leont-iano/s, h/, o/n, Astrol.,
born under the sign Leo, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.112.

leont-i/asis, ews, h(,
the early stage of e)lefanti/asis, Ruf. ap. Orib.45.27.2, Gal.14.757.

leont-i^deu/s, e/ws, o(,
lioncub, Ar.Byz. ap. Ael.NA7.47.
leont-ikh/, h(, a plant, = kakkali/a, Dsc. 4.122 (v.l. leantikh/). a dye, PLeid.X.98.

leont-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of a lion, ta\ l., in Mithraic mysteries, Porph.Abst.4.16, Antr.15.
leo/nt-ion, to/, Dim. of le/wn, Theognost.Can.123. = leonti/asis, Aret.SD 2.13.

leont-i/s, i/dos, h(,
lion-shaped ornament on a building, Keil- Premerstein
Dritter Bericht No.117.

leonto-ba/mwn [a_], on, gen. onos, (bh=ma)
resting on a lion or
lion's feet, ska/fh A.Fr.225.

leonto/-ba^sis, ews, h(,
base in form of a lion, IG22.1425.349, 381, 1544.64 (pl.), Roussel
Cultes Egyptiens p.220, Michel832.45 (Samos).

leonto-bo/tos, on,
feeding or
keeping lions, Nonn.D.1.21. proparox. leonto/botos,
fed on by lions, xw/ra Str.16.1.24.

leonto-da/ma_s [da^], acc. -da/man, o(,
lion-taming, ku/wn Pi.Fr.74aSchroeder ( = Luc. Pr.Im.19).

leonto-de/rhs, ou, o(, (de/ros)
like a lion's skin, tawny, Orph. L.619.

leonto/-difros, on,
in a chariot drawn by lions, *(re/h AP6.94 (Phil.).

leonto-eidh/s, e/s,
lion-like, Ael.NA12.7, Gp.19.2.1.

leonto-ke/fa^los, on,
lion-headed, paraieti/des, of gargoyles, IG22.1627.303, prob. in 1666 B 19,29, cf. Luc.Herm.44:—also leonto-kefa^lh/, h(,
lion-headed gargoyle, SIG 241.107, 117 (Delph., iv B.C., in Dor. form -a/), IG42(1).102.294, 303 (Epid.).

leonto-ko/mos, on,
tending or
rearing lions, Opp.C.3.53, Philostr. Her.10.5.
leonto/-kra_non, to/, = *)amazoniko\n o(/plon, Com.Adesp.1365.

leonto/-krounon, to/,
lion's-head spout, IG7.3099 (Lebad.).

leonto-ma/xos [a^], on,
fighting with a lion, Epic.Oxy.412.40, Hdn.Gr.1.232:—also leonto-ma/xa_s, Theoc.Ep.22.2.

leonto-mi^gh/s, e/s, (mei/gnumi)
half-lion, half something else, Poll.5.38.

leonto/-morfos, on,
lion-shaped, Horap.1.21, Sammelb.5620.14, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).252.

leonto-mu/rmhc, hkos, o(,
half-lion, half-ant, Hdn.Gr.1.46.

leonto-pe/ta^lon, to/, a plant,
Leonticé Leontopetalum, Dsc. 3.96, Gal.12.57.
leonto-po/dion, to/, = foreg., Dsc.3.96; = zw|o/nuxon, Ps.- Dsc.4.133.

leonto/-pous, o(, h(, poun, to/, gen. podos,
lion-footed, E.Fr. 540; of vessels, IG11(2).161 B 10, C 55, al. (Delos, iii B.C.).

leonto-pro/swpos, on,
lion-faced, Sch.E.Ph.411, POxy.465.162 (ii A.D.), PMag.Par.1.2113.

leonto-trofi/a, h(,
rearing or
breeding of lions, Ael.NA6.8.

leontou=xos, on, (e)/xw)
holding a lion, epith. of Asclepios at Ascalon, Marin.Procl.19.

leonto-fo/nos, on,
lion-killing, ni=kai AP6.74 (Agath.); l., h(,
lionslayer, BMus.Inscr.1061 (Cyrene, ii A.D.). leontofo/non, to/, a Syrian insect
that poisons lions, Arist.Mir.845a28, cf. Ael.NA4.18.

leonto-fo/ros, on,
bearing the figure of a lion, Luc.Herm.44.

leonto-fu^h/s, e/s,
of lion nature, a)/gra E.Ba.1196 (lyr.); kuli/kion . . w)=ta e)/xon -fua= Roussel
Cultes Egyptiens p.235 (Delos, ii B.C.).
leonto/-xasma, atos, to/, = leonto/krounon, CIL10.1554 (Puteoli).

leonto/-xlainos, on,
clad in a lion's skin, APl.4.94 (Arch.).

leonto/-xortos, on,
eaten by a lion, bou/balis A.Fr.330 (-tan cod. Eust.).

leonto/-xrous, oun,
lion-coloured, Heph.Astr.1.1.

leonto/-yu_xos, on, (yuxh/)
lion-hearted, Sch.D Il.5.639.

leontw/dhs, es,
lion-like, h)/qh Arist.Pol.1338b19; pai=s l. th\n fu/sin Plu.Alex.2; to\ l. the
leonine element, Pl.R.590a, Plot.1.1.7;
lionheartedness, Plu.Fab.1. Adv. -dw=s Posidon.15 J.
*leontw/n, w=nos, o(, a month at Alexandria, Ptol.Alm.9.7.

leo/pardos, o(,
leopard, Gal.5.134, Edict.Diocl.8.39, Theognost. Can.98.
leotribe/w, = leiotribe/w (q.v.).
leourgo/s, o/n, = lewrgo/s, blamed as fortiko/n by Poll.3.134, quoting X.（Mem.1.3.9, where lewrgo/taton is now read).

lepa^deu/omai, (lepa/s)
fish for limpets, Hsch., Phot.

lepadn-isth/r, h=ros, o(,
end of the le/padnon, Poll.1.147.

le/padn-on, to/,
broad leather strap fastening the yoke (zugo/n) to the neck, and joined to the girth (masxalisth/r), mostly in pl., Il.5.730, 19.393, A. Pers.191, Ar.Eq.768, PFay.348 (ii/iii A.D.): sg., AP4.3 b 1 (Agath.): so metaph., a)na/gkas e)/du le/padnon A.Ag.218 (lyr.):—later le/pamnon acc. to Apollon.Lex. s.v. le/padna. le/padna sidhra= iron
baskets, PLond.1821.112.
lepa/zw, = pe/ssw, in pf. Pass., Stratt.77, Hsch.

lepai=os, a, on, (le/pas)
of a scaur or
cliff, o)fru/h E.Heracl.394;
rocky, rugged, xqw/n, na/pai, Id.Hipp.1248, IT324.
le/panqos: lipo/dermos (Tarent.), Hsch.

le/pargos, on, (le/pos)
with white coat or
feathers, ki/rkos A.Fr.304.5; of a sheep or goat, Theoc.4.45. as Subst., l., o(, of an ass, Nic.Th.349.

le/pas, to/,
bare rock, scaur, Simon.114.1, A.Ag.283, 298, E.Ph. 24, al.; *)akrai=on l. Th.7.78. (Only nom. and acc. sg.)

lepa/s, a/dos, h(,
limpet, Alc.51 (s.v.l.), Epich.42.2, 114, Hermipp. 31, Arist.HA528b1, al.; w(/sper lepa\s prosexo/menos tw=| ki/oni Ar.V.105, cf. Pl.1096.

le/pasma, atos, to/,
coat, skin, membrane, gloss on xitw/n, Sch.Nic. Th.184.

lepasth/ (so Hdn.Gr.1.345) or lepa/sth, h(, (lepa/s)
limpet-shaped drinking-cup, Ar.Pax916, Pherecr.95, Cratin.423 (pl.):—also lepasti/s, i/dos, h(, AJA31.349 (vase), Hsch.
le/pastron: skeu=o/s ti a(lieutiko/n, Hsch.
lepe/w or lepo/w, impf. e)le/poun: oi(=on e)le/pizon tu/ptwn kai\ mastigw=n, Hsch.

lepi/d-ion, to/, (lepi/s)
small plate, capsule, used to close a tube, Hero Spir.1.3. a Syrian plant,
pepperwort, Lepidium latifolium, used in cases of scurvy, Dsc.2.174, Gal.12.58, 13.350:—in Ath.3.119b, 9.385a. le/pidi or le/pid-din, to/.
lepid-i/skh, h(, Dim. of lepi/s, IG12(8).51.19 (Imbros, ii B.C.).

lepi^do-eidh/s, e/s,
like scales, of bones, Gal.2.713; l. proskollh/mata, of sutures, Id.UP9.18.

lepi^do/-omai, Pass.,
to be covered with scales, ta\ lelepidwme/na, = ta\ lepidwta/, S.E.P.1.50. ta\ o)ste/a lepidou=tai the bones
scale off, Hp.Fract.33.

lepi^dwto/s, h/, o/n,
scaly, de/rma, of the crocodile, Hdt.2.68; i)xqu/es Arist.HA505a24, al.; sw=ma Paul.Aeg.6.78. qw/rhc l. a cuirass
covered with scales, Hdt.9.22, cf. D.C.78.37. as Subst. l., o(, a fish of the Nile
with large scales, Hdt.2.72; = kupri=nos, Dorio ap. Ath.7.309b. (Prob.
Cyprinus bynni.) a kind of
gem, Orph.L. 287.

lep-i/zw, (le/pos)
peel off the husk, skin or
bark, mostly in Pass., Antiph. 217.10 (codd. Ath.), Thphr.HP9.2.7, Arist.Mir.830a15 (s.v.l.), Ph.Bel.88.45, Dsc.1.36; of the tongue, Aët.8.40:—Act. in LXX Ge. 30.37, al. (lepi/s)
strip an object of its covering
of metal
plates, Plb.22.4.7, 10.27.11 (Pass.).

le/p-ion, to/, Dim. of le/pos,
thin rind, scurf, Hp.Coac.458; l. tou= a)/rtou Sor.1.80.

lep-i/s, i/dos, h(, (le/pw)
epithelial debris, Hp.Aph.4.81;
layer of the skull, PMed. in Arch.Pap.4.270; w)|ou= l. egg-
shell, Sch.Ar.Pax 198;
cup of a filbert, AP6.22 (Zonas), 102 (Phil.);
coat of an onion, Sch.Luc.Hist.Conscr. 26. collectively,
scales of fish, lepi/dos sidhre/hs o)/yin i)xquoeide/os Hdt.7.61; o(\ e)n o)/rniqi ptero/n, tou=to e)n i)xqu/i+ e)sti\ l. Arist.HA486b21; opp. foli/s, ib.490b23, 517b5; also of serpents, v.l. in Nic.Th.154, cf. Emp.82. of other things, l. xalkou=
flakes that fly from copper in hammering, Dsc.5.78, 79: abs., lepi/s Hp.Mul.1.63.
plate of metal, Ph.Bel.69.50, Hero Aut.12.2, D.S.20.91, Plu.Phoc.18; collectively, l. sidhra= BGU544.8 (ii A.D.); of gold and silver, Plb.10.27.10; l. a)rgura= PMag.Par.1.258. l. pri/onos
blade of a saw, Heliod. ap. Orib.47.14.5. lepi/des (sc. xio/nos) snow-
flakes, cj. in Thphr.HP4.14.13, CP5.12.11.

le/p-isma, atos, to/,
peel, LXX Ge.30.37, Dsc.1.23, Gal.19.106.
lep-isth/s, ou=, o(, = yeusth/s, Hsch., EM 436.11.

lep-isto/s, h/, o/n,
peeled, Al.Le.23.14, Eust.1246.28.

le/poris, o(, Sicel and Aeol. for
hare, Lat.
lepus, acc. to Varro RR 3.12, LL5.20; cf. lebhri/s 11.

le/pos, eos, to/, (le/pw)
rind, husk, scale, Alex.266.7, Dsc.1.40; kua/mou Luc.Icar.19; stafi/dos Nic.Th.943; i)xqu/wn le/ph Poll.6.51, 94.

le/pr-a, Ion. le/pr-rh, h(, (lepi/s)
leprosy, which makes the skin scaly, Hdt. 1.138, Hp.Aph.3.20 (pl.), Prorrh.2.43 (pl.), Epid.5.9 (sg.), Morb.1.3 (sg.), Arist.Pr.887a34, Thphr.Char.19.2, Sud.14, LXX Le.13.2.
lepr-ai/nomai, = lepru/nomai (q.v.), Nic.Th.156.

lepr-a/s, a/dos, h(, poet. fem. of lepro/s,
rough, lepra\s pe/tra Theoc.1.40, cf. Opp.H.1.129.

lepr-a/w,
have or
catch leprosy, LXX Nu.12.10;
become scaly or
rough, l. th\n ku/stin Hp.Epid.5.17 (cf. Aph.4.77); th\n r(a/kin lele/prhke Herod. 3.50; lepra=n kera/mion o)chro/n the vinegar-jar
is mouldy, Ar.Fr. 723.
lepr-ia/w, = foreg., of the nails, Dsc.1.74, Orib.Syn.7.18.8; korw/nh lepria=| Porph.Abst.3.7; l. ta\s o)/yeis Sch.Ar.Av.149.

lepr-iko/s, h/, o/n,
good for leprosy, Dsc.2.62, 3.88, POxy.1088.14 (i A.D.).

lepr-o/omai,
become leprous, LXX 4 Ki.5.1, 27, PHolm.3.16.

lepr-o/s, a/, o/n,
scaly, scabby, rough, of places, cj. Coraës in Hp.
Aër.13, 24, etc.; so bouno\s l. Schwyzer 289.169 (Priene, ii B.C.); a)ktai\ l. Lyc.642; *l. a)kth/ as pr.n., Hippon.47.
leprous, Thphr.CP2.6.4, LXX Le.13.44: as Subst.,
leper, Ev.Marc.1.40, etc.; l. o)/nuxes, prob.
psoriasis unguium, Hp.Liqu.4, Dsc.2.114; to\ l., = le/pra, h(, LXX 4 Ki.5.11; i(ma/ntas e)k leprw=n (sc. derma/twn, for the toughest leather, acc. to Sch., was supposed to be made of
mangy skins) Ar.Ach.724 (but Sch. prefers e)k *leprw=n, pr. n. of a Tannery outside the walls); l. baubw/n Herod. 6.36.

lepr-u/nomai,
to be rough and scaly, of snakes, Nic.Th.156 (as v.l.), 262.

lepr-w/dhs, es,
rough, of the tri/glh, named from its habitat (
rough rocks), Ael.NA2.41; floio/s Dsc.1.68.
of leprous character, of a disease, Id.Eup.1.47, 120, Ruf. ap. Orib.8.24.35; of a man,
suffering from a leprous disease, Gal.12.315.

le/pr-wsis, ews, h(,
leprosy, Tz.H.10.147.
lepta/gion, to/, dub. sens. in PHib.1.47.13 (iii B.C.).
lept-a^ki^no/s, h/, o/n, poet. for sq., AP11.102 (Ammian. or Nicarch.).
lept-a/rion, to/, a surgical instrument, Hermes 38.282.

lept-epi/leptos, on,
thin-upon-thin, i.e.
as thin as thin can be, in Comp., AP11.110 (Nicarch.); cf. pappepi/pappos, faulepi/faulos.

lept-ere/binqos,
cicer, Gloss.

lept-hkh/s, e/s, (a)kh/ A)
fine-pointed, delicate, Hsch., Phot.
lept-i/zw, v. leptu/nw 1.

lept-i/on, to/,
jar (cf. lepto/s 111.3), POxy.1153.4 (i A.D.), Sammelb. 4425v7, al. (ii A.D.), BGU14 iv 18 (iii A.D.).

lept-i/tides [i_t] kriqai/, a kind of
fine barley, Gp.3.3.12.

lepto/-blastos, on,
with feeble shoots, Thphr.CP3.7.11.

lepto/-bursos, on,
thin-skinned, Sch.Ar.Eq.316.

lepto/-gastros, on,
with a small belly, Hp.Epid.4.30.

lepto/-geios, on, Thphr.CP3.6.8, HP6.5.2, etc.:—also lepto/gews, wn, Th.1.2: (gh=):—
of a thin or
poor soil: pl. lepto/gea, ta/,
barren lands, Hsch., Phot., Suid.

lepto-gnw/mwn, on, gen. onos,
subtle in mind, Luc.JTr.27.

lepto/-grammos, on,
written small or
neat, Id.Symp.17.
lepto/-gra^fos, on, = foreg., Id.Vit.Auct.23.

lepto-dermi/a, h(,
thinness of skin, Thphr.CP3.5.3.

lepto/-dermos, on,
with thin or
fine skin, Hp.Morb.2.74: Sup. -o/tatos Arist.PA657b2, GA781b21.

lepto/-domos, on, (de/mw)
slightly framed, slight, pei/smata A.Pers.112 (lyr.).

le/pto-qric, tri^xos, o(, h(,
with fine hair, e)/qeira, of the eagle, B.5.28; lepto/trixes Arist.Pr.966b33; also lepto/trixoi Id.HA518b6: neut. pl. lepto/trixa (which may come from either form), Id.GA783a2: Comp. -trixw/teros Id.HA538b8.

lepto/-qrios, on, (qri=on)
with thin, fine leaves, ko/nuza Nic.Th.875. [Prop. i_, but i^ l.c., metri gr.; cf. qri=on.]

lepto/-i+nos [i_], on, （i)/s A)
with fine fibres, Thphr.HP3.9.3.

lepto-ka/la^mos [ka^], on,
with fine stalks, ib. [8.9.2].

lepto/-karpos, on,
with small, delicate fruit, Dsc.3.24.

lepto-ka/ru^on [a^], to/,
nut with a thin shell, = *pontiko/n, Id.1.125, cf. Gp.10.3.3, Gal.6.609, 12.15:—hence lepto-u/i+nos, =
colurnus, Gloss.

lepto/-karfos, on,
with thin, light stem, Dsc.3.23.

lepto-kera^mei=on, to/, (lepto/s 111.3)
jar-factory, PFlor.50.104 (iii A.D.).

lepto-kera^meu/s, e/ws, o(,
potter, jar-maker, ib.71.343 (iv A.D.), 73.5 (vi A.D.), Sammelb. 2137.4 (vi/vii A.D.).

lepto/-knhmos, on,
spindle-shanked, Adam.2.2 (Comp.).

lepto-kope/w,
chop fine or
small, Dsc.1.12, 5.75 (both Pass.), Aq., Thd., Sm.Is.28.28.

lepto-kth/twr, oros, o(,
small land-holder, PMasp.2i2 (vi A.D.), PLond.5.1674.95 (vi A.D.).

lepto-la/xa^non [la^], to/,
small vegetables, POxy.1656.8 (iv/v A.D.).

lepto/-li^qos, on,
covered with pebbles, Lyr.Alex.Adesp.20.10.

leptolog-e/w,
speak subtly, chop logic, quibble, Ar.Nu.320; peri/ tinos S.E.M.1.65; l. ti
discuss in quibbling fashion, Luc.
Bis Acc.34, D.C.55.28:—also in Med., Luc.Prom.Es6; ti pro/s tina Id.JConf. 10.

leptolog-i/a, h(,
subtle argument, quibbling, Hermipp.22, Stoic.1.89, Philostr.VA1.17. = knipo/ths, Phryn.PSp.85 B.
chicanery, PMasp.151.201 (vi A.D.).

lepto/log-os, on,
speaking subtly, quibbling, fre/nes Ar.Ra.876 (hex.), cf. Philostr.VS1.21.1: in good sense, a)ll' o(/ ge leptolo/gos skh=ptron *)/aratos e)/xei Ptol. ap. Ach.Tat.Intr. Arat.p.79 M.

leptome/r-eia, h(,
a consisting of small particles, Ti.Locr.98e, Placit. 1.7.34, al.; of the soul, Epicur.Ep.1p.20U.

leptomer-h/s, e/s, (me/ros)
composed of small particles, as water and fire, opp. paxumerh/s, Ti. Locr.100e; of the soul, Epicur.Ep.1p.19U.: Comp. -e/steros Arist. Cael.303b19: Sup. -e/statos Id.de An.405a6, al.
treated in detail or
minutely, Ptol.Geog.1.22.1 (Comp.), Tz.H.10.159. Adv. -rw=s Phot.Bibl.p.4 B., Hsch. of persons,
refined or
meticulous, l. kai\ dedidagme/nos Cat.Cod.Astr.8(2).124.

leptomerimn-i/a, h(,
attention to trifles, Corn.ND18.

leptome/rimn-os, on, (me/rimna)
meticulous, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(2).124, cf. Gloss.

lepto-mh/lh, h(,
slender probe, Hermes 38.282.
lepto/-mhtis: h( dasei=a yuxh/, Hsch.

lepto/-mi^tos, on,
of fine threads, fa/ros E.Andr.831 (lyr.); nefe/lh AP6.11 (Satyr.).

lepto/-neuros, on,
with thin sinews, Adam.2.2 (Comp.).

lepto/-phnos, on, (phni/on)
of fine fabric, u(/fos Eub.67.5 = 84.4; v.l. lepto/nhtos, on, (ne/w)
fine-spun, in the latter place (cod. A Ath.).

leptopoi-e/w,
make fine or
small, Crito ap.Gal.13.878, Orib.50.11.8.

leptopoi/-hsis, ews, h(,
making fine, Gal.10.742.

leptopoi-hte/on,
one must make fine or
small, Dsc.5.88.

lepto/-pous, o(, h(, gen. podos,
with small, delicate feet, Sch.Ar.Av. 1292.

lepto/-prumnos, on,
with slender stern, nau=s B.16.119.

lepto/-pu_gos, on,
with a thin pugh/, Sch.Ar.Eq.1365.

lepto/-ramfos, on,
having a slender bill, strouqi/on Paul.Aeg.3.45.

lepto/-rrizos, on,
with thin, delicate root, Thphr.HP8.2.3, Gp.2.12.2, Sch.Theoc.5.123.

lepto/-rru^tos, on,
thinly- flowing, u(/dwr Hp.Ep.17.

lepto/s, h/, o/n, (le/pw) rare in lit. sense,
peeled, husked, r(i/mfa te le/pt' e)ge/nonto, of barley being
threshed out, Il.20.497.
fine, small, koni/h 23.506; ko/nis S.Ant.256; te/fra Ar.Nu.177; leptoi=s a(lsi/ Alex.187.5: freq. in Hp., diatrh/seis l. Loc.Hom.10, al.; of soil,
light, Thphr.HP1.8.1.
thin, fine, delicate, freq. in Hom., mostly of garments and the like , o)qo/nai Il.18.595; pe/ploi, fa=ros, Od.7.97, 10.544; a)ra/xnia 8.280; mh/rinqos Il.23.854; -o/tatos xalko/s 20.275; e)/benos, e)le/fas, si/dhros BCH35.286 (Delos, ii B.C.); r(ino\s boo/s Il.20.276 (Sup.); de/rma Arist.HA517b27 (Sup.); tri/xes Id.GA783a4 (Comp.); sa/rc E.Med.1189; xalko\s kai\ do/nakes Pi.P.12.25, cf. E.Med.949, Th. 2.49, etc.; lepta\ ta\ prw/|raqen e)/xein, of ships, to have the bows
thin and weak, Id.7.36. of the human figure, mostly in bad sense,
thin, lean, Alc.39; opp. paxu/s, Hp.Art.8 (Comp.); e)gw\ de\ lepth\ ka)sqenh/s Ar. Ec.539; sofistw=n leptw=n, a)si/twn Antiph.122.4; l. kai\ au)xmw=n Thphr. Char.26.5, cf. Ceb.10; l. xei/r Hes.Op.497; sth=qos Ar.Nu.1018 (anap.); tra/xhlos X.Cyn.5.30; lepto\s <e)k> toi=n skeloi=n Luc.Nav.2; l. u(po\ merimnw=n Pl.Amat.134b; of animals, X.Cyr.1.4.11; also,
slender, taper (opp. paxu/s）, da/ktulos Pl.R.523d; a)polh/gein ei)s lepto/n, of the fingers of a statue, Luc.Im.6. of space,
strait, narrow, ei)si/qmh Od.6.264; a)tarpo/s Alcm.81; e)pi\ lepto\n teta/xqai in
a thin line, X. Cyr.5.4.46, cf. Plb.3.115.6; ou)/te eu)rei=an ou)/te lepth\n . . o(do/n Plu.2.964c (ap.Porph.Abst.1.6). generally,
small, weak, impotent, lepth\ mh=tis Il.10.226, 23.590; e)lpi/s Ar.Eq.1244, cf. o)xe/w 11.3; a)sfa/leia D.Ep.2.20; l. i)/xnh
faint traces, X.Cyn.5.5; l. ou)=as, of a child's ear,
tiny, Simon.37.14; ta\ l. tw=n proba/twn
small cattle, i.e.
sheep and goats, Hdt.8.137; l. ploi=a
small craft, Id.7.36; a)/krai l.
small headlands, Id.8.107; l. klima/kia Ar.Pax69; to\ -o/taton tou= xalkou= nomi/smatos Plu.Cic.29; l. xalko/s OGI485.12 (Magn. Mae.): without xalko/s, Inscr.Perg.374 D7; a)rgu/rion *(ro/dion l. CIG2693e5 (Mylasa), cf. TAM2(1).15 (Telmessus); v. infr. 111.2. Adv. -tw=s, zh=n
poorly, meanly, Men.Mon.682: neut. pl. as Adv., lepta\ leu/ssw ko/rais E.Or.224.
light, slight, leptai=s u(pai\ kw/nwpos . . r(ipai=si A. Ag.892; l. pnoai/
light breezes, E.IA813; leptai=s e)pi\ r(oph=|sin on
slight turns of fortune, S.Fr.555. of size or quantity, l. puri/dia
small, Ar.Lys.1206; l. ku/likes Pherecr.143.5 (but f.l.): neut. pl. as Adv., l. ti=lai 'pluck into small pieces', Theoc.3.21. of liquids,
thin, ga/la Hp.Vict.2.46; lepta\ a)neme/ein Id.Coac.310; l. oi)=nos
light wine, Luc.Merc.Cond.18; also of food, l. di/aitai Hp.Aph.1.4; l. o)ya/ria OGI484.16 (Pergam.). Adv. -tw=s, diaita=sqai, diaita=n, Gal. 19.191, Paul.Aeg.3.43. = leptomerh/s,
consisting of fine parts, o(/sw| -o/teron a)h\r u(/datos Arist.Ph.215b4, cf. Cael.303b26, al. metaph.,
subtle, refined, nou=s E.Med.529; -o/teroi mu=qoi ib.1082 (anap.); -o/tatoi lh=roi Ar.Nu.359; puknh=| . . lepta\ mhxana=| freni/ Id.Ach.445; l. logista/ Id.Av.318; l. kai\ a)kribh/s Antipho 3.4.2; e)s ta\s te/xnas paxe/es, ou) leptoi/ Hp.
Aër.24; lo/goi l. . . tre/fous' e)kei/nous Alex.220.8; cf. leptolo/gos. Adv. -tw=s, merimna=n Lyr.Adesp.135; l. kai\ puknw=s e)ceta/zein Amphis 33.5: Comp. -ote/rws Anaxandr.36: also kata\ lepto/n
in detail, PPetr.2p.118 (iii B.C.), Cic.Att.2.18.2, Phryn. PS p.83 B., Phot. s.v. nifeto/s; cf. kata/lepton, kataleptologe/w: ta\ kata\ lepto/n, title of poems by Aratus, Ach.Tat.Intr.Arat.p.79 M., Str.10.5.3; also of minor poems of Virgil; tw=n kata\ lepto\n po/rwn a)rai/wsis, perh.
small pores, Gal.15.201. rarely of the voice,
fine, delicate, Arist.HA545a7, Lyc.687; a(rmoni/a E.Fr.773.23 (lyr.): neut. as Adv., lepto\n a)mfitittubi/zein Ar.Av.235 (lyr.); of sound, l. u(potru/zousa AP11.352.5 (Agath.); cf. leptale/os. of
smell, Pl.Ti.66e (Comp.). of persons, oi( l.
the poor, Plb.24.7.3; lepth\n ple/kein, prov. of poor people, Hsch.; lepta\ cai/neis Suid. Subst. lepto/n (sc. e)/nteron), to/, the
small intestine, Hp.Coac.311, 449. (sc. no/misma)
a very small coin, Ev.Luc.21.2, Phot.s.v. o)bolo/s; cf.supr.1.6. (sc. kera/mion)
jar, POxy.920.4 (ii/iii A.D.), PStrassb.40.48 (vi A.D.); cf. lepti/on, leptokerameu/s. Astron. (sc. e(chkosto/n), division of a degree, prw=ta lepta/, =
minutes, deu/tera l., =
seconds, Gem.18.11, 18; lepta/ alone, =
minutes, PLond. 1.98r.47 (i/ii A.D.), POxy.1476 (iii A.D.).

lepto/-sarkos, on,
with fine pulp, ka/ruon Gp.10.64.3, cf.Sch.Theoc. 5.94.
lepto-si/nion, to/, a kind of fruit(?), PPetr.3p.154 (iii B.C.).

lepto-skelh/s, e/s,
thin-shanked, Arist.PA684a10: Comp.-e/steros Id.HA505b16.

lepto-spa/qhtos [a^], on,
fine-woven, xlani/dia Trag.Adesp. 7.

lepto-spa/qion [a^], to/,
thin spatula, Cass.Fel.36.

lepto/-spermos, on,
with small seeds, Dsc.4.93.

lepto/-stomos, on,
with small mouth, Arist.Fr.304.
lepto-su/nh, h(, = lepto/ths, AP11.110 (Nicarch.).

lepto-su/nqetos, on,
of fine texture, kalu/mmata Antiph.52.10.

lepto-sxi^dh/s, e/s,
with narrow slit, of sandals, Cephisod.4, cf. Dsc.3.24, Poll.7.85. Adv. -dw=s Dsc.4.186.

lepto/-swmos, on,
with thin or
taper body, Eust. 1288.40.

lepto-ta^ri/xion [i_x], to/,
small pickled fish, PLond.ined.2184 (iii A.D.).

lepto/ths, htos, h(, (lepto/s)
thinness, opp. paxu/ths, Hp.VC2.
fineness, delicacy, opp. pa/xos, Pl.R.523e, al.; of soil, Arr.Tact.34.1; of the air,
tenuity, Pl.Ti.58b, Arist.Cael.303b24, cf. Ph.215b28: in pl., opp. pa/xh, Id.HA507b26; of the ei)/dwla, Epicur.Ep.1p.10U.
thinness, meagreness, of body, Pl.Lg.646b. metaph.,
subtlety, tw=n frenw=n Ar.Nu.153, cf. Luc.
Bis Acc.2.

lepto-tome/w,
cut small, mince, Str.15.2.14.

lepto-tra/xhlos [a^], on,
thin- or
fine-necked, Arist.Phgn.809b6 (Comp.), Alex.Mynd. ap. Ath.9.392c.

lepto/-trhtos, on, (titra/w)
with small holes, Dsc.5.120, Gal.13.638.
lepto/-tri^xos, on, v. lepto/qric.

leptourg-e/w,
do fine work, of carvers and turners, Plu.Aem.37, 2.997d:—Pass., of a drug,
to be finely powdered, Gal.11.404. metaph., = leptologe/w, E.Hipp.923, Pl.Plt.262b;
recount in detail, ib.294d; o(/sa e)/drasen h(ma=s a)gaqa\ kaq' e(/kaston l. Jul.Or.3.123c.

leptourg-h/s, e/s,
finely worked, e)/sqos h.Hom.31.14:
cut up small, r(i/zai Nic.Fr.70.10.

leptourg-i/a, h(,
fine workmanship, Bito 54.3, J.AJ3.6.4; esp. in wood,
cabinet-making, PMasp.159.13 (vi A.D.): metaph.,
working out in detail, Them.Or.34p.448Dind.; o)noma/twn Gal.18(1).460;
subtlety, Procl.in Prm.p.518 S.

leptourg-ika/, ta/,
articles of fine workmanship, SIG 88o.66 (Pizus, iii A.D.).

leptourg-o/s, o/n,
producing fine work, esp. in wood, D.S.17.115 (as Subst.), Edict.Diocl.7.3; te/ktwn l. PMasp.158.6 (vi A.D.).

lepto-u+fh/s [u^], e/s, （u(fai/nw)
finely woven, Luc.Am.41, Alciphr.3.41.

lepto-fa^h/s, e/s,
feebly shining, Nonn.D.5.170.

lepto/-floios, on,
with thin bark, Thphr.HP1.5.2, etc.
lepto-fu^h/s, e/s, = lepto/s, ou)rh/ Nonn. D.26.315; tu/pos . . e)lefa/ntwn ib.18.86.

lepto/-fullos, on,
with thin leaves, Thphr.HP9.11.4, Sor.2.16, Anon.Vat.16, Alex.Aphr.in Top. 118.30: Comp., Thphr.HP3.9.5, 6.2.6.

lepto/-fwnos, on,
with small, weak voice, Sapph.Oxy.1231Fr.22.2, Arist.HA538b13 (Comp.).

lepto-xeilh/s, e/s,
thin-lipped, ib.528a29; v.l. lepto/xeilos, on.

lepto/-xrws, wtos, o(, h(,
with delicate skin, dub. cj. in E.Fr.906.

lepto/-xu_los, on,
with thin or
little juice, Thphr.CP6.16.5 (Comp.).

lepto-ya/ma^qos [ya^], on,
with fine sand, prosto/mia A.Supp.3 (anap.), as Pauw for leptomaqw=n.

lepto/-yhfos, on,
with small spots, of red porphyry with white granules, Plin.HN36.57.
*le/ptu_nis, h(, name for Persephone, Lyc.49.

le/ptun-sis, ews, Ion. ios, h(,
attenuation, Hp.Prorrh.2.25; ai( tou= u(grou= l.
evaporation, Hero Spir.1 Praef. -te/on,
one must reduce, to\ pa/xos Aët.16.61.

leptun-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for making thin, attenuating, Dsc.5.88, Gal.6.572, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.8.369d (also Comp., ib.e): c.gen., xulo\s l. ai(/matos Id. ap. Ath.8.356d; to\ fw=s l. tou= a)e/ros Stoic. 2.143.

leptu/n-w, fut. -u^nw= LXX Ps.17(18).42: aor. 1 e)le/ptuna Hp.Epid. 6.1.5:—Pass., aor. e)leptu/nqhn Id.Aph.5.46: pf. lele/ptusmai Id.Morb.1.19, Arist.HA511b22; inf. leleptu/nqai Ath.12.552e: (lepto/s): —
make thin or
meagre, ai( talaipwri/ai l. [ta\ pro/bata] Arist.HA 596a29, cf. Pr.882a27; l. to\ sxh=ma [tw=n tagma/twn] Plb.3.113.8 (cf. leptusmo/s）; fwnh\n barei=an . . leptu/nwn Babr.103.5:—Pass.,
to be reduced, grow lean or
slender, Hp.Aph.2.7, Arist.HA518b29, al.; tou\s w)/mous leptu/nesqai X.Smp.2.17; leleptusme/nos （-isme/nos cod.) kata\ th\n ou)ra/n, of a serpent, Philum.Ven.18.1; of things,
to be rarefied, Damox.2.28, cf. Ph.1.642, S.E.M.10.25.
comminute or
liquefy food in digestion, Plu.2.689d; -u/nousa di/aita diet
productive of thin humours, Gal.Vict.Att.3:—Pass.,
become fluid, opp. paxu/nesqai, of foods, Hp.VM19; also -o/mena ei)s pneu=ma diakri/netai Arist.Pr.966b14.
thresh, winnow, l. *dhou=s karpo/n AP9.21.
leptuci/s: a)po\ tou= le/pous, kai\ th=s xwri/sews, Hsch.

leptusmo^s, o(,
thinning, Hp.Epid.6.3.16; trixw=n Dsc.5.112; esp. of the line of battle, Ael.Tact.38.3.
le/ptw, v. le/pw 11.2.

lepu_r-i/zomai,
to be contained in a husk, Sch.Nic.Th.802.

lepu_r-io/w,
strip off the husk (lepuriw=sai: e)caxuriw=sai), Hsch.

lepu_r-iw/dhs, es,
like husks, consisting of coats or
layers, like the onion, Arist.HA546b30, Thphr.HP 4.6.2, 7.9.4, al.; cf. lepurw/dhs.

le/pu_r-on, to/, (le/pos)
rind, shell, husk, Batr.131, LXX Ca.4.3, Dsc.Eup.1.89, Porph.Gaur.17.7.

lepu^ro/s, a/, o/n,
in a husk, peel, rind, gene/qlh Nic.Th.136; a)qe/rwn sta/xus ib.803.
lepu^rw/dhs, es, = lepuriw/dhs, Thphr.HP1.6.7.

le/pw, fut. le/yw （a)po-) prob. in E.Cyc.237; Ep. inf. a)po-leye/men Il.21.455: aor. e)/leya 1.236, Nic.Fr.82:—Med., Alex.49:—Pass., fut. la^ph/somai （e)k-) Hp.（Nat.Puer.29) ap.Erot.: aor. 2 la^p<*>nai Hsch., (e)k-) Ar.Fr.164: pf. le/lemmai （a)po-) Epich.158, but le/lammai IG22.463.68:—
strip off the rind or
husks, peel, bark, peri\ ga/r r(a/ e( xalko\s e)/leye fu/lla te kai\ floio/n Il.1.236; kro/mmuon l. Eup.255; kua/mou koloka/sion Nic.l.c.:—Pass., ka/lamos lelamme/nos IGl.c. metaph., in Com. Poets,
give a hiding to, i.e.
thrash, Pl.Com.12, Timocl.29, Apollod.Car.5.10 (Pass.); *)afrodi/thn PBerol. 13426 (Gercke-Norden Einleitung31(9)p.42).
eat, Antiph.135; Phot. cites le/ptei (sic) = katesqi/ei from Eup.（Fr.427). Med., = de/fomai: hence,
indulge in indecent gestures, Alex.49, Mnesim.4.18 (anap.).

lepw/dhs, es,
bare, windswept, etym. of e(lespi/s, EM328.24.

*le/rna, h(, Lerna, a marsh in Argolis, the mythol. abode of the Hydra, Plu.Cleom.15, Paus.2.4.5; also *le/rnh, Cratin.347, Str.8.6.8, etc.: gen. *le/rnhs A.Pr.652, etc.: prov., *le/rnh kakw=n an abyss of ills, Hsch.; so *l. qeatw=n, of the theatre, Cratin.l.c.:—Adj. *lernai=os, a, on, Hes.Th.314, etc.; also os, on E.Ion191 (lyr.):—*lernai/a xolh/, of malignant anger, Trag.Adesp.229.
le/ros, o(, a fish, Xenocr. ap. Orib.2.58.14.

*lesb-a/rxhs, ou, o(,
president of the council of Lesbos, IGRom.3.87 (Amastris).

*lesb-ia/zw,
do like the Lesbian women, Lat.
fellare, Ar.Ra. 1308, Luc.Pseudol.28.
*lesb-i/zw, = foreg., in Att. fut. -iei=n, Ar.V.1346 codd. (leg. -ia=n).

*lesb-i/s, i/dos, h(,
Lesbian woman, Il.9.271, cf. Pherecr. 149:—also*lesb-ia/s, a/dos, Hermesian.7.52, AP9.26 (Antip.Thess.).

*le/sb-os, h(, Lesbos, Il.24.544, Od.4.342, etc.; the seventh in magnitude of islands known to the Greeks, Alex.268.6:—hence Adv. *lesb-o/qen,
from Lesbos, Il.9.664; *lesb-o/qi,
at Lesbos, EM25.15:—Adj. *le/sbios, a, on, Sapph.92, Hdt.1.23, etc.: prov., meta\ *le/sbion w)|do/n, of those who are judged second best, Cratin.243; *le/sbion ku=ma or kuma/tion, v. ku=ma 1.3, A.Fr.78, Vitr.4.6.2; so to\ *le/sbion (without k.) PCair.Zen. 445.11 (iii B.C.); *lesbi/a oi)kodomi/a Arist.EN1137b30; *l. pw/matos ou)k e)/stin a)/llos oi)=nos h(di/wn piei=n Alex.274, cf. Philyll.24; h(di/wn o( *l. (sc. oi)=nos), with a play on words, indicating a preference for Theophrastus (of Lesbos) over Eudemus (of Rhodes), Arist. ap. Gell.13.5. *le/sbion, to/, part of a ship, h( deute/ra tro/pis acc. to Poll.1.85.
drinking-cup, Hedyl. ap. Ath.11.486b.
le/spin: mega/lhn. u(drhlh/n. *di/dumos th\n kataduome/nhn ei)s pe/lagos pe/tran. oi( de\ th\n notera/n. a)/lloi de\ spi/da baqei=an. oi( de\ lo/xmhn, Hsch.

lesx-a/zw, (le/sxh)
prate, chatter, kaka\ l. Thgn.613.
lesx-ai/nw, = foreg., -ousa/ te kai\ a)kou/ousa kala/ Perict. ap. Stob.4.28.19, cf. Call. Fr.98b.
lesx-ai=os: e)chghth/s, o(milhth/s, Hsch.
*lesxana/sios, o( (sc. mh/n), a month at Tegea, IG5(2).3.
*lesxano/rios, v. *lesxhno/rios.
lesxa/rai: oi(=on ai( sxolai/, ktl. (cf. sq.), EM561.17.

le/sx-h, h(, (prob. from *le/x-skh, cf. le/xos) orig.
couch: hence,
funeral bier or
tomb, IG12(1).709 (Camirus); then,
lounging place, resort of idlers or beggars, ou)d' e)qe/leis eu(/dein xalkh/i+on e)s do/mon e)lqw\n h)e/ pou e)s le/sxhn Od.18.329; pa\r d' i)/qi xa/lkeion qw=kon kai\ e)pale/a le/sxhn Hes.Op.493, cf. 501; kati/zwn e)n tai=s l. tw=n gero/ntwn Ps.- Hdt.Vit.Hom.12. later,
public building or
hall, used as a
lounge or
meeting-place, esp. at Sparta and in other Doric cities, Cratin.164 (pl.), cf. Paus.3.14.2, Plu.Lyc.16, 24 (pl.); also in Attica, IG12.888, 2.1055.23, Procl.ad Hes.Op.491; at Delphi,
hall adorned with paintings by Polygnotus, Luc.Im.7, Paus.10.25.1; at Cnidus,
council-chamber, Plu.2.412d, cf. 298d; of the
council of the Olympian gods, *zeu\s a(=s le/sxas a)phciw/sato (sc. ta\s *)erinu=s) A.Eu.366 (lyr.); also su/gklhton th/nde gero/ntwn l. this specially summoned
council, S.Ant.161 (anap.).
talk or
gossip, such as went on in the le/sxai (cf. lesxhneu/w, etc.), makrai\ l. E.Hipp.384, cf. IA1001 (pl.), Epicr.11.32 (pl., anap.), LXX Pr.23.29 (pl.), AP13.6 (Phal.); in bad sense,
malicious gossip, scandal, Vett. Val.in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(1).165 (pl.); also in good sense,
conversation, discussion, genome/nhs l., o(\s ge/noito . . a)/ristos Hdt.9.71; e)k lo/gwn a)/llwn a)pike/sqai e)s l. peri\ tou= *nei/lou Id.2.32; lo/gon ei)/ tin' oi)/seis pro\s e)ma\n l. if thou hast aught to
discuss with me, S.OC167 (lyr.); ai)=san le/sxhs oi)=nos e)/xein e)qe/lei Call. Aet.1.1.16; h(/lion e)n le/sxh| katedu/samen Id.Epigr.2.3; lu/w le/sxas, 'cut the cackle', prov. for breaking off
discussion and setting to work in earnest, Pl.Com.223.

le/sx-hma, atos, to/,
gossip, v.l. in Hp.Ep.17 (pl.).

lesx-hmoneu/omai, Med.,
chat, polla\ toi=sin i)diw/th|sin Hp.Decent. 7.

lesx-h/n, h=nos, o(,
chatterer, Timo 46.
lesxhn-ei=: o(milei=, muqologei=, Hsch.

lesxhn-ei/a, h(,
gossip, Pl.Ax. 369d.

lesxhn-euth/s, ou=, o(,
gossip, chatterer, Ath.14.649c.

lesxhn-eu/w,
chat or
converse with, toi=s pre/sbesi App.BC2.91:—Med., Heraclit.5, Democr.85, Hp.Decent.7 (v.l.), Prorrh.2.4, Morb.1.19, Nic.Dam.3 J.: —Hdt. has the compds. perilesxh/neutos, prolesxhneu/omai.
lesxhn-i/ths [i_], ou, o(, = lesxhneuth/s, Suid.

lesxhn-o/rios, o(, epith. of Apollo, as
guardian of the meetings in the le/sxai, Cleanth.Stoic.1.123, Plu.2.385c, Corn.ND32:—Dor. *lesxa_no/rios, o( (sc. mh/n), a month in Thessaly, IG9(2).509, al.; in Crete, -ori/a [nemonhi/+a] Supp.Epigr.1.410 (iv B.C.).

lesxhn-w/ths, ou, o(,
scholar, pupil, Thalesap.D.L.1.43, Anaximen.ib.2.4. (On the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.74.)
lesxhrei=: ko/ptei, o(milei=, Hsch. (cf. lesxhnei=).

lesxologi/a, h(,
superfluity of words, PMag.Par.1.2085.

lesxw/dhs, es,
given to scandal, Vett.Val.in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(1).169.

lesw=nis, PAmh.2.35.11 (ii B.C.); gen. -w/nios ib.41.15 (ii B.C.); dat. -w/nei ib.40.1 (ii B.C.); later gen -w/nou Sammelb.6154.31 (i B.C.), dat. -w/nh| BGU37v (i A.D.): o(:—
chief administrator of a temple in Egypt, ll.cc.:—hence leswnei/a, h(,
his office, PAmh.2.35.30 (ii B.C.), Wilcken Chr.92 i 13 (ii/iii A.D.):—written lesoni/a, BGU719.10 (i/ii A.D.). (Egypt.
mr šn = a)rxierei=s.)
letmo\s a)nadrh/ssei: to\ sw=ma <*)a>meri/as fhsi/, Hsch. letwnh=sai: a)feidw=s pai=sai kata\ tw=n i)sxi/wn, Id.
leugai/a, Maced., = i)/lh, as pr. n. of a regiment, Arr.An.2.9.3.

leuga^le/os, a, on, (v. lugro/s): of persons,
in sad or
sorry plight, wretched, ptwxw=| l. e)nali/gkion Od.16.273; l. e)so/mesqa 2.61. Adv. -e/ws, xwrei=n to go
in ill plight, Il.13.723. of conditions, etc.,
sore, baneful, nu=n de/ me l. qana/tw| ei(/marto a(lw=nai, i.e. by drowning, 21.281, cf. Od.15.359; kh/desin . . leugale/oisi ib.399; a)/lgesi l. 20.203; pole/moio meqh/sete l. Il.13.97; e)n dai\+ l. 14.387; fresi\ l. piqh/sas 9.119; l. e)pe/essin 20.109; h)/qea l. Hes.Op.525; poinh/ ib.754; ko/ros Thgn.1174; a)ni=ai A.R.1.295; ke/ntron Nic.Th. 836. rarely of material objects, l. xitw/n
sorry tunic, Philet. 17. leugale/a: dia/broxos, Phot., cf. EM561.28 (prob. an error due to misunderstanding of S.Fr.785).
leu/gh, h(, a measure of milk, Hsch.

*leui/ths [i_], ou, o(,
Levite, Ev.Luc.10.32, Plu.2.671f:—fem. *leui=tis, fulh/ v.l. in J.AJ3.11.1; *leui_tiko/s, h/, o/n, Ep.Hebr.7.11; to\ -ko/n, title of book of VT.

*leuka^q-e/a, h(, goddess worshipped in Thessaly ( = *leukoqe/a), IG 9(2).422 (Pherae), *)arx. *)ef. 1910.380 (Larissa). neut. pl. *leuka/qea, ta/, festival at Teos, CIG3066.25:—hence *leuka^q-ew/n, w=nos (sc. mh/n), o(, month at Chios, GDI5661.25 (iv B.C.); at Teos, Supp.Epigr. 2.579.21 (iv B.C.); at Magnesia on Maeander, Inscr.Magn.89.6:— also *leuka^q-iw/n, at Lampsacus, CIG3641b17; *leuka^/q-eos, at Astypalaea, SIG 780 (i B.C.).
leuka^q-e/w, = leukaqi/zw, perh. to be read in Hes.Sc.146 (o)do/ntwn . . leuka\ qeo/ntwn codd.).
leuka^q-ew/n, v. *leukaqe/a.

leuka^q-i/zw,
to be white, Hdt.8.27 (codd. opt.), PLeid.X.84, Gloss.; of spots on the body, LXX Le.13.38; [tri/xes] leukaqi/zousai Babr.22.9; ai)=ges xio/ni l. Id.45.3, cf. Ael.NA17.8, 9; l. oi( lo/foi, of snow-clad hills, Alciphr.3.30; oi)ki/a l. gu/yw| Epict.Gnom.43; of fluids in the eye,
to be colourless, Cass.Pr.27; of eyes, S.E.P.1.44:—Pass., leleukaqisme/nh
clad in white, LXX Ca.8.5. (leukanq- is read in Babr., but is against the metre, also in Ael., Alciphr., Epict., Cass., and S.E., and is v.l. in Hdt.l.c., LXX Ca.l.c.; cf. leukaqe/w, u(poleukaqi/zw.)

leukai/a, h(, a synonym (perh. a variety) of spa/rtos, used for cordage or tackle, Moschio ap.Ath.5.206f:—written leuke/a in BGU544.5 (ii A.D.), Artem.3.59 (who dists. it from ka/nnabis), Hsch. = leu/kh 11.1, leukai/as ste/fanos IG12(1).155 iii 79, iv 118:—hence *leukai=os *zeu/s, Zeus
of the white poplar, Paus.5.5.5.

leukai/nw, late aor. 1 inf. leuka=nai (v. infr.): pf. Pass. leleu/kasmai Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.2.54b, Orib.Fr.102:—
make white, leu/kainon u(/dwr cesth=|s e)la/th|sin Od.12.172; a(/la r(oqi/oisi l. E.Cyc.17; e)s ge/nun e(/rpei leukai/nwn o( xro/nos Theoc.14.70;
plaster with whitening, leuka=nai ta\ leukw/mata Ephes.3p.148:—Pass.,
to be or
become white, Arist.GA 730a6, Sopat.8, A.R.1.545, Diph.Siph.l.c.;
to be clarified, of oil, Orib.l.c.
cause to appear white, of the effect of dawn on lamplight, E.IA157 (anap.). Pass.,
have a sensation of whiteness, S.E.M.7.191, al. intr.,
grow white, E.Hyps.Fr.34(60) i13, Arist.Pr.890a9, LXXLe.13.19; a)froi=o
with foam, Nic.Al.170.

leuk-a/kanqa [a^k], h(,
white thistle, Tyrimnus leucographus, Thphr. HP6.4.3, Plin.HN21.94 (v. infr.).
tuberous thistle, Cnicus tuberosus, Dsc.3.19, Gal.12.58, Plin.HN22.40:—in form leuk-a/kanqos, h(, ib.21.94, v.l. in Gal.6.623.

leuk-a/lfi^tos, on,
rich in pearl-barley, Sopat.3.

leuk-a/mpuc, u^kos, o(, h(, to/,
with white headband, pu=r Opp. H.4.238.

leuk-a/nqemon, to/,
white-flower, like xrusa/nqemon, name of several plants of the genus Anthemis, Dsc.3.137, Plin.HN21.163:— also leuk-anqemi/s, i/dos, h(, ib.22.53.

leuk-anqh/s, e/s,
white-blossoming, Nic.Th.530: generally,
blanched, white, kapno/s Pi.N.9.23 (dub.); l. ka/ra S.OT742, cf. AP12.165 (Mel.).
leuk-anqi/zw, v. leukaqi/zw.
leuk-a^ni/h, leuk-a^ni/hqen, etc., v. laukani/h.
leuk-ani/wn (?), dub. sens. in PSI8.944.5 (iv A.D.).

leuk-ante/on,
one must bleach, khro/n Dsc.2.83.

leuk-anth/s, ou=, o(,
one who makes or
paints white, Gloss.

leuk-antiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for whitening, du/namis Sch.Pl.Tht.156d. Adv. -kw=s, diateqh=nai
have a sensation of whiteness, S.E.M.7.192.

leuk-a/ntuc, u^gos, h(,
bright-orbed, of the moon, Doroth. ap. Heph.Astr.3.20.

leuk-a/rgillos or leuk-a/rgi_los, on,
of or
with white clay, Str.9.5.19: as Subst.,
leucargilion, white clay, Plin.HN17.42.

leuk-a/s, a/dos, fem. of leuko/s: *l. pe/trh as pr.n. of mythical and real promontories, Od.24.11, Anacr.19, cf. E. Cyc.166; *l. alone, Th.1.30, etc. l. o)reinh/
mountain deadnettle, Lamium maculatum, Dsc.3.99; l. h(/meros
dead-nettle, L. Moschatum, ibid. epith. of h)/ruggos,
white, Nic.Th.849.
leuk-a^si/a, h(, = leu/kwsis 11, of artificial pearls, PHolm.3.6.
leuk-asmo/s, o(, gloss on 'Laban', Ph.1.306.

leu/k-aspis, i^dos, o(, h(,
white-shielded, of a Trojan, Il. 22.294; of the Carians, X.HG3.2.15; of a Maced. corps, Plu.Cleom. 23; in Trag. esp. of the Argives, A.Th.89 (lyr.), S.Ant.106 (lyr.), E.Ph.1099; ko/rai l. Lyr.Adesp.68.

leuk-augh/s, e/s,
white-gleaming, of a fish, Antiph.217.20.

leuk-a^xa/ths [xa_], ou, o(,
white agate, Plin.HN37.139.
leuk-e/a, v. leukai/a.
leuk-elefa/ntina: leuka\ w(s e)lefa/ntina, Hsch. (leu/k' e)le/fanti Valck. from Il.5.583).

leuk-eri_neo/s, Att. leuk-eri/news, h(,
white fig-tree, Ath.3.76c: also as Adj., of the fruit, l. i)sxa/des Hermipp.68.

leuk-e/ruqros, on,
whitish red, xroiai/ Arist.Phgn.806b4; of persons, Ptol.Tetr.143.

leuk-erw|dio/s, o(,
white heron or
spoonbill, Platalia leucorodius, Arist.HA593b2.

leu/k-h, h(, a cutaneous disease, so called from its colour: a kind of
leprosy or
elephantiasis, le/prhn h)\ leu/khn e)/xein Hdt.1.138; leixh=nes kai\ le/prai kai\ leu=kai Hp.Prorrh.2.43; l. a)lfou/s te Pl.Ti.85a; [e)ca/nqhma] o(\ kalei=tai l. Arist.HA518a13, cf. Pr.891a26.
white poplar, Populus alba, Thphr.HP1.10.1, al.; used for chaplets, Ar.Nu.1007, Eup.14.4, D.18.260, Theoc. 2.121; later leu/kh leukh/ Hippiatr.22. a place at Athens where the taxes were let out to farmers of the revenue, prob. so called from a
poplar in the place, And.1.133. = a)ndro/sakes, Ps.-Dsc.3.133. in pl.,
white spots on the nails, Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.146. in pl., kind of ko/gxoi, = a)ndrofukti/des, Epich.42.11. name of various plasters, Gal.13.414, al.
white clay or
chalk, Gloss.

leuk-hnai/, ai(,
chestnuts from *leukai/ (or *leu=kai) on Mt.Ida, Gal.6.778.

leuk-hpa^ti/as or leuxhpa^ti/as, ou, o(,
white-livered, i.e.
cowardly, Com.Adesp.1072.

leuk-h/peiros, on,
with white soil, [pe/trai] Gp.2.6.39.

leuk-h/retmos, on,
with white oars, *)/arhs E.IA283 (lyr.).

leuk-h/rhs, es,
white, blanched, qri/c A.Pers.1056, dub. in PFay.2 iii 32 (Lyr., ii A.D.).
*leukianh/, h(, epith. of Artemis, BCH12.269 (Panamara).

leu/ki^nos, h, on, (leu/kh 11)
of white poplar, ste/fanoi Arist.Oec.1353b27; mu/ron Gal.13.631. of soldiers,
decorated with chaplets of white poplar, OGI266.14 (Pergam., iii B.C.). (leukai/a 1)
of hemp, sxoini/a Hsch.s.v. masxa/lhn.

*leukippi/des, ai(,
daughters of Leucippus, nymphs worshipped at Sparta, ko/rai *l. E.Hel.1466 (lyr.), cf. Paus.3.13.7.

leu/k-ippos, on,
riding or
driving white horses, Ibyc.16, Stesich.86, Pi.P.4.117, S.El.706; of Persephone, Pi.O.6.95; l. *)aw/s B.Scol.Oxy. 24. l. a)guiai/
full of white horses, Pi.P.9.83.

leuk-i/skos, o(, a fish,
white mullet, Hices. ap. Ath.7.306e, Gal.6.713.
leuk-i/ths [i_], ou, Dor. leu/k-a_s, o(, = leuko/s 11, of a ram, Theoc.5.147.
leuko-ba^fh/s, e/s, gloss on leukanqe/s, Sch.rec.S.OT742.

leuko-bra^xi/wn [i_], on, gen. onos,
with white arms or
shoulders, Suid.s.v. leukw/lenos, Sch.D Il.1.55.

leuko/-geios, on, Thphr.CP2.4.4, Hsch.s.v. a)/rgilos; leuko-ge/ws, wn, Str.9.5.18, Eust.332.21 (v.l. leuko/gaios):—
of or
with white earth, ll. cc.

leuko-gra^fe/w,
paint in white on a coloured ground, Arist.Po.1450b2.

leuko-gra^fi/a, h(,
painting in white, Phlp. in Mete.74.22.

leuko-gra^fi/s, i/dos, h(, a kind of
clay for painting white, Plin.HN27.103; = mo/roxqos li/qos, Dsc.5.134, Aët.2.16.

leu/ko-gruy,
ossifragus, Gloss.
leuko-de/rma^tos, on, gloss on sq., Hsch.

leuko-di/fqeros, on,
with a white skin, Id.
leuko-ei/mwn, = leuxei/mwn, ta=| e)sqa=ti Melissa Ep. 11.1.
leuko-e/ruqros, on, = leuke/ruqros, Procl.Par.Ptol.203.
leuko/-zwtos: th=s gh=s h( me\n kalei=tai l., h( de\ mela/nzwtos, Hsch.

*leukoqe/a, Ep. leuko-e/h, h(,
the white goddess (cf. *leukaqe/a), name of the sea-goddess Ino, Od.5.334, Pi.P.11.2. l., h(,
the faculty of seeing white, Aristo Stoic.1.86.
*leuko/qion, to/, name of a building in Delos, IG11(2).154A 24, al. (iii B.C.).

leuko-qra|ki/a (sc. a)/mpelos), h(,
a white Bithynian
vine, Gp.5.17.4.

leu/ko-qric, tri^xos, o(, h(,
white-haired, white, leuko/trixa krio/n Ar. Av.971; leukotri/xwn ploka/mwn E.Ba.112 (lyr.); -trixes i(/ppoi Call. Cer.121; tw=n leukotri/xwn Arist.GA786a24; l. pro/bata Str.16.4.26.

leuko-qw/rac, a_kos, o(, h(,
with white cuirass, X.An.1.8.9.

leuk-o<i/>kion, to/,
white house, PLond.2.405.12 (iv A.D.).

leuko/-i+nos [i^], h, on,
made of leuko/i+on, Thphr.Od.27, cf. Philonid. ap.Ath.15.675e (-o/i+on codd.); o( l. (sc. ste/fanos) AP11.34 (Phld.):— written leuko/i+os, Apollon.Mir.45 (s.v.l.).
of the colour of leuko/i+on, dei=gma POxy.113.5 (ii A.D.).

leuko/-i+on [i^], to/, for leuko\n i)/on, lit.
white-violet:
gilliflower, Matthiola incana, Theoc.7.64, Dsc.3.123, etc.
snowdrop, Galanthus nivalis, flowering very early, Thphr.HP6.8.1; joined with the narcissus and lily in AP5.143 (Mel.), 146 (Id.). l. to\ me/lan, = i)/on to\ me/lan, Hp.Nat.Mul. 32.

leuko/-karpos, on,
yielding white fruit, Thphr.HP3.18.6.

leuko/-kaulos, on,
white-stalked, ib.7.4.6: Comp., ib.5.
leuko-ke/ra_tes, v. leuko/kras.
leuko/-kerkos, gloss on ma/louris, Hsch.
leuko-ke/fa^los, on, gloss on leuko/kras, Id.

leuko/-khros, on,
made of white wax, Id.s.v. *datu/s.

leuko/-knhmos, on,
white-legged, Anatoliusin Cat.Cod.Astr.8(3).188.13.

leuko/-komos, on,
white-haired, Poll.4.139.

leuko-kra/mbh, h(,
white cabbage, Gp.12.1.4.
