leu/ko-kras: leukoke/falos, Hsch.: pl. -krates （-ke/rates cod.): h)\ dia\ to\ tou\s e)n *eu)boi/a| bou=s leukou\s ei)=nai, h)\ i)/sws a)nti\ tou= lamprou/s, Id.

leuko-ku/mwn [u_], on, gen. onos,
white with waves or
surf, h)|o/nes E.Or.992 (lyr.).

leuko/-li^qos, on,
made of white marble, e)/rga Supp.Epigr.4.270 (Panamara); ta\ e)n tw=| qea/trw| l. OGI510 ( = Ephes.2 No.39, ii A.D.); sth/lh, sta/la l., IPE12.40.42 (Olbia), al.; krhpi/s Str.5.3.8; stoai/ Id.12.5.3: as Subst., -li/qou sta/la| IPE12.357 (Chersonesus).

leuko/-li^non, to/,
white flax for ropes and rigging, used esp. by the Phoenicians, Hdt.7.25,34,36, Ael.NA5.3.
leuko-lo/fas, a_, o(, = sq. 1, E.Ph.119 (lyr.).

leuko/-lofos, on,
white-crested, Anacr.82, Ar.Ra.1016, Philet.4. tou=t' a)na\ leuko/lofon prob. on this
white hill, AP 7.636 (Crin.).

leuko-maini/s, i/dos, h(,
the white sprat (maini/s), Polioch. 1.

leuko/-mallos, on,
with white wool, Eust.403.44.

leuko-me/la_s, aina, an,
grey, Hdn.Epim.163, Tz.ad Lyc.334.

leuko-me/twpos, on,
with a white forehead, Hippiatr.104, Hsch. s.v. falaro/s. as Subst., name of a bird, PPetr.3p.152 (iii B.C.), PGrenf.2.14b3 (iii B.C.), etc.; l. a)/grios PMag.Par.1.2395, 3148, cf. 2.209 (prob.).

leuko-mh/linos, on,
pale-yellow, e)/mplastros Gal.13.460.

leuko-mu^o/xrous, oun,
white and mouse-coloured, BGU1258.22 (ii B.C.); esp. of asses, ib.1066.6
(i A.D.), PLond.2.303.16 (ii A.D.):—also leuko/-xrws, BGU228.4 (ii/iii A.D.).

leukomfa/lios [a^], on,
with white navel or
centre, of fig-trees, Thphr. CP5.1.8.

leuko/n, to/,
white, as a colour, to\ l. oi)=den knows
white from black, Ar.Eq.1279; opp. me/lan, Pl.Prt.331d.
a white dress, leuko\n a)mpe/xei are dressed
in white, Ar.Ach.1024; h)mfiesme/nh leuka/ Id.Th. 840.
white of egg, Hp.Nat.Mul.32, Arist.GA753a35, Dsc.2.50. ta\ l. the
whites of the eyes, Hp.Prog.2, Alex.222.9, cf. Arist.HA492a1. ta\ l. the
menstrua alba of young girls, Id.GA738a26, HA581b2; more generally, Hp.Prorrh.1.80, Epid. 4.22. of a
white formation in testaceans, Arist.HA529a3.

leuko/-notos, o(,
the south wind which cleared the weather (for the usual no/tos brought rain), Arist.Mete.362a14: distd. from libo/notos, Gal.16.410, 17(1).655.
leuko-oina/rion, to/, inscription of amphorae at Pompeii, CIL4Suppl.6564, al. (written leukoun-).

leuko-o/pwros, on, (o)pw/ra)
with white fruit, AP9.563 (Leon.).

leuko-pa/reios [a^], on,
faircheeked, ib.5.159 (Mel.).

leuko-pa/ru^fos, on,
with white-edged robe, Alexander Magnusap.Plu.2.180e.

leuko-pe/lios, on,
pale-grey, Erot. s.v. to\ xrw=ma a)fuw=des.

leuko/-peplos, on,
white-robed, Corinn.20: metaph., h(me/rh l., Lat.
dies albo notandus, Hippon.32.

leuko-pe/thlos, on,
white-leaved, Poet.
de herb.8.

leuko/-petron, to/,
bare rock, Plb.3.53.5, 10.30.5.

leuko/-phxus, u,
white-armed, only in acc. pl. -ph/xeis, E.Ph. 1351 (lyr.), and dat. pl. -ph/xesi, Id.Ba.1206.

leuko/-pleuros, on,
with white sides, Sch.Theoc.4.45.

leuko-plhqh/s, e/s,
full of persons in white, e)kklhsi/a Ar.Ec.387.

leuko-podh/rhs, es,
clad in white down to the feet, in acc. -h/rhn, Zos.Alch.p.117 B.

leuko-poi/ki^los, on,
motley-white, Sch.Theoc.4.45. as Subst., l., h(, name of
a gem, Plin.HN37.171.

leuko-poio/s, o/n,
that makes white, Sch.S.Aj.624.

leuko/-pous, o(, h(, poun, to/, gen. podos,
white-footed, bare-footed, *ba/kxai E.Cyc.72 (lyr.), cf. Ar.Lys.665, Anacreont.8.5.

leuko/-prwktos, on,
with white prwkto/s, a play on the words eu)ru/prwktos and leuko/s 11.1c, conveying a notion of cowardice, Call.Com.11 (s.v.l.).

leuko/-pteros, on,
white-winged, of a ship, E.Hipp.752 (lyr.): generally,
white, nifa/s A.Pr.993; *(ame/ra E. Tr.848 (lyr.).
leuko-pte/ruc, u^gos, o(, h(, = foreg., prob. l. in Ion Eleg. 10.
leuko/-pu_gos, on, = leuko/prwktos, Alex.321.

leuko/-pu_ros, o(,
fine wheat, in pl., Ph.1.614, 669.

leuko/-purros, on,
pale-red, trixw/mata Arist.Col.797b13; prob. to be read for leuko/puron ma/lagma, Gal.13.984.

leuko/-pwlos, on,
with white horses, h(me/ra A.Pers.386, S.Aj.673; te/qrippon Plu.Cam.7; epith. of the Dioscuri (cf. leu/kippos), Pi.P.1.66; at Thebes also of Amphion and Zethus, E.HF29; qeoi/ Id.Ph. 606.

leuko-ro/dios, on,
rose-pink, Sammelb.7033.37 (v A.D.).

leuko/-rodon, to/,
the white rose, Gloss.

leuko/-rugxos, on,
white-nosed, of a horse, Hippiatr.104.

leu=kos, o(, name of
a fish (cf. leuki/skos), Theoc.Beren.4, cf. Arist. HA567a20.
*leu=kos, o(, divinity at Miletus, Schwyzer725 (vi B.C.).

leuko/s, h/, o/n,
light, bright, clear (opp. me/las in all senses), ai)/glh Od. 6.45; leuko\n (v.l. lampro/n） . . h)e/lios w(/s Il.14.185; l. fa/os S.Aj.708 (lyr.), cf. infr. 11.3; ai)qh/r E.Andr.1228 (anap.); of metallic surfaces, le/bhs Il.23.268; l. galh/nh a
glassy calm, Od.10.94; of water,
clear, limpid, Il.23.282, Od.5.70, A.Supp.23 (anap.); l. na=ma E.HF573; -o/tatos potamw=n Call.Jov.19. metaph.,
clear, distinct, of the voice, Arist.Top.106a25, S.E.M.6.41: in literary sense,
clear, l. sti/xos AP11.347 (Phil.): prov., leuko\s *(ermh=s, when a rogue was detected, Macar. 5.53. Adv. -kw=s, pa/nta fai/nein, of Hermes, Corn.ND16: Comp. -o/teron, dialexqh=nai Hld.7.20. of colour,
white, freq. in Hom., varying from the pure
white of snow ([i(/ppoi] -o/teroi xio/nos Il.10.437) to the
grey of dust (leukoi\ e)ge/nonto konisa/lw| 5.503); ga/la l. 4.434; kri= 5.196; a)/lfita 18.560; h(ni/a leu/k' e)le/fanti 5.583; o)do/ntes 10.263; o)ste/a 16.347; i(sti/a 1.480; fa=ros 18.353, etc.; l. a(/rma, = leu/kippon, E.Ph.172; of the white horses used by tyrants, l. zeu=gos D. 21.158, cf. leu/kippos; l. li/qos marble, OGI219.36 (Sigeum, iii B.C.), etc., cf. leuko/liqos; leukw=|<)n>li/qw| l. sta/qmh a
white line on a
white stone, prov. of explanations which do not explain, S.Fr.330; h( l. r(i/za
white root (= h( tou= drakonti/ou, acc. to Gal.19.118), Hp.Morb.2.48, Nat.Mul.32; freq. of
white or
grey hair, l. ka/rh Tyrt.10.23; qri/c S.Ant.1092; l. gh=ras Id.Aj.625 (lyr.); leuka\ gh/ra| sw/mata E.HF 909, etc. of the human skin,
white, fair, sts. as a sign of youth and beauty, xrw/s, ph/xee, Il.11.573, Od.23.240; l. pareia/, parhi/+s, S.Ant.1239, E.Med.923; sa/rc, de/rh, ib.1189 (v.l.), IA875 (troch.); freq. with the notion of
bare, kw=lon, pou/s, Id.Ba.665, 863 (lyr.), Ion 221 (lyr.); cf. leuko/pous. of persons,
white-skinned, Pl.R.474e: hence,
weakly, womanish, Ar.Th.191, Ec.428, X.HG3.4.19; leukw=n a)ndrw=n ou)de\n o)/felos Macar.5.55; cf. leuko/prwktos, leuko/xrws. leukai\ fre/nes in Pi.P.4.109 is expld. by Hsch. maino/menai,
frantic, passionate (cf. leukw=n prapi/dwn: kakw=n frenw=n, Id.). l. xruso/s,
pale gold, i.e. gold
alloyed with silver (prob. the same as h)/lektron), opp. a)/pefqos xruso/s, Hdt.1.50. metaph.,
bright, fortunate, happy, leuko\n h)=mar nukto\s e)k melagxi/mou A.Pers.301, cf. Ag.668; a
joyful day or
holiday, Call.Aet.1.1.2; l. h(me/ra a
happy day, S.Fr.6, cf. Sch.Call.Iamb.in PSI9.1094.39; variously expld. in Phylarch. 83 J., Plu.Per.27; h( l. yh=fos the vote of acquittal, Luc.Harm.3, cf. Hsch. leu/kh, h(, leuko/n, to/, as Subst., v. sub vocc. (Cogn. with Lat.
lux, etc.)

leuko/-sarkos, on,
with white flesh, Xenocr. ap. Orib.2.58.44, Epaenet. ap. Ath.7.312b.

leuko/-spa_nos, on,
pale-grey, of a coloured garment, PHamb.10.20 (ii A.D.).

leuko/-sternos, on,
white-chested, o)/nos BGU982.9 (ii A.D.).

leuko-stefh/s, e/s,
white-wreathed, of suppliant boughs, A.Supp.191,334. leukostefh=: ta\ kerauno/blhta, Hsch.

leuko/-stiktos, on, (sti/zw)
grizzled, qri/c E.IA222 (lyr.).

leuko/-stolos, on,
white-robed, Orph.Fr.33.

leuko/-sfu^ros, on,
white-ankled, *(/hba Theoc.17.32.

leuko-sw/ma^tos, on,
of white substance, a)/rtoi Antiph.176.3.

leuko/ths, htos, h(,
whiteness, Hp.
Aër.20, Pl.Tht.156d, al.

leuko-tra/xhlos [a^], on,
white-necked, Anatolius in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).188.
leuko/-tri^xa, leuko-tri/xwn, v. leuko/qric.

leuko-tri^xe/w,
have white hair, Str.6.1.13.

leuko/-trofos, on,
white-growing, mu/rta Ar.Av. 1100 (lyr.).

leukourg-e/w,
provide with marble facing, ta\s puli/das CIG2749 (Aphrodisias).

leukourg-o/s, o(, (e)/rgon)
worker in marble or
white stone, BCH32.500 (Aphrodisias), Milet.7.60 (Didyma), Princeton Exp.Inscr. Sect.B No.1170, Wiener Denkschr.44(6) p.31 No.70 (Cilicia, iii A.D.).

leu/kouros, on,
white-tailed, Hsch. s.v. ma/louros.

leuko-u+fh/s [u^], e/s,
of a white web, fa=ros Eust.1530.56.

leuko-fa^h/s, e/s,
white-gleaming, ya/maqos E.IA1054 (lyr.); au)ga/ prob. in Id.Hyps. Fr.3(1)ii 4 (lyr.); au)xh/n Nonn.D.15.232; cf. sq.

leuko/-faios, on,
whitish grey, ash-coloured, pro/baton PHib.1.32.13 (iii B.C.); xitw/n PCair.Zen.433.9 (iii B.C.), cf. Ath.3.78a, Poll.7.129; karpo/s prob.in Posidon.3 J.

leuk-o/fqalmos, h(,
white-eye, name of a gem, Plin.HN37.171.

leukoflegma^t-e/w,
have dropsy, Hp.Coac.472.

leukoflegma^t-i/a, h(,
the beginning of dropsy (also called leuko\n fle/gma), dub. in Cels.3.21.

leukoflegma^t-i/as, ou, o(,
one of a leuco-phlegmatous temperament, Hp.Epid. 3.14. o( l. u(/deros
oedematous dropsy,
anasarca, Gal.10.82, al.

leukofle/gma^t-os, on,
suffering from white phlegm, Hp.Epid.4.30.

leukoflegma^t-w/dhs, es,
affected with dropsy, ib.10.

leuko/-floios, on,
with white husk, cj. in Posidon.3 J.; cf. leuko/faios.
leuko-fo/nths, gloss on *)argeifo/nths, Hsch.

leuko-fore/w,
wear white garments, of e)/fhboi, IG3.1132 (ii A.D.).

leuko-fori_no/xroos, on,
white-skin-coloured, Philox.2.31.

leuko-fo/ros, on,
white-robed, dai/mwn APl.2.20 (Ammian.);
shining white, Zos.Alch.p.118 B.
bearing white grapes, a)/mpeloi Gp.5.2.2.
*leukofru^-hna/, ta/, festival of Artemis Leucophryene, SIG561.26 (Magn. Mae., iii B.C.), al.
*leukofru^-hnh/, h(, epith. of Artemis at Magn. Mae., ib.558.12 (ibid.), al.

leu/kofrus, u, gen. uos,
white-browed, a)gorh/ Orac. ap. Hdt.3.57. leuko/frus, v. luko/frus.
leuko-fu^h/s, v.l. for leukofah/s, Nonn.D.15.232.

leuko/-fullos, on,
white-leaved, Dsc.4.103; r(a/bdos l., name of a plant growing in the Phasis, Arist.Mir.846a29, Ps.-Plu.Fluv.5.2. leuko/fullon, to/, = chro/muron, Aët.16.128(118).

leuko-xi/twnos [i^], on,
white-coated, h(/pata Batr.37.

leuko/-xlwros, on,
pale-green, Aret. SD1.8, 15.

leuko/-xristos, on,
whitewashed, e)pa/lceis Ulp.ad D.3.29.

leuko/-xroia, h(,
whiteness, white colour, Placit.3.1.1.

leuko/-xroos, on, contr. leuko/-xrous, oun,
of pale complexion, Arist.GA728a2, Aret.SD 1.13, etc.: generally,
white, heterocl. acc. leuko/xroa ko/man E.Ph. 322 (lyr.): pl. leuko/xroas Ptol.Geog.7.2.17:—also leuko/-xroios, on, Hp. Epid.2.1.10, Phlp.in GA53.3.

leuko/-xru_sos, h(, a gem
of pale gold colour, Plin.HN37.128, 171: as Adj., Lyd.Mag.3.70.
leuko-xrw/matos, on, = leuko/xrws, Phint. ap. Stob.4.23.61a.
leuko/-xrwmos, on, = foreg., ka/mhlos PGrenf.2.74.7 (iv A.D.).

leuko/-xrws, wtos, o(, h(,
white-skinned, colourless, Eub.35, Alex.98.18, Theoc.Ep.2.1, Arist.Phgn.808b4.

leuko/-ya_ros, on,
whitish grey, o)/noi Hippiatr.14.

leuk-o/w,
whiten over, [puci/on] Aen.Tact.31.14; bwmo/n IG22.1672.140:—Med., leukou=sqai ta\ o(/pla
whiten their shields, X.HG2.4.25, cf. 7.5.20; l. po/da
bare the foot, AP9.403 (Maec.). mostly in Pass.,
to be made or
become white, leukwqei\s ka/ra mu/rtois Pi.I.4(3).69; toi=xos leleukwme/nos
whitened or
plastered, Pl.Lg.785a; grammatei=on leleukwme/non, = leu/kwma 1, D.46.11; o( a)/nqrwpos ou) leuko/s e)stin a)lla\ leleu/kwtai Arist.Ph.185b29; of a leper, Ph.1.346; leleukwme/nos pi/nac, of the list of proscribed, D.C.Fr.109.12.

leuk-w/lenos, on,
white-armed, epith. of Hera, Il.1.55, 195, etc.; of Persephone, etc., Hes.Th.913, Pi.P.3.98, etc.; of female slaves, Od.6.239, 18.198, 19.60; l. li/non, perh. with a play on leuko/linon, of a useless woman, Diogenian.6.22.

leu/k-wma, atos, to/,
tablet covered with gypsum, used as a public
notice-board, e)s l. gra/yai, a)nagra/fein, Lys.9.6, Lex ap.D.24.23, IG12(5).647.40 (Ceos), PHib.1.29.9 (iii B.C.), etc.: hence e)n leukw/masin grafh=nai to be posted in a list of defaulters, 'to be sold up', App.Prov.2.63; of the
proscription-list, D.C.47.3; of the
album of senators, Id.55.3: hence oi( tou= l. senators, Procop.Arc.29.
whiteness, Arist.Phgn.813a28.
a white spot in the eye, caused by a thickening of the cornea, PGrenf.1.33.14 (ii B.C.), Dsc.3.84, Gal. 14.775, Sammelb.4414.6 (ii A.D.), Aët.7.39 tit.

leuk-wma^ti/zomai,
to be affected with leu/kwma 11.2, Sch.A.Pr.499.

leuk-wma^tiko/s, h/, o/n,
good for leu/kwma 11.2, kollou/ria Paul.Aeg.3.22.

leuk-wmatw/dhs, es,
of the nature of leu/kwma 11.2, pa/qbs Erot. s.v. a)/rgemon.

leuk-wpi/as: leuko\s o)fqh=nai, Hsch. -wsis, ews, h(, = leu/kwma 11.2, interpol.in Hippiatr.11.
whitening, Olymp.Alch.p.91 B.; of pearls, etc., PHolm.2.36, al.

leuk-wth/s, ou=, o(,
whitewasher, or leuk-wto/s, h/, o/n,
whitewashed, in dat. -wth=|, IG12.374.46.
leu=rai: eu(ri/skw, Hsch.

leuro/s, a/, o/n (also o/s, o/n A.Pr.371), poet. Adj.
smooth, level, even, leurw=| e)ni\ xw/rw| Od.7.123, Orac. ap. Hdt.1.67; *sikeli/as leurou\s gu/as A.l.c.; l. oi)=mos ai)qe/ros ib.396; e)n yama/qw| leura=| E.Hec.700 (lyr.); pe/don, pe/tra, Id.Ph.836, Ba.982 (lyr.); o(doi/ Call.Aet.Oxy.2080.67.
smooth, polished, ci/fos Pi.N.7.27; de/rma . . leuro\n e)/qhke
boo/s AP6.116 (Samus). leura=s swfrosu/nhs: telei/as, kai\ tapeinh=s, koi/lhs, o(malh=s, mh\ traxei/as, Hsch.

leu/simos, on, (leu/w)
stoning, xei\r l. E.Or.863; l. katafqorai/ death
by stoning, Id.Ion1237 (lyr.); qana/tou leu/simon a)/tan ib.1240 (lyr.); qanei=n l. petrw/mati Id.Or.50; l. dou=nai di/khn ib.614, cf. Heracl.60; l. a)rai/ curses
that will end in stoning, A.
Ag..1616;
stoned, qu=ma ib.1118 (lyr.).

leusmo/s, o(,
stoning, A.Eu.189, E.Fr.878.

leu/ssw, by good authors used only in pres. and impf. (in codd. sts. with single s, as also in IG (v.infr.), CIG3284 (Smyrna), Hsch.); Ep. impf. leu=sson Od.8.200; Ion. leu/sseskon Emp.129.5: fut. leu/sw dub. in AP15.7, Man.6.93: aor. opt. leu/sseie ib.487, leu/sseien ib. 620.—Poet. Verb, also used in Arc., IG5(2).16 (Tegea, iii B.C.), cf. *kleitori/wn . . leu/sei: o(ra=| AB1096:—
look or
gaze upon, see, c. acc., Il. 1.120, al., Pi.P.4.145: c. Part., purpole/ontas e)leu/ssomen Od.10.30; of the gods, o( ei)saie\n o(rw=n ku/klos leu/ssei nin *dio/s S.OC705 (lyr.); leu/ssete . . oi(=a pa/sxw Id.Ant.940 (anap.); used by Com. in mock Trag. phrases, Ar.Th.1052, Ra.992 (both lyr.). abs.,
look, gaze, leu/sswn e)pi\ oi)/nopa po/nton Il.5.771; *kuklw/pwn e)s gai=an e)leu/ssomen Od.9.166; e)s au)to/n 8.171, cf. S.OT1254; stato\n ei)s u(/dwr Id.Ph.716 (lyr.); e)s xe/ras E.Ph.596 (troch.); pro/ssw kai\ o)pi/ssw l. Il. 3.110; o( mh\ leu/sswn, like o( mh\ ble/pwn, he that
lives no more, S.Tr.828 (lyr.); so c. acc., ei) leu/ssei fa/os E.Ph.1084, cf. Tr.269 (lyr.). c.acc. cogn., l. foni/ou de/rgma dra/kontos A.Pers.81 (lyr.); lepta/, deino\n l. ko/rais, E.Or.224, 389; fo/non leu=sso/n te prosw/pw| and
looked murder, Theoc.25.137.

leusth/r, h=ros, o(, (leu/w)
one who stones, E.Tr.1039; to\n *kassandre/wn leusth=ra their
oppressor, Ael.NA5.15; so perh. in Hdt.5.67, where the oracle tells Cleisthenes *)/adrhston me\n ei)=nai *sikuwni/wn basile/a, e)kei=non de\ leusth=ra (or perh.
a mere stone-thrower, i.e. yilo/s: Suid., quoting Ael.Fr.115, makes it Pass., = o( kataleusqh=nai a)/cios). as Adj., l. mo/ros death
by stoning, A.Th.199; leusth=ra prw=ton . . r(i/yas pe/tron Lyc.1187, cf. Hsch.
leusto/s, h/, o/n, neut. pl. leuk-a/: o(rata/, liqobo/lhta, Hsch.
leuton, dub. sens. in IG5(2).3, ei) d' a)\n leuton me\ i)nforbi/e (Tegea, iv B.C.).

leux-eimone/w,
to be clad in white, Pl.R.617c, CIG2715.8 (Stratonicea), Str.11.11.8, Ph.1.156.

leux-ei/mwn, onos, o(, h(, (ei(=ma)
clad in white, Phint. ap. Stob.4.23.61a; lew/s Ph.2.188, cf. Orph.H.51.11, Aristid.Or.48(24).31.
leux-hpa^ti/as, ou, o(, = leukhpati/as, Suid.

leu/w, fut. leu/sw （kata-) Ar.Ach.285: aor. e)/leusa （kat-) Hdt.9.5, Th.1.106:—Pass., fut. leusqh/somai J.Ap.2.27: aor. e)leu/sqhn S.OC (v. infr.), Hp.Ep.27: (la=as):—
stone, Th.5.60; pe/trois l. mnh=ma E.El. 328; to\ leusqh=nai pe/trois S.OC435, cf. E.IA1350.

lexai=os, a, on, (le/xos 1)
of or
for a couch, fulla/s A.R.1.1182, cf. Theognost.Can.9. (le/xos 4)
in the nest, te/knwn u(perde/doike lexai/wn for her
nestlings, A.Th.292 (Lachm., for lexe/wn).

lexepoi/h, h(, (le/xos, poi/a)
grown with grass fit to make a bed, i.e.
grassy, meadowy, epith. of various towns, Il.2.697, h.Ap.224, h.Merc. 88:—masc. lexepoi/hs, ou, of the river Asopus, from its grassy banks, Il.4.383, Orac. ap. Hdt.9.43.—Hom. has both forms in acc. sg. only; the dat. occurs ap.Hdt.l.c.
lexe/rna: u(po\ *)argei/wn h( qusi/a e)piteloume/nh th=| *(/hra|, Hsch.

lexh/rhs, es,
bed-ridden, E.Ph.1541 (lyr.).
lexh/ria: e)nh/lata, Hsch. lexma/d . . . : h)/lektron, Id. le/xnh: tro/pos, Id.

le/xomai,
lie down, pres. only in Hsch. le/xetai （leu/xetai cod.): koima=tai, cf. Theognost.Can.139: pf. part. leloxui=a ( = lexw\ genome/nh) Hsch.; other tenses in Ep.: fut. le/comai: aor. e)leca/mhn; also 3sg. aor. e)/lekto, le/kto; imper. le/co, le/ceo (v. infr.):—
lie down, esp. to sleep, le/cetai u(/pnw|
will lie asleep, Il.4.131, cf. Od.7.319; le/comai ei)s eu)nh/n 17.102: aor., pa\r d' *(ele/nh e)le/cato 4.305; tw=| e)/ni leca/sqhn Il. 14.350; leca/sqwn para\ ta/fron
let them bivouac, 9.67, cf. 8.519; e)/lekto Od.19.50, Hes.Sc.46; le/kto Od.4.453, al.; imper. le/co Il.24.650, Od.10.320; le/ceo Il.9.617, Od.19.598. causal in Act.,
lay asleep, lull to sleep, le/con me Il.24.635; e)/leca *dio\s no/on 14.252. (Goth.
ligan, Engl.
lie, etc.)

le/xos, eos, to/, poet. Noun,
couch, bed, Il.1.609, al.: in Hom. freq. in pl.,
bedstead, Il.3.448, al.
bier, usu. in pl., 24.589, 702, IG Rom.4.507a25 (Pergam.), etc.
marriage-bed: and generally,
marriage, e)mo\n l. a)ntio/wsan Il.1.31; o(mo\n l. ei)sanabai/noi 8.291; l. d' h)/| sxune kai\ eu)nh\n *(hfai/stoio a)/naktos Od.8.269, cf. 3.403; e(te/rw| le/xei+, i.e. in adultery, Pi.P.11.24; i)w\ l. kai\ sti/boi fila/nores A.Ag.411 (lyr.); to\ so\n l. cunh=lqon S.Aj.491; l. *(hraklei= . . custa=sa Id.Tr.27; kru/fion w(s e)/xoi le/xos ib.360; le/xous ga\r . . a(gno\n de/mas (sc. e)sti/) E. Hipp.1003: freq. in pl., e)k lexe/wn Pi.P.9.37; lexe/wn *dio\s eu)na/teira A.Pr.895 (lyr.); ta\ numfika\ l. S.OT1243: i(e/menoi lexe/wn Id.Tr.514 (lyr.); gh=mai mei/zw le/xh make a great
marriage, E.El.936; l. ta)llo/tria ib.1089; mikra\ mega/lwn a)mei/nw . . le/xh ib.1099: hence for the concrete, l. new/teron younger
spouse, Sapph.75; sa\ le/xea thy
spouse, E.El.481 (lyr.); w)/lesas kedno\n l. Id.Hipp.835: used by Com. in poet. or mock Trag. passages, l. gamh/lion Ar.Av.1758; kouri/dion l. Id.Pax844; paidi\ summei=cai l. Id.Th.891. a bird's
nest, A. Ag.50 (anap.), S.Ant.425.

le/xosde, Adv.
to bed, Il.3.447, Od.23.294.

le/xrios, a, on, also os, on Call.Del.236: (v. likrifi/s):—
slanting, crosswise, with a Verb, l. o)kla/sas S.OC195 (lyr.); l. e)kpesei=n, xwrei=n, E.Hec.1026 (lyr.), Med.1168; tiqe/nai ta\s kefala\s e)pi\ gh=n lexri/as X.Cyn.4.3: metaph., pa/nta ga\r l. ta)n xeroi=n all the business in hand is
cross, S.Ant.1345 (lyr.).

le/xri^s, Adv.
crosswise, l. te/mnwn a)/po mh/dea patro/s Antim.35, cf. A.R.1.1235, 3.238, 1160.

lexw/, o/os, contr. ou=s, Cyrenaic gen. lexo/s Berl.Sitzb.1927.166, dat. lexoi= ib.158, IG5(1).713, al. (Sparta), lekxoi= Schwyzer323 D13 (Delph., v/iv B.C.): h(: (le/xos):—
woman in childbed or
one who has just given birth, E.El.652, 654, 1108, A Ec.530, Sor.1.77, etc.; of an animal, Opp.C.3.208: pl. lexoi/ Orph.H.2.10; acc. pl. lexou/s Sch. A.R.2.1010 (cod. Par.).
lexw=en: u(lw=des, botanw=des, Hsch.
lex-wi+a/s, a/dos, h(, fem. of sq., nu/mfh l., = lexw/, Nonn.D.48.848.

lex-w/i+os, on, (lexw/)
of or
belonging to childbed, A.R.2.1014; l. dw=ra presents
made at the birth, AP7.166 (Diosc. or Nicarch.). neut. as Subst., *rei/hs . . lexw/i+on
the place where Rhea
bare her child, Call.Jov.14.
lex-wi/+s, i/+dos, h(, = lexw/, A.R.4.136, Call.Dian.127, Del.56, AP6.348 (Diod.).
lex-w/s, = lexw/, dub. l. in LXX Ep.Je. 28.
lew/batos: o(do/s, kai\ i)xqu=s selaxw/dhs, Hsch.; cf. leio/batos.

lew/dhs (A), es, （lew/s） = law/dhs,
popular, common, Gloss.
lew/dhs (B), = liqo/leustos, Theognost.Can.9: liw/dhs, Hsch.; fort. lew/lhs. lewko/nhtos, lewko/nitos, v. le/ws.

*lewko/reion, to/,
the temple of the daughters of Leos, Th.1.20, 6.57.
lewko/rhtos, lew/leqros, lew/lhs, v. le/ws.

lewloge/w,
number the people, Phoen.1.8.
le/w|mi, le/wn, v. lw=.

le/wn, ontos, o(, Ep. dat. pl. lei/ousi Il.5.782, etc., leo/ntessi IG12(2).285 (Mytil., prob.):—
lion, w)mofa/goi l. Il.l.c.; ai)/qwn 18.161; xaropoi/ Od.11.611; o)resi/trofos 6.130, cf. Hdt.7.126; cf. li/s: metaph., of Artemis, se\ le/onta gunaici\ *zeu\s qh=ken Zeus made thee a
lion toward women (because she was supposed to cause their sudden death), Il. 21.483; used of savage persons, A.Ch.938 (lyr.); but also, of brave men, Id.Ag.1259, E.Or.1401 (lyr.), 1555; of a baby, Ar.Th.514 (but by way of contrast, of a coward, le/ont' a)/nalkin, of Aegisthus, A.Ag. 1224); oi)/koi me\n le/ontes, e)n ma/xh| d' a)lw/pekes Ar.Pax1189 (lyr.); a)nti\ le/ontos pi/qhkon gi/gnesqai Pl.R.590b; curei=n e)pixeirei=n le/onta, of a dangerous undertaking, 'to bell the cat', ib.341c. Leo, the sign in the Zodiac, Eudox. ap. Hipparch.1.2.8, Euc.Phaen.p.12 M., Arat.148, IG14.1307. = leonth=,
lion's skin, Luc.Hist.Conscr.10. as an ornament, BGU387ii5 (ii A.D.). a kind of
crab, Diph.Siph. ap.Ath.3.106c, Ael.NA14.9. a kind of
serpent, Nic.Th.463, f.l. in Artem.2.13. = leonti/asis, Aret.SD2.13. a kind of
dance, Ath.14.629f, Poll.4.104. title of grade of initiates in the mysteries of Mithras, Porph.Abst.4.16. a
sea-monster, Ael.NA9.49, Opp.H.1.367, Nonn.D.1.273. = o)roba/gxh, Dsc.2.142, Gp.2.42 tit.
lewpa/thtos, v. le/ws.
lewpetri/a, h(, = lei/a pe/tra, D.S.3.16 ( = Agatharch.34), LXX Ez. 24.8, al.; lewpe/tra is f.l. in Hsch.; cf. liope/trion.

lewrgo/s, o/n, (Adv. le/ws, e)/rgon)
one who will do anything (cf. r(a|diou=rgos, panou=rgos),
villainous, A.Pr.5; of actions, lewrga\ ka)qe/mista (fort. kai\ qemista/) Archil.88.3: Sup. -o/tatos X.Mem.1.3.9, Ael.NA 16.5; cf. leourgo/s, litourgo/s.
lew/s, w/, o(, Att. and Ion. for lao/s (q.v.).

le/ws or lei/ws, Ion. Adv.
entirely, wholly, at all, lei/ws ga\r ou)de\n e)fro/neon Archil.112, cf. Hp. ap. Erot.et Gal.19.118:—elsewh. only found in the compds. lewrgo/s (q.v.); lew-ko/nhtos, lex-ko/nitos, or lex-ko/rhtos,
utterly destroyed, Theognost.Can.9, Hsch., Phot.: lew/leqros, lew/lhs, es,
utterly destroyed, Hsch. (also leiw/lhs, q.v., cf. liwleqri/a Hsch.): lewpa/thtos [a^], on, v.l. for lakpa/thtos, S.Ant. 1275.—The Gramm. expl. it as shortd. for tele/ws, A.D.Pron.58.12, Erot.l.c. (ubi li/ws codd.), Gal.l.c. (ubi male lew=s), EM560.31.

lewsfe/teros, on, only in Hdt.9.33, lewsfe/teron e)poih/santo *teisameno/n made him
one of their own people, their fellow-citizen.
lewfo/ros, on, v. laofo/ros. lh=|, lh=|s, etc., v. lw=. lhbo/le: liqobo/le, a)/cie liqasqh=nai, Hsch. lhboli/a: dhmosi/a kopri/a, Id.

lh/gw, Ep. aor. e)/llhca A.R.2.84:—
stay, abate, *)idomeneu\s d' ou) lh=ge me/nos me/ga Il.13.424, cf. 21.305; l. go/on AP7.549 (Leon. Alex., s.v.l.): c. gen., ou)de/ ken w(\s e)/ti xei=ras e)ma\s lh/caimi fo/noio
would stay my hands
from slaughter, Od.22.63. more freq. intr.,
leave off, cease, of speaking, etc., ou) lh/cw, pri\n . . Il.19.423; ou)de/ t' e)/lhge qeo\s me/gas 21.248; e)n soi\ me\n lh/cw, se/o d' a)/rcomai 9.97, cf. Hes. Op.368; l. [h( a)trapo\s] kata\ *)alphno\n po/lin
comes to an end at . . , Hdt.7.216, cf. Th.7.6; h( h(me/rh e)/lhge Hdt.9.52, cf. X.An.7.6.6; of heat, wind, rain, etc., l. me/nos h)eli/oio Hes.Op.414; lh/cantos ou)/rou Pi.P.4.292; yaka\s l., no/tos l., A.Ag.1534 (lyr.), S.Aj.258 (anap.); a(/ma tw=| tou= sw/matos a)/nqei lh/gonti Pl.Smp.183e. c. gen.,
stop, cease from a thing, e)/ridos, xo/loio, fo/noio, a)pata/wn, po/nou, xoroi=o, Il.1.319,224, 6.107, Od.13.294, Il.10.164, 3.394; a)oidh=s Hes.Th.48 (dub. l.); klauma/twn A.Pers.705 (troch.); qrh/nwn, go/wn, S.El.104 (anap.), 353; o)du/nhs Pl.Phdr.255d; l. tou= bi/ou, i.e. to
die, X.Ap.8; fu/lla pto/rqoio l. Hes.Op.421; also l. a)p' e)/rgwn A.R.4.928: c. dat., l. th=| au)qadi/a| PTeb.16.9 (ii B.C.). c. part., o(po/te lh/ceien a)ei/dwn Il. 9.191, cf. Od.8.87; ou) pri\n lh/cw . . e)nari/zwn Il.21.224; eu)=t' a)\n fle/gwn . . h(/lios xqo/na lh/ch| A.Pers.365, cf. 831; to\ ske/los r(i/yantes lh/gomen Ar.Pax332; lh/gei kinou/menon Pl.Phdr.245c, etc. with Preps., l. e)/s ti Hdt.4.39, Plot.3.2.2; e)pi\ tw=n o)neidw=n App.Hisp.75 (73). Gramm.,
terminate, of a word, ei)s e_ l. A.D.Pron.11.9, cf. D.T.639.20; also lh/gesqai c. dat., makra=|, braxei/a|, An.Ox.2.
313.
follow logically, Them.in Ph.115.5; to\ lh=gon, opp. to\ h(gou/menon, the
consequent, opp.antecedent, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.70, S.E. P.2.111, 112. of months, = fqi/nw, IG12(3).325.20 (Thera); also peri\ lh/gonta to\n e)niauto/n D.24.98; tou= xeimw=nos -ontos Th.5.81; so perh. ei)s to\ lh=gon is to be read for ei)s to\ lh=gos in Gp.12.1.4.
*lh/da, as, h(, Leda, A.Ag.914, etc.:—the forms *lh/dh, hs, only Ep., as Od.11.298.

lh/da^non or la/da^non [la_], to/, （lh=don） = ki/sqos,
gum-ladanum, to\ lh/danon, to\ kale/ousi *)ara/bioi la/danon Hdt.3.112, cf. 107, Hp.Mul.2.189, Plu.2.397a, Ruf. ap. Gal.12.425, Heraclid.ib.436, Gal.12.28, al., Wilcken Chr.273i15 (ii/iii A.D.). (lh- Hdt. ll.cc., Hp.l.c. (cod. opt.), Plu.l.c., also (in verse) Ruf. l.c.; la- Heraclid., Gal., Wilcken Chr.ll.cc., v.l. in Hp.l.c.).
lhda/rion [a^], to/, Dim. of lh=dos, Ar.Av.715, 915 (v.l. lh|da/rion).
lhdei=n: kopia=n, kekmhke/nai, and lhdh/sas: kekmhkw/s, kopia/sas, Hsch.

lh/dion or lhdi/on, to/, Dim. of lh=dos, IG22.1514.45, 1516.23, 1517.149, 151 (iv B.C.):—also lh/|dion or lh|di/on, to/, Men.1028, Clearch. 25, Machoap.Ath.13.582d sq., Hsch.; cj. Toup for lh/i+on, Suid.; cf. lh=dos, lhi+diw/deis.

lh=don, to/,
shrub from which the gum lh/danon exudes,
Cistus cyprius, Dsc.1.97, Plin.HN26.47.

lh=dos, Dor. la=dos, eos, to/,
a cheap common dress, esp.
a light summer dress, Alcm.97 (so Did.; la=idos Hsch.): more freq. in Dim. forms, lh/dion or lhdi/on, to/, and lhda/rion (qq.v.).
lh/|zomai, v. lhi/+zomai.

lh/qaios or lhqai=os, a, on, (lh/qh)
of or
causing forgetfulness, ptero/n, of Sleep, Call.Del.234; sko/tos Lyc.1127, etc. of persons,
oblivious, opp. e)/mfrwn, S.E.M.7.129.
of or
from Lethe, a)/katos AP9.279 (Bass.); v.lh/qh 11. l. li/qos, = meliti/ths l., Ps.-Dsc.476 ed. Sarac.
lhqa/nemos, v.laqa/nemos. lhqa/nw, v.e)klhqa/nw, lanqa/nw B.

lhqarg-e/w,
forget, PMag.Lond.122.91:—Pass., CIG2804 (Aphrodisias), Sch.Pi.N.6.30.

lhqarg-i/a, h(,
drowsiness, Com.Adesp.344 (pl.).

lhqarg-iko/s, h/, o/n,
affected by lethargic fever, Hp.Coac.136, Praxag. ap.Gal.17(1).889, Ruf. ap. Orib.7.26.129, 8.24.30, AP9.141.

lh/qarg-os, on, (lh/qh)
forgetful, c.gen., ib.5.151 (Mel.), 12.80 (Id.): abs., Men. 1029, Phld.Rh.1.6 S.:—later word for e)pilh/smwn, acc. to Phryn. 390.
lethargic, a)lh/qargos (sic) ei)s u(/pnon e)fero/mhn POxy.1381.100 (ii A.D.). as Subst., o( and h(,
lethargy, Hp.Morb.2.65, al., Lyc.241, Ant.Lib.23.2, Gal.10.931, Paul.Aeg.3.9: in pl., Arist. Somn.Vig.457a3, Chrysipp.Stoic.3.57; coupled with melagxoli/a, ibid.
lethargic fever, Hp.Aph.3.30. Cf.lai/qargos.
lhqarg-w/dhs, es, = lhqargiko/s, Dsc.Ther.15, Gal.7.466. Adv. -dw=s Dsc.4.64.

lhqed-a^no/s, h/, o/n,
causing forgetfulness, fa/rmakon Luc.Salt.79, Philops.39.
lhqed-w/n, o/nos, h(, poet. for lh/qh, AP7.17 (Tull.Laur.), APl.4.244 (Agath.).

lh/q-h, Dor. la/qa, h(,
forgetting, forgetfulness, personified in Hes. Th.227; mhde/ se lh/qh ai(rei/tw Il.2.33; [*persefo/nh] brotoi=s pare/xei lh/qhn, bla/ptousa no/oio Thgn.705; kakou= l. S.Ph.878, cf.E.Ba.282, Or.213; lh/qhn poieu/menos ta/ min e)o/rgee
forgetting . . , Hdt.1.127; l. poiei=n tinos S.Fr.259; *lh/qhn . . kwfh/n, a)/naudon Id.Fr.670; xro/nos pa/nta . . e)s l. a)/gei Id.Fr.954; tw=n i)di/wn l. labw/n Timocl.6.5, cf. Phld. Rh.1.254 S.; tw=n au(tou= kakw=n e)pa/gesqai l. Men.467; pare/xein Pl. Phdr.275a; e)mpoiei=n Id.Phlb.63e; lh/qhn e)mpoih=sai tw=n pepragme/nwn Isoc.1.8; ei)s lh/qhn e)mbalei=n tina Aeschin.3.205; lh/qh lamba/nei, e)/xei tina/, Th.2.49, D.18.283; lh/qh tino\s e)ggi/gnetai/ tini X.Mem.1.2.21; ei)s l. a)figme/na
forgotten, Phld.Ir.p.19 W. after Hom., of
a place of oblivion in the lower world, *lh/qhs do/moi Simon.184.6; to\ *lh/qhs pedi/on Ar.Ra.186; to\ th=s *l. p. Pl.R.621a, D.H.8.52; *l. u(/dwr Luc.DMort.13.6, Paus.9.39.8, Aesop.168; also, o( th=s *lh/qhs potamo/s, of the river *limai/as in Lusitania, Str.3.3.4, 5, cf. App.Hisp.73 (71). (*lh/qh as pr. n. of a river is not found.)
lhq-hke/a: ei)s lh/qhn a)/gonta fa/rmaka, Hsch.
lhq-h/mwn, on, only dat.pl.lhqh/mosi （lhqhmo/noisi cod.): lhqa/rgois, Id.

lh/q-ios, on,
causing forgetfulness, po/ma Zonar. = laqrai=os, Hsch.

lhqome/rimnos, on,
banishing cares, nu/c Orph.H.3.6 codd. (lusim- Abel).
lh=qon: balio/n, Hsch.
lh=qos, Dor. la=qos, eos, to/, = lh/qh, Theoc.23.24.
lhqo/ths, htos, h(, = lh/qh, Suid., Zonar.
lh/qw, lh/qomai, collat. forms of lanqa/nw, lanqa/nomai (q.v.).
*lhqw/, = *lhtw/, Pl.Cra.406a.

lhqw/dhs, es, (lh/qh)
lethargic, u(/pnos Hsch.s.v.kw=ma.
lhi+a/neira [i^a^n]: h( poiou=sa tou\s a)/ndras gunaikw=n e)ra=n, Hsch.

lhi+-a/s, a/dos, h(, poet. fem. of lhi/+dios,
taken prisoner, captive, gunai=kes Il.20.193; Ep.dat.lhi+a/dessi A.R.1.612.

lhi+-both/r, h=ros, o(, (lh/i+on A)
crop-consuming, crop-destroying, Suid., etc.: fem., su=s lhi+bo/teira Od. 18.29.

lhi/+dios, a, on, (lhi/+s)
taken as booty, captive, AP6.20 (Jul.Aegypt.), APl.4.203 (Id.), Tryph.679.
lhi+diw/deis: tribwniw/deis （-i/des cod.), Hsch.; cf. lh/dion.

lhi/+zomai, Ep.and Ion., Hes.Op.702, Hdt.4.112; lh/|zomai, X.HG 5.1.1, AP9.410 (Tull. Sab.), etc.: also lei/+zomai, ib.6.169; Att. impf. e)lh|zo/mhn Th.1.24, etc.: Ep. fut. lhi/+ssomai Od.23.357: aor. e)lhi+sa/mhn Hdt.3.47, And.1.101; Ep. lhi/+ssato Il.18.28; Att. e)lh/|sato E.Tr.866: pf. in pass. sense le/lh|smai, v. infr. 11:—
seize, carry off as booty, either men or things, dmw|ai\ a(\s *)axileu\s lhi/+ssato Il.l.c., cf. Od.1.398, 23.357, Hdt.3.47, 4.110, al.: e)k do/mwn da/marta . . e)lh/|sato E.l.c.; e)k th=s *)attikh=s X.HG5.1.1, etc.: generally,
win, acquire, o)/lbon a)po\ glw/sshs lhi/+ssetai Hes.Op.322; ou) ga/r ti gunaiko\s a)nh\r lhi/+zet' a)/meinon th=s a)gaqh=s ib.702, cf. Semon.6.
plunder, despoil, esp. by raids or forays, a)llh/lous Th.1.5, cf. 3.85, 5.115, And.1.101, etc.; th\n *kolxi/da X.An.4.8.23; th\n qa/lattan D.S.11.88, Jul.Or.7.210a: metaph., l. th\n tw=n zw/|wn fu/sin Pl.Epin.976a. abs.,
plunder, SIG38B 20 (Teos, v B.C.), Hdt.4.112, Lys.20.24 (prob.), etc. Act. lhi/+zw occurs in several Mss. of Th.3.85, and all Mss. of Id.4.41:—so in Pass.,
to be carried off, e)k gh=s barba/rou lelh|sme/nh E.Med.256; gunaiko\s . . ou) bi/a| lelh|sme/nhs Id.Tr.373; lhi+sqei=sa A.R. 4.400; ou)/ ti/ pou lelh/|smeq' e)c a)/ntrwn le/xos; I
have not surely
had my wife
carried off . . , E.Hel.475; lhi+zo/menos
robbed, Luc.Gall.14.
lhi/+h, h(, Ion. for lei/a (q.v.). lh/i+mnos: eu)/botos, Hsch.

lhi/+nh, h(, = Lat.
laena, cloak, PGiss.76.5 (ii A.D.).

lhi+no/mos [i^], on,
dwelling in the country, APl.4.94 (Arch.).

lh/i+on (A), Dor. la=|on (q.v.), to/,
standing crop, w(s d' o(/te kinh/sh| *ze/furos baqu\ l. Il.2.147, al., cf. Hes.Sc.288, Hdt.1.19, Pherecr.20 (pl.); tou= si/tou to\ l. Arist.HA612a32; l. si/tou baqu/ Arr.An.1.4.1; lh/i+a/ te staxu/wn IG14.1389ii 10. in later Poets, also,
corn-field, Theoc.10.42 (in Dor. form); lhi/+ou ko/mh| Babr.88.3. = lei/a,
booty, SIG3g (Susa, from Didyma, v B.C.).
lh/i+on (B), to/, v.lh/|dion.

lh-i/+s, Dor. la_i/+s, i/+dos, h(, Ep. form of lei/a,
booty, spoil, mostly of cattle, lhi/+da d' e)k pedi/ou sunela/ssamen . . , penth/konta bow=n a)ge/las, ktl. Il.11.677, cf. X.Lac.13.11; then of all kinds of
booty, Il.9.138, 18.327, Od.10.41; plazo/menoi kata\ lhi/+da 3.106: in A.Th.331 (lyr.), concrete for ai)xma/lwtoi, cf. A.R.1.695; cf. lhi+a/s. without any notion of plunder,
cattle, stock (cf. lei/a）, lhi/+d' a)e/cein, boukoli/as t' a)ge/las tekai\ ai)po/liaplate/' ai)gw=n Hes.Th.444, cf.Theoc.25.97.
lh-i+sqiw=n: trepo/menos, Hsch.
lh-i+smadi/a: ai)xma/lwtos, lelhi+sme/nh, Id.
lh-i+sth/r, h=ros, o(, v. lh|sth/r.
lh-i+sth/s, ou=, o(, = Att. lh|sth/s, h.Bacch.7, Hdt. 6.17, SIG38B20 (Teos, v B.C.), Democr.260, A.R.1.750.

lh-i+sto/s, h/, o/n,
to be carried off as booty, to be won by force, Il.9.406: also in form lei+sto/s, ib.408, Inscr.Prien.268c5.

lh-i+stu/s, u/os, h(,
plundering, zh=n a)po\ . . lhi+stu/os Hdt.5.6.
lh-i/+stwr, oros, o(, = lhi+sth/r, Od.15.427, Nic.Th.347: in Prose lh/|stwr, Sammelb.4309.14 (iii B.C.) as Adj., lhi/+stori xalkw=| AP9.649 (Maced.).
lh-i+tiai/: h(gemoni/ai, stratiai/, Hsch.

lh-i=tis, idos, h(,
she who makes or
dispenses booty, epith. of Athena, Il.10.460, Paus.5.14.6. Pass., = lhi+a/s, A.R. 1.818, Lyc.105.
lhi+toa/rxai: oi( kaqhgou/menoi tw=n qusiw=n kai\ e(stia/sewn, kai\ a)rxai\ kai\ i(erei=s, Hsch. (Cf. lh/|tarxos.)

lh/i+ton, to/, (lao/s, lew/s)
town-hall, council-chamber, as the Achaeans of Achaea Phthiotis called it, Hdt.7.197; = dhmo/sion acc. to Plu. Rom.26, Id.2.280a:—Hsch. has la/i+ton: to\ a)rxei=on, lai/+twn: tw=n dhmosi/wn to/pwn; cf. laieto/n, lai=stron, Suid., Zonar.:—Hsch. also quotes lhi/+th, lh|th/, = i(e/reia, a
public priestess.
lhi+tourge/w, lh-ourgo/s, early forms of lh|t-, leit- (q.v.).
lhka/w, (lhkw/) = laika/zw, aor. inf. lhkh=sai Pherecr.177:—Pass., of the woman, Ar.Th.493; lhkou/mesq' (sic) Pherecr.l.c. lhka=n: to\ pro\s w)|dh\n o)rxei=sqai, Hsch.

lh/khma, atos, to/, (lhka/w)
wenching, in pl., Epicur.Fr.414; or perh. from lhke/w (cf. sq.),
bawling, = a)nakrau/gasma.

lhkhth/s, ou=, o(, (lhke/w)
bawler, a)gorai/wn l. e)pe/wn Timo 42.

lhki/nda pai/zein,
beat time, tattoo, Luc.Lex.8, A.D.Adv.152.11.

lhkte/on, (lagxa/nw)
one must lay claim to, o(/lou tou= klh/rou Is.7.23.

lhk-th/rios, a, on, (lh/gw)
extreme, nh=son ei)s lhkthri/an to
the farthest bounds of the island, Lyc.966, cf. 1391 (s.v.l.).
lhk-to/s: katalhpto/s, Hsch.
lhkuq-ia/des: e)nw/tia poia/, Hsch.

lhkuq-i/zw,
declaim in a hollow voice, as though speaking into a lh/kuqos, tragw|do\s *mou=sa-i/zousa Call.Fr.10.13 P., Phryn.PSp.86 B., Poll.4.114, 7.182: c.acc., qe/seis l.
declaim commonplaces, Str.13.1.54.

lhku/q-ion, to/, Dim. of lh/kuqos,
small oilflask, Ar.Ra.1200-1246, D.24.114, PTeb.221 (ii B.C.), Anon. ap. Suid., etc. name for the Trochaic hephthemimer, originating with the form lhku/<*>qion a)p<*>w/les<*>en in Ar.l.c., Heph.6.2.

lhkuq-ismo/s, o(,
hollow, affected speaking, Plu.2.1086e, Anon. ap. Suid.

lhkuq-isth/s, ou=, o(,
one who declaims in a hollow voice, S.Fr.1063.

lhku^qo-poio/s, o(,
maker of oil-flasks, Str.15.1.67.

lhku^qo-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
seller of oil-flasks, Poll.7.182.

lh/ku^qos (Dor. la/kuqos [a_] IG42(1).123.130 (Epid., iv B.C.)), h(,
oil-flask, dw=ken de\ xruse/h| e)n lhku/qw| u(gro\n e)/laion Od.6.79, cf. 215, Hp. Morb.4.51, Ph.Bel.102.41, etc.;
casket for unguents, cosmetics, etc., S.Fr.130; ai( de\ lh/kuqoi mu/rou ge/mousi Ar.Pl.810, cf. Fr.207; buried or burnt with the dead, Id.Ec.538, 996, 1032, cf. IG14.865, CIG 8346
k. in pl.,
rhetorical bombast, Cic.Att.1.14.3, Plin.Ep.1.2.4.
projecting cartilage on the gullet, Adam's apple, = bro/xqos, Clearch.72.

lhku^qofo/ros, on,
carrying an oil-flask, Poll.3.154.
lhku^ti/a, h(, = lh/kuqos, BGU1160.11 (pl.).

lhkw/, ou=s, h(,
membrum virile (whence lhka/w), Hsch., Phot.

lh=ma, atos, to/, (lw=)
will, desire, purpose, Epich.182 (prob.l.): concrete, l. *korwni/dos
wilful Coronis, Pi.P.3.25; mhtrw=|on l. thy
proud mother, S.El.1427; lh/matos ka/kh weakness
of will, cowardice,
A.Th.616; h(/kista tou)mo\n l. e)/fu turanniko/n E.Med.348; e)s to\ ke/rdos l. e)/xwn a)neime/non Id.Heracl.3, cf. 199, Alc.981 (lyr.), Ba.1000 (lyr.).
temper of mind, spirit, either, in good sense,
courage, resolution, eu)/tolmon yuxh=s l. Simon.140; gennai=on l. Pi.P. 8.45, cf. N.1.57; ai)/qwn l. fiery
in courage, A.Th.448; du/o lh/masin i)/sous *)atrei/+das Id.Ag.122 (lyr.); tocoulkw=| lh/mati pistoi/ relying on their archer
spirit, Id.Pers.55 (anap.); a)rei/faton l. Id.Fr.147; pe/tras to\ l. ka)da/mantos E.Cyc.596; l. ou)k a)/tolmon Ar.Nu.457 (lyr.); kaq' *(hrakle/a . . to\ l. e)/xwn Id.Ra.463; or, in bad sense,
insolence, arrogance, audacity, o(/son l. e)/xwn a)fi/kou S.OC877 (lyr.); w)= lh=m' a)naide/s ib.960; dh=lon . . ta)nqrw/pou' sti to\ lh=ma Ar.Nu.1350 (lyr.).— Poet. word, also used in Ion. Prose, in signf.
spirit, courage, e)/rga xeirw=n te kai\ lh/matos Hdt.5.72; lh/matos ple/os ib.111, cf. 7.99, 9.62: and in late Prose, as D.S.2.58 (pl.), J.BJ3.10.4, Luc.Dem.Enc.50, etc.; defined by Andronic.Pass.p.575 M.

lhma^le/os, a, on, (lh/mh)
bleared, of the eyes, Luc.Lex.4.

lhma^t-i/as, ou, o(,
high-spirited, l. ka)ndrei=os ei)= Ar.Ra.494; cf. sq.

lhma^t-ia/w,
to be high-spirited, v.l. in Ar.l.c.
lhma^/t-ion, to/, Dim. of lh=ma, = fro/nhma, Hsch. (pl.).
lhma^t-o/omai, in pf. Pass. lelhma/twmai: lh=ma e)/xw ei)s to\ e)/rgon, Id.

lhm-a/w, only pres., (lh/mh)
to be bleared, of the eyes, Hp.Prorrh. 2.18;
to be blear-eyed or
purblind, lhma=n koloku/ntais
to have one's eyes running pumpkins, Ar.Nu.327, cf. Hsch.; l. kai\ a)mbluw/ttein Luc.Tim.2, etc.: metaph., *kronikai=s lh/mais l. ta\s fre/nas Ar.Pl. 581.

lh/m-h, h(,
a humour that gathers in the corner of the eye, rheum, Hp. VM19, Prog.2: in pl.,
sore eyes, Ar.Lys.301 (v. Sch.): metaph., h( tou= *peiraie/ws l. the
eye-sore of Piraeus, of Aegina, Pericles ap.Arist. Rh.1411a15, Plu.Per.8; *kronikai\ lh=mai old prejudices
that dim the mind's eye, Ar.Pl.581; o)/yews l. h( deisidaimoni/a Plu.2.1101c. (Cf. la/mas.)

lhm-hro/s, h/, o/n,
misty, lhmhrh=| nefe/lh| ei)lume/nos o)/sse Heliod. ap.Stob.4.36.8.
lhm-i/on, to/, Dim. of lh/mh, Hp.Coac.214, Epid.1.5.

lh=mma, atos, to/, (lamba/nw)
anything received, opp. do/ma, Antig. ap. Plu.2.182e; l. kai\ a)na/lwma
receipt and expense, Lys.32.20, Pl.Lg. 920c, Anaxandr.26; a)nenegkei=n （e)n- Pap.) e)n lh/mmati place to
credit, PEleph.15.4 (iii B.C.), cf. BGU1346.2 (i B.C.), etc.: generally,
gain, profit, D.5.12, etc.; l. ti ke/rdous Id.45.14; esp. of
unjust gain, Din. 1.45; panto\s h(/ttwn lh/mmatos unable to resist any temptation
of gain, D.19.339; w(/sper a)\n truta/nh e)pi\ to\ l. r(e/pein Id.18.298; l. labei=n Id.21.28, 27.39: freq. in pl., S.Ant.313, D.8.25, etc.; ta\ l. tou= a)rguri/ou Id.49.57; lhmma/twn mete/xein Id.58.40; ta)po\ *qra/|khs l. e(/lkousi deu=ro Antiph.196. in Logic,
statement taken as true,
assumption; esp.
premiss in a syllogism, e)pi\ l. tw=| toiou/tw| A.D.Synt.245.13; ta\ oi)kei=a th=| e)pisth/mh| l. Arist.Top.101a14; lh/mmata tiqe/nai ib. 156a21, cf. Gell.9.16, Phld.Rh.1.9 S.; prop.
the major premiss (the minor being pro/slhyis), Crinis Stoic.3.269; later, a)podeiktika\ lh/mmata parasxei=n offer scientific
proofs, Gal.14.627.
matter, substance, or
argument of a sentence, etc., opp. form or style (le/cis), D.H.Dem.20, Longin.15.10, etc.: hence,
title or
argument of an epigram, Lat.
lemma, Mart.14.2;
theme or
thesis, Plin.Ep.4.27.3, Mart.10.59;
nutricis lemmata, 'baby songs', Aus.Ep.12.90. in LXX,
burden laid on one,
commission received, esp. of
prophecy, Na. 1.1, Je.23.33, al.; even, lh=mma i)dei=n Hb.1.1, cf. La.2.14.

lhmma^t-i/zw,
place to credit, PFlor.361.7 (iii A.D.), etc.
assume, posit, ta\ lelhmmatisme/na
premisses, A.D.Synt.101.27.

lhmma^t-iko/s, h/, o/n,
quick at seizing opportunity, Hp.Decent.3.
lhmma^/t-ion, to/, Dim. of lh=mma, Ptol.Alm.1.10, Olymp.in Mete.261.27, Dam.Pr.233, 396, al., Zonar.

lhmma^t-isth/s, ou=, o(,
receiver of taxes, PKlein.Form.51 (vi A.D.).
*lhmniako/s, Dor. *la_mn-, v. *lh=mnos.

*lhmniastai/, oi(,
worshippers of the Lemnian deities, IG12(1).43 (Rhodes, i B.C.). *lh/mnios, v. *lh=mnos.

*lh=mnos, h(, Dor. *la=mnos, Lemnos, Il.1.593, al., Od.8.283; sacred to Hephaestus, Sch.A.R.1.851, etc.: *lamno/qen, Adv.
from Lemnos, Pi. P.1.52:—Adj. *lh/mnios, a, on, Lemnian, pu=r S.Ph.800, Ar.Lys.299; *l. e)/rga, prov. from the wickedness of certain Lemnian women, Hdt. 6.138, cf. A.Ch.631 (lyr.); *l. a)/mpeloi Ar.Pax1162:—also *lhmniako/s, Dor. *lamn- Call.Fr.1.44 P.:—also fem. *lhmnia/s ( *lamnia/s), a/dos, Pi.O.4.22; *lhmni/s, i/dos, mi/ltos Nic.Th.865.

lhm-o/ths, htos, h(, (lh/mh)
soreness of eyes, Sch.Ar.Nu.326.
lhm-u/drion, to/, Dim. of lh/mh, Gal.17(1).868.

lhmyapo/dosis, ews, h(,
receipts and payments, PLond.1.77.50 (vi A.D.).
lh=myis, = lh=yis (q.v.): lh/myomai, = lh/yomai, v. lamba/nw.

lhm-w/dhs, es, (lh/mh)
full of rheum, Alex.Trall.2.

lh/m-wsis, ews, h(,
secretion of rheum in the eyes, PMed.in Sitzb.Heidelb.Akad.1913 (13).33,41.
lh=n, inf. of lw=; but lh/n: li/an, Hsch.

*lhna_ge/tas, a, o(, (*lh=nai)
leader of Bacchanals, qoa=n *lhnage/ta *bakxa=n BMus.Inscr.902 (Halic., iii B.C.).
*lh=nai ( *lhnai/ Hsch.), ai(, (lhno/s 1) Bacchanals, Heraclit.14, Str.10.3.10, D.P.702, 1155, Theoc.26 tit. (Arc. acc. to Hsch.）

*lhna^-i/+zw,
celebrate Bacchanal rites, Heraclit.15.

*lhna^-i+ko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
belonging to the *lh/naia, a)gw=nes Posidipp. ap. Ath.7.414e; didaskali/ai Plu.2.839d; qe/atron *l. Poll.4.121.

lhnai=os, a, on, (lhno/s 1)
belonging to the wine-press; esp. epith. of Dionysus, as
god of the wine-press, D.S.3.63. *lh/naia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
the Lenaea, an Athenian (also Rhodian, IG12(1).125) festival held in the month *lhnaiw/n (i.e. Gamelion) in honour of Dionysus, at which there were dramatic contests, esp. of the Com. Poets, Ar.Ach.1155 (lyr.). *lh/naion, to/,
the Lenaeum, the place at Athens where the Lenaea were held, ou(pi\ *lhnai/w| a)gw/n the Lenaean dramatic contest, opp. ta\ kat' a)/stu, ib.504, cf. Pl.Prt.327d, Lex ap. D.21.10; *dionu/sia ta\ e)pi\ *lhnai/w| SIG1029.9 (iv B.C.).
*lhn-a_i/+ths [i_], ou, o(, = *lhnai+ko/s, qo/rubos Ar.Eq.547 (anap.).
*lhn-aiw/n, w=nos, o(, name of a month in many Greek calendars, Hes.Op.504, SIG1014.94 (Erythrae), etc.
*lhn-eu/s, e/ws, o(, epith. of Dionysus, ib.1024.24 (Myconos).
lhn-eu/w, = bakxeu/w, Hsch.

lhn-ew/n, w=nos, o(,
the place of the lhno/s 1, Gp.6.1.3.
lhn-i/dion, to/, Dim. of lhno/s, PTeb.414.37 (ii A.D., prob.), POxy.2153.4 (iii A.D.).

lhn-i/s, i/dos, h(,
a Bacchante, Eust.629.30, Suid. = lhno/s 2 or 3, PTeb.414.31 (ii A.D.); = lhno/s 4, EM478.28 (lini/da codd.).

lhno-ba/ths [a^], ou, o(,
one who treads the wine-vat, Him.Or.6.3, 21.6, Sammelb.5810.12 (iv A.D.), Gloss.

lhno-pa^te/w,
tread the wine-press, Hsch. s.v. trapei=n.

lhno/-pi^qos, o(,
vat, PMasp.97.2 (vi A.D.).
lhno-poio/s, o(, = lhnoba/ths, Gloss.

lhno/s, Dor. la_no/s Theoc.7.25, IG14.150.5 (Syracuse): h(:—
anything shaped like a tub or
trough, Hp.Mochl.38; esp.
winevat in which the grapes are pressed, PCair.Zen.300.15 (iii B.C.), Theoc.7.25, 25.28, D.S.3.63.
trough, for watering cattle,
watering-place for them, h.Merc.104, LXX Ge.30.38,41. = ka/rdopos,
kneading-trough, Men.116.
socket into which the mast fitted, = i(stope/dh, Asclep.Myrl. ap. Ath.11.474f, Poll.1.91.
coffin, Pherecr.5, CIG1979, al. (Thessalonica), IGl.c. part of the brain,
the meeting-point of the sinuses of the dura mater, still called
torcular Herophili, Herophil. ap. Gal.2.712, cf. UP9.6.
hollow of a chariot, Hsch. (pl.). in pl.,
the lower parts of the nose, Poll.2.80.

lh=nos, eos, to/,
wool: hence,
fillet, A.Eu.44, Epic.in Arch.Pap.7p.4 (pl.): in pl.,
fleece, A.R.4.173, 177.
lhnw/n, w=nos, o(, = lhnew/n, PLond.2.401.13 (ii B.C.).

lhciarx-iko/s, h/, o/n,
belonging to the lhci/arxos: to\ l. grammatei=on the register of each Athenian deme, IG12.79.6, Is.7.27, D.44.35, Lycurg.76, etc.
lhci/arx-os, o(, the officer at Athens who kept order in the e)kklhsi/a, Poll.8.104.

lhci^pu/retos [u^], on, （lh=cis B)
allaying fever, Asclep. ap. Gal.14.136:—also lhcopu/retos, Gal.13.68, 1013.

lh=cis (A), ews, h(, Ion. la/cis (q.v.), (lagxa/nw)
determination or
appointment by lot, a)rxh=s Pl.Lg.765d.
portion assigned by lot, allotment, ib.740a, 747e, Criti.109c, 113b; cf. la/cis.
section of a body, determined by lot, Arist.Ath.30.3, 31.3. pl.,
fortunes, ai( dia/foroi th=s a)nqrwpei/as yuxh=s lh/ceis Simp.
in de An.4.6. without the notion of lot or chance,
assigned sphere, qew=n kai\ tw=n ei)s qei/an lh=cin poreuqe/ntwn Jul.Or.6.187c; h( e(te/ra l. the other
world, Hld.2.24; h( e(w/|a l. the eastern
part of the empire, Procop. Gaz.Pan.497.3; h( th=s *)aqhna=s l. the
sphere of Athena, Lib.Or.12.36, Decl.1.175, Ep.1065.3;
province, ta\s l. [tw=n qew=n] Herm. in Phdr. p.74A.;
dwelling-place, ei) . . ai( l. tw=n yuxw=n . . u(pose/lhnoi/ ei)sin ib. p.104A. as law-term, l. di/khs or l. alone,
written complaint lodged with the Archon, as the first step in private actions, nearly, = e)/gklhma, Pl.R.425d, Is.11.10, Aeschin.1.63, cf. lagxa/nw 1.3; very rarely of
public actions, as in D.39.17. l. tou= klh/rou,
an application to the Archon (required of all except direct descendants)
to be put in legal possession of an inheritance, tou= klh/rou laxei=n th\n l. h)ci/wsen Is.3.2, cf. Arist.Ath.43.4.

lh=cis (B), ews, h(, (lh/gw)
cessation, mo/xqwn, a)ne/mwn, A.Eu.505 (lyr.), A.R.1.1086; of the flow of a river, Ph.1.175; th=s e)nergei/as lh=cin lambanou/shs Gal.Phil.Hist.17, cf. M.Ant.9.21.
death, decase, PMasp.19.6 (vi A.D.), etc. Gramm.,
termination, A.D. Synt.104.28; l. h( ei)s s_ Id.Adv.195.27.
end, extremity, tou= ko/lou Sor.1.7.
lhci^-fa/rma^kon, to/, = lhcipu/reton, Asclep. ap. Gal.14.136.

lhci^/-fwtos, on,
waning, Heph.Astr.2.34; lhci^-fwte/w,
wane, Anubion ap.eund. 2.5.
lho/s, o(, Ion. form of lao/s (q.v.).

lh/p-ths, ou, o(,
one who accepts, Zonar.

lhp-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
disposed to accept, Arist.EN1120b15.
assimilative, opp. e)kkritiko/s, Id.Ph.243b14.

lhp-to/s, h/, o/n, (lamba/nw)
to be apprehended, lo/gw| kai\ dianoi/a| Pl.R.529d; tw=| logismw=| Max.Tyr.7.5; pro\s ai)/sqhsin Chryserm. ap. Gal.8.741. later,
to be apprehended by the senses, opp. nohto/s, AP11.354.6 (Agath.). in Stoic philos.,
acceptable, not to be refused if offered, Stoic.3.32, 34. = e)pi/lhptos, Arist.Pr.896b6.
lhr-ai/nw, = lhre/w, Ph.1.77, Hsch.; f.l. for lhnai/+zw in Heraclit. 15.
lhr-ei/a, h(, = lh/rhsis, Phld.Mus.p.92 K.

lhr-e/w, (lh=ros A)
to be foolish or
silly, speak or
act foolishly, S.Tr.435, Ar.Eq.536, al., Pl.Tht. 152b, etc.; cunqiasw/ths tou= lhrei=n Ar.Pl.508; peri/ tinos Isoc.12.11, 33; lh=ron lhrei=s Ar.Pl.517; lhrei=s e)/xwn (v. e)/xw B. IV. 2) Id.Ra.512, cf. Pl.Grg.497b: c. acc., mh\ lhrh/sh|s to\n e)ktinagmo/n sou PFay.114.
21 (i A.D.). of a sick person,
to be delirious, Hp.Epid.1.26.g/.

lh/r-hma, atos, to/,
silly talk, nonsense, Pl.Grg.486c (pl.), Phld.Mus.p.72 K. (pl.), Gal.8.651 (pl.).

lh/r-hsis, ews, h(,
silly talk, trifling, Plu.2.504b, D.L.7.118; l. tou= gh/raos
dotage of the old, Aret.SD1.6.
lhri/as, v. leirw/s.
*lhro/kritos, name given by Epicurus to Democritus, D.L.10.8.
lhropetw/dh: lhrw/dh, Hsch.

lh=ros (A), o(,
trash, trumpery, of what is showy but useless, lh/rois a)nadw=n tou\s nikw=ntas Ar.Pl.589; tragiko\s l. Id.Ra.1005; lh=ro/n te ta)/ll' h(gei=to tou= gnw=nai pe/ri fu/seis poihtw=n
no good as connoisseurs of poets, ib.809; l. pa/nta pro\s to\ xrusi/on Antiph.232.1, cf. X.An.7.7.41; l. ei)=nai dokei= to\ no/misma, fu/sei d' ou)qe/n
mere trash, Arist.Pol.1257b10; a mere
trifle, Pl.Phd.72c, Men.Epit.60; l. e)sti ta)/lla pro\s *kinhsi/an there's
naught to compare with Cinesias, Ar. Lys.860; oi( poihtai\ l. ei)sin
useless, futile, Xenarch.7.1; poihtw=n l. Cratin.306; e)me\ me\n l. h(gei=sqai Pl.Chrm.176a, cf. Tht.176d, Luc. DMeretr.10.3; leptota/twn l. i(ereu= Ar.Nu.359; lh=roi kai\ paidiai/, of flute-playing at banquets, Pl.Prt.347d; lh=roi kai\ fluari/ai
futile nonsense, Id.Hp.Ma.304b; o(dou\s kai\ krh/nas kai\ lh/rous D.3.29; paroyi/des kai\ lh=ros side-dishes and suchlike
trumpery, Alex.261.5; parei\s l. polu\n a)stako\n w)nou= Archestr.Fr.24, cf. 35.7; as an exclamation, lh=ros
nonsense! humbug! Ar.Pl.23, cf. Eub.41.8.
delirium, Hp.Epid.1.26.g/ (as v.l. for para/lhros). as Adj.,
silly, poihth/s Luc.Gall.6, cf. Rh.Pr.17. Adv. -rws Tz.H.13.337. (Perh. derived fr. sq.)

lh=ros (B) (Boeot. lei=ros IG7.2421), o(,
gold ornament on women's tunics, AP6.292 (Hedyl.), cf. Luc.Lex.9, Poll.5.101, Hsch. (Oxyt. in AP l.c., Hsch.）

lhrwd-e/w,
talk frivolously, Phot.Bibl.p.4 B.
lhrw/d-hma, atos, to/, = lhrwdi/a, Suid. s.v. *leo/ntios (pl.).

lhrw/d-hs, es,
frivolous, silly, Pl.Tht. 174d, Arist.Rh.1414b15, BGU1011 ii 15 (ii B.C.), Phld.Ir.p.16 W., cj. in Lucil.187 Marx.

lhrwd-i/a, h(,
frivolous talk, Hdn.Epim.77.
lhsqe/wn: strefo/menos, Hsch.; cf. lhi+sqiw=n.

lhsi/mbrotos, on, (lh/qw, broto/s)
taking men unawares, cheat, thief, h.Merc.339.
lh=sis (A), ews, h(, （lh/qw） = lh=stis, Hsch. s.v. lhqedw/n (lu/sis cod.); f.l. for lh=stis in Critias 6.12 D.
lh=sis (B), ews, h(, （lw=） = bou/lhsis, ai(/resis, Hsch.
lhsmadi/a: lelh|sme/nh, Hsch.; cf. lhi+sm-.

lhsmonhqe/ntes, =
illimati, Gloss. (dub.).

lhsmosu/nh, h(, = lh/qh,
forgetfulness, kakw=n Hes.Th.55; tw=n nu=n qe/sqai lhsmosu/nan S.Ant.151 (lyr.).

lh/smwn, on, gen. onos, (lh/qw)
unmindful, Them.Or.22.268c.
*lh=sos: o( e)n tw=| r(a/xei tou= skorpi/ou lampro\s a)sth/r, Hsch.

lh|sta/rx-hs, ou, o(,
chief of robbers, Plu.Crass.22. -i/a, h(,
chieftainship of robbers, Lyd.Mag.3.72.
lh/|starx-os, o(, = lh|sta/rxhs, D.S.33.1, App.Hisp.68, Polyaen.4.9.3, Wilcken Chr.20 iv 8 (ii A.D.).

lh|st-ei/a, h(,
robbery, piracy, Th.1.5, Pl.Lg.823e, etc.; a)po\ lh|stei/as bi/on e)/xein, zh=n, X.An.7.7.9, Arist.Pol.1256a36: in pl., po/lin . . kata\ gh=n lh|stei/ais porqoume/nhn Th.8.40.

lh|st-eu/w, fut. -eu/sw App. Pun.116:—Pass. (v. infr.), aor. e)lh|steu/qhn D.S.2.55:—
practise robbery or
piracy, Th.7.18, D.4.23; e)n th=| gh=| kai\ e)n th=| qala/ssh| D.C.36.3. c.acc.,
spoil, plunder, Th.4.45, App.Pun.5, etc.:—Pass., Th. 4.2, 5.14, D.S.l.c.; lh|steu/etai h( o(do/s
is infested by robbers, Arr.Epict. 4.1.91.

lh|st-h/r, h=ros, o(, in Hom. lhi+sth/r, = lh|sth/s (q.v.),
robber, esp.
pirate, Od.3.73, etc.; l. polu/plagktoi 17.425, cf. 16.426, AP7.737, Man.3.258:—fem. lh/|steira, nau=s Ael.NA8.19.

lh|st-h/rion, Dor. la|sth/rion, to/,
band of robbers, X.HG5.4.42, Aeschin.1.191, PPetr.3 P.59 (iii B.C.): in pl.,
piratical vessels, Clidem.5, IGRom.4.219 (Ilion).
retreat or
nest of robbers, SIG581.52 (Crete, iii/ii B.C.), Str.14.1.32.
robbery, Luc.Cont.11 (pl.). la|sth/rioi (Dor.), oi(,
pirates, metaph., Axiop.6.

lh|st-h/s, ou=, o(, Ion. lhi+sth/s, Dor. la|sth/s, (lhi/+s, lhi/+zomai)
robber, pirate, E.Alc.766, X. Cyr.2.4.23, etc.; opp. kle/pths, Pl.R.351c; esp. by sea,
buccaneer, later peirath/s, And.1.138, etc.; lh|stou= bi/on zh=n Pl.Grg.507e; lhi+sth\s katesth/kee *karxhdoni/wn he began a course of
piracies upon them, Hdt.6.17, cf. Th.1.5, 8, 6.4; oi( l. au(tou\s porista\s kalou=sin Arist.Rh.1405a25; of irregular troops, IG12(2).526 (Eresos). metaph., l. e)nargh\s th=s e)mh=s turanni/dos S.OT535; *ku/pridos Lyc. 1143; lh|sta\ logismou=, of love, APl.4.198 (Maec.).

lh|st-iko/s, h/, o/n,
piratical, ploi=on D.23.148; lh|stikw=| tro/pw| PTeb.53.11 (ii B.C.). h( -kh/, = lh|stei/a, Pl.Sph.222c. to\ -ko/n,
piracy, Th.1.4, 13;
piratical vessels, Id.2.69. Adv. -kw=s
in the manner of pirates: Comp. -kw/teron, ploi=a l. pareskeuas me/na Id.1.10, cf. 6.104. Cf. lh|striko/s.

lh=stis, ews, h(, = lh/qh, E.Cyc.172, Critias 6.12 D.; lh=stin i)/sxein, = e)pilanqa/nesqai,
forget, S.OC584.

lh|sto-di^w/kths, ou, o(, =
latrunculator, Gloss.

lh|sto-kto/nos, on,
slaying robbers, AP11.280 (Pall.).

lh|sto-pi^asth/s, ou=, o(, in pl.,
thiefcatchers, a branch of the local police in Egypt, Wilcken Chr.472.2 (iii A.D.), PFlor.2.181 (iii A.D.).

lh|sto-salpigkth/s, ou=, o(,
robbertrumpeter, of the Tyrrhenians, inventors of the trumpet, Com. word in Men.1030; in Hsch. lhi+stosa/lpigc.

lh|st-riko/s, h/, o/n, = lh|stiko/s, for which it is a freq. v.l., of ships, triako/ntoros l. (cf. lh|stri/s) Th.4.9, cf. App.Pun.25, etc.; l. ska/fh D.S.3.43: metaph., of e(tai=rai, ta\ l. th=s *)afrodi/ths AP5.43 (Rufin.), 160 (Hedyl. or Asclep.); l. tro/pw| BGU1061.14 (i B.C.). of persons, Str.7.2.2; also l. du/namis Plu.Sert.18; bi/os l. Arist.Pol. 1256b1; e)/qnh ib.1338b23; to\ l. h)=qos Str.12.8.9; o( l. po/lemos App. Mith.96. Adv. -kw=s Str.2.5.26.

lh|st-ri/s, i/dos, h(, fem. of foreg., nh=es l.
pirate vessels, D.52.5, cf. D.S.16.5, Plu.Nic.29, etc.; l. gunh/ Id.Thes.9, cf. Herod.6.10.

lh|st-rw/n, =
latrina, Gloss. (dub.).
lh/|st-wr, v. lhi/+stwr.
lh/sw, lh/somai, v. lanqa/nw.

lh/|t-arxos, o(,
public priest, Lyc.991. (Cf. lh/i+ton.)

lh/|t-eira, h(,
public priestess, Call.Fr.123, Hsch.; cf. lei/teirai.
lh/|t-h, h(, v. lh/i+ton.
lh|t-h=res: i(eroi\ stefanhfo/roi (Athamanian), Id.
lh=to: e)pela/qeto, Hsch. (Cf. lh/i+to: e)pe/qeto, Id).

*lhtogenh/s, Dor. *la_t-, e/s,
born of Leto, epith. of Apollo and Artemis, E.Ion465 (lyr.), AP9.525.12:—fem. *la_toge/neia, A.Th.148 (lyr.).

*lhtoi/+dhs [i^], ou, Aeol., Dor. *la_toi/+das, a, o(,
son of Leto, i.e.Apollo, h.Merc.253, Hes.Sc.479, Alc.Supp.30.3:—Pi.P.1.12 has *la_toi/das (trisyll.).
lh|t-ourge/w, lh|t-ourgi/a, lh|t-ourgo/s, v. leit-.

*lhtw/, Dor. *la_tw/, o/os, contr. ou=s, h(, Leto, mother of Apollo and Artemis, Il.21.497, Hes.Th.406, cf. 918, al.; on the accent of the acc. sg., v. Hdn.Gr.2.33; voc. *lhtoi= Il.21.498, h.Ap.14, 62. (Dor. uncontr.acc. *lhto/a Tyrannio ap.Sch.Gen.Il.21.497):—Adj. *lhtw=|os, a, on,
of or
born from Leto, ko/rh A.Fr.170, S.El.570; Dor. *la_tw/|a AP 6.280:—fem. also *lhtwi^a/s, a/dos, Call.Dian.83, Opp.C.1.109, etc.; and *lhtwi/+s, Dor. *la_t-, i/+dos, AP6.272 (Pers.), A.R.2.938. *lhtw=|on, to/,
temple of L., Arist.EE1214a2, Str.14.3.6. *lhtw=|a, ta/, festival in honour of L., IG11(2).161 A 93 (Delos, iii B.C.).

lh/twr, oros, o(,
priest, prob. in IG5(2).405 (Lusi); cf. lei/twr, leitoreu/w, lh|th=res.
lhxmo/s, o(, = lh=cis (B), Antim.53.

lh=yis, ews, h( (later lh=myis POxy.1088.45 (i A.D.), etc.),
taking hold, seizing, catching, r(u/gxos . . pro\s ta\s l. tw=n zw|dari/wn Arist.PA662b9; ai( kampai\ tw=n daktu/lwn kalw=s e)/xousi pro\s ta\s l. kai\ pie/seis ib.687b10; a)porw/teros h( l. the
seizure of them will be more difficult, Th.5.110; h( l. th=s po/lews the
seizure of it, Id.4.114, cf. 7.25.
accepting, receiving, h(/diston o(/tw| pa/resti l. w(=n e)ra=| kaq' h(me/ran S.Fr.356; h( tou= misqou= l. Pl.R.346d; opp. a)po/dosis, ib.332b; opp. a)pobolai/ (loss), Arist.Rh.1362a35 (pl.): in pl.,
receipts, Pl.R.343d, Alc.1.123a, Arist. EN1122a13, al.
taking of medicine, prolou/sas pro\ th=s l. POxy. l.c.
attack of fever or sickness,
seizure, a)po\ th=s prw/ths l. Hp.Epid.1.6, cf. Morb.1.18, Arist.Pr.866a26. in Logic,
assumption (cf. lh=mma 11), Id.APr.24a23, 24b11. th=| h(mete/ra| l. from our
point of view, Ascl.Tact.7.8.
choice of matter, in a poem, etc., Longin.10.3; cf. lh=mma 111.
choice of pitch, in Music, Ocell.4.8, Aristid.Quint.1.11 bis. Geom., th\n tou= ke/ntrou tou= e)kke/ntrou l. the
determination of the centre of the eccentric circle, Procl.Hyp.5.56.

lhy-oli^go/-misqos te/xnh, the art of
taking low pay, cj. Hemsterh. in Ephipp.14.4 (lhyigom- codd.): Meineke lhyi-logo/-misqos
receiving pay for words.
li=, Adv., = li/an, Epich.223; cf. lipo/nhros.

li^a/zomai, aor. e)lia/sqhn, Ep. 3pl. li/asqen Il.23.879: 3sg. plpf. leli/asto Mosch.4.118 (for Act. v. sub fin.):—
bend, incline; and so, mostly of persons,
go aside, recoil, shrink, e)k potamoi=o liasqei/s Od.5.462; a)po\ purkai+h=s e(te/rwse l. Il.23.231; no/sfi l. 1.349, 11.80; u(/paiqa lia/sqh he
shrank beneath his attack, 15.520, cf. 21.255; deu=ro lia/sqhs hither
hast thou
retired, 22.12; para\ klhi=+da lia/sqh e)s pnoia\s a)ne/mwn, of a vision,
disappeared by the key-hole, Od.4.838: metaph.,
stray from the straight path, Emp.2.8; in A.R. of
parting, separating from others, 1.94, 3.827, 1164:—once in Trag., pro/s s' e)lia/sqhn
hastened to thee, E.Hec.98 (anap.).
sink, fall, prhnh\s e)lia/sqh Il.15.543; liazo/menon poti\ gai/h| 20.420, cf. 418; e)n gh=| Mosch. l.c. of things, a)mfi\ d' a)/ra sfi lia/zeto ku=ma
retired, drew back, Il.24.96; ptera\ pukna\ li/asqen (for e)lia/sqhsan) the dying bird's thick wings
dropped, 23.879; where Aristarch. read li/assen it
dropped its wings, though the Act. is not used exc. impf. li/azon they
loosened (the cables), Lyc.21.
lia/zw (A), v. foreg. sub fin.

lia/zw (B), (li/an)
to be over-enthusiastic, [para\ to\] li/an lia/zein A.D. Pron.34.27; lia/zein: li/an e)spoudake/nai, Phot.
liai/nw, = xliai/nw, Hsch. s.v. e)lia/nqh; cogn. with liaro/s.

li/an [v. fin.], Ion. and Ep. li/hn, Adv.
very, exceedingly, in Hom. with an Adv., l. e(ka/s Od.14.496; l. a)eikeli/ws 8.231: with an Adj., l. me/ga ei)=pes 3.227, 16.243; nh/pios l. to/son 4.371, cf. 13.238; l. lupro/s 13.243; l. e)nqu/mios ib.421: alone with a Verb,
very much, overmuch, kexolw/ato l. 14.282; l. a)/xqomai e(/lkos Il.5.361; ou)/ ti l. poqh\ e)/ssetai not
exceedingly, 14.368; mh/ ti l. prokali/zeo Od.18.20, cf. Il.6.486; also, in Hom., kai\ li/hn, which always begins the sentence or verse,
surely, aye surely, kai\ l. kei=no/s ge e)oiko/ti kei=tai o)le/qrw| Od.1.46, cf. 3.203, Il.1.553, al. after Hom., a)sxa/la mh\ li/hn Archil.66.7, cf. Sol.6; li/hn de\ deilia/zeis Anacr. ap. Ptol.Ascal. p.409 H.; l. pisteu/ein to believe
implicitly, Hdt.4.96; mh\ ka/mne l. Pi. P.1.90; mh\ l. ste/ne S.El.1172, cf. E.Med.158 (lyr.); a)spa/zou au)th\n l. POxy.936.13 (iii A.D.); kai\ l. safw=s Ar.Eq.1231; l. a)selgw=s Lys. 24.15; l. po/rrw Pl.Prt.310c; e)nto\s l. tw=n teixw=n Th.7.5: with other words of like sense, polu\ l. Isoc.9.48; l. pa/nu Antiph.184.2 (dub.), cf. Eust.972.46; ko/mpos l. ei)rhme/nos, opp. peplasme/nos (compare our
very and
verily), A.Pr.1031:—in Trag.and Com.freq.betw.Art.and Noun, h( l. filo/ths brotw=n his
too great love . . , A.Pr.123 (anap.); to\ l. poto/n Cratin.187; h( l. trufh/ Men.587; ta\ l. meira/kia Theopomp.
Com.29; ai( pro\s tura/nnous li/an o(mili/ai D.6.21; to\ l.
excess, violence, E.Andr.866, Pl.Cra.415c. [Hom. has i^ nine times, i_ thirty-two times; the latter is found both in arsi and in thesi. In later Ep.and Trag. both quantities are found: a_ always.]
lianth/r, h=ros, o(, = leanth/r, Gloss.
li/ac, o(, v. lei/ac.

li^a^ro/s, a/, o/n,
warm, lukewarm, ai(=ma, u(/dwr, Il.11.477, 830, Od.24.45, etc.; ou)=ros l. a
warm, soft wind, 5.268; u(/pnos l.
gentle, balmy, Il.14.164, cf. A.R.3.300, etc.
li/ba, libo/s, acc. and gen. of li/y (q.v.).

li^b-a/dion [a^], to/, （liba/s)
small spring, po/tima l. Plu.2.913c;
small stream, l. o)leqri/ou u(/datos Str.8.8.4. in the common dialect,
a wet place, Eust.1358.54, Thom.Mag.p.223 R.; = xwri/on botanw=des, Hsch. = kentau/reion to\ mikro/n, Plin.HN25.68.

li^b-a/zw, = lei/bw,
let fall in drops, Hsch., Phot.:—Med.,
run out in drops, trickle, AP9.258 (Antiphan. Megalop.). gh= liba/zousa land
full of pools of water, Poll.1.238.
li^ba^n-a=s, o(, = libanopw/lhs, PLond.3.604.281 (i A.D.), Sammelb. 410.1 (i/ii A.D.).
li^ba^n-i/dion, to/, Dim. of li/banos, Men.260 (i)/dion cod.; corr. Bentl.).

li^ba^n-i/zw,
smell like frankincense, Dsc.1.71, Gal.13.475.

li^ba^/n-inos, h, on,
made of frankincense, Gloss.
frankincensecoloured, POxy.114.5 (ii A.D.).
*li^ba^ni=tis, idos, h(, title of Aphrodite, Luc.Ind.3 codd.
li^ba^no-eidh/s, e/s, = libanw/dhs, Dsc.3.83.

li^ba^no-qh/kh, h(,
incensebox, Poxy.978 (iii A.D.), Gloss.

li^ba^no-ka^i/+a, h(,
burning of incense, ib.
li^ba^no-ma/nna, h(, = ma/nna libanwtou=, Orph.H.20 tit.

li^ba^no/-mantis, ews, o(, also h(,
one that divines from the smoke of frankincense, Eust. 1346.39.

li^ba^no/-omai, Pass.,
to be mixed with frankincense, oi)=nos lelibanwme/nos LXX 3 Ma.5.45; libanw= occurs in Hdn.Gr.1.451.
li^ba^no-pw/lhs, Dor. li^ba^no/-a_s, ou, o(, = libanwtopw/lhs, in gen. pl. -pwla=n, SIG1000.15 (Cos, i B.C.).

li/ba^nos [i^], o(,
frankincense-tree, Boswellia Carterii, Hdt.4.75, Thphr.HP9.4.2, Dsc.1.68, etc.; i(ero/dakrus l. Melanipp.1.5. = libanwto/s,
frankincense, in which sense it is fem. in Pi.Fr.122.3, E.Ba.144 (lyr.); but masc. in PCair.Zen.69.13 (iii B.C.), AP6.231 (Phil.), 9.93 (Antip. Thess.), Edict.Diocl. (*)aqhna= 18.6, Tegea); indeterminate in Sapph.Supp.20c.2, S.Fr.1064, Anaxandr.41.37, SIG 247ii 19 (Delph., iv B.C.).

li^ba^no/-xroos, on, contr. li^ba^no/-xrous, oun,
frankincense-coloured, Str. 15.1.37.

li^ba^n-w/dhs, es,
frankincense-like, po/a Philostr.Im.1.29.

li^ba^n-wti/dion, to/, Dim. of libanwti/s (B),
small censer, Roussel
Cultes Égyptiens p.217 (Delos, ii B.C.).

li^ba^n-wti/zw,
fumigate with frankincense, Str.16.4.26.
to be like frankincense, Dsc.3.84.

li^ba^n-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
consisting in frankincense, forti/a Raccolta Lumbroso 119 (iii B.C.), OGI 132.11 (ii B.C.).
of or
for the manufacture of frankincense, [e)rgasi/a] PSI6.628.5 (iii B.C.).

li^ba^n-w/ti^nos, h, on,
prepared with frankincense, mu/ron Apollon.Herophil. ap. Ath.15.689b.

li^ba^n-wti/s (A), i/dos, h(,
rosemary frankincense, l. ka/rpimos
Lecokia cretica, Thphr.HP9.11.10, Dsc.3.74.1, Gal.12.60; l. kaxrufo/ros Nic.Th.850. l. [ka/rpimos] e(te/ra
Ferulago galbanifera, Dsc.3.74.2. l. a)/karpos
Rosmarinum sterile, Ibid.; also,
Lactuca graeca, Thphr.HP9.11.11, Dsc.3.74.4.
rosemary, Rosmarinus officinalis, Id.3.75, Gal.12.61. = ko/nuza lepto/fullos, Ps.-Dsc.3.121.

li^ba^n-wti/s (B), i/dos, h(, = libanwtri/s, IG22.840.7, 11(2).110, 111, al. (Delos, iii B.C.), Roussel
Cultes Égyptiens p.217 (ibid., ii B.C.), Polyaen.4.8.2.

li^ba^nwto-pwle/w,
deal in frankincense, Ar.Fr.807.

li^ba^nwto-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in frankincense, Critias 70 D., Cratin.Jun.1.4.

li^ba^nwto/s, o(, also h( Men.Sam.Fr.1:—
frankincense, the gum of the tree li/banos, used to burn at sacrifices, Xenoph.1.7, Hdt.1.183, 2.40, 86, Ar.Nu.426, V.96, Ra.871, Thphr.HP4.4.14, etc.; l. u(pe\r au)tw=n e)pitiqe/nai Antipho 1.18: called, when in small pieces, xo/ndros libanwtou= Luc.Sat.16; when pounded, ma/nna libanwtou= Gp.6.6.1; cf. libanoma/nna: the best kind was l. a)/rrhn Dsc.1.68, Alciphr. 2.4. = li/banos 1, Thphr.HP9.1.6.
the frankincensemarket, Eup.304, Chamael. ap. Ath.9.374b. = libanwtri/s, Apoc.8.3, 5.

li^ba^nwtofo/ros, on,
bearing frankincense, Hdt.2.8, 3.107; h( l. (sc. xw/ra) Str.16.4.25, Peripl.M.Rubr.31.

li^ba^nwtri/s, i/dos, h(,
censer, Carnead. ap. Plu.2.477b, Keil-Premerstein
Zweiter Bericht No.20 (Thyatira), Ramsay
Studiesin the Eastern Rom.Provinces p.319 (Pisidia), Hsch.

li^ba/s, a/dos, h(, (lei/bw)
anything that drips or
trickles, esp.
spring, fount, stream, S.Ph.1215 (lyr.), E.Andr.116, 534 (lyr.); l. numfai/a Antiph.52.13;
standing water, Babr.24.6: in pl.,
streams, liba/sin u(drhlai=s . . phgh=s A.Pers.613; dakru/wn liba/des
streams of tears, E.IT 1106 (lyr.); ga/laktos A.R.4.1735; also a)raia\ h( *ai)/guptos kai\ r(a|di/a liba/das diadou=nai Ephor.65 J.: in pl., also of
pools of water that collect after rain, u(po/nomoi l. Str.8.6.21, cf. Gal.6.627, Gp.2.6.14; of marshes, Thphr.HP2.4.4; cf. liba/zw.
vessel that drips when under the influence of heat, a rudimentary thermometer, Hero Spir.2.8.
libdu/ein: a)fori/zein, Hsch.

li/bellos, o(, = Lat.
libellus, petition, PGiss.40.2 (iii A.D.), etc. libla/rios, o(, = Lat.
l[icaron]brarius, scribe, secretary, BGU 423v. 3 (ii A.D.), PFlor.71.605 (iv A.D.), etc.
li/bernos, o(, = *liburni/s (nau=s), BGU455.9 (i A.D.), etc.

li_berti=nos, o(, = Lat.
libertinus, freedman, IG14.1781, Act.Ap.6.9:—also li/bertos, = Lat.
libertus, Plb.30.18.4.
li/bhqron, v. lei/bhqron.
li^bhro/s, a/, o/n, = u(gro/s, Hp. ap. Gal.19.118, EM564.50.
li_biano/n, to/, an eye-salve, Gal.12.762, Alex.Trall.2.

li^biko/s, h/, o/n, (li/y)
western, PIand.52.23 (i A.D.), PFlor.50.3, al. (iii A.D.), etc.

li^bo/notos, o(,
a wind between south-west and south, Arist.Mu.394b34, Agatharch.2.7, Peripl.M.Rubr.57; cf. libofoi=nic.
libo/s, gen. of li/y.

li/bos [i^], eos, to/, （lei/bw） = liba/s, in pl.,
tears, A.Ch.448 (lyr.); v. li/pos. = e)pi/stagma/ ti tw=n o)mma/twn, Gal.19.118. = Lat.
libum, Chrysipp.Tyan. ap. Ath.15.647d, cf. Ath.3.126a.
li^bofoi=nic, i_kos, o(, = libo/notos, Arist.Mu.394b34.

libro/s, a/, o/n, = skoteino\s kai\ me/las, Hp. ap. Erot. (prob. referring to
Aër.15 where dierw=| and qolerw=| codd. Hp., as epith. of h)h/r）; nu/c expld. as either
dark or (cf. liba/s)
dewy night, EM564.49; libro\n se/las Trag.Adesp.232; o)lo\s l. either
black or
dripping blood, AP 15.25.1 (Besant.); cf. limbro/s.
*li^bu^-afigenh/s, e/s, v. *lebuafigenh/s.

*li^bu/h [u^], h(, Libya, Od.4.85, 14.295, Hdt.1.46, etc.; also for Africa generally, Id.4.42, al.;
the west bank of the Nile, PTaur.8.9 (ii B.C.), PLond.1.3.8 (ii B.C.): prov., a)ei\ *libu/h fe/rei ti kaino/n or kako/n, Arist.HA606b20, Zen.2.51:—Adv. *li^bu/hqen,
from Libya, D.P. 46, 222:—also *li^bu/hqe, Dor. *li^bu^/-a_qe, Nic.Al.368, Theoc.1.24:—Adj. *li^bu^ko/s, h/, o/n, Hdt.2.8, etc.; *l. o)/rneon, i.e. a
strange, foreign bird, Ar.Av.65; *l. lo/goi a kind of fables resembling those of Aesop, Arist.Rh.1393a30; also,
western, Ptol.Tetr.119; = dutiko/s, Procl. Par.Ptol.29.

li/buon, to/,
wild lotus, f.l. in Ps.-Dsc.4.111 (*libuko/n cj. Wellmann).
libuo/s, o(, unknown bird, Arist.HA609a20.

*li^burnoi/, oi(,
the Liburnians, a people on the Adriatic coast below Istria, *liburnh\ po/lis Str.7.5.4, etc.:—Adj. *li^burniko/s, h/, o/n, Liburnian, A.Fr.364: -ko/n (sc. ploi=on), to/,
a light, swift vessel, felucca, such as was used by the *liburnoi/, Plu.Cat.Mi.54:—also *li^burno/s, o(, BGU709.23 (ii A.D.), prob. in Supp.Epigr.3.565.11 (Tyras, iii A.D.):—fem. *li^burni/s (sc. nau=s), i/dos, h(, Plu.Ant.67, etc.; -i/des nh=soi Str.7.5.5:—hence *li^burna/rios, o(, Stud.Pal.20.123.33 (v A.D.).

*li/bu^s [i^], u^os, o(,
a Libyan, Hdt.4.181, al., S.El.702, etc.: and as Adj., = *libuko/s, au)lo/s E.Alc.346; *l. kaulo/s, = si/lfion, Antiph.217.13:—fem. *li/bussa [i^], Pi.P.9.105, S.Fr.11, Hdt.4.189, Call.Ap.86, Riv.Fil.57.379 (Crete):—also *li^bustiko/s, h/, o/n, A.Eu.292, Fr.139, etc.; fem. also *li^busti/s, i/dos, h(, A.R.4.1753; cf. *libu/h. harmless kind of
serpent, Nic.Th.490. = loutrofo/ros 2, Hsch.

*li^bustiko/n, to/, a herb, Gal.6.267, 12.62:—also *li^bustia/s, a/dos, h(, Androm. ap. Gal.14.40:—hence *li^bustika=ton, to/, a drink made from it, Alex.Trall.8.2. [Identical with *ligustiko/n, q.v.]

*li^bu^-foi=nic, i_kos, o(,
Liby-Phoenician, i.e. Carthaginian, Plb.3.33.15, etc.

*li^bu^-foi/ths, ou, o(,
visiting Libya, Jubaap.Hsch.
li/bw, = lei/bw, Hsch.

li/g-a^ [i^], Adv. of li^gu/s (cf. ta/xa, w)=ka, etc.),
in loud, clear tone, a)mf' au)tw=| xume/nh li/g' e)kw/kue Il.19.284, cf. Od.8.527; li/g' a)/eiden
in clear, sweet tone, 10.254, cf. Alcm.59, Thgn.939; zefu/rou l. kinume/noio A.R. 4.837.

lig-ai/nw, (ligu/s) poet. Verb,
cry out with a loud, clear voice, of heralds, Il.11.685; of mourners, A.Th.874 (lyr.); of shepherds, Mosch.3.81; also fo/rmiggi, su/riggi l.,
produce clear sounds on . . , play on . . , A.R.1.740, AP9.363.7 (Mel.): c.acc.cogn., me/los l. Bion 2.1, cf. Mosch.3.120; [ou)k] w)/|eto dei=n to\n e)n dikasthri/ois lo/gon kwti/llein kai\ ligai/nein D.H.Dem.44:—Med., Arat.1007:—Pass., of a person,
to be made ligu/s, *(omh/rw| u(po\ *kallio/phs ligainome/nw| Max.Tyr.3.8. trans.,
sing of, AP9.197 (Marin.).
charm, w)=ta fqegcame/nh l. Ph.2.267, cf. Hsch. ligai/nei: te/rpei.
liga/ntar: ei)=dos te/ttigos (Lacon.), Hsch. liggou/rion, v. lugkou/rion.
li/gda, v. li/gdos 111. ligdareoxu/tai: oi( e)n tai=s li/gdais ta\s <s>a/rkas xe/ontes, toute/sti xoa/nais, Hsch. ligdeu/ei: a)phqei=, Id.

li/gdhn, Adv., (v. li/zw)
grazing, ba/le xei=r' e)pi\ karpw=| li/gdhn Od.22.278; v. e)pili/gdhn.

li/gdos, o(, = quei/a,
mortar, Nic.Th.589, 618, cf. S.Fr.35, and i)/gdis.
clay mould, Poll.10.189, Ael.Dion.Fr.249.
lye, used as soap, Eust.1229.27: so in Hsch., li/gda: h( a)ko/nh, kai\ h( koni/a.
li/geios [i^], a, on, later form of ligu/s, cj. Coraës for li/gion, lu/gion (q.v.), Hld.6.5; ligh/i+a suri/zousi (Schneid. for lige/a) Opp.C.4.411. Adv. -ei/ws Suid.

ligipene/s: a)sqene/s, a)genne/s, Hsch. (cf. o)lighpelh/s). li/gnon, =
bandum ('banner'), Gloss. (si/gnon Scaliger). lignu/zwn, o(, v. liqi/zw.

lignu^o/eis, essa, en,
smoky, sooty, kapno/s A.R.2.133, 3.1291.

lignu/s, u/os, h( (parox. in Call.Fr.1.57 P.),
thick smoke mixed with flame, murky fire (such as is made by burning resinous substances, Arist.Mete.387b6, al.), i(e/nta . . dia\ sto/ma lignu\n me/lainan A.Th.494; ste/roy l., of the fires seen by night on the two peaks of Parnassus, S.Ant.1127 (lyr.); l. sw=ma kataiqaloi= Ar.Av.1241; l. kai\ kapno/s Id.
Lys.319; lignu\s pro/sedros S.Tr.794, expld. by Sch. of the
smoke of the altar hanging round Heracles: pl., ai( flo/ges kai\ ai( l. Plb.34.11.18, cf. Str.6.2.11.
soot, l. e)sti kapnw/dhs ai)qa/lh Erot.s.v. glw=ssalignuw/dhs; used medicinally, Dsc.2.72, Gal.12.61. [u_ Tryph. 322; but u^ Call. l.c., and prob. in S.Ant. l.c.]

lignu^w/dhs, es,
smoky, sooty, dark-coloured, pneu=ma Hp.Coac.255; glw=ssa Id.Epid.3.17.ib/; opp. kapnw/dhs, Gal.9.470; a)naqumia/seis, pneu/mata, Agath.2.15, 5.8.

li/gce, only aor. 1, li/gce bio/s the bow
twanged, Il.4.125.

li^goura/, Boeot. fem. of liguro/s, Corinn.21:—also li^gourokw/ti^los, a, on,
clear and plaintive, e)nopai/ Ead.20.4.
ligro/n: pikro/n, liguro/n, h(du/, gluku/, Hsch.

li^gu^a/oidos [a^], on,
clear-singing, Arc.86.
*li^gu^asta/dhs, ou, o(, (ligu/s) name borne by Mimnermus, Sol.20.3, cf. Suid. s.v. *mi/mnermos.

li^gu^-hxh/s, e/s, poet. li^gu^-a_xh/s,
clear-sounding, kiqa/rh AP9.308 (Bianor); *mou=sai Ath.Mitt.27.339; dub. in B.Scol.Oxy.4.
li^gu^/-qroos, on, = foreg., D.P.574, Coluth.276, etc.
li^gu^/-kortos, on, = sq., Alcm. 85 B.

li^gu^/-krotos, on,
loud-rattling, gloss on ligurw/taton, Suid.; cf. foreg.
li^gu^-makro/fwnos, on, epith. of heralds, Tim.Pers.232.

li^gu^/-molpos, on,
clear-singing, nu/mfai h.Hom.19.19.

li^gu^/-mu_qos, on,
clearspeaking, AP7.343.

li^gu^/-pnoios, on,
shrill-blowing, whistling, a)/nemoi h.Ap.28.
li^gu^/-pnoos, on, contr. li^gu^/-pnous, oun, = foreg., Coluth.309, IG14.1934f7.

li^gu^-pte/ru^gos, on,
chirping with the wings, of the cicada, AP7.195 (Mel.).

li^gu^ri/zw,
sing loud or
clear, w)|dh/n Luc.Lex.2, cf. Hsch.
ligu/rion, to/, a precious stone (Dim. of li/guros), LXX Ex.28.19, J. BJ5.5.7.
li^gu^ro/pnoos, on, = ligu/pnoos, Poll.4.72.

li^gu^ro/s, a/, o/n, Boeot. fem. ligoura/ (q.v.),
clear, shrill, w)=rto de\ ku=ma pnoih=| u(/po ligurh=| Il.23.215, cf. 5.526, 13.590; of a whip, 11.532, S.Aj. 242 (anap.); a)ko/na (v. a)ko/nh）; ligura\ a)/xea griefs
which vent themselves in shrill wailings, E.Med.205 (lyr.); also (like ligu/s), of a
clear, sweet sound, as of the Sirens, ligurh=| qe/lgousin a)oidh=| Od.12.44; ligurh\n e)/ntunon a)oidh/n ib.183; of a bird, Il.14.290; of locusts, Hes.Op.583; l. su/rigges Id.Sc.278: metaph., of poets, Id.Op.659; a)oida/ Theoc. 15.135, etc.: neut. pl. as Adv., ligura\ a)ei/dein Thgn.939: regul. Adv. -rw=s Theoc.8.71.—Poet. word, used occasionally in Prose, liguro\n u(phxei= echoes
shrilly, Pl.Phdr.230c; fwnh\ l., opp. lampra/, Arist. HA616b31, cf. Aud.804a29 (Comp.): also in later Prose, Plu.2.974a, Luc.Salt.72, Phal.1.11, etc. metaph., sumbiw=nai . . h(/distos kai\ -w/tatos Isoc.Ep.4.4.
pliant, flexible, of dogs' tails, X.Cyn. 4.1.
li/guros, o(, = ligu/rion, J.AJ3.7.5.

li^gu^ro/ths, htos, h(,
clearness, sweetness, of Homer, prob. in Phld. Herc.1677.21.

li^gu/s, li/geia (not ligei=a, Hdn.Gr.1.249), ligu/; of sound,
clear, shrill, lige/wn a)ne/mwn laiyhra\ ke/leuqa Il.14.17; w)=rto d' e)pi\ l. ou)=ros Od. 3.176, cf. 4.357: more freq. of a
clear, sweet sound,
clear-toned, fo/rmiggi ligei/h|, fo/rmigga li/geian, Il.9.186, Od.8.67, etc.; of articulate sounds,
clear-voiced, *mou=sa li/geia 24.62, Alcm.1; l. *seirh/n Id.7; l. a)gorhth/s in Il. as epith. of Nestor, 1.248, 4.293; also of Thersites, 2.246; e)pe/wn oi)=mos l. Pi.O.9.72. Adv. lige/ws, a)goreu/ein Il.3.214: freq. also, l. klai/ein wail
shrilly, 19.5, Od.11.391; i)a/xein Hes.Sc. 233: neut. as Adv., l. pnei/ontes a)h=tai Od.4.567; l. me/lpesqai Hes. Sc.206; ligu/ or lige/a kla/zein Mosch.4.24, A.R.4.1299. after Hes., mostly of sad sounds, as always in A., l. kwku/mata Pers.332; ka)nakwku/sas ligu/ ib.468; l. pa/qea Supp.113 (lyr.); of the nightingale, Ag.1146 (lyr.), S.OC671 (lyr.); also of music, li/geia lwtou= xa/ris E.Heracl.892 (lyr.); au)lou= l. h)=xon, v.l. for gluku\n in Mosch. 2.98.—Poet. word (*mou=sai li/geiai Pl.Phdr.237a).

*li/gus [i^], uos, o(, h(, Ligurian, A.Fr.199.1, Hdt.5.9, Th.6.2, etc.: as Adj., *l. strato/s A.Fr.199.9 (on the accent, v. Hdn.Gr.1.236.7):— Adj. *li^gustiko/s, h/, o/n, Ligurian, S.Fr.598, Str.2.4.3; h( *ligustikh/ Liguria, Arist.Mete.351a16, cf. 368b32:—also *li^gusti=nos, h, on, sa/goi, xitw=nes Str.4.6.2. to\ l.
bastard lovage, Laserpitium Siler, Dsc.3.51.

li^gu-sfa/ra^gos [fa^], on,
shrill-sounding, fo/rmigges Pi.Parth.2 Fr. 1.34.

li^gu/-fqoggos, on,
clear-voiced, in Hom. always epith. of heralds, Il.2.50, al., Od.2.6, etc.; au)li/skoi Thgn.241; a)hdw/n Ar.Av.1380; o)/rniqes B.5.23; me/lissa (of a poet) Id.9.10; au)dh/ Opp.H.5.620.

li^gu-fwne/w,
sound clear or
loud, Sch.Theoc.8.30.

li^gu/-fwnos, on,
clearvoiced, loud-voiced, a(/rph Il.19.350, cf. h.Merc.478; also of
sweet sounds, *(esperi/des Hes.Th.275, 518; a)hdw/n Theoc.12.7; a)oidh/ Orph. A.5.

lidri/on: tru/blion, Hsch. li/zei: pai/zei, and li/zousi: pai/zousin, Id. lizo/n: e)/latton, Id. (i.e. o)/lizon). li/zw,
graze, Eust.1926.37, as giving the Root of li/gdhn, e)pili/gdhn. lizw=nes: e)la/ttones, Hsch. (Cf. o)lei/zwn, o)li/gos). li/hmos: ya/maqos, Id. (fort. a)/mmos). li/hn, Ion. and Ep. for li/an. li/hnos: liqopurgi/a, Id. li/hfos:, deino/s, Id. li=q', v. li=ta.

li^qa^gwg-i/a, h(,
conveyance of stone, IG12.347.37, SIG241 B87 (Delph., iv B.C.).

li^q-a/zw, (li/qos)
fling stones, Arist.Pr.881b1, Plb.10.29.5; e)pi\ skopo/n Str.15.1.43.
throw like stones, xruso\n ei)/s tina App.Reg. 4.
stone, tina Anaxandr.16, LXX 2 Ki.16.6, Ev.Jo.10.31:— Pass., dub. sens. in IGRom.4.494.13 (Pergam.).
li^q-a^ko/s, o(, = li/qac, Stesich.Oxy.1087.48; on the accent, v. Hdn.Gr.1.150.

li^q-anaboleu/s, e/ws, o(,
surgical instrument for extracting stone, Aët.16.110 (100).

li^/q-ac, a^kos, o(, h(,
stony, li/qaki poti\ pe/trh| Od.5.415. as fem. Subst., = li/qos, Arat.1112, Orph.A.613; kwfh\ l., of a
gravestone, AP7.392 (Heraclid. Sinop.); of a
precious stone, Man.6.343; l. trhth\n spo/ggw| e)eidome/nhn, of the pumice-
stone, AP6.66 (Paul. Sil.). in pl.,
stony land, Epic.in Arch.Pap.7.10, v.l. in Nic. Th.150; cf. e(/rmac.
li^qargu/r-eos [u^], a, on, = sq., Stesich.30.

li^qargu/r-i^nos, h, on,
of or
like liqa/rguros, Arist.SE164b23.

li^qa/rgur-os, h(,
litharge, lead monoxide, Nic.Al.594, Gal.13.397, al.: sts. called l. a)rguri=tis, to dist. it from l. xrusi=tis (flake
litharge), Dsc.5.87. as Adj., = foreg., Achae.19.

li^qargu^rofa^nh/s, e/s,
like litharge, Dsc.5.85.
li^qa^r-i/dion, to/, = sq., Alex.Trall.3.3.

li^qa^/r-ion, to/, Dim. of li/qos,
stone, Thphr.HP3.7.5, Phld.Po.Herc.1675.5, Dsc.1.68, 5.40, PKlein.Form.303 (vi A.D.). a
gem, IG11(2).287 B46 (Delos, iii B.C.), Annuario 6/7.405 (Perge), PHolm.5.4, al. (Condemned by Phryn. 158.)

li^q-a/s, a/dos, h(, = li/qos,
stone, seu=en ku/nas . . puknh=|sin liqa/dessin Od.14.36; qa/lamon de/mon . . puknh=|sin l. 23.193; collectively,
shower of stones, A.Th.158 (lyr.);
heap of stones, liqa/das te kai\ e(/rmakas e)nnai/ontes, of snakes, Nic.Th.150 (v.l. li/qakas).

li^q-a/sbestos, o(, =
lapis calcinus, Gloss.

li^q-asmo/s, o(,
stoning, Sch.A.Th.676.

li^q-asth/s, ou=, o(,
one who stones, A.D.Adv.135.25.

li^q-astiko/s, h/, o/n,
by stoning, mo/ros Sch.A.Th.199.
li^q-a/w, v. liqia/w.

li^q-ei/a, h(, later written liqi/a, a sort of
fine stone or
marble, Plb.4.52.7, Str.9.5.16, J.AJ8.2.9: collectively, IG11(2).287 A89 (Delos, iii B.C.), Sammelb.5801.3 (i B.C., written -e/a, and so in Gloss.). collectively,
precious stones, jewellery, OGI132.8 (ii B.C.), Str.15.1.67, 16.4.22, D.S.1.46, Peripl.M.Rubr.56.
li^/q-eios, a, on, = li/qinos, bolh/ Sch.A.Pr.561, 677; also -os, on Suid.

li^q-e/mporos, o(,
stone-merchant, IG14.2247 (Picenum), Supp.Epigr.4.106 (Rome, ii A.D.).

li^/q-eos, a, on, = li/qinos,
of stone, Il.23.202, Od.13.107.

li^q-hgo/s (sc. nau=s), h(,
stone-carrying vessel, PCair.Zen.176.6, PPetr.2p.43, 3p.137 (all iii B.C.), IG11(2).203 B97 (Delos, iii B.C.): pl., Rev.Phil.50.70 (Didyma, ii B.C.).

li^q-hlogh/s, e/s, (le/gw (B) 1)
built of stones, AP6.253 (Crin.).
li^qi^-a^ko/s, v. liqiko/s.

li^qi^/-a_sis, ews, Ion. ios, h(,
the disease of the stone, Hp.Aph.3.26 (pl.), Gal.10.917.
a callosity within the eyelid, Id.14.771, Aët.7.82.

li^qi^-a/w, only pres.,
suffer from the stone, Hp.Aph.4.79, al., Pl.Lg.916a, IG42(1).121.68 (Epid., iv B.C.), Arist.Pr.895a37, Ruf.Ren.Ves.3, al., Philostr.VS1.25.11; [nosh/mata] -iw=nta Hp.Hum.12:—also li^qa/w, which is restored in Pl. l.c., cf. Phot. s.v. liqw=ntas; also liqo/wsa: polu/liqos, Hsch.

li^q-i/dion, to/, Dim. of li/qos,
pebble, gem, Pl.Phd.110d, Arist.Pr. 934b22, Plu.2.979b, Luc.Hist.Conscr.4.
gravel in the urine, Hp. Coac.578 (pl.);
stone in the bladder, Paul.Aeg.6.60 (sg.).

li^q-i/zw,
look like a stone: liqi/zwn, name of a kind of
carbuncle, v.l. in Callistr. ap.Plin.HN37.94 (sed leg. lignu/zwn).

li^q-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for stones; e)/rga Arch.Pap.3.128 (ii B.C.); but usu. liqika/ (sc. bibli/a), ta/,
a treatise upon precious stones, title of Orphic poem, ap.Tz. (peri\ li/qwn codd.); also bibli/a liqiaka/ Eust.ad D.P.Prooem.; but *liqika/, of D.P.'s work, Sch.Od.10.323.
of or
for stone in the bladder, Paul.Aeg.6.60.

li^/q-i^nos, h, on, also os, on AP9.719, D.L.2.33:—
made of stone, Hippon.10, Ibyc.22, Hdt.3.88, Th.3.68, Herod.7.109, PHib.1.27.26 (iii B.C.), etc.; l. qa/natos, i.e. caused by seeing the Gorgon's head, Pi.P.10.48; so l. eu)qu\s gi/gnomai Antiph.166.4; but, e(/sthke li/qinos, of a statue, Hdt.2.141 (cf. i(/sthmi A.1, B.111.2); ta\ l.
marble statues, X.Lac.3.5; *(ermh=s l. Eub.96; for Hdt.2.69, v. li/qos 11.1, u(/alos 11: metaph., kardi/a LXX Ez.11.19. Adv. -nws
like stone, l. ble/pein pro/s tina, with allusion to the Gorgon, X.Smp. 4.24.

li^q-ino/ths, htos, h(,
stony quality, dub. in Phld.Herc.862.6.
li^/q-ion, to/, Dim. of li/qos, Paus.2.25.8.
li^/q-ios, Thess. for li/qinos, IG9(2).517.21 (Larissa).
li^q-i/s, i/dos, h(, = liqi/asis, Hp.Morb.4.55.

li^qo/-ba^sis, ews, h(,
stone base of a tripod, BCH29.541 (Delos).

li^qo-blh/s, h=tos, o(, h(,
stoned, qnh/|skei l. Tz.H.3.246.

li^qo/-blhtos, on,
stone-throwing, pelting, eu)stoxi/h AP9.3.
set with stones, kekru/fala ib.5.269 (Paul. Sil.).

li^qobol-e/w,
pelt with stones, stone, LXX Le.20.2, al., D.S.17.41, Ev.Matt.21.35, Plu.2.1011e:—Pass., LXX Ex.8.26(22).
li^qobol-h/simos, on, = liqobo/los, Sch.E.Or.50:—also li^qobol-bo/lhtos, Hsch. s.v. leusi/mou di/khs.
li^qobo/l-hsis, v. sq.

li^qobol-i/a, h(,
throwing of stones, Hp. Fract.2 (pl., v.l. for liqobo/lhsis), D.S.3.49.
stoning, Sch. A.Eu.189. neut. pl. liqobo/lia, ta/, festival at Troezen, Paus. 2.32.2.
li^qobol-ismo/s, o(, = liqoboli/a, Sch.A.Th.546.
li^qobol-i/ths, gloss on liqoleu/sths, Hsch.

li^qo/bol-os, on, (parox.)
throwing stones, pelting with stones: -bo/loi, oi(,
stone-throwers, distd. from sfendonh=tai, Th.6.69, cf. J.BJ3.7.18; gumnh=tes l. kai\ a)kontistai/ Pl.Criti.119b: sg., as winner of a contest, SIG1061.6, 19 (Samos, ii B.C.). -bo/los, o(,
engine for hurling stones, Plb.8.5.2, Moschio ap.Ath.5.208c, Ath. Mech.18.6; distd. from katape/lths, D.S.20.48; also -bo/lon, to/, LXX 1 Ma.6.51, J.BJ5.6.3; in full, l. mhxanai/ ib.4.9.12. proparox. liqo/bolos, on, Pass.,
struck with stones, stoned, E.Ph.1063 (lyr.).

li^qo/-glhnos, on,
stony-eyed, Nonn.D.48.456. = liqoderkh/s, ib.47.592.

li^qo-glu/pths, ou, o(,
sculptor in stone, Gloss.

li^qo-glu^fi/a, h(,
a cutting in stone, Man.4.130 (dat. pl.); liqoglufe/essi cj. Rigler.

li^qo-glu/fos [u^], o(,
sculptor, Luc.Somn.18, Gal.1.7;
engraver,
Dsc.5.147 (v.l. -gra/fos); title of play by Philemon, Did.
in D.9.62.

li^qo-glw/xi_n, o(, h(, gen. i_nos,
set with sharp stones, a)guiai/ Nonn.D. 40.354, cf. 6.138.

li^qo-gnwmiko/s, h/, o/n,
skilful in stones: l. (sc. bibli/on), to/,
a work on stones, by Philostr., Suid.s.v. *filo/stratos.
li^qo-gnw/mwn, on, gen. onos, = foreg., Jul.Or.2.91b.
li^qo-go/nos, on, = liqopoio/s 11, Dsc.Eup.2.118.
li^qo-gra/fos, v. liqoglu/fos.

li^qo-dai/da^los, on,
cunningly fashioned in stone, App.Anth.2.534 (Halic.).

li^qo/-dendron, to/,
