branching coral, Dsc.5.121.

li^qo-derkh/s, e/s,
petrifying with a glance, *gorgw/ APl.4.147 (Antiphil.).

li^qo/-dermos, on,
with stony hide, Arist.Rh. post 1377a7 (interpol.).

li^qo-dikte/w, (fort. -dike/w)
throw stones at, Suid.

li^qo/-dmhtos, on,
stone-built, AP9.570 (Phld.).
li^qo-do/mhtos, on, = foreg., J.AJ15.11.5.

li^qo-do/mos, o(,
mason, te/ktones kai\ liqodo/moi joiners and
masons, X.Cyr.3.2.11 codd. (sed leg. liqoto/moi).

li^qo-eidh/s, e/s,
like stone, Hp.Morb.4.55, Pl.Ti.74a, Gal.2.745, etc.
li^qo-ergh/s, e/s, = sq. 1, *me/dousa Opp.C.3.222.

li^qo-ergo/s, o/n,
turning to stone, *gorgw/ AP6.126 (Diosc.). Subst.,
stonemason, Man.1.77.

li^qo-qesi/a, h(,
placing of stones, Alex.Polyh.14.

li^qo-qh/ras, ou, o(,
stone-collector, Tz.H.11.518.

li^q-oikodo/mhtos, on,
built of stone, oi)ki/a Alex.Aphr.in Top.261.29.

li^qo-kallh/s, e/s,
of beautiful stone, morfh/ App.Anth.2.534 (Halic.).

li^qo-ka/rdios, on,
stony-hearted, Sch.E.Or.121.

li^qo-ke/fa^los, on,
with a stone in its head, xre/mus Arist.Fr.294.

li^qo/-kolla, h(,
cement, Dsc. 5.145.

li^qo-ko/llhtos, on,
set with precious stones, xitw/n Callix.2; poth/ria Thphr.Char.23.3, Parmenioap.Ath.11.782a; krath=res Theopomp. Hist.283 (a); fia/lai Agatharch.102; peritraxh/lion Plu.Alex. 32, cf. Men.372: metaph., xa/lubos l. sto/mion a bit of steel
set with stones (to make it sharper), S.Tr.1261 (lyr.). to\ l.
inlaid work, mosaic, prob. in Str.16.4.19, cf. Thphr.Lap.35 (pl.).
li^qo/-kollos, on, = foreg., CIG2852.47 (Branchidae).
li^qo-komiko/n, to/, dub. sens. in IG12.336.9.

li^qo-kope/w,
pelt with stones, UPZ16.18 (Pass., ii B.C.).
li^qo-kopi/a, h(, = h( e)k li/qwn bolh/, Suid.

li^qo-kopiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for stone-cutting, skeu=os Eust.1533.10.

li^qo-ko/pos, o(,
stonecutter, Antipho Soph.92, D.47.65, IG3.307, prob. in 3455.

li^qo-krh/demnos, on,
with crown of stone, of a cliff, Coluth.103.

li^qo-ktoni/a, h(,
death by stoning, AP9.157.

li^qo-la/bos [a^], o(,
instrument for extracting the stone, Gal.14.787.

li^qo-leuste/w,
pelt with stones, Sch.Ar.Ach. 233.
li^qo-leu/sths: liqoboli/ths, Hsch.

li^qo/-leustos, on,
stoned, u(po\ tw=n o)/xlwn D.S.3.47; l. poih=sai/ tina Plu.2.313b, Sch.Call.Iamb.in PSI9.1094.25; l. *)/arhs death
by stoning, S.Aj.254 (lyr.).
deserving to be stoned, Call.Epigr.42.5, Alex.Aet.3.12.

li^qolog-e/w,
build with unworked stones, IG22.463.39, Poll.7.118; o)pta/nion IG22.1672.189. Pass.,
to be demolished, Aq.Mi.3.12.

li^qolo/g-hma, atos, to/,
foundation of unworked stone, X.Cyr.6.3.25, IG 22.463.45 (pl.), 1672.47.

li^qolog-i/a, h(,
laying of a foundation of unworked stones, ib.97.
heap of stones, Aq.Ps.78(79).1.

li^qo/log-os, o(, (le/gw (B) 1)
one who picks out stones for building: hence,
one who builds with stones picked out to fit their places, not squared (cf. loga/s 2), BSA3.112 (Athens): so generally,
mason, Pl.Lg.858b; liqolo/goi kai\ te/ktones
masons and joiners, Th.6.44, cf. 7.43, X.HG4.4.18.

li^qoco/-a^nos, on,
adorned with statues, Nonn.D.4.273.

li^qoco-ei=on, to/,
workshop of a liqoco/os, Gloss.

li^qoco-i+ko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for stonecutting, Klio 10.232, Eust.341.28.

li^qo/co-os, o(, (ce/w)
stone- or
marblemason, Luc.Somn.9, Max.Tyr.38.7, 39.5, f.l. in Timo 25.
sculptor, Plu.2.74d, IG3.1372, AP5.14 (Rufin.).
li^qo-cu/sths, ou, o(, = foreg., Cat.Cod.Astr.7.117.

li^qo-poie/w,
turn to stone, v.l. in Luc.DMar.14.3.

li^qo-poio/s, o/n,
turning to stone, *me/dousa Id.Im.1.
producing stone in the bladder, Alex.Aphr. Pr.1.109.

li^qo-pri/sths, ou, o(,
sawing stone or
marble, pri/wn IG12.313.129, Poll.10.148.
li^qo-purgi/a, gloss on li/hnos, Hsch.

li^qo/-rri_nos, on,
with stony skin, xelw/nh Emp.76.2.

li/qos [i^], ou, o( (v. infr. 11),
stone, Hom., etc.; esp. of the
stones thrown by warriors, trhxu\s l., l. o)krio/eis, Il.5.308, 8.327; also,
stonequoit, Od.8.190; e(le/sqai . . e)k gai/as li/qon A.Fr.199.4; of building-
stones, li/qoi basilikoi/ PSI4.423.28, PCair.Zen.499.20 (both iii B.C.): prov., e)n panti\ ga/r toi skorpi/os frourei= li/qw| S.Fr.37; li/qon e(/yein 'to lose one's labour', Ar.V.280; also of stupid persons, 'blockheads', li/qoi Id.Nu.1202, cf. Thgn.568, Pl.Hp.Ma.292d, Gal.9.656; l. tis, ou) dou/lh Herod.6.4; proshgoreu/qh dia\ to\ mh\ fronei=n l., of Niobe, Philem.101; w(/sper li/qon zh=n Pl.Grg.494a sq.; li/qw| lalei=s prov. of a)nai/sqhtoi, Macar.5.61.
stone as a substance, opp. wood, flesh, etc., e)pei\ ou)/ sfi l. xrw\s ou)de\ si/dhros Il.4.510; laou\s de\ li/qous poi/hse turned into
stone, petrified, 24.611, cf. Pl.Smp.198c; so [nh=a] qei=nai l. Od.13.156; as an emblem of hard-heartedness, soi\ d' ai)ei\ kradi/h sterewte/rh e)sti\ li/qoio 23.103, cf. Theoc.3.18. li/qos, h(, twice in Hom., Il.12.287, Od.19.494, just like masc., also in Theoc.7.26, Bion Fr.1.2: later mostly of
some special stone, as the magnet is called *magnh=tis l. by E.Fr.567 (but h( li/qos simply in Democr.11k, Arist.Ph. 267a2, cf. v.l. de An.405a20); also *ludi/a l. by S.Fr.800 (but in B.Fr. 10 J. *ludi/a l. =
touchstone); *(hraklei/a l. by Pl.Ion533d, Epicur.Fr. 293; so of a
touchstone, Pl.Grg.486d; h( diafanh\s l.
a piece of crystal used for a burning-glass, Ar.Nu.767, cf. Luc.Alex.21; xuth\ l. was perh. a kind of
glass, and so an older name for u(/alos, Epin.1.8 (the same thing as the a)rth/mata li/qina xuta/ in Hdt.2.69; cf. th\n u(/alon . . o(/sa te li/qwn xuta\ ei)/dh kalei=tai Pl.Ti.61c); l. =
precious stone is fem. in Hp.Nat.Mul.99, IG22.1421.92, 1460.21, but masc. in Hdt.2.44, etc.; in the sense of
marble mostly masc., leuko\s l. Id.4.87 (simply li/qos 1.164), S.Fr.330 (leukoi\ l. is opp. pe/trinoi l. Supp.Epigr.4.446.8 (Didyma)); *pa/rios l. Pi.N.4.81, Hdt.3.57; *taina/rios l. Str.8.5.7; l. *qa/sios, *ai)gu/ptios, etc., Paus.1.18.6, etc.; kogxi/ths Id.1.44.6; kogxulia/ths X.An.3.4.10; but *pari/a l. Theoc.6.38, Luc.Am.13; cf. luxni/as, -i/ths; pw/rinos l.
tufa, Hdt.5.62. collectively, pe/fuke li/qos . . a)/fqonos, e)c ou(= . . X.Vect.1.4.
grave-stone (fem.), Call.Epigr.8.1. at Athens, li/qos, o(, was a name for various
blocks of stone used for rostra or
platforms, as, the bh=ma (q.v.) of the Pnyx, Ar.Ach.683, Pax 680, Ec.87. another in the a)gora/ used by the kh/rukes, Plu.Sol.8; prob. the same as o( prath\r l., on which the auctioneer stood when selling slaves, etc., Poll.3.78, cf. 126. an
altar in the a)gora/, at which the Thesmothetae, arbitrators, and witnesses took their oaths, Philoch.65, D.54.26 (restored from Harp. s.v. li/qos), Arist.Ath.7.1, 55.5, Plu.Sol.25; cf. liqwmo/ths. two
stones on which litigants stood in the Areopagus, Paus.1.28.5.
piece on a draughtboard, Alc.82, Theoc. 6.18, cf. grammh/ 111.1: hence pron., pa/nta li/qon kinei=n Zen.5.63 (who explains it differently). Medic.,
stone in the bladder, calculus, Arist.HA519b19, Hp.Morb.4.55, al. *di/a li/qon o)mnu/nai, = Lat.
Jovem lapidem jurare, Plb.3.25.6. li/qoi xala/zhs hail-
stones, LXX Jo.10.11. l. o( ou) l. the philosophers'
stone, Zos. Alch.p.122 B.

li^qo-spa^dh\s a(rmo/s, a chasm in the vault
made by tearing out stones, S.Ant.1216.

li^qo/-spermon, to/,
gromwell, Lithospermum officinale, Dsc.3.141, Ps.-Gal.19.694.

li^qo-stegh/s, e/s,
covered with stones, Sch. Lyc.350.

li^qo/-strwtos, on,
paved with stones, S.Ant.1204; dro/mos POxy.2138.15 (iii A.D.), PFlor.50.97 (iii A.D.). esp. of
tessellated work, l. e)/dafos Str.17.1.28, Poll.7.121; l., to/,
mosaic or
tessellated pavement, IG42(1).110.19 (Epid., iv/iii B.C.), LXX Ca.3.10, Ev.Jo.19.13, CIG2643 (Cyprus, -strat-), Roussel
Délos: Colonie Athénienne p.422, Arr.Epict.4.7.37 (v.l.), etc.

li^qotom-ei=on, to/,
quarry, IG22.47.30. = liqotomi/a 11, Gloss. -e/w,
quarry, Ph.1.235, Philostr.VA3.48:—Pass.,
to be cut out of stone, Luc.JTr.10.
cut for the stone, Gal.1.168:—Pass., Dsc. 5.15, Paul.Aeg.6.60.

li^qotom-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
stone-quarry, IG22.1666B72: mostly in pl.,
quarries, Hdt.2.8, Th.7.86, 87, D.53.17;
marble quarries, Thphr.Lap.6, Paus.1.32.1 (sg. in 1.18.9, 1.19.6), etc.; cf. latomi/a.
cutting for the stone, lithotomy, Gal.18(1).29, Paul. Aeg.6.60.

li^qotom-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for stone-cutting: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh), Porph.Hist.Phil.11, cf. BCH35.12 (Delos);
skill in lithotomy, Gal. Thras.24.
li^qoto/m-ion, to/, = liqoto/mon 11.b, Hermes 38.282.

li^qo/tom-os (parox.), on,
for cutting stones, o)/rgana Agath.1.10: Subst. l., o(, prob. for liqodo/mos in X.Cyr.3.2.11;
quarryman, IG12.347.36, 22.1680.4;
mason, Gal.Thras.43, PAmh.2.76.9 (ii/iii A.D.). Subst., l., o(,
surgeon who cuts for the stone, Gal.1.125, Thras.24; but,
who cuts the stone (internally), Ammonius o( l. Cels.7.26.3. l., to/,
knife for cutting for the stone, Paul.Aeg.6.60.

li^qo-tra/xhlos [a^], on,
stony-, i.e.
stiff-necked, Jul.Gal.213b.

li^qo-tri^biko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for stone-polishing: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh),
the art of so polishing, Lys.Fr.69.

li^qoulk-e/w,
draw or
quarry stones, Suid.: metaph.,
drag slowly along, Hsch.

li^qoulk-i/a, h(,
haulage of stone, IG12.347.38, al.

li^qoulk-o/s, o/n, (e(/lkw)
quarrying stones, Poll.7.118. as Subst. l., o(,
instrument for extracting the stone, Heliod. ap. Orib.45.6.2, Aët.16.111 (101), Paul.Aeg.6.60.

li^qourg-ei=on, to/,
quarry, Is.5.44, Str.5.2.5, IG2.1123
b.

li^qourg-e/w,
work in stone, hew, li/qon LXX Ex.35.33: abs., Porph.Hist.Phil.11;
carve a gem, PMag.Berol.1.68.
turn into stone, petrify, gui=a AP3.11 (Cyzic.), cf. Philostr.Im.1.11.

li^qourg-h/s, e/s,
worked in stone, ei)ko/nisma S.Fr.574; bo/trus Aristeas 70.

li^qourg-i/a, h(,
sculpture in marble, IG12.347.39, D.S.4.76;
working at or
in stone, Thom. Mag.p.221 R.: in pl.,
stone-quarries, Brut.Ep.37.

li^qourg-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a liqourgo/s, te/xnh LXX Ex.28.11: -ka/, ta/, ib.31.5: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh), Lys.Fr.69: -ko/n, to/,
sum spent on masonry, IG12.374.317, al.

li^qourg-o/s, o(,
stone-mason, Ar.Av.1134, Th.4.69, 5.82, etc.;
sculptor in marble, opp. a)ndriantopoio/s (in bronze), Arist.EN1141a10, cf.Supp.Epigr.3.464 (Thess., iv B.C.). sidh/ria liqourga/ a
stone-mason's tools, Th.4.4.

li^qouri/a, h(,
passing gravel with the urine, Sch.Pi.P.1.87.

li^qofor-e/w,
carry stones, Th.6.98.

li^qo/for-os, on,
carrying stones, o(lka/des D.S.13.78; kerai=ai Moschio ap.Ath.5.208d; i(ereu/s IG3.296. as Subst. l., o(, = liqobo/los 1.2, Plb.4.56.3.
li^qo-fru/gion [u^], to/, = li/qos fru/gios (v. Dsc.5.123), Olymp.Alch. p.93 B., Paul.Aeg.3.59.

li^qo-yh/kths, ou, o(, (yh/xw)
stone-polisher, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).216 (-yu/kt- cod.).

li^qo/-ywktos, on, (yw/xw)
rubbing or
polishing stones, Man.4.326.

li^q-o/w, only in Pass. liqo/omai,
to be petrified, Arist.PA641a21, GA 783a28, Plu.2.577f, Luc.Asin.4: impers., liqou=tai
petrifaction takes place, Arist.Pr.937a17. leliqwme/non, prob. = liqo/strwton, Poll. 7.121.

li^q-w/dhs, es,
like stone, stony, gh= Hdt.4.23; o(do/s X.Eq.4.4; to/poi traxei=s kai\ l. Arist.HA590b23; pedi/on (as pr. n.) Str.4.1.7: Comp., of plants, Arist.GA783a31: metaph., l. [ke/ar] Pl.Tht.194e; *nio/bhs au)th=s -wde/steros Lyd.Mag.3.61. Adv. -dw=s, o(/sa (sc. u(/data） prosph/gnutai toi=s xalkei/ois l. Ruf.Fr.66.16.

li^q-wdi/a, h(,
stone-like hardness, Eust.24.7.

li^q-wmo/ths, ou, o(,
one that took an oath at the altar (li/qos IV.3), Com.Adesp.667.

li^q-w/phs, es, (w)/y)
gleaming with jewels, o)fqalmoi/, of the Wooden Horse, Tryph.68. fem. liqw=pis, idos,
turning one to stone by a look, Nonn.D.30.265.

li^/q-wsis, ews, h(,
a turning into stone, petrifying, Plu.2.953e.
work in stone, l. poiki/lh Aristeas 74.

likerti/zein: skirta=n, Hsch. li/khnon: a)ggei=on o)stra/kinon,
Id. li/kigc: h( e)laxi/sth boh\ tw=n o)rne/wn, Sch.Ar.Ach.1034. likma/zein: perilei/xein, Hsch.

likm-ai=os, a, on,
presiding over winnowing, of Demeter, AP6.98 (Zon.).

likm-a/s, a/dos, h(,
winnowing fan, = qri=nac, Hsch. (lixma/s cod.).

likm-hth/r, h=ros, o(,
winnower of corn, Il.13.590.

likm-hth/rion, to/,
winnowing-fan, shovel, Sm. Je.15.7, Thd.Is.30.14, Hsch.
likm-hthri/s, i/dos, h(, = foreg., Poll. 1.245.
likm-hth/s, ou=, o(, = likmhth/r, PFay.101.4 (i B.C.), Poll.1.222, Aq., Sm.Je.51(28).2, Serv.Dan.ad Verg.G.1.166.

likm-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for winnowing, ptu/on Eust.135.43.

likm-hto/s, o(,
winnowing, AP6.225 (Nicaen.). = a)pw/leia, likmhto\n a)nqrw/pois a)peilei= Lyd. Ost.20.
likm-htri/s, i/dos, h(, = likmo/s, PFay.120.4 (i/ii A.D.), Gloss.
likm-h/twr, oros, o(, = likmhth/r, metaph., l. a)sebw=n LXX Pr. 20.20(26).
likm-i/zei: a)loa=|, Hsch.
likm-o/s, ou=, o(, = li/knon, LXX Am. 9.9, Sammelb.5230.2 (i A.D.), Serv.Dan.ad Verg.G.1.166, Hsch.
likn-a/rion, to/, Dim. of li/knon, Gloss.
likn-i/zw, = likma/w, PFay.102.30 (ii A.D.), Gloss.

likn-i/ths [vi_], ou, o(, god
of the li/knon, epith. of Dionysus, Orph.H.46.1, 52.3, Plu.2.365a:—fem. likn-i=tis, trofh/ S.Ichn.269.
liknoeidh/s, e/s, = r(upa\ro/s, Suid., Zonar.

li/knon, to/ (also lei=knon acc. to Hdn.Gr.2.543, and likmo/s (q.v.)),
winnowing-fan, i.e. a broad basket, in which the corn was placed after threshing, and then thrown against the wind so as to winnow the grain from the chaff, Arist.Mete.368b29; sacred to Dionysus, and carried on the head at his festivals, AP6.165 (Phal.); also to Athena, S.Fr.844; cf. likni/ths, liknofo/ros.
cradle, h.Merc.21.150, al., Call.Jov.48, Arat.268, Gal.6.37, etc.
likno-stefei=: li/knon stefanou/menos qrhskeu/ei, Hsch.

likno-fore/w,
carry the sacred li/knon, Polem.Hist.88.

likno-fo/ros, on,
carrying the sacred li/knon
in procession, D.18.260, Call.Cer.127.
likno/w or likne/w, = likma/w, in part. dat. pl. lignou=sin (sic), dub. in Ostr.Strassb.748 (ii A.D.).

likri^fi/s, Adv.
cross-wise, sideways, l. a)i/+cas Il.14.463, Od.19.451.

likroi/: oi( u)/zoi tw=n e)lafei/wn kera/twn, Hsch. (also lekroi/ Id.). li/kths, ou, o(, (lei/xw)
one that licks, Gloss. (better lei/kths).

li^lai/omai, only pres. and impf.,
long or
desire earnestly, freq. in Hom., mostly c. inf.,
long to be or
do so and so, ti/me . . lilai/eai h)peropeu/ein; Il.3.399; l. polemi/zein 16.89; eu)nhqh=nai 14.331: metaph., of a lance, lilaiome/nh xroo\s a)=sai
longing to taste flesh, 21.168, cf. 11.574, 15.317; lilaiome/nh po/sin ei)=nai
longing for him to be her husband, Od.1.15, 9.30, 32, 23.334: c. gen.,
long for, pole/moio, o(doi=o, bio/toio, do/rpoio, Il.3.133, Od.1.315, 12.328, 13.31; also fo/wsde lilai/eo
struggle to the light of day, 11.223: so in later Ep., c. inf., A.R.3.394, al.: c. acc., Nonn.D.28.144: abs., ib.42.132.—Cf.leli/hmai.
lilei=: fqonei=, e)piqumei=, Hsch. lilourgeta/: e)n tw=| sw/mati e)canqh/mata, Id. li/lu: to\ u(/dwr (Libyan word), Id.

li_magx-e/w, in Pass.,
to be weakened or
reduced by hunger or
low diet, Hp.Art.8, Prorrh.2.4, POxy.37i 14 (i A.D.), Gal.10.584.

li_magx-i/a, h(,
weakening by low diet, Ruf.Ren.Ves.1.6.

li_magx-iko/s, h/, o/n,
famished, Hp.Epid.2.1.8.
li_magx-one/w, = limagxe/w, Id.Art.81, Antisth. ap. Stob. 3.8.26, LXX De.8.3, Gal.15.573.
li_magx-oni/a, h(, = limagxi/a, Id.15.478.

li_magx-oniko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for reducing by hunger, Id.1.605.

li_mai/nw (limo/s), aor. 1 e)li/mhna,
suffer from famine, of armies, Hdt. 6.28, 7.25; of a country, Nic.Dam.45 J.

li_ma^le/os, a, on,
starved, Hsch.
limb-ei/a, h(, = lixnei/a, Hdn.Epim.77; limbi/a, Hsch.s.v. lixni/a.
limb-eu/w, = lixneu/w, Hdn.l.c.
li/mb-os (or limbo/s), on, = li/xnos, Hsch., Anon.in EN182.9, etc.

limbo/s, o(, = Lat.
limbus, a dinner-dress, Lyd.Mag.2.4.
limbro/s, a/, o/n, = libro/s 11, EM564.52, Suid.

li^menarx-e/w,
to be a harbour-master, IG7.1826 (Creusis).

li^mena/rx-hs, ou, o(,
harbour-master, PGiss.10.4 (ii A.D.), Cod.Just.7.16.38, Gloss.

li^men-h/oxos, on, (e)/xw)
closing in the harbour, a)/krh A.R.2.965.

li^men-i/zw,
form a harbour, Polyaen.4.7.7.
li^me/n-ion, to/, Dim. of limh/n, Str.5.2.6 (pl.), Marcian.Epit.8.

li^me/n-ios, a, on,
of the harbour, epith. of Aphrodite, Paus.2.34.11; of Zeus, Ach.Tat.Intr.Arat.p.84 M.; cf. sq.

li^men-i/ths [ni_], ou, o(, voc. limeni=ta,
god of the harbour, of Priapus, AP10.1 (Leon.), cf. 10.17 (Antiphil.):—fem. li^men-i=tis, idos, of Artemis, ib.6.105 (Apollonid.). l. fulakth=res
custom-house officers, Dam.Isid.186.

li^men-i_tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of a harbour, xrh/mata
harbour-dues, Cod.Just.10.30.4 (-htiko/s codd.).

li^meno-eidh/s, e/s,
like a harbour, ko/lpos Str.5.1.9.

li^meno-poii/+a, h(,
construction of harbours, Tz.H.2.8 (pl.).

li^meno-poii+ka/, ta/,
things belonging thereto, Ph.Bel.49.3.

li^men-ormi/ths [mi_], ou, o(, （limh/n, o(/rmos)
god of harbours and mooring-places, epith. of Priapus, AP10.5 (Thyill.).

li^menosko/pos, on,
watching the harbour, epith. of Zeus and Phoebus, Call.Fr.114, AP10.25 (Antip.): as fem., Call.Dian.259.

li^menourgi/a, h(,
harbour-making, Tz.H.11.621.

li^menofu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
harbour-watcher, Aen.Tact.29.12: title of magistrate at Carystus, IG12(9).8 (ii B.C.), 9 (i B.C.); to\n li[menofulakou=nta *)a] qhnai/wn may perh. be restored, ib.22.133.23 (iv B.C.).

li^mh/n, e/nss, o(,
harbour, Il.1.432 (here distd. fr. o(/rmos, mooringplace), al., Pl.Ti.25a, etc.; *kanqa/rou l. a dockyard in the Piraeus, with a pun on ka/nqaros just above, Ar.Pax145 (ubi v. Sch.): freq. in pl., lime/nes nhw=n o)xoi/ Od.5.404; lime/nes d' e)/ni nau/loxoi au)th=| 4.846; lime/nes te pa/normoi 13.195, cf. S.Ph.936, etc.: c. gen. objecti, lime/nes qala/sshs
havens of refuge from the sea, Od.5.418, cf. Hes.Sc. 207. metaph.,
haven, retreat, refuge, Thgn.460; e(tairei/as l.
a haven of friendship, S.Aj.683; ou(=tos . . l. pe/fantai tw=n e)mw=n bouleuma/twn E.Med.769: c. gen. objecti, l. kakw=n
from ills, A.Supp.471; w)= nauti/loisi xei/matos l. fanei/s E.Andr.891; u(/pnon . . tw=n kama/twn l. Critias 6.20 D.; l. th=s pla/nhs h(/de h( gh= mo/nh lei/petai D.H.1.58.
gathering-place, receptacle, plou/tou l. A.Pers.250; me/gas E.Or.1077; panto\s oi)wnou= l. S.Ant.1000; *(/aidou l.
harbour of death, ib.1284 (lyr.); cei/nwn ai)doi=oi lime/nes Emp.112.3; boh=s th=s sh=s poi=os ou)k e)/stai l.; what place shall not
harbour (i.e. receive) thy cry? S.OT420. = a)gora/ in Thessaly and Paphos, IG9(2).517.42 (Larissa), Gal.Thras.32, D.Chr.11.23 (interpol.).
the source of birth, womb, Emp.98.3, S.OT1208 (lyr.).

li_mhro/s, a/, o/n, (limo/s)
hungry, causing hunger, e)/rws Theoc.10.57; e)rgasi/h AP6.47 (Antip. Sid.), cf. 285 (Nicarch.), 7.546, Alciphr.1.9, etc.

li^mhro/s, a/, o/n, (limh/n)
furnished with a good harbour, special epith. of Epidaurus in Laconia, Th.4.56, 7.26; eu)li/menon de\ ou)=san, braxe/ws . . limhra\n ei)rh=sqai, w(s a)\n limenhra/n Apollod. ap. Str.8.6.1.
li/minqes: e(/lminqes, Hsch.

limn-a_genh/s, e/s,
born at *li/mnai (v. *li/mnh 11), BMus.Inscr.1009 (Cyzic., ii B.C.), Hsch.

limn-a/zw, of the sea or rivers,
form stagnant pools, Arist.Mete.352b35, 356a7; o(/soi potamoi\ -a/zousin ei)s e(/lh rivers which
stagnate into marshes, Id.Pr.938a3: impers., -a/zei
stagnant pools are left in them, Id.Mete.351b8, 352a5. of the blood,
to be stagnant, Id.HA513b4, Gal.UP14.10. c. acc.,
form into a lake, o( potamo\s l. ta\s a)rou/ras Ph.2.98, cf. Str.8.8.4, D.Chr.11.76:—Pass., of land,
to be flooded, J.AJ1.3.5, PStrassb.10.11 (iii A.D.). intr. in Act., of a country,
become a marsh, e)n toi=s -a/zousi to/pois Arist.Mete.340b37, cf. D.S.4.18, Str.8.5.1, etc.
limn-ai=on, to/, v.l. for limnh/sion, Dsc.3.7.

limn-ai=os, a, on, (li/mnh)
of or
from the marsh, o)/rniqas xersai/ous kai\ l. both land-fowl and
water-fowl, Hdt.7.119, cf. Ar.Av.272; of the crocodile, e)o\n . . tetra/poun, xersai=on kai\ l. e)sti Hdt.2.68; l. krhnw=n te/kna, of frogs, Ar.Ra.211; of the beaver, Nic. Al.307; of an eel, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.8.355d (vulg. limni/a） l. futo/n
water-plant, Plu.2.399f. of water,
stagnant, Hp.
Aër.7.
of or
for marshes, l. ploi=on, ska/fos, PLond.2.317.9 (ii A.D.), Hld.1.31; l. a)/nemoi Hsch. (*li/mnai)
of or
from Limnae, epith. of Dionysus, from his temple there, Call.Fr.37 P.: but *limnai=on, to/,
a temple of Artemis at Limnae, on the borders of Laconia and Messenia, Str.8.4.9, cf. Paus.3.2.6: hence she was called *limna=tis v. limnh/ths; also *limnai/a, epith. of Artemis at Sicyon and elsewhere, Id.2.7.6, etc.
limn-a/s, a/dos, h(, poet. fem. of limnai=os, Theoc. 5.17, Babr.115.1, Paus.3.7.4.

limn-a^si/a, h(,
marshy ground, Arist. Pr.938a7.

limn-asmo/s, o(,
irrigation, flooding, PFlor.21.3 (iii A.D.), POxy.2121.41 (iii A.D.).

limn-astei/a, h(,
irrigation works, BGU91.5 (ii A.D.).

limn-asth/s, ou=, o(,
supervisor of irrigation-works, PTeb.209 (i B.C.), Wilcken Chr.392.4 (ii A.D.).
limn-ei/a, h(, and li/mn-eusis, ews, h(, = limnasi/a, Zonar.

li/mn-h, h(,
pool of standing water left by the sea or a river, Il.21.317: hence,
marshy lake, mere, distd. from e(/los, Pl. Criti.114e, Lg.824c; *boibhi/+s l. Il.2.711; *gugai/h ib.865; *khfisi/s 5.709; l. *gorgw=pis A.Ag.302; *maiw=tis Id.Pr.419 (lyr.), cf. 729, Pers. 871 (lyr.), Hdt.4.86; h( *bo/lbh l. Th.4.103; l. troxoeidh/s, at Delos, Hdt.2.170, cf. A.Eu.9. also,
artificial pool or
basin, Hdt.1.185, 191, al., SIG799 ii 3 (Cyzic., i A.D.). in Hom. and other Poets,
the sea, Il.24.79, Od.3.1; be/nqesi li/mnhs Il.13.21, 32: so in Trag. in lyr., li/mna| porfuroeidei= A.Supp.529; e)p' oi)=dma li/mnas S. Fr.476, E.Hec.446; *po/seidon, o(\s glauka=s me/deis . . li/mnas S.Fr.371; *mhli/da pa\r l. by the Malian
bay, Id.Tr.636. *li/mnai, ai(, (used without the article),
a quarter of Athens (once prob.
marshy), near the Acropolis, in which stood the Lenaeum, Ar.Ra.216, Th.2.15, Is.8.35, etc., cf. limnai=os 11.
a quarter or
suburb of Sparta, Str.8.5.1.
a place in Messenia, Id.8.4.9.

li/mn-hqen, Adv.
from the lake or
sea, A.R.4.1579.
limn-hsi/a, h(, = a)da/rkh, Gal.7.600.
limn-h/sion, to/, = kentau/reion to\ mikro/n, Dsc.3.7; = kentau/reion to\ me/ga, Ps.-Dsc.3.6. = a)da/rkh, Damocr. ap. Gal.13.1051.
*limnh/sios, o(, Laker, name of a frog, v.l. in Batr.223.
li/mn-hsis, ews, h(, = a)da/rkh, v.l. in Gal.6.434.

limn-h/stinon (sc. a)/kopon), to/,
drug prepared from limnh/sion 11, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus.58.92 (s.v.l.).
limn-h/stion, to/, = foreg., ib.104 (lhmni/stion ib. 101).

li/mn-hstis, ews, h(, = kentau/reion to\ me/ga, Ps.-Dsc.3.6, cf. Aret. CA1.2, al.; = a)da/rkh, Gal.6.434:—also limn-hstri/s, i/dos, h(, = a)da/rkh, Androm. ap. Gal.13.1036: gen. sg. lhmni/tidos (sic) Herod.Med.in Rh.Mus.58.101.
li/mn-hstron, to/, = a)da/rkh, Gal.12.424.

limn-h/ths, ou, o(, fem. limn-h=tis, Dor. limn-a=tis, idos,
living in marshes, bde/lla Theoc. 2.56. epith. of Artemis at Limnae (v. limnai=os 11), IG5(1).1431.38 (i A.D.), Paus.3.23.10, 4.4.2, al., Artem.2.35, Sch.Th.Oxy. 853x14: voc. limna=ti AP6.280.

limni-a/rxhs, ou, or limni/-arxos, o(,
superintendent of lakes, POxy.117.20 (ii/iii A.D.).
li/mni-on, to/, Dim. of li/mnh, Arist.Mir.840b33, dub. in Phld.Mort.32.
li/mni-os, a, on, v. limnai=os 1.1.

limn-i_tika/, ta/,
taxes incident upon gh= limnitikh/ (prob. land
on the margin of the lakes, which occurs in
PGen.ined.), PRyl.213.32, al. (ii A.D.).
li/mn-i_tis, idos, h(, epith. of the moon, Hymn.Mag.5.46.

limno/-bi^os, on,
living in a lake, opp. xerso/bios, Ael.NA6.10, Philum.Ven.36.1.
limno-eidh/s, e/s, = limnw/dhs. Adv. -dw=s Eust.ad D.P.48.

limno-qa/lassa [qa^], Att. li/mno-tta, h(,
lagoon, Xanth.3, Arist.
HA598a20, GA761b7, Gal.6.711; later, of the Dead Sea, Aët.1 Praef.

limno-ma/xhs [a^], ou, o(,
candidate for the prize at the Lenaea, v. li/mnh 11.1, Hsch.

limno/-omai, Pass.,
become a marsh, Thphr.HP5.4.6, CP5.12.3, Str.5.3.13.
li/mnos, h(, perh. = li/mnh, POxy.103.18 (iv A. D.).

limno/streon, to/,
edible oyster, which was kept in ponds by the sea (li/mnai), Arist.HA528a23, 547b11, GA763a30.

limnosw/ma^tos, on,
marsh-bodied, e)gxe/leis Eub.37 (s. v.l.).

limnourgo/s, o(,
one who works in li/mnai,
fisherman, Plu.Mar.37.

limno-fu^h/s, e/s,
marsh-born, do/nac AP6.23.

limno/-xa^ris, itos, o(,
Grace of the marsh, or limno-xa^rh/s,
Love-marsh, name of a frog, Batr.12, 212.

limnw/dhs, es,
marshy, u(/dwr Hp.
Aër.10, cf. Arist.Mete.353b24; o( *po/ntos e)sti\ l. dia\ to\ pollou\s potamou\s ei)s au)to\n r(ei=n Id.Pr.932a28. of
marshy ground, to\ l. tou= *strumo/nos Th.5.7.

li_modoc-e/w,
crave after fame, Ph.2.273, 534.

li_modoc-i/a, h(,
craving for fame, Id.1.290.
*li_modwriei=s, oi(, name given to colonists driven by famine from Peloponnesus, Hsch.

li_mo-qnh/s, h=tos, o(, h(,
dying of hunger, A.Ag.1274.

li_mo-ki/mbic, i_kos, o(, h(,
one who starves himself from avarice, Com.Adesp.1073.

li_mo-ko/lac, a^kos, o(,
hungry flatterer, ib.1074.

li_mo-ktone/w,
treat by hunger, diet severely, starve, Hp.
Acut.(Sp.）56, Pl.R.589a, LXXPr.10.3:— Pass.,
to be severely dieted, Hp.Mul.1.12;
to be starved to death, Str. 11.11.3, Procop.Arc.25.

li_mo-ktoni/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
treatment by abstinence from food, Hp.
Acut.(Sp.）24, Vict.3.71, Gal.11.182: pl., Pl. Prt.354a.

li_mo/-chros, on,
wasted with hunger, Hierocl.Facet.219- 226. Adv. -rws Gloss.

li_mo-poio/s, o/n,
causing hunger, Erot. s.v. lebhri/dos; *zeu/s Oenom. ap. Eus.PE6.7.

li_mo/s, ou=, o( (Dor. h(, acc. to Phryn.164, used by the Megarian in Ar.Ach.743, cf. Herod.2.17, Bion Fr.14.4; *l. e)/xwn gunaiko\s morfh/n Callisth. ap. Ath.10.452b; also h.Cer.311, Call.
Fr.anon.43, Plb.1.84.9, AP9.89 (Phil.), Ev.Luc.15.14, Act.Ap.11.28):—
hunger, famine, di/ya te kai\ l. Il.19.166; limw=| qane/ein Od.12.342; limo\n o(mou= kai\ loimo/n Hes.Op.243, cf. Th.2.54; l. ai)anh/s Pi.I.1.49; limw=| sunestew=tas Hdt. 7.170; sko/tw| l. cu/noikos A.Ag.1642; dei/pnou profh/thn limo/n Antiph. 217.23; a(/panq' o( l. gluke/a plh\n au(tou= poiei= Id.293; o( de\ l. e)stin a)qanasi/as fa/rmakon Id.86.6: prov., a)polei=te limw=| *mhli/w|, referring to the siege of Melos, Ar.Av.186: metaph., h)/dh ga\r ei)=don . . limo/n t' e)n a)ndro\s plousi/ou fronh/mati, gnw/mhn de\ mega/lhn e)n pe/nhti sw/mati E.El. 371.
a hungry wretch, Men.Kol.78, Posidipp.26.12, Eust. 1828.6.

li_mo-foreu/s, e/ws, o(, (fe/rw)
causing hunger, AP11.371 (Pall.).

li_mo/-ywros, o(, (yw/ra)
scurvy, arising from hunger or bad food, Plb.3.87.2:—later li_mo-yw/ra, h(, Hippiatr.69.
limpa/nw, collat. form of lei/pw, Hp.Morb.4.55, Arat.128, Hdn.Gr. 2.10: elsewh. only in compds. a)po-, kata-, u(po-limpa/nw; not in Hom. exc. as v. l. in Il.11.604 (PTeb.266).
limfeu/ein: a)pata=n, Hsch. limfo/s: sukofa/nths, h)\ mhnuth\s parano/mwn, Id.

li_m-w/dhs, es,
famished, hungry, limw=de/s ti e)/xei tina/ Hp.Prog.2; limw=des e)rugga/nein Alciphr.1.25; l. ti a)nafqe/ggesqai Plu.2.751a, cf. Sm.Jb.30.7, Ath.6.270f; l. tra/peza
scanty, Plu.2.703f; lepto\s kai\ l. u(/pnos ib.325c.

li_/m-wcis, ews, h(,
starvation, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.230, PLond.5.1676.27 (vi A. D.).

li_m-w/ssw, Att. li_/m-ttw,
to be famished, hungry, Str.15.2.5, J.AJ2.1.1, Babr.45.8, AP6.307.8 (Phan.), Luc. Luct.9, Alciphr.1.21: aor. e)li/mwca Apostol.10.53.
li^n-agertoume/nh (fort. -agre-）: e)nhmme/nh lina/, kakoei/mwn, linergou=sa, Hsch.

li^n-agre/ths, ou, o(,
caught in the net, Lyc.237.

li^n-ai=os, a, on,
pertaining to flax, fo/ros
flax-tax, PBaden19.32 (ii A. D.).
made of flax or
linen, Hp.Steril.221, Morb.2.34. (Perh. always a misspelling of li/neos: li/naia <:e)/ria>, Hsch. is a misspelling of lh/nea.)
li/namai: tre/pomai, Hsch.

li^n-a/rion, to/, Dim. of li/non,
thread, Roussel
Cultes Égyptiens p.213 (Delos, ii B. C.), Dsc.2.171, PMag.Par.1.1083.
net, D.Chr.7.71, Eust.574.32.

li^n-a/rmenon, to/,
sail, POxy.2136.6 (iii A. D.), PLond.3.1164h7 (iii A. D.).
li^n-autia/, sine expl., Hsch.
li^n-a/w, only found in compds. dia-, e)k-, e)pi-lina/w.
li/ndesqai: a(milla=sqai, Hsch.
li/ndos, o(, an aromatic plant, Mnesim.4.63, cf. Eust.315.18.
li/n-eios [i^], a, on, = li/neos, Suid.

lin-e/mporos, o(,
flax-merchant, POxy.1414.7 (iii A. D.).

li/n-eos, a, on, contr. lin-ou=s, h=, ou=n, (li/non)
of flax, linen, kiqw/n, qw/rhc, Hdt.1.195, 3.47, etc.; i(ma/tion Pl.Cra. 389b; sfai=ra Arist.HA616a6; stolh/ BGU1036.14 (ii A. D.); nefe/lai (i. e. nets) Call.Aet.3.1.37; o(/pla l. cables
of flax, Hdt.7.36: also lina=, ta/, A.Fr.206, Ar.Fr.19: Subst. line/h, h(,
tape-measure used in building, IG7.3073.128 (Lebadea), cf. Bito63.7, 9 (v.l. linai/a); cf. linai=os.
lin-erge/w, gloss on linagertoume/nh, Hsch.

lin-ergh/s, e/s,
wrought of flax, Lyc.716, D.P.1116.
lin-eu/s, e/ws, o(, = kestreu/s, Call.Com.3, Phot., Hsch.

lin-eu/w,
catch with nets, l. gurgaqoi=s Peripl.M.Rubr.15.

lin-e/yion, to/,
tax on, or
payment for, linenboiling, Ostr.Bodl.i 140,141 (ii B. C.).

lin-eyo/s, o(,
linen-boiler, linencleaner, PCair.Zen.304.6, PSI4.349.5, 6.566.7 (all iii B. C.).

lin-iko/s, h/, o/n,
pertaining to flax: -kh/, h(,
tax on flax, PTeb.347.12 (ii A. D.).
li/n-inos, h, on, = li/neos, Schwyzer462 B39, al. (Tanagra, iii B. C.).
lini/s, v. lhni/s 11.

li^no-genh/s, e/s,
born (i. e. made)
of flax, e)pendu/tai S.Fr.439.
li^no/-desmos, on, = sq., sxedi/a A.Pers.68 (lyr.).

li^no/-detos, on, (de/w)
bound with flaxen cords, xalinoi/ E.IT1043; pe/dh (of the Hellespont) Tim. Pers.85; l. w(/sper mhlolo/nqhn tou= podo/s
tied by the foot, Ar.Nu. 764.
li^no/-dru_s, uos, h(, = xamai/drus, xamai/rwy, Dsc.3.98.
li^no-ergh/s, e/s, = linergh/s, Opp.H.3.444 (v.l. -erkh/s).

li^no-erkh/s, e/s,
surrounding with nets or
snares, Nonn.D.26.55; cf. foreg.

li^no/-zwstis (in codd. sts. wrongly li^no-zw=stis), ews (Gal.14.760, 19.128) and idos (Id.12.63, 19.96), Ion. ios (Hp.Epid.7.92), h(,
mercury, Mercurialis annua, Hp.Mul.2.135, Epid.l. c., Dsc.4.189: dat. linozw/stw| v.l. in Aret.CA1.2. l. a)gri/a a)/rrhn
dog's mercury, Mercurialis perennis, Ps.-Dsc.4.190.

li^no/-zwstos, on,
bound with flaxen cords, pleurai/, of ships, Tim.Pers.16. v. foreg. 1.

li^no-qh/ras, ou, o(,
one who uses nets or
snares, AP7.172tit.

li^no-qw/rac, a_kos, Ep. and Ion. li^no-qw/rhc, hkos, o(, h(,
wearing a linen cuirass, Il.2.529, 830; *)argei=oi AP14.73; [*lusitanoi/] Str.3.3.6.

li^no-ka^la/mh [la^], h(, = a)morgi/s,
fine flax, PCair.Zen.470 (iii B. C.), Cleopatra ap.Gal.12.433, Sch.Ar.Lys.736; collectively,
flax-straw, used as thatch, LXX Jo.2.6, cf. Eust.ad D.P.525, POxy.103.9 (iv A. D.), etc.
li^no-ka^la^mi/s, i/dos, h(, = li/non (i. e. lino/spermon), Ps.-Dsc. 2.103.
li^no-ka/la^mon [ka^], to/, = linokala/mh, PMasp.116.3 (pl., vi A. D.).
li^no-ka/rukes: oi( ta\ lina\ pwlou=ntes, Hsch.
li^no/-klws, v. linoulko/s.

li^no/-klwstos, on,
spinning flax, h)laka/th AP7.12.

li^no-kri_qh/, h(,
flax mixed with barley, PLille1.38f (iii B. C.).

li^no/-krokos, on,
flaxwoven, fa=ros E.Hec.1081.

li/non [i^], to/,
anything made of flax (v. fin.)
cord, fishingline, Il.16.408;
thread spun from a distaff, E.Or.1431 (lyr.), Archipp. 38, etc.: pl., E.Tr.537 (lyr.);
thread for stringing jewels, o(/rmon xrusei/oisi li/noisin e)erme/non h.Ap.103; a)/lla pantodapa\ xrusa= a)nhrme/na e)pi\ li/nou IG11(2).208.22 (Delos, iii B. C.);
thread used as a
ligature, Gal. 2.669. metaph.,
thread of destiny spun by the Fates, Il.20.128, Od.7.198, etc.: pl., ta/ ge ma\n l. pa/nta leloi/pei e)k *moira=n Theoc.1.139, cf. Call.Lav.Pall.104; u(pe\r to\ l., = u(pe\r mo/ron, Luc.JConf.2. prov., with or without neg., li/non li/nw| suna/ptein, i. e. join like with like , deal with matters of like kind, Pl.Euthd.298c, Stratt.38, Arist. Ph.207a17.
fishing-net, a)yi=si li/nou a(lo/nte Il.5.487, cf. klwsth/r 11; also,
hunting-net, Theoc.8.58, 27.17; for catching birds, D.S.1.60, AP9.396 (Paul. Sil.), 343 (Arch.); l. dorka/deia
hunting-nets for gazelles, PCair.Zen.524 (iii B. C.).
linen, linen-cloth, Il. 9.661, Od.13.73, 118: pl.,
linen cloths, linen garments, A.Supp.121, 132 (both lyr.): sg.,
linen garment, Apoc.15.6;
sail-cloth, Ar.Ra.364, A.R.1.565, etc.
flax for spinning, li/nou mesto\n a)/trakton Ar. Ra.1347, cf. PRev.Laws39.7 (iii B. C.), etc.; l. *karpa/sion
asbestos, Paus.1.26.7.
the plant flax, Linum usitatissimum, li/non e)rga/zesqai Hdt.2.105, etc.; li/nou spe/rma
linseed, Th.4.26: pl., h( e)k twn l. dhmiourgi/a Pl.Plt.280c. = qumelai/a, Dsc.4.172. = xruso/gonon, ib.56. l. pu/rinon, an unknown plant, Thphr. HP9.18.6. l. a)po\ tw=n dendre/wn
cotton, Gossypium herbaceum, Nearch. ap. Arr.Ind.1.16.1. v. *li/nos 11. (Lith.
linaĩ pl. 'flax', with i^ as in Gr., but Lat.
linum, OE.
lin, etc. with i_: i_ also in the doubtful words lino/sarkos, linopta/omai, a)mfi/linos.)

li^no/-peplos, on,
with linen robe, AP6.231 (Phil.).

li^no/-plektos, on,
twisted or
plaited of flax, Nonn.D.26.56 codd. li^no/-plhktos, on,
shy of the net, of animals that have been caught and escaped, Plu.2.642a:—also li^no-plh/c, h=gos, o(, h(, Hsch.: Sup. linoplhge/statos, i)xqu=s Numen. ap. Ath.7.321b.

li^no-plo/kos, o(,
linen-weaver, Ostr.Strassb. 277.3 (ii A. D.).
li^no-plu/nas: tribeu/s, Hsch.

li^no-plu^th/s, ou=, o(,
flax-washer, flax-soaker, prob. in Aët.8.16 (linoplh/twn gen. pl., codd.).

li^no-poio/s, o/n,
making linen, Sch.Ar.Th.942.

li^no-po/ros, on,
sail-wafting, au)=rai E.IT410 (lyr.).
linopt-a/zei: e)pilineu/ei, perible/pei, Hsch.

linopt-a/omai, (lino/pths)
watch nets to see whether anything is caught, Ar.Pax 1178 (li_n-; dub. l.).

li^no/-pteros, on,
sail-winged, l. nauti/lwn o)xh/mata A.Pr.468.
li^no-pte/ruc, u^gos, o(, h(, = foreg., Opp.C.1.121, 4.61.

li^n-o/pths, ou, o(, (o)/yomai)
one who watches nets to see whether anything is caught, Arist. ap. Sch.Ar.Pax 1178, Poll.5.17, Hsch.

li^no-pu_ros, o(,
flax mixed with wheat, PLille 31.13 (iii B. C.).

li^no-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
flax-merchant, Ostr.45, al. (i/ii A. D.).

li^no-rra^fh/s, e/s, (r(a/ptw)
sewn of flax, tulei=a S.Fr.468; l. do/mos dub.sens. in A.Supp. 134 (lyr.).
making nets, a(lih=es Nonn.D.23.131.

*li/nos [i^], o(, Linos, a mythical minstrel, Hes.Fr.192, Theoc.24.105, Apollod.1.3.2. as Appellat.,
the song or
lay of Linos, whether composed by him or upon him; li/non d' u(po\ kalo\n a)/eide leptale/h| fwnh=| sang
the lay of Linos in accompaniment, Il.18.570, cf. Pi.Fr.139.5, Hdt.2.79, E.HF348 (lyr.), Ar.Byz. ap. Ath.14.619c, and v. oi)to/linos. (In Il. l. c. Zenod. read li/nos and interpreted it of the string of the instrument, which was orig. made of flax acc. to Sch.)

li/nos, o(, = li/non, to/, li/nos: to\ di/ktuon, Suid.; li=nos: to\ lina/rion, Et.Gud.371; li=nos also in Gp.2.40.3. li/noi, oi(,
the Bands, a constellation, Gem.3.7.

li_no/sarkos, on,
with soft, tender body (as Eust. expld. it), trofali/s Antiph.49 (s. v. l.).

li^no/-sparton, to/,
Spanish broom, Spartium junceum, Thphr.HP 1.5.2.

li^no-spe/rminos, h, on,
of linseed, e)/laion Aët.1.101.

li^no/-spermon, to/,
linseed, Dsc.2.103, Gal.6.549, Artem.1.68, Alex.Aphr.Pr. 1.67, POxy.103.13 (iv A. D.):—also lino/sperma, atos, to/, Cleopatra
ap.Gal.12.433, Hippiatr.54, Alex. Trall.12, v.l. in Gal.6.549.

li^no-sta^si/a, h(,
laying of nets: the nets laid, AP6.179 (Arch.), 9.76 (pl., Antip.).

li^no-sta^te/w, (i(/sthmi)
lay nets, Opp.C.4.64, Longus 2.13:— Pass.,
to be surrounded and caught with nets, Ath.5.219d.

li^no-stoli/a, h(,
wearing of linen, linen clothing, Plu.2.352c (pl.), Man.4.344, Vett.Val.4.27.

li^no/-stolos, on,
clad in linen, B.18.43, Hymn.Is. 1.

li^no/-strofos, on,
twisted of flax, qw=migc Opp.H.3.76. -strofon, to/, =
marrubium, Plin.HN20.241, Gloss.

li^no-teixh/s, e/s,
with linen walls, Dionys. ap. St.Byz.s.v. *gazo/s.
li^no-to/moi: oi( ta\ li/na diate/mnontes kai\ u(gih= deiknu/ntes, i.e. conjurers, Hsch.
li^nou/gion, to/, perh. = sq., Sammelb.7033.40, al. (v A.D.).

li^n-ou/dion [i^], to/,
linen shirt, POxy.114.8 (ii A.D.), 1066.10 (iii A. D.), etc.

li^n-oulko/s, o/n, (e(/lkw)
of spun flax, xlai=na Ion Trag. 40 (lino/klws cj. Lobeck).

li^nourg-ei=on, to/,
linen factory, prob. l. in Str.4.2.2 (pl.): sg., Id.16.1.7.

li^nourg-e/w,
make into linen, th\n kala/mhn Sch.Pi.P.4.376.

li^nourg-i/a, h(,
linen manufacture, Str.11.2.17.

li^nourg-o/s, o/n,
working flax, spinning or
weaving, gunh/ Alex.35. as Subst. l., o(,
linen-weaver, PMagd. 36.2 (iii B.C.), Str.3.4.9, PRyl.397.2 (iii A. D.), Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).137; suntexni/a l. IGRom.3.896 (Anazarba). a kind of
goose, Dionys.Av.3.23. a kind of
stone, Ps.-Plu.Fluv.22.3. linourgoi/, oi(, name given to the proletariate, D.Chr.34.21.
linou=s, h=, ou=n, contr. for li/neos.

li^nou+f-h/s [u^], e/s,
weaving linen, EM558.49:—also li^no/u+fos, on, AB302, PGiss.40 ii 27 (iii A. D.), Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).216, etc.; cf. li/nufos.

li^nou+f-iko/s, h/, o/n,
pertaining to linen-weaving, ph=xus POxy. 669.33 (iv A. D.):

li^nou+f-ko/s, o(,
linen-weaver, BGU637.17 (iii A. D.): -ko/n, to/,
tax on linen-weaving, POxy.1438.12 (ii A.D., linouyiko/n Pap.).

li^nou/+f-ion,
lintio, Gloss. (fort. linoufi/wn).

li^nou=xos, on,
having or
using nets, Gloss.

li^no-fako/s, o(,
flax mixed with lentils, PLille1.31.14 (iii B. C.).

li^no-fa/nths, ou, misspelling for *linou+f-,
linen-weaver, UPZ85.14 (ii B. C.).

li^no-fqo/ros, on,
linen-spoiling, u(fasma/twn laki/des A.Ch.27 (lyr.).

li^no-fo/ros, on,
flax-bearing, of land,
PLond.ined.2361r (iii B. C.).

li^no-xi/twn [i^], wnos, o(, h(,
with linen tunic, Hsch., prob. l. in Him.Or.11.1.

li^no/-xlainos, on,
with linen mantle, D.P.1096, Nonn. D.26.58.

li^no/-xortos, o(, or li^no/-xorton, to/,
joint crop of flax and grass, PBaden 15.20 (i B. C.).

li^nu^fant-ei=on, to/,
workshop for weaving flax, PMagd.36.2 (iii B. C.), PTeb.5.238 (ii B. C.).

li^nu^fant-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for linen-weaving, e)rgalei=a ib.242 (ii B. C.).
li^nu^f-a/rios, o(, = li/nufos, Cod.Just.11.8.13.
li^nu^f-ei=on, to/, = linufantei=on, e)p' a)mfo/dou *linufei/wn BGU324.7 (ii A. D.).

li^/nu^f-os, = lino/u+fos, PTeb.5.239 (ii B. C.), POxy.1281.4 (i B. C.), etc.; h( suntexni/a tw=n l. guild of
linen-weavers, Papers of Amer.School 1.97 (Tralles); h( i(era\ te/xnh linu/fwn JRS18.171 (Jerash).

li^nw|di/a, h(,
the lament for Linos (v. *li/nos II), Sch.B. Il.18.570 (pl.).

li^nwni/a, h(,
purchase of flax, PPetr.3p.187, al. (iii B. C.).
li/c: pla/gios, kai\ li/qos platu/s, Hsch.; also, = pneumoni/a, no/sos, Id. lioleqri/a|: pantelei= o)le/qrw|, Id. liope/trion: li/qos lei=os, Id.

li/pa^ [i^], used by Hom. as Adv. usu. in the phrase a)lei/yasqai li/p' e)lai/w| anoint oneself
richly with oil, Il.10.577, 14.171, al.; xri=sai, xri/sasqai li/p' e)lai/w|, Od.3.466, 6.96, 10.364, Hes.Op.522: once without e)lai/w|, loe/ssato kai\ li/p' a)/leiyen Od.6.227; so later, tw=| r(odi/nw| a)lei/fesqai li/pa Hp.Mul.2.150; e)lai/w| xri/wn li/pa ib.147: also without a dat., xri/esqai li/pa ib.1.35; li/pa a)lei/yasqai, a)lei/yesqai, Th.1.6, 4.68, cf. Thphr.HP9.8.5, etc. in Hp. sts. as Subst., neut. nom. or acc., xri=sma li/pa e)/stw Mul.2.133; mhd' a)/llo ti pi=on mhde\ li/pa e)/xon ib.145; so li/pa a)skei=n D.C.53.27. (Cf. li/pos.）

li^pa/delfos [a^], on,
brotherless, Epigr.Gr.241.9 (Smyrna).
li^pa/zw, = sq., Nic.Th.90, 112.

li^pai/nw, aor. e)li/phna Opp.H.4.357, e)li/pa_na Axionic.4.10:—Med., aor. e)liph/nato Euph.9.9; part. liphna/menos APl.4.273 (Crin.):— Pass., aor. e)k-lipanqh=nai Plu.Mar.21: pf. leli/pasmai Damocr. ap. Gal.13.225:—
oil, anoint, th\n kefalh\n e)lai/w| Hp.Mul.1.35; xrw=ta mu/rois Anaxil.18.1; xara=s u(/po sw=ma l. i(drw=ti Aspasia ap.Ath.5.219c; pa/smasi sw=ma l. Axionic. l. c., cf. PMag.Osl.1.212; of
oiling the to/noi in a machine to preserve them, Ph.Bel.61.37:—Med.,
anoint oneself, AP l. c. of rivers,
make fat, enrich, xw/ran u(/dasin E.Ba. 575 (lyr.), cf. Hec.454 (lyr.); of Sciron swallowed by a sea-tortoise, xe/luos . . e)liph/nato laimo/n Euph. l. c. (s. v.l.). intr., of the eyes,
glisten with tears, Epicur.Fr.120.

li^pandr-e/w,
to be in want of men, Ephor.216 J.

li^pandr-i/a, h(,
want of men, Str.13.1.32, J.BJ3.3.2.
li^panqrwpi/a, h(, = foreg., Eust.23.39.

li/pan-sis [li^], ews, h(,
anointing, Antyll. ap. Orib.10.29.1.

lipan-te/on,
one must anoint, Herod.Med.in Rh.Mus.58.104.

lipan-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for anointing, e)/laion Sch.Od.6.227.

*li^pa/ra [pa^], h(, Lipara, the largest of the Aeolian islands, Th.3.88, etc.:—Adj. *li^pa^rai=os, a, on,
of Lipara, ai( *l. nh=soi
the group of these islands, Plb.1.25.4, etc.; h( *liparai/wn po/lis Arist.Mete.367a6; li/qos *liparai=os a stone like
volcanic glass or
obsidian, Thphr.Lap.14, Orph. L.692.

li^pa^r-a/mpuc, u^kos, o(, h(,
with bright fillet or
headband, *mnamosu/na Pi.N.7.15; parodied by Ar.Ach.671 (lyr.), as epith. of fishsauce.

li^pa^r-augh/s, e/s,
bright-beaming, porqmi/des Philox.3.1.

li_pa^r-e/w,
persist, persevere, hold out, of obstinate resistance, liparh/somen ou(/tw, o(/kws a)\n e)/xwmen Hdt.8.144: in part., tou\s *ludou\s te/ws me\n dia/gein lipare/ontas continued
to hold out, under pressure of famine, Id.1.94: reversely, with part. added, lipare/ete me/nontes
persist in holding your ground, Id.9.45; e)lipa/ree i(store/wn
persisted in inquiring, Id.3.51: c. dat., l. th=| po/sei
keep on drinking, Id.5.19; l. th=| e(tai/ra| D.L.6.66. of persistent entreaty, abs.,
to be importunate, lipareo/ntwn de\ au)tw=n Hdt.1.86, cf. 2.42, 9.111, A.Pr.520, Pl.Cra.413c, Men.Epit.54, Herod.6.28,93; genou= gli/sxros prosaitw=n liparw=n te Ar.Ach.452, cf. D.21.206. c. acc. et inf.,
beseech one to do a thing, A.Pr.1004; also tou= me xrei/as w(=de liparei=s tuxei=n; to obtain what request
dost thou so
importune me? S.OT1435; liparou=nti me\n tuxei=n
importunate to obtain, Id.OC776; cuggene/sqai . . m' e)lipa/rei . . ma/zais
importuned me to become acquainted with cakes, Telecl.38 (cj. Porson), cf. X.Oec.2.16; also l. tina\ o(/pws . . PAmh. 2.79.47 (ii A. D.); e)caith/sesqai kai\ liparh/sein par' u(mw=n au)to/n
entreat earnestly for him at your hands, D.21.208; but also l. bwmou/s
importune . . , Plb.32.15.7:—Pass.,
to be earnestly entreated, u(po/ tinwn X. HG3.5.12.

li_pa^r-h/s, e/s,
persisting or
persevering in a thing,
earnest, indefatigable, peri/ tinos Pl.Cra.413a; peri/ ti, pro/s ti, Id.Hp.Mi.369d, 372b: also c. gen., paidei/as Luc.Am.6. of things, l. xeirourgi/a Ar.Lys.672; proqumi/a Luc.Abd.4; l. pureto/s an
obstinate fever, Id.Hist.Conscr.1.
earnest in begging or
praying, importunate, c. part., l. h)=san deo/menoi Plu.TG6; a)kou=sai/ ti boulo/menoi l. h)=san Id.2.665e; l. xei/r a hand
instant in prayer, S.El.1378: c. gen.,
fawning upon, tw=n e)n e)cousi/a| Plu.2.776b; to\ l.
importunity, Luc.Herm.24; pro\s to\ l., = liparw=s, S.OC1119. Adv. -rw=s
earnestly, importunately, Pl.Lg.931c; l. e)/xwn a)kou/ein longing
earnestly to hear, Id.Prt.315e; l. e)/xw gi/gnesqai/ ti I am
importunate in desiring that . . , ib.335b.

li_pa^/r-hsis, ews, h(,
supplication, D.H.1.81 (pl.).

li_pa^r-hte/on,
one must be importunate, X.Ap.23.

li^pa^r-i/a, h(, (liparo/s)
fatness, Dsc.1.40.
li^pa^r-ia/zw, gloss on lipai/nomai, An.Ox.2.470.
li^pa^r-i/sxios, on, dub. sens. in Lyr. in Philol.80.338.

li^pa^ro/-geios, on,
with rich soil, Sch.D Il.18.541.

li^pa^ro/-zwnos, on,
bright-girdled, qu/gatres B.8.49; *)ae/lios E.Ph.175 (lyr.).

li^pa^ro/-qronos, on,
bright-throned, A.Eu.806, Lyr.Adesp.140.6, Aristonous 2.16.

li^pa^ro-krh/demnos, on,
with bright headband, Il.18.382, h.Cer.25, 459, etc.

li^pa^r-o/mma^tos, on,
lustrous-eyed, Licymn.4, Arist.Phgn.808a34.

li^pa^ro-plo/ka^mos, on,
with glossy locks, Il.19.126, Pi.Fr.88.1.
li^pa^ro-poie/w, gloss on katalipai/nein, Hsch.

li^pa^r-o/s, a/, o/n, (li/pa) prop.
oily, shiny with oil, once in Hom.,
anointed, liparoi\ kefala\s kai\ kala\ pro/swpa Od.15.332; l. xwrei=n e)k balanei/ou Ar.Pl.616; qea=sqai liparo\n para\ tw=| *dionu/sw| Id.Eq.536, cf. Nu.1002; soi\ de\ melh/sei . . liparw=| (Bentl. for -rw=s） xwrei=n e)pi\ dei=pnon Id.Ec.652; of oil or oily objects,
shiny, Simon.148.4, X.Mem. 2.1.31, Pl.Ti.60a, 84a, Arist.HA520a27.
fatty, greasy, a)/rtos Ar.Fr.109; ta\ l.
unctuous dishes, ib.506.1; to\ l.
fatty substance, Arist.PA651a24; liparai/ (sc. e)/mplastroi), ai(,
oily plasters, Dsc.1.112, Gal.12.468: sts. opp. to\ pi=on (which implies resinous substance), Arist.Mete.387b6, cf. Col.791b23; of vegetables
boiled in grease, Hp. Mul.1.66. Adv. -rw=s, e(/yein boil
in grease, Hp.Mul. l. c.; so l. h)rtume/non Gal.9.677; a)natri/bein massage
with a greasy or
oily lubricant, Hp.Art.9. of the healthy look of the human body or skin,
shining, sleek, in Hom. in phrase liparoi\ po/des
bright, smooth feet, without a wrinkle on the skin, mostly of men's feet, in the line possi\ d' u(po\ liparoi=sin e)dh/sato kala\ pe/dila Il.2.44, al.; of Hera, 14.186; of Themis, Hes.Th.901; -w/teroi e)ge/nonto Hdt.3.23; l. sth=qos Ar.Nu. 1012; qhri/a X.Cyr.1.4.11; xei/lea Luc.Am.13;
radiant, quga/thr *xro/nou B.7.1; a)/koitis Id.5.169. of condition or state of life,
rich, comfortable, easy, gh=ras Od.11.136, 19.368, Pi.N.7.99; l. eu)frosu/nh AP11.63 (Maced.). Adv. -rw=s, ghraske/men Od.4.210; plh/santa l. ku/klon e)tw=n e(kato/n Epigr.Gr.451. of things,
bright, brilliant, liparh\ kalu/ptrh Il.22.406; l. krh/demna Od.1.334, etc.; xoroi/ Hes.Th.63; of city walls, Od.13.388; l. do/mos B.15.29; ni/ka Id.10.38; ste/fanoi Id.1.47; lipara\s tele/ousi qe/mistas
splendid or
rich tribute, Il.9.156,298; also, of the
oily smoothness of a calm sea, l. gala/na Theoc.22.19, cf. Call.Epigr.6.5; also se/las Theoc.23.8; and of smells, l. o)smh/
rich, savoury, Arist. de An.421a30, cf. Sens.443b10. of soil,
fat, rich, fruitful, as epith. of places, *xi/os, h(\ nh/swn liparwta/th ei)n a(li\ kei=tai h.Ap.38; l. po/lis Thgn.947; l. *)orxomeno/s, *qh=bai, *na/cos, *maraqw/n, Pi.O.14.2, P.2.3, 4.88, O.13.110; liparai\ *)aqh=nai, favourite epith. with the Athenians, prob. with allusion to the Attic olive, first in Pi.I.2.20, Fr.76, cf. Ar.Ach.639, 640 (where he plays on the double sense of
brilliant and
greasy), Nu.300, Fr.110; l. to\ xrh=ma th=s po/lews, of Nephelococcygia, Id.Av.826; l. xeu/mata, of rivers, A.Supp.1028 (lyr.); l. o(/rmos Call.Del.155; a)/ntron Orph.H. 59.4 (Hermann), etc. Adv. li^parw=s, v. supr. 1, 111.

li^pa^r-o/ths, htos, h(,
fattiness, u(pa/rxei e)n ga/lakti l. Arist.HA522a21, cf. PA652a29: in pl.,
fatty substances, Hp.Prog.12.
brilliancy, o)mma/twn Plu.2.670f.

li^pa^ro/-trofos, on,
richly fed, mh=la Pi.Oxy.1792 Fr.1.6.

li^pa^ro/-xroos, on,
with shining body, sleek of skin, *selanai/a liparo/xroe Theoc.2.165:— also li^pa^ro/-xrws, wtos, o(, h(, acc. -xrwn, ib.102.

li^pa^rw/y, w=pos, o(, h(,
bright-looking, tra/peza Philox.2.1.
li/pa^s [i^], to/, = li/pos, used by Aret. in nom. li/pas, CD2.3, SD2.9; gen. li/paos CA1.1; dat. li/pai+ ibid.

li/p-asma [i^], atos, to/,
a greasy form of ulceration, Hp.Alim.16, Heliod. ap. Orib.46.22.14, Gal.15.316.
a fattening substance, Plu.2.771b, LXXNe.8.10 (pl.).
salve, Man.4.345.
li/pasma o)fqalmw=n
a glistening, i.e. a tear, Epicur. ap. Cleom.2.1 (p.89 U.).

lip-asmo/s, o(,
anointing, Dsc.Alex.14, Paul.Aeg.2.48.

li^p-aure/w, (au)/ra)
to be calm, lipaurei= (impers.) Hsch.

li^p-a/w, (li/pas, li/pos)
to be sleek, radiant, Ep. pres. lipo/w, v.l. for r(upo/w, Od.19.72; part. lipo/wn Call.Fr.141, AP6.324 (Leon.), Nic. Al.487, Q.S.10.274: regul. forms, ind. 3pl. pres. lipw=sin Ph.1.542, part. lipw=n Phryn.Com.38, Call.Fr.121, Plu.2.206f. trans.,
anoint, gui=a Nic.Th.81.

li^p-e/laion, to/, gloss on
pinguis olivi, Serv. ad Verg.E.5.68.

li^perga/ths [a^], ou, o(,
unemployed labourer (s.v.l.), v. lipernh/ths.

li^pern-e/w,
to be poor, Suid. (who also has lifernw=n sine gloss.); li^ferne/w,
to be meagre, sta/xus J.AJ2.5.5:—but Hsch. has lifernou=ntes: e)n sunde/ndrw| to/pw| prosfilw=s dia/gontes.

li^pern-h/s, h=tos,
poor, forlorn, outcast, w)= lipernh=tes poli=tai Archil.50 (borrowed by Cratin. 198); context doubtful in BCH11.161 (Lagina); =
pupillus, o)rfano/s, Gloss.:—also li^pern-h/ths, ou, o(, AP9.649 (Maced.), EM566.50, restored by Schäfer in Longus 2.22 for liperga/ths:—fem. li^pern-h=tis, idos, Call. Fr.66e, Epic.Oxy.1794.17.

li^pesa/nwr [a_], oros, h(,
forsaker of her husband, of Helen, Stesich. 26.5.

li^ph/meroi: oi( e)n tw=| prosh/konti xro/nw| mh\ gennw/menoi, Hsch. *lip[i]u+i/+a, h(,
land that lacks rain, coined as etym. of *libu/h by Varro ap. Serv. ad Verg.A.1.22.
li^po/-bi^oi: nekroi/, Hsch.

li^po-bota^ne/w,
lose or
be without herbage, Plu.2.182e.

li^po-ga/laktos [ga^], on, = lipo/qhlos, Eust.175 2.01; =
lacticularius, lacticulosus, Gloss.

li^po/-ga^mos, on,
having abandoned her marriage ties, h( l.
the adulteress, of Helen, E.Or.1305 (lyr.); cf. lipesa/nwr.

li^po/-glhnos, on,
without eyeballs, sightless, Nonn.D. 37.517.

li^po/-glwssos, on,
tongueless, ib.26.281.
li^po-gnw/mwn, v. leipognw/mwn.

li^po-gra/mma^tos, on,
wanting a letter, Suid. s.v. *ne/stwr, Eust.1379.55.

li^po/-guios, on,
wanting a limb, maimed, lame, AP9.13 (Pl. Jun.).

li^po-deh/s, e/s,
with few wants, Pythag. Ep.2.

li^po-derme/w,
to be without skin, Hippiatr.26.

li^po-dra^ne/w,
fail in strength, Gal.10.842.

li^po-dra^nh/s, e/s,
lacking strength (cf. a)dranh/s), Aret.SD2.6.
li^po-zu/gwn: monazo/ntwn, Hsch.

li^po/-qhlos, on, (qhlh/)
deprived of the breast, of late-born pigs (meta/xoira), which the sows will not suckle, Gp.19.6.8.

li^/po-qric, trixos, o(, h(,
hairless, Ael.NA17.4, Nonn.D.11.510.

li^po/-qroos, on,
wanting voice, mute, of Echo, ib.4.327.

li^poqu_m-e/w,
fall into a swoon, faint, Hp.Art.68, Mul.2.134, Plu. Them.10, Gal.1.139.
li^poqu_/m-hma, atos, to/, = sq., Tz.H.12.391.

li^poqu_m-i/a, h(,
swoon, Hp.Aph.1.23, Art.68, Plu.Pomp.49, etc.

li^poqu_m-iko/s, h/, o/n,
subject to fainting fits, Hp.Liqu.2, Antyll. ap. Orib.7.7.7.

li^poqu_m-iw/dhs, es,
swoon-like, Archig. ap. Orib.8.1.26, Aët.9.40.

li^po/-kentros, on,
leaving a sting, me/lissai Lyr.Alex.Adesp.7.15.
li^po/-kopros, li^po/-koptos, v. lipo/kwpos.

li^po-kre/ws, wn, gen. w,
losing flesh, i.e.
wasted, thin, Suid.: acc. pl. l（e）ipokre/ous in Tz.H. 11.60; neut. pl. -krea Phlp.in GA200.22.

li^po/-kwpos, on,
without handle, fasgani/des cj. Toup in AP6.307 (Phan.) for lipoko/ptous or lipoko/prous.

li^po-martu^ri/ou di/kh, action
against a witness for non-appearance, Poll.8.36, cf. D.49.19, Lys.Fr.321 S.

li^po-mh/twr, oros, o(, h(,
having left one's mother, AP9.240 (Phil.).
li^po-mori/a: de/ndron ta\ e)k tou= qwraki/ou kateago/s, e)k de\ th=s r(i/zhs fe/ron blastou/s, Hsch.

li^po/-naus, o(, h(,
deserting the fleet, A.Ag.212 (lyr.) (or,
deserted by the allied fleet); v. lipo/news.

li^po-nau/ths, ou, o(,
leaving the sailors, Theoc.13.73, Anon. ap. Suid.

li^po-nauti/ou grafh/, indictment
against one who deserts his ship or
duty at sea, Poll.8.42.
li^po-ne/ws, wn, = lipo/naus, D.50.65, Luc.Cat.3, Max.Tyr.9.7.
li_-po/nhros: li/an ponhro/s, Hsch.; cf. li=.

li^po/-cu^los, on,
lacking wood: metaph.,
defective, feeble, pi/stis Emp.71.1, cf. 21.2.

li^po/-pais, paidos, o(, h(,
childless, found in neut. pl., le/xh lipo/paida Man.4.584.

li^po/-patris, idos, o(, h(,
leaving one's country, Nonn.D.1.131.
causing to forget one's country, l. e)dwdh/, i.e. the lotus, AP15.12 (Leo Phil.).

li^po-pa/twr [a^], oros, o(, h(,
deserter of one's father, E.Or.1305.

li^po-pno/h, h(,
death, Tim.Pers. 106.

li^po/-pnoos, on, contr. li^po/-pnous, oun,
breathless, dead, AP12.132 (Mel.), APl.4.110.5 (Id.), 133.5 (Philostr.).
without wind, deadly still, *(/aidhs Orph.H.18.9.

li^po-pto/lemos, on,
leaving the war, Nonn.D.35.389.

li^po/-ptolis, ios, o(, h(,
leaving the city, ib.9.78; lipo/polis, Hsch. s.v. lipernh/s, Phot. s.v. lipernh=tis.

li^po-pwgwni/a, h(,
want of beard, Crates Com.22.

li^po/-rri_nos, on,
without skin, of Marsyas, Nonn.D.1.44. epith. of the salamander, perh. (from li/pos)
with greasy skin, Nic.Al.537.
li/portos: bakthri/a, Hsch.

li/pos [i^], eos, to/, prop.
animal fat, lard, tallow, Arist.Long.467a3, cf. Pr.935b20: pl., xhno\s li/ph AP9.377.8 (Pall.); bebrw=tes ai(/matos l. gorged with
fat and blood, S.Ant.1022; but l. ai(/matos
a fleck of blood, A.Ag.1428 (lyr., li/bos Casaub.); of vegetable oil, l. e)lai/as S.Fr.398, cf. Thphr.HP3.18.3, 8.7.3, Call.Ap.39. (Cf. li/pa, liparo/s, lipa/w, lipai/nw, Skt.
lip- 'anoint', Lith.
lipti 'stick'.)

li^posark-e/w,
lose flesh, opp. a(dru/nomai, Thphr.HP8.11.4 (dub. cj.), Hippiatr.26.
li^posark-h/s, e/s, = lipo/sarkos, AP11.374 (Maced.), Man.1.55, cj. for leipo/sarkes in Opp.C.2.106.

li^posark-i/a, h(,
want of flesh, Sch.Hes.Sc.268.

li^po/sark-os, on,
lean, thin, Hp.Ep.17, v.l. in Opp.C.2.106 (cf. sq.); skh=nos l., of the skeleton, IG14.2131 [i^]; of wounds,
leaving a hollow, Hippiatr.77.
li^po/-sarc, sarkos, o(, h(, = foreg., prob. in Opp.C.2.106.

li^po-sqenh/s, e/s,
powerless, Nonn.D.14.101.

li^po-si_te/w,
to be in want of corn or
bread, Suid.

li^po/-ski^os, on,
casting no shadow, de/ndrea Nonn.D. 2.93.
unshadowed, au)xh/n ib.10.186.

li^po-ste/fa^nos, on,
falling from the wreath, fu/lla AP6.71 (Paul. Sil.).

li^postra^t-e/w,
desert, refuse to serve in arms, Sch.Ar.Eq.226.

li^postra^t-i/a, h(,
desertion from the army, refusal to serve, Hdt.5.27, Th.6.76, D.H. 11.22:—also li^postra^/t-ion, to/, Th.1.99, Ph.2.132.

li^postra^t-iw/ths, ou, o(,
deserter, dub. l. in App.Pun.115.

li^po-takte/w,
desert one's post, LXX 4 Ma.9.23, Ascl.Tact.3.6, Plu.2.241a; l. th=s tou= qeou= ta/cews Ph.1.268.

li^po-ta/kths, ou, o(,
deserter, D.H.8.79, Ph.1.144, J.BJ5.3.4, Max. Tyr.9.7: metaph., l. *mousw=n Jul.Ep.183.
li^po/-taktos, o(, = foreg., Gloss.

li^po-taci/a, h(,
desertion, D.21.166 codd. (-ion Cobet): metaph., dia/lusis tw=n e)n tw=| zw/|w| pa/ntwn kai\ l. sumbai/nei (after death) Anatoliusap.Theol.Ar.35.

li^po-ta/cion, to/,
desertion, l. diapepragme/noi Ph.2.132:—elsewh. in gen.

li^po-taci/ou grafh/, in dictment
for desertion, Pl.Lg.943d, D.21.103; e)/noxos lipotaci/ou Lys.14.5; ta\ d' e)gxe/leia gra/yomai lipotaci/ou, Com. phrase, Antiph.129.9, cf. Pl.Com.7, Ar.Fr.808, v. Poll.8.42.

li^po/-teknos, on,
childless, oi)=kos Pi.Parth.1.16.

li^po-tele/w,
to be in arrears with taxes, IG9(1).334.14 (Oeanthea, v B.C.).

li^po/ths, htos, h(,
fatness, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.225.4.

li^po-tone/w,
become relaxed, Nicom.Harm.4 (leip-, interpol.).

li^po-tri^xe/w,
grow bald, Gal.14.530.
li^po-tri^xh/s, e/s, = lipo/qric, AP9.52 (Carph.); li^po/-tri^xos, on, Nonn.D.26.159.

li^pourg-o/s, o/n,
badly healed, Heras ap.Gal.13.815:—hence li^pourg-i/a, h(, Asclep.ib.525, Heras ib.546.

li/pouros [i^], on,
without tail, Call.Fr.28.2 P.
li^po-feggh/s, e/s, = lipaugh/s, Man.1.65, Musae.238.
li^po/-fqoggos, on, = lipo/qroos, Nonn.D.26.288.

li^poyu_x-e/w,
swoon, S.Fr.496, Th.4.12, X.HG5.4.58, Xenarch.7.12, Arist.Somn.Vig.456b15, D.S.12.62, Plu.2.347b, Arr.An.6.11.2.

li^poyu_x-i/a, h(,
swooning, v.l. in Hdt.1.86, Hp.Aph.7.8, Arist.Somn.Vig.455b5, Plu.2.695a, Arr.An.6.10.2.

li^poyu_x-w/dhs, es,
like lipoyuxi/a,
faint, Hp.Acut.42.
lipo/w, lipo/wn, v. lipa/w.

li/ptomai, pf. le/limmai,
to be eager, ou)/te mei=on ou)/t' i)/son lelimme/noi A. Th.355 (lyr.): c. gen.,
to be eager for, long for, ma/xhs lelimme/nos ib. 380:—later in Act. li/ptw, A.R.4.813, Lyc.131, Nic.Th.126. (Cf. li/y: e)piqumi/a, Hsch., e)/lipen, = e)piqumhtikw=s h)/sqien, Id., liyouri/a, and perh. Lith.
li[etilde]pti 'command'.)

li^pu^r-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(, for lipo-puri/a,
a malignant intermittent fever, Hp.Judic.11:—also lipu/rion, to/, Id.Morb.2.51:—hence li^pu^r-i/as, ou, o(,
one who suffers from lipuri/a, Gal.17(2).728, cf. 18(2).121, Ps.-Gal.19.399:—Adj. leipu^riko/s (leg. li^pu^riko/s), h/, o/n,
like lipuri/a, Hp.Coac. 117; li^pu^riw/dhs, es,
of the nature of lipuri/a, pureto/s Id.Ep.21.

li^pw/dhs, es, (li/pos)
fatty, oily, Thphr.HP3.12.1 (Comp.).

li_rai/nw, (liro/s)
to be bold or
shameless, = a)naideu/omai, Hsch.
li/rinos, lirio/eis, li/rion, less correct forms of leir-.

li_ro/s, a/, o/n (not li=ros, Hdn.Gr.1.191),
bold, shameless, lewd, Call. Fr.229, Alex.Aet.3.30.

li_ro/fqalmos, on,
lewd-eyed, Suid.

li/s, o(, Ep. for le/wn,
lion, mostly in nom., e)fa/nh li\s h)uge/neios Il. 15.275, cf. 11.239, 18.318, Hes.Sc.172: acc., e)pi/ te li=n h)/gage dai/mwn Il.11.480, cf. Theoc.13.6: nom. pl. li/es [i^] Euph.35, but li=es Antim. 89: dat. pl. li/essi [i^] ibid. [li/s but li=n, Aristarch. ap. Hdn.Gr.2.73, cf. 77.]

li/s, h(, Ep. = lissh/,
smooth, li\s pe/trh Od.12.64, 79. v. li=ta.
li/sai, v. li/ssomai.

lisga/rion, to/,
spade, mattock, Sch.Theoc.4.10, Suid. s.v. skafei/dion. (Mod.Gr. lisga/ri, a kind of
rake or
harrow.）
li/sh|, v. li/ssomai. li/skos: di/skos, Hsch. li/sph, h(, v. li/spos.

lispo/pu_gos, on,
smooth-buttocked, epith. of ki/naidoi, Phryn.PS p.86 B., Poll.2.184; cf. Suid. s.v. li/spoi:—also lispo/puc, Eust. 1288.46: acc. pl. lispo/pugas Sch.Ar.Eq.1365.

li/spos, h, on,
smooth, polished, li/sph glw=ssa Ar.Ra.826 codd.; cf. li/sfos. = lispo/pugos, Poll.2.184; from li/spos, = qhri/dion lepto\n sfo/dra, acc. to Callistr. ap. Sch.Ar.Ra.848. Subst. li/spai, ai(,
dice cut in two by friends (ce/noi), each of whom kept half as a tally, Pl.Smp.193a:—so li/spoi, oi(, Suid.

lissa/nios [a_], on, Lacon. for a)gaqo/s (Hsch., Phot.), w)= lissa/nie
my good friend, Ar.Lys.1171 (lussa/nie cod. R).

lissa/s, a/dos, Boeot. litta/s Corinn.Supp. 1.30, fem. of lisso/s, lissa\s ai)gi/liy pe/tra A.Supp.794 (lyr.), cf. E.Andr.533 (lyr.), HF 1148, Theoc.22.37, Lyr. ap. Plu.2.90d: Subst. lissa/s (sc. pe/tra),
bare, smooth cliff, Plu.Mar.23, Crass.9, Opp.H.2.320; of
a tomb-stone, Epigr.Gr.256.

li/ssomai, Hom., Lyr., Trag.; Ep. Iterat. lisse/sketo Il.9.451: aor. 1 e)li^sa/mhn, Ep. e)ll. Od.11.35; imper. li/sai Il.1.394; subj. 2sg. li/sh| Od.10.526: aor. 2 inf. li^te/sqai Il.16.47; opt. li^toi/mhn Od.14.406. (For pres. li/tomai, v. sub voce):—
beg, pray, either abs. or c. acc. pers., lissome/nh prose/eipe *di/a Il.1.502; eu)xwlh=|si lith=|si/ te e)/qnea nekrw=n e)llisa/mhn Od.11.35, etc.; the thing by which one prays is found with u(pe/r, l. u(pe\r toke/wn, u(pe\r yuxh=s kai\ gou/nwn, Il.15.660, 22.338; l. tina\ u(pe\r patro\s kai\ mhte/ros 24.467: or simply in gen.,
l. *zhno\s h)de\ *qe/mistos Od.2.68; l. tina\ gou/nwn Il.9.451, Od.22.337 (for which in Il.6.45 we have labw\n e)lli/sseto gou/nwn, cf. Od.6.142; th= e(te/rh| me\n e(lw\n e)lli/sseto gou/nwn Il.21.71; h(/pteto xei/resi gou/nwn i(e/menos li/ssesq' 20.469); also in Trag., pro\ . . te/knwn se l. E. Tr.1045 (v. infr.): an inf. is freq. added, as ou)de/ s' e)/gwge li/ssomai ei(/nek' e)mei=o me/nein I do not
pray thee to remain, Il.1.174, cf. 283, B.10.69, Pi.P.4.207; pro/s nun qew=n se l. e)moi\ piqe/sqai S.El.428; kai\ mh\ prodou=nai l.
prays her not to abandon him, E.Alc. 202: more rarely with an acc. and inf. added, li/ssontai *di/a . . *)/athn a(/m' e(/pesqai they
pray Zeus
that Ate may follow, Il.9.511, cf. Od.8.30: sts. folld. by o(/pws, li/ssesqai/ min, o(/pws nhmerte/a ei)/ph|
entreat him to say the truth, 3.19; or by i(/na, ib.327: in Trag. parenth., mh\ pro/leipe, l., pa/ter A. Supp.748; mh/, li/ssomai/ s', au)/da ta/de S.Aj.368, cf. OT650 (lyr.), Ar. Pax382. c. acc. rei,
beg or
pray for, oi(= au)tw=| qa/naton kai\ kh=ra lite/sqai Il.16.47: c. dupl. acc. pers. et rei, tau=ta me\n ou)x u(me/as e)/ti li/ssomai this
I beg of you no more, Od.2.210, cf. 4.347. in Hom. freq. c. dat. modi, e)pe/essi Il.21.98, al.; eu)xh=|si Od.10.526; eu)xwlh=si lith=si/ te e)llisa/mhn 11.35.—Rare in Prose, as Hdt.1.24, LXXJb.17.2, Luc.Syr.D.18; in Pl.R.366a there is a ref. to Il.9.501. [The l- freq. makes position in Ep., Il.1.394, al.; written ll after the augm., v. supr.]

liss-o/s, h/, o/n,
smooth, Hom. (only in Od.), lissh\ ai)pei=a/te ei)s a(/la pe/trh a
smooth rock running sheer into the sea, 3.293; lissh\ d' a)nade/drome pe/trh 5.412, cf. 10.4; l. nh=sos A.R.2.382; l. deira/des AP15.25.11 (Besant.).
poor ( = deo/menos, Hsch.): hence,
insolvent, SIG527.115 (Dreros, iii B. C.).

liss-o/w,
render insolvent, [lis]swqe/ntwn dub. in ib.524.43 (Crete, iii B. C.); cf. foreg. 2.

li/ss-wma, atos, to/,
smoothness, l. trixw=n the
crown or
spot on the head from which the hair sets in different ways, Arist.HA491b6.

li/ss-wsis, ews, h(,
setting of the hair from the crown of the head, ib.491b8.
li/sswmen: e)a/swmen, Hsch.

listo/s, h/, o/n, (li/ssomai)
to be moved by prayer, Il.9.497 (as quoted in Pl.R.364d): elsewh. only in compds. a)/llistos, tri/llistos.

listr-ai/nw,
dig round, Suid.
listr-eu/w, = foreg., futo/n Od.24.227.
listr-h=res: oi( listreu/ontes, kai\ oi( pro\s tai=s u(pokaiome/nais xu/trais i(sta/menoi spinqh=res, Hsch.
li/str-ion, to/, Dim. of sq., = koxlia/rion, Ar.Fr.809 (restd.fr. Phryn.PSp.88 B.), Hsch.; cf. lei/strion.

li/str-on, to/,
tool for levelling or
smoothing, spade, shovel, Od.22.455, Lyc. 1348, Mosch.4.101:—later also li/str-os, o(, Sch.Nic.Th.29, EM587.43.
listr-o/w, = listreu/w, Eust.1229.26.

listr-wto/s, h/, o/n,
levelled, a(/lw dro/mos Nic.Th.29.
li/sf-os, h, on, Att. for a)/pugos, Moer.p.245 P.; said to be Att. for li/spos (q. v.), Tz.ad Hes.Op.156. as Subst. li/sfoi, oi(, = i)/sxia, EM567.20.
lisf-w/sasqai: e)lattw/sasqai, Hsch.

li/sxroi, oi(, = ta\ strofika\ tw=n sperma/twn, i. e.
plants which were ploughed into the ground, to serve for manure, as lupines in Italy, Hsch. li/sxros: feidwlo/s, Suid. Adv. -rw=s Hsch.

li=ta, li_ti/, case forms of a noun of which no nom. sg. is found (unless sindw
 li/s is right in Michel 832.19 (Samos, iv B. C.)),
linen cloth, e(anw=| liti\ ka/luyan they covered [the corpse] with a fine
linen cloth, Il.18.352, 23.254; li=ta may be acc. sg. or acc. pl., au)th
 d' e)s qro/non ei(=sen a)/gwn, u(po\ li=ta peta/ssas, kalo
 daida/leon Od.1.130; e)/balle qro/nois e)/ni r(h/gea kala/, porfu/rea kaqu/perq', u(pe/nerqe de\ li=q' u(pe/ballen 10.353: understood as pl. by Ath.2.48c; used for covering a chariot, Il.8.441: in AP6.332 (Hadr.) li/ta [i^] poludai/dala is prob. f.l. (Perh. akin to li/non.)
li^t-a/zomai, = li/ssomai, IG14.2525, Arch.Anz.19.8 (Milet.), Opp. C.2.373, Orph.Fr.333 (perh. Act.), Inscr.Perg.324 (hymn to Zeus).
li^t-ai/nw (fr. litan-yw, cf. litano/s), = litaneu/w, E.El.1215 (lyr.).

li^t-ai=os,
hearing prayer, epith. of Zeus, BCH2.509 (coin of Nicaea); also in form lidai=os ib.24.389 (inscr. of Bithynia).

li^ta^n-ei/a, h(,
entreaty, LXX 2 Ma.3.20, 10.16, PTeb.284.9 (i B. C.), Corn.ND12: pl., D.H.4.67; -ei=ai pro\s tou\s qeou/s Jul.Ep.114, cf. Iamb.Myst.1.15.

li^ta^n-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for praying, Sch.A.Supp. 809.

li^ta^n-euto/s, h/, o/n,
begged, entreated, Hsch. s.v. a)mfili/thn.

li^ta^n-eu/w, in Hom. with ll in augm. tenses, e)llita/neue, e)llita/neusa: (litano/s): —
pray, entreat, pa/ntas d' e)llita/neue (v.l. de\ l.) Il.15.422:— Constr. same as li/ssomai, either abs., Od.7.145: or c. acc. pers., Il. l. c., 9.581, etc.; that by which one prays in gen., gou/nwn e)llita/neusa Od.10.481; for which in Il.24.357 we have a)ll' a)/ge, gou/nwn a(ya/menoi litaneu/somen (Ep. for -wmen); also c. inf., 23.196: c. acc. pers. et inf., Hes.Th.469, Pi.N.8.8, etc.: c. Adj. neut., polla\ l. tina/ ib.5.32: rare in Att. Poets, Men.49 (dub. l.), and in Prose, X.HG2.4.26, Pl. R.388b, LXXPs.44(45).12; l. to\ qei=on Str.15.1.60; tou\s qeou\s eu)xai=s D.H.4.76.

li^ta^n-o/s, h/, o/n, (lith/)
praying, suppliant, me/lh A.Supp. 809 (lyr.): as Subst. litana/, ta/, = litai/, a)mfi\ lita/n' e(/comen engage in
prayer, Id.Th.102 (Seidler for a)mfi/litan or a)mfi\ lita\n).

li^targ-i/zw, Att. fut. -iw=,
slip away, Ar.Pax562; cf. a)polit-.
li^targ-ismo/s, ou=, o(, = skirth/mata, in pl., Sch.Ar.Nu.1255.

li^/targ-os, on,
running quick, An.Ox.2.236, EM567.38, prob. in Semon.7.12 (litorgo/n codd. Stob.).

li^th/, h(, (li/tomai)
prayer, entreaty, mostly in pl., lith=|si e)llisa/mhn Od.11.34; katabai/nein e)s lita/s Hdt.1.116; litai=s a)potre/pei [au)to\n] mh\ poreu/esqai ib.105; litai=s pei=sai/ tina Pi.O.2.80, cf. 8.8; malqa/ssein ke/ar litai=s A.Pr.1008; hu)/xeto litai=si Id.Pers.499; lita=n a)kou/ein Id.Ag.396 (lyr.); lita\s klu/ein Id.Th.172 (lyr.), cf. E.Or.1233, etc.; litai=s sebi/zein S.OC1557 (lyr.); e)peu/xesqai lita/s ib.484; l. de/xesqai Id.Ant. 1019; e)n litai=s ste/llein
with prayers, Id.Ph.60; litai\ qew=n
prayers to the gods, E.Supp.262; but litai\ e)mautou= cumma/xwn te
prayers for myself, S.OC1309: also c. gen. of that by which one prays, genei/ou tou=d' . . e)ktei=nai lita/s E.Or.290. (Poet., Ion. and late Prose, BGU 74.15 (ii A. D.).) *litai/, ai(, personified,
Prayers of sorrow and repentance, Il.9.502 sq., AP11.361 (Autom.).
lith=ra qallo/n (= Trag.Adesp.234）: to\n i(ke/sion, Hsch.
li_ti/, v. li=ta.

li_to/-bi^os, on, (lito/s)
living plainly or
sparingly, Str.15.1.34.
li_to-bo/ros: eu)telw=s trafei/s, Hsch.

li_to-di/aitos [di^], on,
of a plain way of life, D.H.2.49.
li/tomai [i^], = li/ssomai, h.Hom.16.5, Ar.Th.313, 1040 (both lyr.), AP5.150 (Mel.), 164 (Id.), Orph.H.41.9, Opp.C.2.367, IG14.902 (Capri).

li_to/s, h/, o/n,
simple, inexpensive, frugal, litai\ tra/pezai Ps.-Phoc.81; oi( l. xuloi/ Epicur.Ep.3p.63U.; l. bi/os Men.633, Crates Theb.10; trofh\ litota/th Ath.5.191f; lith\ di/aita Plu.2.668f, cf. 125d, etc.; to\ l. th=s diai/ths, kata\ th\n di/aitan, Epicur.Fr.478, M.Ant.1.3; pare/codos (q.v.) -ote/rh Hp.Decent.8; l. xlamu/dion Men.442; ta\ i(ma/tia l. kai\ sw/frona Jul.Caes.317c; mi/trh lith\ stuppei/ou Michel832.17 (Samos, iv B. C.); u(pokefa/laia du/o h(mitubi/ou lita/ ib.l.23; [a)spi/das] xalka=s lita\s du/o, opp. peri/xrusos mi/a, IG22.1491.31 (iv B. C.); a(/la lito\n e)pe/sqwn
frugal salt, Call.Epigr.48; l. o)ci/s Nicostr.Com.9 (cj. for loiph/）; l. u(/dwr pi/nwn D.L.8.13; l. xri/mata
simple or
plain unguents, Call. Lav.Pall.25; l. tafh/ Phld.Mort.30; l. zwmo/s
thin (chicken-) broth, Gal.12.295; of medicines, h( dia\ kwduw=n lith/ (sc. du/namis) Crito ap. Gal.13.38; h( dia\ mo/rwn lith/ Archig. ap. eund.12.973; l. e)/mplastroi Androm. ap. eund.13.495, cf. 486; xa/rths lito/s, as a cargo, perh.
cheap or
coarse papyrus, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.104.28. of persons,
poor, l. geno/menos toi=s e)/xousi mh\ fqo/nei dub. in Dionys.Com.10 ( = Dionys.Trag.8);
frugal, au)ta/rkeis kai\ l. Plb.6.48.7; kata\ th\n e)sqh=ta kai\ si/thsin a)felh\s kai\ l. Id.11.10.3; l. peri\ di/aitan Plu.2.709b. Adv. -tw=s
frugally, Sotad.Com.1.6, AP7.156 (Isid.); l. biou=n D.L. 6.105; l. kai\ swfro/nws zh=n Ephor.149 J.; lamprw=s h)\ l. e)cenexqe/ntas Phld.l.c. metaph., of style,
plain, simple, unadorned, Arist. Rh.1416b25, D.H.Th.23, al.
paltry, petty, small, ta/fos AP 7.73 (Gemin.), cf. 7.18 (Antip.Thess.); of persons, opp. me/gas, Call. Ap.10; polisma/tia Plb.32.8.3. Adv. -tw=s
slightly, h(yhme/na Artem. 1.70; l. e(fqa/ Diocl.Fr.141; dub. sens. in Alc.Oxy.1788 Fr.2.11. [i_, but i^ late, li^ta\ dei=pna Nonn.D.17.59.]
li^to/s (A), h/, o/n, epith. of gai=a, dub. sens. in Alex.Aet.1, Orph. A.92; lith\ xqw/n: a)po\ tou= proskunei=sqai kai\ litaneu/esqai, Hsch.

li^to/s (B), h/, o/n,
suppliant, supplicatory, qusi/ai Pi.O.6.78; e)paoidai/ Id.P.4.217.

li_to/ths, htos, h(, (li_to/s)
plainness, simplicity, ko/smou Democr.274; tw=n stefa/nwn Thphr.Fr.142; th\n l. diw/kousi D.S.2.59; l. diai/ths Cic.Fam.7.26.2; cj. for lepto/ths in Epicur.Sent.Vat.63. Gramm., a figure of speech,
assertion by means of understatement (cf. mei/wsis) or
negation, Serv. ad Verg.G.2.125, Donat.ad Ter.Hec.775.
litourg-e/w, = kaka\ le/gw, Did. ap. Ammon.Diff.p.88 V.
litourg-o/n: kakou=rgon, Hsch. (Cf. li/targos.)

li/tr-a, h(,
a silver coin of Sicily, Epich.9, Sophr.72, Diph.71, Posidipp. 8.—On its value v. Arist.Fr.476,510. as a weight, 12 ounces,
a pound, [Simon.]141, Plb.21.43.19, D.S.14.116, Dsc.1.43, Plu. TG2, J.AJ14.7.1: metaph., li/tra^n e)tw=n zh/sas having lived
a pound of years, i.e. 72 (in late times a pound of gold was coined into 72 pieces), AP10.97 (Pall.). measure of capacity, = 1 Italic kotu/lh, Gal.6.287. [i_ as in Lat.
libra; written lei/tra in CIG2040.7 (Bosp.).] (Both li/tra and Lat.
libra prob. from early Italic
*līprā.）

litr-ai=os, a, on,
weighing or
worth a li/tra, xei/lh AP11.204 (Pall.), cf. Gal.13.415. l. ke/ras a drinking-cup
holding 1 li/tra, ib.435.

litr-asmo/s, =
libratio, Gloss.
litr-iai=os, a, on, = litrai=os 1, D.H.9.27.

litr-i/zw,
weigh or
deliver by weight, POxy.1543.1 (iii A. D.).
litr-i/s: puci\s samatodo/xos, Hsch. (perh. puci\s dmhmatodo/xos 'soap-box', litri/s being from li/tron 1).

litr-ismo/s, o(,
delivery by weight, PFlor.31.21 (iv A. D.).

litrodo/kh, h(,
box for holding li/trai, Phot. s.v. li/tra.

litro/mhlon, to/,
an apple weighing a li/tra, Tz.H.9.347.

li/tron [i^ by nature], to/, older form for ni/tron, Hp.Epid.2.6.9 and 29, Hdt.2.86,87, Ar.Fr.320.1, Pl.Ti.60d, 65d (pl.), Thphr.HP3.7.6, Alex. 1, dub. l. in Pl.Com.69.3. = li/tra 111, PFay.331 (ii A. D.).

litropw/lhs, ou, o(,
seller of li/tron, IG22.1673.22 (iv B. C.).

litrosko/pos, o(, (li/tra I)
one who examines money, money-changer, S.Fr.1065.
litrw/dhs, es, = nitrw/dhs, Pl.Ti.65e, Thphr.Fr.159, Gal.6.559: Comp. -este/ra Ath.2.43b.
litta/s, v. lissa/s.

*li^tu^e/rshs, ou, Dor. litr-e/rsas, o(, Lityerses, a bastard son of Midas, who used to challenge wayfarers to a reaping match, and bound the heads of the conquered in his sheaves, Ath.10.415b, Suid.
a reaper's song named after him, Men.264, Theoc.10.41, Ath.14.619a.

li/tuon, to/, = Lat.
lituus, Plu.Rom.22.

li^faim-i/a, h(,
bloodlessness, Ph.2.512.
lixa/zei: e)piqumei=, Hsch. in aor. inf. lixa/cai: r(i=yai, ba/lai (Cret.), Id.

li^xa^noeidh\s to/pos, o(,
locus of the li/xanos II, Aristox.Harm. p.26 M.; o( l. fqo/ggos
the highest note of a pukno/n, Bacch.Harm.43, cf. Aristid.Quint.1.6.

li^xa^no/s, o/n, (lei/xw)
licking: o( l., with or without da/ktulos,
forefinger, from its use in licking up, Hp.Art.37,al., Luc.Tim.54, Ath. 1.15d, PLips.12.9 (iii A. D.), etc. as Subst. li/xa^nos (sc. xordh/), h(,
the string struck with the forefinger, and
its note, Aristox. Harm.p.116 M., Arist.Pr.919a17, D.S.3.59, Plu.2.1029a, etc. Adj., l. swlh/n
a tube of the alembic, Zos.Alch.pp.225,236 B.

li^xa/s, a/dos, h(,
the space between the forefinger (lixano/s)
and thumb, the lesser span, Hero
*Geom.4, Poll.2.158. = a)po/tomos, Hsch. lixa/des: o)/strea pa/nta, oi( de\ li/qoi kai\ yh=foi kai\ kogxu/lia, Id.
lixh/n, h=nos, o(, v. leixh/n.

lixm-a/zw, = lixma/w, Hes.Sc.235; glw/ssh| l. Nic.Th.229. trans.,
lick, Opp.H.2.250, Nonn.D.44.111; Ion. impf., lixma/zeske de/rhn Mosch.2.94.
lixm-ai/nw, = lixma/w, Opp.C.3.174.
lixm-a/s: qri=nac, kai\ a(palh\ po/a kai\ xamaipeth/s, h(\n ta\ e(rpeta\ e)pilei/xousi, Hsch.

lixm-a/w, fut. Med. -h/somai （a)na-) J.AJ8.15.4: aor. e)lixmhsa/mhn ap.D.L.8.91:—
play with the tongue, of snakes, in Ep. part., ai)no\n lixmw/wntes Q.S.5.40: in irreg. pf. part., glw/ssh|si lelixmo/tes Hes.Th.826:—Med., e(kato\n . . kefalai\ kola/kwn . . e)lixmw=nto peri\ th\n kefalh/n
played like serpents round . . , Ar.V.1033, Pax756 (e)lixnw=nto v.l. in Sch., Hsch.), cf. Theoc.24.20, Euph.51.6. trans.,
lick, o)/fesi . . lixmw=sin ge/nun E.Ba.698:—Med., D.L. l. c., App.Hisp.96, Mith.38. Med., also,
lick up, lixmw/menos e)/rshn Nic.Al.569; used by Hom. only in the compd. a)polixma/omai.

lixm-h/mwn, on, gen. onos,
licking, of mice, Nic.Al.37.

lixm-h/rhs, es,
playing with the tongue, of snakes, Id.Th.206.
lixna/omai, v. lixma/w 1.1.

lixn-ei/a, h(,
gluttony, luxuriousness in eating, X.Lac.5.4, Luc.Tim. 55: pl., X.Oec.1.22, Pl.R.519b; peri\ ta\ fau=la Ath.5.220c. in pl. also,
dainties, Plu.2.225f: so in sg. in collective sense, Nic. Dam.56 J.

li/xn-euma, atos, to/,
a dainty, delicacy, Sophr.24.

lixn-eu/w,
gormandize, peri\ ta\s pe/tras Luc.Pisc.48, cf. Arr.Epict.2.4.8, Plu.2.713c.
desire greedily, covet, ta\ dhmo/sia D.H.8.73; do/can Plu. Comp.Dem.Cic.2:—Med.,
desire eagerly to do, c. inf., Id.2.347a;
to be greedy, l. ei)s o(/rasin Lib.Descr.30.3: c. gen., sarko\s a)nqrwpei/ou l. Sch.Il.Oxy.221 ix 35:—Pass.,
to be lusted after, Nic.Dam. 1 J. codd. (dub.).

lixno-bo/ros, on,
eating tit-bits, mu=s AP9.86 (Antiphil.).

lixno/-graus, a_os, h(,
greedy old woman, Timo 38.1.

li/xnos, h, on, also os, on E.Hipp.913,
gluttonous, X.Mem.1.2.2, Pl.R.354b, Plb.3.57.7, Gal.6.716; ta\ peri\ th\n trofh\n li/xnoi Clitarch. 1 J.: c. gen., tw=n e)n diai/th| poikilma/twn Epicur.Sent.Vat.69: metaph., l. th\n yuxh/n Pl.R.579b: Comp. -o/teros Sophr.62: Sup. -o/tatos Arist.HA594a6. metaph.,
curious, inquisitive, E. l. c.; o)/mmata l. Call.Fr.107, AP12.106 (Mel.);
lewd, Crates Theb.4: c. gen.,
curious after, tou= kekrumme/nou E.Fr.1063.8; c. inf., l. ei)mi\ kai\ to\ peu/qesqai Call.Fr.98d. of things,
luxurious, appetizing, o)/ya, e)de/smata, Gal.Anim.Pass.6.

lixno-te/nqhs, ou, o(,
greedy glutton, Poll.6.122.
lixno/-ths, htos, h(, = lixnei/a, Sch.Ar.Av.1690.

lixno-fi^la/rgu^ros, on,
both epicure and miser, Philyll.17(s. v.l.).
lixnw/dhs, es, = li/xnos, Ael.Fr.325 (Sup.).

li/y (A), o(, gen. libo/s,
the SW. wind, Hdt.2.25, Arist.Mete.364b2 (pl.), Mu.394b27, Theoc.9.11: pl., Plb.10.10.3.
the South, freq. in LXX, Ge.13.14, al.
the West, opp. a)phliw/ths, PTeb. 14.19 (ii B. C.), Vett.Val.8.5, Paul.Al.A.2, Herm. ap. Stob.1.21.9, 1.49.45; rarely in LXX, 2 Ch.32.30, 33.14, Thd.Da.8.5; libo/s or li/ba ei)s a)phliw/thn from West to East, BGU1037.15 (i A. D.), CPR28.21 (ii A.D.). Astron., prwino\s l., meshmbrino\s l., o)yino\s l.,
position of a star
on the W. horizon at sunrise, midday, or sunset, Ptol.Alm. 8.4.

*li/y (B), h(, (lei/bw) only gen. and acc. (liba/s or li/bos being the nom. in use),
stream, e)c o)mma/twn lei/bousi . . li/ba (Burges for di/a) A.Eu.54; a)fqone/steron li/ba f.l. in A.Fr.72; me/litos li/ba A.R.4.1454. = loibh/,
libation, filospo/ndou libo/s A.Ch.292; eu)ktai/an li/ba Id.Fr.55.
li/y (C): e)piqumi/a (cf. li/ptomai）, pe/tra a)f' h(=s u(/dwr sta/zei, Hsch.

liyouri/a, h(, (li/ptomai, ou)=ron)
desire to make water, A.Ch.756.
liw/dhs: liqo/leustos, Hsch. (Perh. liw/lhs, cf. lew/lhs.）
liwrgo/s: kakou=rgos, Id. lo/bai: xei=res, Id.

lo/b-ion, to/, Dim. of sq. 1.1, Gal.14.701; of sq. 1.2, Hsch.
fruit of the smi=lac, Dsc.2.146.

lob-o/s, o(,
lobe of the ear, e)u/+trhtoi (for wearing ear-rings) l. Il.14.182, cf. h.Hom.6.8, Hp.Prog.2, Arist. HA492a16; a)/kroi l. Lyc.1401.
lobe of the liver, to which special attention was paid in divination, A.Pr.495, E.El.827, Pl.Ti.71c, Euphro 7: generally,
liver, A.Eu.159 (lyr.).
lobe of the lung, Gal.UP6.4, al.; of the whole
lung, Hp.Loc.Hom.14.
capsule or
pod of leguminous plants (cf. e)/llobos), Thphr.HP1.11.2, etc.; esp. of fasi/oloi or do/lixoi, because they were eaten pod and all, Gal.6.557, Jul.Or.5.175c. in rose leaves,
the white part, elsewh. o)/nuc, Gal.12.748.

log-a/dhn [a^], Adv., (loga/s)
picked, of troops, Plu.Oth.6. mostly of stones for building, ei)rga/zonto l. fe/rontes li/qous kai\ cuneti/qesan w(s e(/kasto/n ti cumbai/noi bringing the stones
as they picked them out, Th.4.4, cf. 31, 6.66, D.H.Comp.22.

log-ai=os, a, on,
chosen, picked, Str.1.3.18 (paraphrasing Ibyc.22).

log-a^oidiko/s, h/, o/n,
logaoedic, of verses in which dactylic and trochaic rhythms are combined, so that they stand
between lo/gos
and a)oidh/,
between prose and poetry, D.L.4.65, Heph.7, Aristid.Quint.1.23, POxy.220 xii 2.

loga^r-ia/zw,
calculate, Eust. ad D.P.907, Sch.Ar.Pl.381:—hence loga^r-iasmo/s, o(,
calculation, Sch.Luc.Cat.4.
loga^r-i/dion, to/, = sq., POxy. 599 (i/ii A. D.).

loga^/r-ion, to/, Dim. of lo/gos, Ar.Fr.810 (pl.); l. du/sthna wretched
petty speeches, D.19.255; ta\ e)k stoa=s l. Theognet.1.2; loga/ria deipnei=n dine off
mere words, Ath.6.270d.
account, PTeb.20.8 (ii B. C.), etc.

loga/s (A), a/dos, o(, h(, (le/gw)
picked, chosen, mostly in pl. of
picked men, l. nehni/ai Hdt.1.36,43, E.Hec.544, etc.; trihko/sioi *spartihte/wn l. Hdt.8.124; l. *perse/wn tou\s a)ri/stous xili/ous Id.9.63; *)argei/wn oi( xi/lioi l. Th.5.67; strathgw=n loga/des E.Andr.324; of cattle, PStrassb.24.32 (ii A. D.); fwnai\ loga/des
chosen phrases, Phot.Bibl. p.491 B.: with collect.Nouns, stratih\ l. h(miqe/wn AP15.51 (Arch.). l. li/qoi
unhewn stones, taken just as they were picked, Paus.7.22.5; cf. loga/dhn, le/gw B. 1, liqolo/gos.

loga/s (B), usu. in pl., loga/des, ai(,
whites of the eyes, Sophr.49, Call.Fr.132, Nic.Th.292 (sg., Poll.2.70): generally,
eyes, AP5.269 (Paul. Sil.).

loga/w,
to be fond of talking, Luc.Lex.15. loga/w or loge/w, fut. 3sg. logh/sei, perh.
will take account, Tyrt.Fr.1.42 Diehl.
logg-a/zw, = lagga/zw, A.Fr.112, Ar.Fr.811, cf. Phryn.PSp.87 B.

logg-a/sia [a^], ta/,
stones with holes in them, through which mooringcables were passed, Hsch., Phot. s.v. logga/zein:—sg. logga^si/h, Hsch.:—also loggw=nes, oi(, Syracusan acc. to EM569.42, cf. Suid.

log-ei=on, to/, (logeu/s 1) prop.
speaking-place: in the theatre,
stage, IG11(2).161 D126 (Delos, iii B. C.), Vitr.5.7.2, Plu.Thes.16, etc.: generally,
platform, Arch.Pap.2.564 (pl.), unless logei/wn = logi/wn. = sto/ma, Poll.2.98.

log-e/mporos, o(,
phrase-monger, Artem.2.70: a pecul. accent logempo/ros is mentioned by Eust.463.40, 1447.47.

lo/g-euma, atos, to/,
taxes collected, PRev.Laws 56.15, al. (pl., iii B. C.).

log-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
speaker, Critias 54 D., Plu.2.813a.
prose-writer, Sch. D.T.pp.114,119 H.

log-euth/rion, to/,
office of the logeuth/s, PRev.Laws 11.13 (iii B. C.).

log-euth/s, ou=, o(,
tax-collector, ib.9.2, al. (iii B. C.), Ostr.318, PTeb.90 (i B. C.), etc.

log-eutiko/n, to/,
cost of collection, ib.105.24, cf. 5 (pl., ii B. C.).

log-eu/w,
collect contributions, taxes, etc., PRev.Laws 39.14 (iii B. C.), PTeb.5.139, al. (ii B. C.), Plb. 31.31.1, GDI4156 (Lindos), IG12(5).186.4 (Paros, ii B. C.), 12(7).237.24 (Amorgos, i B. C.), OGI665.37 (i A. D.), 629.156 (ii A. D.).
log-i/a, late spelling of logei/a (q. v.).

log-i/atros, o(,
a physician only in words, Gal.Libr.Propr.1, Id.15.159, al.:—hence log-iatrei/a, h(, Ph.1.526 (v.l. logoiatrei/a).

log-i/dion, to/, Dim. of lo/gos, Isoc.13.20, Pl.Erx. 401e.
little fable or
story, Ar.V.64.

log-i/zomai, Att. fut. -iou=mai Id.Ra.1263, Th.5.87, etc.: aor. e)logisa/mhn E.Or.555, Th.6.31, etc.: pf. lelo/gismai Lys.32.24,27, D.28.12:—Pass., v. infr. 111: (lo/gos):—prop. of numerical calculation,
count, reckon, ou)k e)pistame/nous logi/zesqai Hdt.2.16; eu(=ron logizo/menos Id.7.28, cf. 194, etc.; in full, l. yh/foisi Id.2.36; lo/gisai fau/lws, mh\ yh/fois a)ll' a)po\ xeiro/s
calculate roughly, not by rule, but off-hand, Ar.V.656: c. acc. rei, l. tou\s to/kous
calculate the interest, Id.Nu.20; trei=s mna=s a)nalw/sas logi/sasqai dw/deka spend 3 minae and
set down 12, Id.Pl.381. c. acc. et inf.,
reckon or
calculate that . . , l. mu/ria ei)=nai [ta\ e)/tea] Hdt. 2.145; ta\s bla/bas, a(\s e)logi/zeq' au(tw=| gegenh=sqai D.21.176: without acc., *qhrippi/dh| misqo\n a)podedwke/nai l. Id.27.20. l. tini/ ti
set down to one's
account, ou(=tos . . to\ h(/misu tou/tois . . lelo/gistai Lys.32.24, cf. 27; ta)nhlwme/n' . . ou)k e)logizo/mhn I
did not
charge them . . , D. 18.113: metaph., ta\ paraptw/mata l. tini/ 2 Ep.Cor.5.19.
audit the accounts of a person, c. dat., toi=s u(peuqu/nois Arist.Ath.54.2; tai=s a)rxai=s ib.48.3. without reference to numbers,
take into account, calculate, consider, tau=ta Hdt.9.53, cf. S.Aj.816, etc.; l. ta\ cumfe/ronta Th.1.76; l. ti pro/s tinas with them, D.5.24; also l. peri/ tinos
calculate, form calculations about . . , Hdt.2.22, X.Mem.4.3.11. c. acc. et inf.,
reckon, consider that . . , to\n e(/teron [pai=da] ou)k ei)=nai/ moi l. Hdt.1.38; to\n *pa=na tw=n o)ktw\ qew=n l. ei)=nai Id.2.46; l. o(/ti . . or w(s . . , X.HG2.4.28, 6.4.6; e)logizo/mhn pro\s e)mauto\n . . , o(/ti . . And.1.52, Pl.Ap.21d: c. acc. et part., *sme/rdin mhke/ti u(mi=n e)o/nta logi/zesqe Hdt.3.65: also with inf. omitted,
reckon or
account so and so, to\n kaq' h(me/ran bi/on logi/zou so/n [ei)=nai], ta\ d' a)/lla th=s tu/xhs E.Alc. 789; polu\n [ei)=nai] to\n ka/tw xro/non ib.692; logi/zetai/ t' e)kei=na pa/nq' a(marti/as Ar.V.745; mi/an a)/mfw tou/tw tw\ h(me/ra l.
count both days as one, X.Cyr.1.2.11. c. inf. also,
count or
reckon upon doing,
calculate or
expect that . . , e)pisitiei=sqai e)logi/zonto Hdt.7.176; e)logi/zeto katu/perqe/ oi( ta\ prh/gmata e)/sesqai Id.8.136; logizo/menoi h(/cein a(/ma h(li/w| du/nonti X.An.2.2.13; lelogisme/noi . . ei)si\n . . diazh=n E.IA922, cf. Or. 555 (dub. l.); ti/ logi/zom' . . prosdokw=n xa/rin para\ gunaiko\s komiei=sqai; Men.564.
count upon, ei)/ tis du/o h)\ kai/ ti plei/ous h(me/ras l., ma/taio/s e)stin S.Tr.944.
conclude by reasoning, infer that . . , c. acc. et inf., Pl.Grg.524b, X.Ages.7.3; l. o(/ti . . Id.HG6.1.5, cf. Pl.Phd.62e, al. abs., tou\s e)pistame/nous logi/zesqai Archyt.3; o( spoudai=os lelo/gistai h)/dh
has finished reasoning, Plot.3.8.6, cf. 4.4.12. Pass., mostly aor. e)logi/sqhn and (less freq.) pf. lelo/gismai, also in pres., part. logizo/menon Hdt.3.95, freq. in later Gr., PPetr.3p.340 (iii B. C.), Ep.Rom.4.5, etc.; xrh/mata ei)s a)rgu/rion logisqe/nta
counted or
