calculated in silver, X.Cyr.3.1.33; o(pli=tai e)logi/sqhsan ou)k e)la/ttous dismuri/wn Id.HG6.1.19; ou(=tos logismo\s logisqei/s Pl.Ti.34b; ou)d' e)c e(no\s lo/gou lelogisme/nou Id.Phdr.246c; to\ lelogisme/non, = logismo/s, E.IA386, Luc.Nigr.Prooem.

logi^k-eu/omai,
to be merely arguing, pro\s e)pi/deicin Dam.Pr.320, cf. 162.

logi^k-o/s, h/, o/n, (lo/gos)
of or
for speaking or
speech, me/rh l. the organs
of speech, Plu.Cor.38: logikh/, h(,
speech, opp. mousikh/, D.H. Comp. 11; l. fantasi/a
expressed in speech, Stoic.2.61.
of or
in eloquence, a)gw=nes Philostr.VS1.22.1; a)kroa/seis l. kai\ o)rganikai/ Supp.Epigr.2.184.6 (Tanagra, ii B.C.).
suited for prose, o( h(rw=|os semno\s kai\ ou) l. Demetr.Eloc.42; to\ l., opp. to\ megaloprepe/s, ib.41; of persons,
writing in prose, D.L.5.85; e)gkw/mion l.
in prose, IG9(2).531.43 (Thess.).
possessed of reason, intellectual, me/ros Ti.Locr.99e, al.; to\ l. zw=|on Chrysipp.Stoic.3.95; a)retai\ l., = dianohtikai/, opp. h)qikai/, Arist.EN1108b9.
dialectical, argumentative, oi( l. dia/logoi of Plato, such as the Theaetetus and Cratylus, D.L.3.58; in Arist. usu. like dialektiko/s, l. sullogismo/s APo.93a15, cf. Top.162b27; dia\ logikwte/rwn kai\ a)kribeste/rwn lo/gwn
more abstract, Metaph. 1080a10; l. dusxe/reiai ib.1005b22; l. a)po/deicis GA747b28; but also,
logical, l. sullogismoi/, opp. r(htorikoi/, Rh.1355a13. Adv. -kw=s
dialectically, Metaph. 1029b13, APo.84a7, 88a19; fusikw=s kai\ l. GC316a11: Comp. -w/teron Cael.275b12. Subst., h( logikh/ (sc. te/xnh)
logic, Cic.Fin.1.7.22; also ta\ logika/ Id.Tusc.4.14.33; peri\ logikw=n title of work, Democr.10b; to\ l., opp. to\ fusiko/n, to\ h)qiko/n, Zeno Stoic. 1.15, etc. of the 'dogmatic' school of physicians, h( l. ai(/resis Gal.Sect.Intr.1.

logi^k-o/ths, htos, h(,
rationality, Id.19.481, Alex. Aphr.in Metaph.205.33, Eust.1953.44.

lo/g-imos, h, on Hdt.2.98, also os, on Id.6.106: (le/gw B):—
worth mention, notable, famous, po/lis Il.cc.; po/lisma, e)/qnos, a)nh/r, Id.1.143, 171,9.64; l. e)s ta\ prw=ta Id.9.16; -w/tatos ib.37; as epith. of temples in Egypt, i(ero\n l. PTeb.302.4 (i A.D.), etc. (e)llo/gimos is more freq.).

lo/g-ion, to/,
oracle, esp. one preserved from antiquity, Hdt. 4.178,203, 8.60.g/, Plu.Thes.26, Lys.22: more freq. in pl.,
oracles, Hdt.1.64, 8.62, 141, E.Heracl.405, Ar.Eq.120, al., Plu.Fab.4, Marc.3: distd. fr. xrhsmoi/, Th.2.8 (the former being
prose, the latter
verse, acc. to Sch., but this distn. does not hold), cf. Plu.Pel.20, Nic.13, 2.412c. ta\ l. *kuri/ou the
sayings of the Lord, LXX Ps.11(12).6, cf.Act.Ap.7.38, Ep.Rom.3.2, 1 Ep.Pet.4.11. to\ l. tw=n kri/sewn
the oracular breastplate worn by the Jewish High-Priest, LXX Ex.28.26(30), cf. Ph.2.154; ta\ lo/gia Aristeas 158.

lo/g-ios, a, on, (lo/gos)
of or
belonging to lo/goi:
versed in tales or
stories (cf. lo/gos v), lo/gioi kai\ a)oidoi/ Pi.P.1.94, cf. N.6.45: hence of chroniclers (opp. poets), *perse/wn oi( lo/gioi Hdt.1.1; *ai)gupti/wn -w/tatoi Id.2.3, cf. 4.46; so later, oi( -w/tatoi tw=n a)rxai/wn suggrafe/wn Plb.6.45.1, cf. 38.6.1, D.S. 2.4, D.H.5.17, etc. generally,
learned, erudite, Democr.30, etc.; l. peri\ th\n o(/lhn fu/sin Arist.Pol.1267b28; o( l. *)akesti=nos, of a
learned physician, Hld.4.7; oi( -w/tatoi *turrhnw=n, of the Tuscan haruspices, Plu.Sull.7; *xaldai/wn oi( l. Arr.An.7.16.5, cf. J.AJ17.6.2, etc.; logiw/tatos as title, OGI408.5 (Theb. Aeg.), POxy.902.1 (v A. D.), etc.; o( th=s l. mnh/mhs sxolastiko/s PMasp.118.30 (vi A. D.).
skilled in words, eloquent, to\ megaloprepe\s o(/per nu=n kai\ lo/gion o)noma/zousin Demetr.Eloc.38, etc.; Arist. is said to have made Thphr. [to\n] -w/taton (of his disciples), Str.13.2.4; l. e)c a)fw/nou geno/menos Plu.Pomp.51; epith. of Hermes, as the god of eloquence, Luc.Apol.2, Gall.2 (Sup.), Jul.Or.4.132a; oi( l. qeoi/ Id.Ep.80; this sense is condemned by Phryn.176. Adv. -i/ws
eloquently, Plu.2.405a; w(s e)nh=n -w/tata
as nearly in words as possible, of the elephant, ib.968d.
oracular, *)apo/llwnos dw=ma lo/gion Berl.Sitzb.1911.632 (Cyprus).

log-io/ths, htos, h(,
eloquence, Ph.2.93, Plu.2.205a; ascribed to Sophocles by Id.2.348d. as title, from lo/gios 1.2, h( sh\ l. POxy.902.13 (v A. D.), etc.
log-i/s, i/dos, h(, fem. derivative of lo/gos, logi/des semnai/ Anon. ap. An.Ox.1.225.
lo/g-isis, ews, h(, = logismo/s, Phryn.PS p.65 B.

lo/g-isma, atos, to/,
reckoning, account, Antiph.243; e)pi\ lo/gisma a)rguri/ou JHS9.248 = BCH50.491 (Cyprus).

log-ismo/s, o(,
counting, calculation, tw=n h(merw=n Th.4.122; tugxa/nein tou= a)lhqou=s l. Id.3.20; e)k toiou=de l. e)/cesti/ tw| skopei=n Id.5.68; e)n l. a(marta/nein Pl.R.340d; a)riqmo\s kai\ l. Id.Phdr.274c; e)pi\ logismo\n e)lqo/ntes Id.Euthphr.7b; kaqe/zesqai e)pi\ tou\s l. Aeschin.3.59: in pl.,
numbers, arithmetic, logismou\s manqa/nein X.Mem.4.7.8; logismou/s te kai\ a)stronomi/an kai\ gewmetri/an . . dida/skein Pl.Prt.318e, cf. R.510c, al.
account, reckoning, Lys.32.19, D.18.113, etc.; l. lamba/nein hold an
audit, Arist.Pol.1322b9. without reference to number,
calculation, reasoning, tou= cumfe/rontos logismw=| Th.2.40; kaqista/nai tina\s e)s l. Id.6.34; logismw=| e)la/xista xrw/menoi Id.2.11; e)nde/xetai/ ti logismo/n Id.4.92; l. au)tokra/tori (v. au)tokra/twr 1.4) ib.108; ou) logismw=| do/ntes tou\s kindu/nous Lys.2.23; logismo\n peri/ tinos e)/xein Pl. Lg.805a; o(/son h)=n a)nqrwpi/nw| l. dunato/n D.18.300, cf. 193; toi=s l. toi=s i)di/ois ptai/wn a)ei/ Men.380; meta\ logismou= pa/nta pra/ttousi/n tinos Id.617, cf. Philem.90.10, etc.; personified, opp. *qumo/s, Cleanth.Stoic. 1.129.
reason, argument, X.HG3.4.27, Pl.Ti.34a.
reasoning power, [Epich.] 257.1, Democr. 187, X.Mem.4.3.11, Epicur. Sent.16, al.: freq. in Arist., to\ tw=n a)nqrw/pwn ge/nos [zh=|] kai\ te/xnh| kai\ logismoi=s Metaph.980b28, cf. de An.415a8, al.—Only in Prose and Com.

logist-ei/a, h(,
office of logisth/s,
Bull.Inst.Français d' Arch.Orient. 22.193 (Egypt. iii/ii B. C.), Inscr.Délos 396 A19 (ii B. C.), IG12(1).83 (Rhodes, ii A. D.), OGI509.9 (Aphrodisias), PKlein.Form.1010 (iv/v A. D.), Cod.Just.10.56.1, etc.

logist-e/on,
one must reckon, Vett.Val.264.9; l. a)po/ . .
one must deduct from.., th\n trofh\n . . a)po\ tw=n e(bdomh/konta mnw=n . . logiste/on D.27.36.
one must impute, tini/ ti Hld.1.15.
one must take into account, ti Pl.Ti.62a.
one must reason, Men. 531.9.

logist-eu/w,
administer as logisth/s, tou\s *smurnai/ous Philostr.VS 1.19.2, cf. Jahresh.23 Beibl.54 (Mopsuestia), IGRom.3.6, OGI722.10 (iv A. D.), etc.: c. gen.,
to be curator of, th=s kolwni/as, th=s . . po/lews, IG 5(1).524 (Laconia), OGI500.12 (Aphrodisias). metaph., h( fu/sis logisteu/ei ta\ mo/ria Sever.Clyst.p.6 D., cf. Suid.

logist-h/rion, to/,
the place at Athens
where the logistai/
met, Decr. ap. And.1.78 (pl.), Lys.20.10; later of any
office, l. tw=n nomarxikw=n Klio12.365 (Alexandria, ii B. C.), cf. PPetr.2p.26 (iii B. C.), PTeb.24.38 (ii B. C.); stratiwtiko\n l. war-
office, Str.16.2.10. logisth/ria, ta/, = logistai/, Arist.Fr.446; a)nenegka/tw o( tami/as . . tw=| prw/tw| logisthri/w| at the first
meeting of the logistai/, SIG1219.36 (Gambreum, iii B. C.).
reckoning-board, abacus, D.S.30.15; called tra/peza logisthri/a by Poll.10.158.

logist-h/s, ou=, o(,
calculator, teacher of arithmetic, Pl.Plt.260a, R.340d.
calculator, reasoner, leptw\ logista/ Ar.Av.318; di/kaios l. tw=n . . u(phrgme/nwn D.1.10.
auditor, esp. at Athens, in pl., a board which audited the accounts of magistrates going out of office, Aeschin.3.15, D.18.117,229; also called eu)/qunoi acc. to Arist.Pol.1322b11, but distd. from them, Id.Ath.48.3, IG12.91, 22.956; also at Delos, ib.11(2).203 A63 (iii B. C.); in Egypt, l. *)ocurugxi/tou (sc. nomou=) POxy.84.2, etc.; l. kw/mhs PKlein.Form.617 (v A. D.): metaph., logistai\ tw=n . . xorw=n, of the audience, Eup.223. = Lat.
curator rei publicae, an
Imperial commissioner and inspector of accounts, IGRom.3.39 (Bithynia), etc.

logist-iko/s, h/, o/n,
skilled or
practised in calculating, Pl.Tht.145a, X.Mem.1.1.7; oi( fu/sei l. Pl.R.526b; of a mathematician, AP11.267: Subst. h( -kh/ (with or without te/xnh),
practical arithmetic, the art of arithmetic, opp. a)riqmhtikh/ (the science of number), Pl.Grg. 450d, 451b, R.525a, al.; so to\ -ko/n Id.Chrm.174b; h( l., opp. gewmetri/a, Archyt.4.
endued with reason, rational, zw=|a Arist. de An. 434a7; [to\] l. [mo/rion th=s yuxh=s] ib.432a25; l. o)/recis, opp. a)/logos, Id.Rh.1369a2; to\ l. (sc. th=s yuxh=s) the
reasoning faculty, Pl.R.439d, cf. Arist.Top.128b38; = to\ bouleutiko/n, Id.EN1139a12.
using one's reason, reasonable, X.HG5.2.28, Men.Epit.541. -ko/n, to/,
expenses of the logistei/a, Inscr.Délos395.13, 399 A96 (ii B. C.).

logistono/mos, on,
regulating accounts, Man.4.160.
logkou/rion (logou/rion cod.): u(/alos, Hsch. (cf. lugkou/rion, logou/rion).
logogra^f-eu/s, e/ws, o(, = logogra/fos 11, D.H.Din.11 codd. (-gra/fw| Sauppe).

logogra^f-e/w,
to be a logogra/fos 11,
write speeches, tisi for people, Plu.Comp.Dem.Cic.3; e)pi/ tina Id.Dem.6.
make into a story, [muqa/ria] Jul.Or.7.208c.
keep accounts, yeudw=s l., *(ellhnika/ 1.18 (Gytheum, i A. D.).

logogra^/f-hma, atos, to/,
prose work, Anon. in Rh. 3.571 W.

logogra^f-i/a, h(,
writing of speeches: and generally,
of prose, Pl. Phdr.257e, 258b; i(stori/a kai\ h( a)/llh l. Hermog.Id.2.12; esp.
speech-writing for money, Demad.8.
office of official recorder in a lawcourt, PAmh.2.82.7 (iii/iv A. D.).

logogra^f-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for writing speeches or
prose, a)na/gkh l. inevitable rules
for composition, Pl. Phdr.264b; h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh) Id. ap. Poll.2.121; h( l. i)de/a Ammon. in Int.4.30.

logo/gra^f-os, o(,
prose-writer, opp. poet (v. lo/gos v), Arist.Rh. 1388b22, D.H.Comp.16.1: applied to the early Greek historians from Cadmus of Miletus to Hdt. by Th.1.21; cf. logopoio/s 1: generally,
historian, Plb.7.7.1; coupled with suggrafeu/s, D.H.1.73.
professional speech-writer, Alex.124.19, Aeschin.1.94; as a term of reproach, dia\ pa/shs th=s loidori/as e)ka/lei logogra/fon Pl.Phdr.257c, cf. Din.1.111, D.19.246, Aeschin.3.173, Hyp.Ath.3: but without such implication, *xairh/mwn a)kribh\s w(/sper l. Arist.Rh.1413b13.
accountant, POxy.2115 (iv A. D.), etc.
recorder in a court, PAmh.2.82.3 (iii/iv A. D.).

logo-daida^li/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
skill in adorning a speech, Aus.Ep. 10.26.

logo-dai/da^los, on,
skilled in tricking out a speech, Pl.Phdr. 266e.

logo-deh/s, e/s,
wanting in reason or
reasonableness, prob. l. in Arist.Spir.481b27.

logo/-deipnon, to/,
feast of words, learned banquet, Ath.1.b.

logo-dia/rroia, h(,
flux of words, ib.22e, 4.159e.

logo-di^da/ska^los, o(,
teacher of eloquence, Poll.2.125.

logo-ei/deia, h(,
prosaic diction, D.H.Comp.26.

logo-eidh/s, e/s,
prose-like, prosaic, sti/xos Sch.Heph.p.292 C., cf. Hermog.Id.1.3 (Comp.), Eust.718.25, etc.; to\ l.
prose, D.L.7.60; but also,
command of language, Philostr. VA1.19.
resembling reason, qhri/a logoeidh=, logoeidei=s e)ne/rgeiai Dam.Pr.18.
reasonable, rational, Procl.Inst.111, in Alc. p.68 C.

logo-qesi/a, h(,
keeping of accounts, POxy.136.33 (pl., vi A. D.);
audit, BGU77.10 (ii A. D.), etc.
description, account, Bito 44.9.

logo-qe/sios, o(,
accountant, Palchosin Cat.Cod.Astr.1.94.26: -qe/sia, ta/,
account-books, ib.1.95.17.

logo-qete/w,
call to account, Epimyth. ad Aesop.406:—Pass., Mitteis Chr.372 ii 3.
keep accounts, Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr.7.110.29.

logo-qe/ths, ou, o(,
auditor, BGU77.10 (ii A.D.), al., Cod.Just.10.30.4, Procop.Arc.8, al.

logo-qew/rhtos, on,
to be apprehended by the intellect alone, of the pores, Cael. Aur.TP3.2.19, CP2.16, cf. Cic. ap. Macr.Sat.2.3.6.

logo-qh/ras, ou, o(,
word-catcher, Ph.1.526, al.

logo-i+atrei/a, h(,
healing only in words, v. logi/atros.

logo-klopi/a, h(,
stealing of another's words or thoughts,
plagiarism, attributed to Empedocles by Timae.81.

logo-lesxe/w,
prate, Eust.437.24.

logo-le/sxhs, ou, o(,
prater, AP11.140 (Lucill.).

logo-ma/geiros [a^], o(,
one who cooks up words, Suid. s.v. *)antifw=n.

logo-ma^ne/w,
to have a passion for study, Chio Ep.15.3.

logo-ma^xe/w,
fight about words, 2 Ep.Ti.2.14.

logo-ma^xi/a, h(,
war about words, disputation, 1 Ep.Ti.6.4 (pl.), Porph. ap. Eus.PE14.10; title of Menippean satire by Varro, Nonius p.268 L., Porphyr.ad Hor.Sat.2.4.

logo/-mi_mos, o(,
writer or
actor of spoken mimes, Hegesand.13.

logo-mu/qion [u_], to/,
fabulous legend, Poll.2.123.

logo-pla/qos [a^], o(,
fable-maker, e.g. Aesop, Phryn.PS p.86 B.

logopoi-e/w,
write, compose, Pl.R.378d, Lg.636d;
write speeches, Id.Euthd.289d.
fabricate tales, esp. of newsmongers, Th.6.38,
And.1.54, Lys.16.11, D.4.49, Thphr. Char.8.1; ta\s [sumfora\s] au)toi\ logopoiou=sin Lys.22.14; l. kata\ th=s po/lews Plb.28.2.4:—Pass., D.C. 37.35. Med.,
settle accounts, pro/s tinas PRyl.136.4 (i A.D.), etc.:—Pass., Ostr.1179. Med.,
make proposals, i)di/a| pro/s tina Luc.DMeretr.10.4.

logopoi/-hma, atos, to/,
idle tale, piece of gossip, Antiph.166.2.

logopoi-i/a, h(,
tale-telling, newsmongering, Thphr.Char. 8.1.
tale, piece of gossip, Nic.Dam.130.20 J. (pl.), Charito 3.2 (pl.).
prayer, Sm.Ps.101(102).1.
rendering of accounts, PLond.5.1660.20 (vi A.D.).

logopoi-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
like a logopoio/s: h( -kh\ te/xnh, = logografikh/, Pl.Euthd.289c.

logopoi-o/s, o(,
prose-writer; esp.
historian, chronicler, Id.R.392a, Isoc.5.109, 11.37; applied by Hdt. to Hecataeus, 2.143, 5.36,125; to Hdt. himself by Arr.An.3.30.8.
writer of fables, *ai)/swpos o( l. Hdt.2.134, cf. Plu.Sol.28. at Athens, = logogra/fos 11,
professional speechmaker, Pl.Euthd.289d. with collat. sense of
tale-teller, newsmonger, D.24.15, Thphr.Char.8.1, Plu.Nic.30.

logo-pra_ge/w,
write copiously, Eust.1759.5.
logo-pra/ktwr, oros, o(, dub. sens. in PBaden 26.40 (iii A.D.).

logo-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in words, Ph.1.526, Philostr.VS1.23.1.

lo/gos, o(, verbal noun of le/gw (B), with senses corresponding to le/gw (B) II and III (on the various senses of the word v. Theo Sm.pp.72,73 H., An.Ox.4.327): common in all periods in Prose and Verse, exc. Epic, in which it is found in signf. derived from le/gw (B) 111, cf.infr. VI. 1 a:
computation, reckoning (cf. le/gw (B) II).
account of money handled, sani/des ei)s a(\s to\n l. a)nagra/fomen IG12.374.191; e)di/dosan to\n l. ib.232.2; l. dw/seis tw=n metexei/risas xrhma/twn Hdt.3.142, cf. 143; ou)/te xrh/mata diaxeiri/sas th=s po/lews di/dwmi l. au)tw=n ou)/te a)rxh\n a)/rcas ou)demi/an eu)qu/nas u(pe/xw nu=n au)th=s Lys.24.26; l. a)penegkei=n Arist.Ath.54.1; e)n tai=s eu)qu/nais tou= toiou/tou l. u(pexe/tw Pl.Lg.774b; to\n tw=n xrhma/twn l. para\ tou/twn lamba/nein D.8.47; a)dikh/mata ei)s a)rguri/ou l. a)nh/konta Din.1.60; suna=rai lo/gon meta/ tinos settle
accounts with, Ev.Matt.18.23, etc.; deu/teroi l. a second
audit, Cod.Just.1.4.26.1; o( trapezitiko\s l. banking
account, Theo Sm.p.73 H.: metaph., ou)k a)\n priai/mhn ou)deno\s l. broto/n S.Aj.477.
public accounts, i. e. branch of
treasury, i)/dios l., in Egypt, OGI188.2, 189.3, 669.38; also as title of
treasurer, ib.408.4, Str.17.1.12; o( e)pi\ tw=n l. IPE2.29 A (Panticapaeum); dhmo/sios l., = Lat.
fiscus, OGI669.21 (Egypt, i A.D.), etc. (but later, =
aerarium, Cod.Just.1.5.15); also *kai/saros l. OGI669.30; kuriako\s l. ib.18. generally,
account, reckoning, mh\ fu=nai to\n a(/panta nika=| l. excels the whole
account, i.e. is best of
all, S.OC 1225 (lyr.); do/ntas l. tw=n e)poi/hsan
accounting for, i.e. paying the penalty for their doings, Hdt.8.100; l. ai)tei=n Pl.Plt.285e; l. dou=nai kai\ de/casqai Id.Prt.336c, al.; lamba/nein l. kai\ e)le/gxein Id.Men.75d; parasxei=n tw=n ei)rhme/nwn l. Id.R.344d; l. a)paitei=n D.30.15, cf. Arist. EN1104a3; l. u(pe/xein, dou=nai, D.19.95; l. e)ggra/yai Id.24.199, al.; l. a)pofe/rein th=| po/lei Aeschin.3.22, cf. Eu. Luc.16.2, Ep.Hebr.13.17; to\ para/docon tw=n sumbebhko/twn u(po\ lo/gon a)/gein Plb.15.34.2; l. h( e)pisth/mh, polla\ de\ o( l. the
account is manifold, Plot.6.9.4; e)/xwn lo/gon tou= dia\ ti/ an
account of the cause, Arist.APo.74b27; e)s l. tino/s on
account of, e)s xrhma/twn l. Th.3.46, cf. Plb.5.89.6, LXX 2 Ma1.14, JRS 18.152 (Jerash); lo/gw| c. gen., by
way of, Cod.Just.3.2.5. al.; kata\ lo/gon tou= mege/qous if we take into
account his size, Arist.HA517b27; pro\s o(\n h(mi=n o( l. Ep.Hebr.4.13, cf. D.Chr.31.123.
measure, tale (cf. infr. 11.1), qa/lassa . . metre/etai e)s to\n au)to\n l. o(koi=os pro/sqen Heraclit.31; yuxh=s e)sti l. e(auto\n au)/cwn Id.115; e)s tou/tou (sc. gh/raos） l. ou) polloi/ tines a)pikne/ontai to the
point of old age, Hdt.3.99, cf.7.9.b/; o( cu/mpas l. the full
tale, Th.7.56, cf. Ep.Phil.4.15; koinw=| l. nomi/santa common
measure, Pl.Lg.746e;
sum, total of expenditure, IG42(1).103.151 (Epid., iv B.C.); o( th=s ou)si/as l., = Lat.
patrimonii modus, Cod.Just.1.5.12.20.
esteem, consideration, value put on a person or thing (cf. infr. VI. 2 d), ou(= plei/wn l. h)\ tw=n a)/llwn who is of more
worth than all the rest, Heraclit.39; brotw=n l. ou)k e)/sxen ou)de/n' A.Pr.233; ou) smikrou= l. S.OC1163: freq. in Hdt., *mardoni/ou l. ou)dei\s gi/netai 8.102; tw=n h)=n e)la/xistos a)pollume/nwn l. 4.135, cf. E.Fr.94; peri\ e)mou= ou)dei\s l. Ar.Ra.87; lo/gou ou)deno\s gi/nesqai pro/s tinos to be of no
account, repute with.., Hdt.1.120, cf.4.138; lo/gou poih/sasqai/ tina make one of
account, Id.1.33; e)laxi/stou, plei/stou l. ei)=nai, to be highly, lowly
esteemed, Id.1.143, 3.146; but also lo/gon tino\s poiei=sqai, like Lat.
rationem habere alicujus, make
account of, set a
value on, Democr.187, etc.: usu. in neg. statements, ou)de/na l. poih/sasqai/ tinos Hdt.1.4, cf. 13, Plb.21.14.9, etc.; l. e)/xein Hdt.1.62,115; l. i)/sxein peri/ tinos Pl.Ti.87c; l. e)/xein peri\ tou\s poihta/s Lycurg.107; l. e)/xein tino/s D.18.199, Arist.EN1102b32, Plu.Phil.18 (but also, have the
reputation of . . , v. infr. VI. 2 e); e)n ou)deni\ l. poih/sasqai/ ti Hdt.3.50; e)n ou)deni\ l. a)pw/lonto without
regard, Id.9.70; e)n smikrw=| l. ei)=nai Pl.R.550a; u(mei=s ou)/t' e)n l. ou)/t' e)n a)riqmw=| Orac. ap. Sch.Theoc.14.48; e)n a)ndrw=n l. [ei)=nai] to be
reckoned, count as a man, Hdt.3.120; e)n i)diw/tew lo/gw| kai\ a)ti/mou
reckoned as . . , Eus.Mynd.Fr. 59; semno\s ei)s a)reth=s l. kai\ do/chs D.19.142.
relation, correspondence, proportion, generally, u(perteri/hs l.
relation (of gold to lead), Thgn.418 = 1164; pro\s lo/gon tou= sh/matos A.Th.519; kata\ lo/gon probai/nontes timw=si in inverse
ratio, Hdt.1.134, cf. 7.36; kata\ l. th=s a)poforh=s Id.2.109; ta)/lla kata\ l. in
like fashion, Hp.VM16, Prog.17: c. gen., kata\ l. tw=n pro/sqen ib. 24; kata\ l. tw=n h(merw=n Ar. Nu.619; kata\ l. th=s duna/mews X. Cyr.8.6.11; e)la/ttw h)\ kata\ l. Arist. HA508a2, cf. PA671a18; e)k tau/ths e)ge/neto e)kei/nh kata\ l. Id.Pol. 1257a31; cf. eu)/logos: sts. with o( au)to/s added, kata\ to\n au)to\n l. tw=| tei/xei+
in fashion like to . . , Hdt.1.186; peri\ tw=n no/swn o( au)to\s l.
analogously, Pl.Tht.158d, cf. Prm.136b, al.; ei)s to\n au)to\n l.
similarly, Id.R.353d; kata\ to\n au)to\n l. in the same
ratio, IG12.76.8; by parity of
reasoning, Pl.Cra.393c, R.610a, al.; a)na\ lo/gon tino/s, tini/, Id.Ti.29c, Alc.2.145d; tou=ton e)/xei to\n l. pro\s . . o(\n h( paidei/a pro\s th\n a)reth/n is
related to . . as . . , Procl.in Euc.p.20 F., al. Math.,
ratio, proportion (o( kat' a)na/logon l., l. th=s a)nalogi/as, Theo Sm.p.73 H.), Pythag. 2; i)so/ths lo/gwn Arist.EN113a31; l. e)sti\ du/o megeqw=n h( kata\ phliko/thta poia\ sxe/sis Euc.5 Def.3; tw=n a(rmoniw=n tou\s l. Arist.Metaph.985b32, cf. 1092b14; lo/goi a)riqmw=n numerical
ratios, Aristox.Harm.p.32 M.; tou\s fqo/ggous a)nagkai=on e)n a)riqmou= l. le/gesqai pro\s a)llh/lous to be expressed in numerical
ratios, Euc.
Sect.Can. Proëm.: in Metre,
ratio between arsis and thesis, by which the rhythm is defined, Aristox.Harm.p.34 M.; e)a\n h)=| i)sxurote/ra tou= ai)sqhthri/ou h( ki/nhsis, lu/etai o( l. Arist.de An. 424a31; a)na\ lo/gon
analogically, Archyt.2; a)na\ l. merisqei=sa [h( yuxh/]
proportionally, Pl. Ti.37a; so kata\ l. Men.319.6; pro\s lo/gon in
proportion, Plb.6.30.3, 9.15.3 (but pro\s lo/gon e)pi\ steno\n suna/getai narrows
uniformly, Sor. 1.9, cf. Diocl.Fr.171); e)pi\ lo/gon IG5(1).1428 (Messene). Gramm.,
analogy, rule, tw=| l. tw=n metoxikw=n, th=s sugkoph=s, by the
rule of the participles, of syncope, Choerob. in Theod.1.75 Gaisf., 1.377 H.; ei)pe/ moi to\n l. tou= *ai)/as *ai)/antos, toute/sti to\n kano/na An.Ox. 4.328.
explanation,
plea, pretext, ground, e)k ti/nos l.; A.Ch.515; e)c ou)deno\s l. S.Ph.731; a)po\ panto\s l. Id.OC762; xw) l. kalo\s prosh=n Id.Ph.352; su\n a)fanei= l. Id.OT657 (lyr., v.l. lo/gwn）; e)n a)fanei= l. Antipho 5.59; e)pi\ toiou/tw| l. Hdt.6.124; kata\ ti/na l.; on what
ground? Pl.R.366b; ou)de\ pro\s e(/na l. to no
purpose, Id.Prt. 343d; e)pi\ ti/ni l.; for what
reason? X.HG2.2.19; to\n l. tou=ton this
ground of complaint, Aeschin.3.228; ti/ni dikai/w| l.; what just
cause is there? Pl.Grg.512c; ti/ni l.; on what
account? Act.Ap.10.29; kata\ lo/gon a)\n h)nesxo/mhn u(mw=n
reason would that . . , ib.18.14; l. e)/xein, with personal subject, ei)=xon a)/n tina l. I (i.e. my conduct) would have admitted of an
explanation, Pl.Ap.31b; to\n o)rqo\n l. the true
explanation, ib.34b.
plea, case, in Law or argument (cf. VIII. I), to\n h(/ttw l. krei/ttw poiei=n to make the weaker
case prevail, ib.18b, al., Arist.Rh.1402a24, cf. Ar.Nu.1042 (pl.); personified, ib.886, al.; a)mu/neis tw=| th=s h(donh=s l. Pl.Phlb.38a; a)noi/seis tou\s l. au)tw=n pro\s to\n qeo/n LXXEx.18.19; e)xein l. pro/s tina to have a
case, ground of action against . . , Act.Ap.19.38.
statement of a theory, argument, ou)k e)meu= a)lla\ tou= l. a)kou/santas prob. in Heraclit.50; lo/gon h)de\ no/hma a)mfi\s a)lhqei/hs
discourse and reflection on reality, Parm.8.50; dhloi= ou(=tos o( l. o(/ti . . Democr.7; ou)k e)/xei lo/gon it is not
arguable, i.e.
reasonable, S.El.466, Pl.Phd.62d, etc.; e)/xei l. D.44.32; ou)dei\s au)ta\ katabalei= l. E.Ba.202; di/kason . . to\n l. a)kou/sas Pl.Lg.696b; personified, fhsi\ ou(=tos o( l. ib.714d, cf. Sph.238b, Phlb.50a; w(s o( l. (sc. le/gei) Arist.EN1115b12; w(s o( l. o( o)rqo\s le/gei ib. 1138b20, cf. 29; o( l. qe/lei prosbiba/zein Phld.Rh.1.41, cf.1.19 S.; ou) ga\r a)\n a)kou/seie lo/gou a)potre/pontos Arist.EN1179b27; l. kaqai/rwn Aristo Stoic.1.88; lo/gou tugxa/nein to be
explained, Phld.Mus.p.77 K.; o( to\n l. mou a)kou/wn my
teaching, Ev.Jo.5.24; o( profhtiko\s l., collect., of VT prophecy, 2 Ep.Pet.1.19: pl., o(ko/swn lo/gous h)/kousa Heraclit.108; ou)k e)pi/qeto toi=s e)moi=s l. Ar.Nu.73; of
arguments leading to a conclusion (o( l.), Pl. Cri.46b; ta\ *)anacago/rou bibli/a ge/mei tou/twn tw=n l. Id.Ap.26d; l. a)po\ tw=n a)rxw=n, e)pi\ ta\s a)rxa/s, Arist.EN1095a31; sullogismo/s e)sti l. e)n w(=| teqe/ntwn tinw=n ktl. Id.APr.24b18; l. a)nti/tupo/s te kai\ a)/poros, of a self-contradictory
theory, Plot.6.8.7. o( peri\ qew=n l., title of a
discourse by Protagoras, D.L.9.54; o( *)axilleu\s l., name of an
argument, ib.23; o( au)co/menos l. Plu.2.559b; kataba/llontes (sc. lo/goi), title of work by Protagoras, S.E.M.7.60; l. sofistikoi/ Arist.SE 165a34, al.; oi( maqhmatikoi\ l. Id.Rh.1417a19, etc.; oi( e)cwterikoi\ l., current outside the Lyceum, Id.Ph.217b31, al.; *dissoi\ l., title of a philosophical treatise (= Dialex.); *l. kai\ *logi/na, name of play of Epicharmus,
quibble, argument, personified, Ath.8.338d. in Logic,
proposition, whether as premiss or conclusion, pro/tasi/s e)sti l. katafatiko\s h)\ a)pofatiko/s tinos kata/ tinos Arist.APr.24a16.
rule, principle, law, as embodying the result of logismo/s, Pi.O.2.22, P.1.35, N.4.31; pei/qesqai tw=| l. o(\s a)/n moi logizome/nw| be/ltistos fai/nhtai Pl.Cri.46b, cf. c; h(dona\s toi=s o)rqoi=s l. e(pome/nas obeying right
principles, Id.Lg.696c; proaire/sews [a)rxh\] o)/recis kai\ l. o( e(/neka/ tinos
principle directed to an end, Arist.EN1139a32; of the final cause, a)rxh\ o( l. e)/n te toi=s kata\ te/xnhn kai\ e)n toi=s fu/sei sunesthko/sin Id.PA639b15; a)podido/asi tou\s l. kai\ ta\s ai)ti/as ou(= poiou=si e(ka/stou ib.18; [te/xnh] e(/cis meta\ l. a)lhqou=s poihtikh/ Id.EN1140a10; o)rqo\s l. true
principle, right
rule, ib.1144b27, 1147b3, al.; kata\ lo/gon by
rule, consistently, o( kata\ l. zw=n Pl.Lg.689d, cf. Ti.89d; to\ kata\ l. zh=n, opp. kata\ pa/qos, Arist.EN1169a5; kata\ l. proxwrei=n according to
plan, Plb.1.20.3.
law, rule of conduct, w(=| ma/lista dihnekw=s o(milou=si lo/gw| Heraclit.72; polloi\ lo/gon mh\ maqo/ntes zw=si kata\ lo/gon Democr.53; dei= u(pa/rxein to\n l. to\n kaqo/lou toi=s a)/rxousin universal
principle, Arist.Pol.1286a17; o( no/mos . . l. w)\n a)po/ tinos fronh/sews kai\ nou= Id.EN1180a21; o( no/mos . . e)/myuxos w)\n e(autw=| l.
conscience, Plu. 2.780c; to\n l. pro/xeiron e)/xein
precept, Phld.Piet.30, cf. 102; o( prostaktiko\s tw=n poihte/wn h)\ mh\ l. koino/s M.Ant.4.4.
thesis, hypothesis, provisional
ground, w(s a)\n ei) le/goi lo/gon maintain a
thesis, Pl. Prt.344b; u(poqe/menos e(ka/stote l. provisionally assuming a
proposition, Id.Phd.100a; to\n th=s o(moio/thtos l.
hypothesis of equivalence, Arist.Cael.296a20.
reason, ground, pa/ntwn ginome/nwn kata\ to\n l. to/nde Heraclit.1; ou(/tw baqu\n l. e)/xei Id.45; e)k lo/gou, opp. ma/thn, Leucipp. 2; me/giston shmei=on ou(=tos o( l. Meliss.8; [e)mpeiri/a] ou)k e)/xei l. ou)de/na w(=n prosfe/rei has no
grounds for . . , Pl.Grg.465a; meta\ lo/gou
te kai\ e)pisth/mhs qei/as Id.Sph.265c; h( meta lo/gou a)lhqh\s do/ca （= e)pisth/mh) Id.Tht.201c; lo/gon zhtou=sin w(=n ou)k e)/sti l.
proof, Arist. Metaph.1011a12; oi( a(pa/ntwn zhtou=ntes l. a)nairou=si l. Thphr.Metaph. 26.
formula (wider than
definition, but freq. equivalent thereto),
term expressing
reason, l. th=s politei/as Pl.R.497c; yuxh=s ou)si/a te kai\ l. essential
definition, Id.Phdr.245e; o( tou= dikai/ou l. Id.R.343a; to\n l. th=s ou)si/as ib.534b, cf. Phd.78d; ta\s polla\s e)pisth/mas e(ni\ l. proseipei=n Id.Tht.148d; o( th=s oi)kodomh/sews l. e)/xei to\n th=s oi)ki/as Arist. PA646b3; teqei/h a)\n i)/dion o)/noma kaq' e(/kaston tw=n l. Id.Metaph.1006b5, cf. 1035b4; pa=s o(rismo\s l. ti/s e)sti Id.Top.102a5; e)pi\ tw=n sxhma/twn l. koino/s generic
definition, Id.de An.414b23; a)kribe/statos l. specific
definition, Id.Pol.1276b24; phgh=s l. e)/xon Ph.2.477; to\ w)|o\n ou)/te a)rxh=s e)/xei l. fulfils the
function of . . , Plu.2.637d; l. th=s mi/cews
formula, i. e.
ratio (cf. supr. II) of combination, Arist.PA642a22, cf. Metaph.993a17.
reason, law exhibited in the world-process, kata\ lo/gon
by law, ko/smw| pa/nta kai\ kata\ l. e)/xonta Pl.R.500c; kat to\n <au)to\n au)=> l. by the same
law, Epich.170.18; yuxh=s to\ pa=n to/de dioikou/shs kata\ l. Plot.2.3.13; esp. in Stoic Philos., the divine
order, to\n tou= panto\s l. o(\n e)/nioi ei(marme/nhn kalou=sin Zeno Stoic.1.24; to\ poiou=n to\n e)n [th=| u(/lh|] l. to\n qeo/n ibid., cf. 42; o( tou= ko/smou l. Chrysipp.Stoic.2.264; lo/gos, = fu/sei no/mos, Stoic.2.169; kata\ to\n koino\n qeoi=s kai\ a)nqrw/pois l. M.Ant.7.53; o( o)rqo\s l. dia\ pa/ntwn e)rxo/menos Chrysipp.Stoic.3.4: so in Plot., th\n fu/sin ei)=nai lo/gon, o(\s poiei= l. a)/llon ge/nnhma au(tou= 3.8.2. spermatiko\s l. generative
principle in organisms, o( qeo\s sp. l. tou= ko/smou Zeno Stoic.1.28: usu. in pl., Stoic. 2.205,314,al.; gi/netai ta\ e)n tw=| panti\ ou) kata\ spermatikou/s, a)lla\ kata\ l. perilhptikou/s Plot.3.1.7, cf.4.4.39: so without spermatiko/s, w(/sper tine\s l. tw=n merw=n Cleanth.Stoic.1.111; oi( l. tw=n o(/lwn Ph.1.9. in Neo-Platonic Philos., of regulative and formative
forces, derived from the intelligible and operative in the sensible universe, o)/ntwn meizo/nwn l. kai\ qewrou/ntwn au(tou\s e)gw\ gege/nnhmai Plot.3.8.4; oi( e)n spe/rmati l. pla/ttousi . . ta\ zw=|a oi(=on mikrou/s tinas ko/smous Id.4.3.10, cf.3.2.16,3.5.7; opp. o(/ros, Id.6.7.4; a)fanei=s l. th=s fu/sews Procl.
in R.1.18 K.; texnikoi\ l. ib.142 K., al. inward
debate of the soul (cf. l. o(\n au)th\ pro\s au(th\n h( yuxh\ diece/rxetai Pl.Tht.189e (dia/logos in Sph.263e); o( e)n th=| yuxh=|, o( e)/sw l. (opp. o( e)/cw l.), Arist.APo.76b25, 27; o( e)ndia/qetos, opp. o( proforiko\s l., Stoic.2.43, Ph.2.154),
thinking, reasoning, tou= l. e)o/ntos cunou=, opp. i)di/a fro/nhsis, Heraclit. 2; kri=nai de\ lo/gw| . . e)/legxon test by
reflection, Parm.1.36;
reflection, deliberation (cf. VI.3), e)di/dou lo/gon e(wutw=| peri\ th=s o)/yios Hdt.1.209, cf. 34, S.OT583, D.45.7; mh\ ei)de/nai . . mh/te lo/gw| mh/te e)/rgw| neither by
reasoning nor by experience, Anaxag.7; a(\ dh\ lo/gw| me\n kai\ dianoi/a| lhpta/, o)/yei d' ou)/ Pl.R.529d, cf. Prm.135e; o( l. h)\ h( ai)/sqhsis Arist.EN 1149a35,al.; au)tw=| mo/non tw=| l. pisteu/ein (opp. ai)sqh/seis), of Parmenides and his school, Aristocl. ap. Eus.PE14.17: hence lo/gw| or tw=| l. in
idea, in
thought, tw=| l. te/mnein Pl.R.525e; tw=| l. du/o e)sti/n, a)xw/rista pefuko/ta two in
idea, though indistinguishable in fact, Arist. EN1102a30, cf. GC320b14, al.; lo/gw| qewrhta/
mentally conceived, opp. sensibly perceived, Placit.1.3.5, cf. Demetr.Lac.Herc.1055.20; tou\s l. qewrhtou\s xro/nous Epicur.Ep.1p.19U.; dia\ lo/gou q. x. ib.p.10 U.; lo/gw| katalhpto/s Phld.Po.5.20, etc.; o( l. ou(/tw ai(re/ei
analogy proves, Hdt.2.33; o( l. or l. ai(re/ei
reasoning convinces, Id.3.45,6.124, cf. Pl.Cri.48c (but, our
argument shows, Lg.663d): also c. acc. pers., xra=tai o(/ ti min l. ai(re/ei as the
whim took him, Hdt.1.132; h)\n mh\ h(me/as l. ai(rh=| unless we
see fit, Id.4.127, cf. Pl.R.607b; later o( ai(rw=n l. ordaining
reason, Zeno Stoic.1.50, M.Ant.2.5, cf. 4.24, Arr.Epict. 2.2.20, etc.: coupled or contrasted with other functions, kaq' u(/pnon e)peidh\ lo/gou kai\ fronh/sews ou) metei=xe since
reason and understanding are in abeyance, Pl.Ti.71d; meta\ lo/gou te kai\ e)pisth/mhs, opp. ai)ti/a au)toma/th, of Nature's processes of production, Id.Sph.265c; to\ me\n dh\ noh/sei meta\ lo/gou perilhpto/n embraced by thought with
reflection, opp. met' ai)sqh/sews a)lo/gou, Id.Ti.28a; to\ me\n a)ei\ met' a)lhqou=s l., opp. to\ de\ a)/logon, ib.51e, cf. 70d, al.; l. e)/xwn e(po/menon tw=| noei=n Id.Phlb. 62a; e)pisth/mh e)nou=sa kai\ o)rqo\s l. scientific knowledge and right
process of thought, Id.Phd.73a; pa=s l. kai\ pa=sa e)pisth/mh tw=n kaqo/lou Arist.Metaph.1059b26; to\ lo/gon e)/xon Id.EN1102b15, 1138b9, al.: in sg. and pl., contrasted by Pl. and Arist. as
theory, abstract reasoning with outward experience, sts. with depreciatory emphasis on the former, ei)s tou\s l. katafugo/nta Pl.Phd.99e; to\n e)n lo/gois skopou/menon ta\ o)/nta, opp. to\n e)n e)/rgois (realities), ib.100a; th=| ai)sqh/sei ma=llon tw=n l. pisteute/on Arist.GA760b31; gnwrimw/tera kata\ to\n l., opp. kata\ th\n ai)/sqhsin, Id.Ph.189a4; e)k tw=n l. dh=lon, opp. e)k th=s e)pagwgh=s, Id.Mete.378b20; h( tw=n l. pi/stis, opp. e)k tw=n e)/rgwn fanero/n, Id.Pol.1326a29; h( pi/stis ou) mo/non e)pi\ th=s ai)sqh/sews a)lla\ kai\ e)pi\ tou= l. Id.Ph.262a19; marturei= ta\ gigno/mena toi=s l. Id.Pol.1334a6; o( me\n l. tou= kaqo/lou, h( de\ ai)/sqhsis tou= kata\ me/ros
explanation, opp. perception, Id.Ph.189a7; e)/sontai toi=s l. ai( pra/ceis a)ko/louqoi
theory, opp. practice, Epicur.Sent.25; in Logic, of
discursive reasoning, opp. intuition, Arist.EN1142a26, 1143b1;
reasoning in general, ib.1149a26; pa=s l. kai\ pa=sa a)po/deicis all
reasoning and demonstration, Id.Metaph.1063b10; l. kai\ fro/nhsin Phld.Mus.p.105 K.; o( l. h)\ logismo/s ibid.; to\ i)dei=n ou)ke/ti l., a)lla\ mei=zon lo/gou kai\ pro\ lo/gou, of mystical vision, opp.
reasoning, Plot.6.9.10.—Phrases, kata\ l. to\n ei)ko/ta by probable
reasoning, Pl.Ti.30b; ou)/koun to/n g' ei)ko/ta l. a)\n e)/xoi Id.Lg.647d; para\ lo/gon, opp. kata\ l., Arist.Rh.Al.1429a29, cf. EN 1167b19; cf. para/logos (but para\ l.
unexpectedly, E.Ba.940).
reason as a faculty, o( l. a)nqrw/pous kuberna=| [Epich.] 256; [qumoeide\s] tou= l. kath/koon Pl.Ti.70a; [qumo\s] u(po\ tou= l. a)naklhqei/s Id.R.440d; su/mmaxon tw=| l. to\n qumo/n ib. b; peiqarxei= tw=| l. to\ tou= e)gkratou=s Arist. EN 1102b26; a)/llo ti para\ to\n l. pefuko/s, o(\ ma/xetai tw=| l. ib.17; e)nanti/wsis lo/gou pro\s e)piqumi/as Plot.4.7.13(8); ou) qumo/s, ou)k e)piqumi/a, ou)de\ l. ou)de/ tis no/hsis Id.6.9.11: freq. in Stoic. Philos. of human Reason, opp. fantasi/a, Zeno Stoic.1.39; opp. fu/sis, Stoic.2.206; ou) sofi/a ou)de\ l. e)sti\n e)n [toi=s zw/|ois] ibid.; toi=s a)lo/gois zw/|ois w(s l. e)/xwn l. mh\ e)/xousi xrw= M.Ant.6.23; o( l. koino\n pro\s tou\s qeou/s Arr.Epict. 1.3.3; oi(=on [ei)kw\n] l. o( e)n profora=| lo/gou tou= e)n yuxh=|, ou(/tw kai\ au)th\ l. nou= Plot.5.1.3; to\ to\n l. sxei=n th\n oi)kei/an a)reth/n (sc. eu)daimoni/an) Procl.in Ti.3.334 D.; also of the
reason which pervades the universe, qei=os l. [Epich.] 257; to\n qei=on l. kaq' *(hra/kleiton di' a)napnoh=s spa/santes noeroi\ gino/meqa S.E.M.7.129 (cf. infr. x).
creative reason, a)du/naton h)=n lo/gon mh\ ou)k e)pi\ pa/nta e)lqei=n Plot.3.2.14; a)rxh\ ou)=n l. kai\ pa/nta l. kai\ ta\ gino/mena kat' au)to/n Id.3.2.15; oi( l. pa/ntes yuxai/ Id.3.2.18.
continuous statement, narrative (whether fact or fiction),
oration, etc. (cf. le/gw (B) 11.2),
fable, Hdt.1.141; *ai)sw/pou lo/goi Pl.Phd.60d, cf. Arist.Rh.1393b8; o( tou= kuno\s l. X.Mem. 2.7.13.
legend, i(ro\s l. Hdt.2.62, cf. 47, Pi.P.3.80 (pl.); sunqe/ntes l. E.Ba.297; l. qei=os Pl.Phd.85d; i(eroi\ l., of Orphic
rhapsodies, Suid. S.V. *)orfeu/s.
tale, story, a)/llon e)/peimi l. Xenoph. 7.1, cf. Th.1.97, etc.; sunqe/tous l. A.Pr.686; spoudh\n lo/gou urgent
tidings, E.Ba.663; a)/llos l. 'another
story', Pl.Ap.34e; o(mologou/menos o( l. e)sti/n the
story is consistent, Isoc.3.27: pl.,
histories, e)n toi=si *)assuri/oisi l. Hdt.1.184, cf. 106, 2.99; so in sg.,
a historical work, Id.2.123, 6.19,7.152: also in sg., one
section of such a work (like later bi/blos), Id.2.38,6.39, cf. VI.3d; so in pl., e)n toi=si *libukoi=si l. Id.2.161, cf. 1.75,5.22,7.93,213; e)n tw=| prw/tw| tw=n l. Id.5.36; o( prw=tos l., of St. Luke's gospel, Act.Ap.1.1: in Pl., opp. mu=qos, as
history to legend, Ti.26e; poiei=n mu/qous a)ll' ou) lo/gous Phd.61b, cf. Grg.523a (but mu=qon le/gein, opp. lo/gw| (
argument) diecelqei=n Prt. 320c, cf. 324d); peri\ lo/gwn kai\ mu/qwn Arist.Pol.1336a30; o( l . . . mu=qo/s e)sti Ael.NA4.34.
speech, delivered in court, assembly, etc., xrh/somai th=| tou= l. ta/cei tau/th| Aeschin.3.57, cf. Arist.Rh.1358a38; dikanikoi\ l. Id.EN1181a4; tri/a ge/nh tw=n l. tw=n r(htorikw=n, sumbouleutiko/n, dikaniko/n, e)pideiktiko/n Id.Rh.1358b7; tw=| gra/yanti to\n l. Thphr. Char.17.8, cf. logogra/fos 11; e)pita/fios l. funeral
oration, Pl.Mx.236b; esp. of the
body of a speech, opp. e)pi/logos, Arist.Rh.1420b3; opp. prooi/mion, ib.1415a12;
body of a law, opp. proem, Pl.Lg.723b;
spoken, opp. written
word, to\n tou= ei)do/tos l. zw=nta kai\ e)/myuxon ou(= o( gegramme/nos ei)/dwlo/n ti Id.Phdr.276a; o( e)k tou= bibli/ou r(hqei\s [l.]
speech read from a roll, ib.243c; published
speech, D.C.40.54; rarely of the
speeches in Tragedy (r(h/seis), Arist.Po.1450b6,9.
verbal expression or
utterance (cf. le/gw (B) 111), rarely a single
word, v. infr. b, never in Gramm. signf. of vocable (e)/pos, le/cis, o)/noma, r(h=ma), usu. of a
phrase, cf. IX. 3 (the only sense found in Ep.). pl., without Art.,
talk, to\n e)/terpe lo/gois Il.15.393; ai(mu/lioi l. Od.1.56, h.Merc. 317, Hes.Th.890, Op.78,789, Thgn.704, A.R.3.1141; yeudei=s *l., personified, Hes.Th.229; a)frodi/sioi l. Semon.7.91; a)ganoi=si l. Pi.P. 4.101; o)/yon de\ l. fqoneroi=sin
tales, Id.N.8.21; smikroi\ l. brief
words, S.Aj.1268 (s.v.l.), El.415; do/khsis a)gnw\s lo/gwn bred of
talk, Id.OT 681 (lyr.): also in sg., le/g' ei)/ soi tw=| l. tis h(donh/ speak if thou delightest in
talking, Id.El.891. sg.,
expression, phrase, pri\n ei)pei=n e)sqlo\n h)\ kako\n l. Id.Ant.1245, cf. E.Hipp.514; muri/as w(s ei)pei=n lo/gw| Hdt.2.37; makro\s l.
rigmarole, Simon.189, Arist.Metaph.1091a8; l. h)re/ma lexqei\s die/qhke to\ po/rrw a whispered
message, Plot.4.9.3; e(ni\ lo/gw| to sum up, in brief
phrase, Pl.Phdr.241e, Phd.65d;
concisely, Arist. EN1103b21 (but also, = a(plw=s, peri\ pa/ntwn e(ni\ l. Id.GC325a1): pl., l. qelkth/rioi magic
words, E.Hipp.478; rarely of single words, l. eu)su/nqetos oi(=on to\ "xronotribei=n" Arist.Rh.1406a36; ou)k a)pekri/qh au)th=| l. answered her not a
word, Ev.Matt.15.23. coupled or contrasted with words expressed or understood signifying act, fact, truth, etc., mostly in a depreciatory sense, l. e)/rgou skih/ Democr. 145; w(/sper mikro\n pai=da lo/gois m' a)pata=|s Thgn.254; lo/gw|, opp. e)/rgw|, Democr.82, etc.; nhpi/oisi ou) l. a)lla\ cumforh\ dida/skalos Id.76; e)/rgw| kou) lo/gw| tekmai/romai A.Pr.338, cf. S.El.59, OC782; lo/gw| me\n le/gousi . . e)/rgw| de\ ou)k a)podeiknu=si Hdt.4.8; ou) lo/gwn, fasi/n, h( a)gorh\ dei=tai, xalkw=n de/ Herod.7.49; ou)/te l. ou)/te e)/rgw| Lys.9.14; lo/gois, opp. yh/fw|, Aeschin.2.33; opp. no/w|, Hdt.2.100; ou) lo/gw| maqw/n E.Heracl.5; e)k lo/gwn, kou/fou pra/gmatos Pl.Lg.935a; lo/goisi ei)s to\ piqano\n peripepemme/na ib.886e, cf. Luc.Anach.19; i(/na mh\ l. oi)/hsqe ei)=nai, a)ll' ei)dh=te th\n a)lh/qeian Lycurg.23, cf. D.30.34; opp. pra=gma, Arist.Top.146a4; opp. bi/a, Id.EN1179b29, cf. 1180a5; opp. o)/nta, Pl.Phd.100a; opp. gnw=sis, 2 Ep.Cor.11.6; lo/gw| in
pretence, Hdt.1.205, Pl.R.361b,376d, Ti.27a, al.; lo/gou e(/neka merely as a matter of
words, a)/llws e(/neka l. e)le/geto Id.Cri.46d; lo/gou xa/rin, opp. w(s a)lhqw=s, Arist.Pol.1280b8; but also,
let us say, for instance, Id.EN1144a33, Plb.10.46.4, Phld. Sign.29, M.Ant.4.32; lo/gou e(/neka
let us suppose, Pl.Tht.191c; e(/ws lo/gou, me/xri l., = Lat.
verbo tenus, Plb.10.24.7, Epict.Ench.16: sts. without depreciatory force, the antithesis or parallelism being verbal (cf. 'word and deed'), lo/gw| te kai\ sqe/nei S.OC68; e)/n te e)/rgw| kai\ l. Pl.R.382e, cf. D.S.13.101, Ev.Luc.24.19, Act.Ap.7.22, Paus.2.16.2; o(/sa me\n lo/gw| ei)=pon, opp. ta\ e)/rga tw=n praxqe/ntwn, Th. 1.22.
common talk, report, tradition, w(s l. e)n qnhtoi=sin e)/hn Batr. 8; l. e)k pate/rwn Alc.71; ou)k e)/st' e)/tumos l. ou(=tos Stesich.32; dico\s le/getai l. Hdt.3.32; l. u(p' *ai)gupti/wn lego/menos Id.2.47; ne/on [l.]
tidings, S.Ant.1289 (lyr.); ta\ me\n au)toi\ w(rw=men, ta\ de\ lo/goisi e)punqano/meqa by
hearsay, Hdt.2.148: also in pl., e)n gra/mmasin lo/goi kei/menoi
traditions, Pl.Lg.886b.
rumour, e)pi\ panti\ l. e)ptoh=sqai Heraclit. 87; au)da/eis l. voice of
rumour, B.14.44; peri\ qew=n dih=lqen o( l. o(/ti . . Th.6.46; l. parei=xen w(s . . Plb.3.89.3; e)ch=lqen o( l. ou(=tos ei=s tinas
o(/ti . . Ev.Jo.21.23, cf. Act.Ap.11.22;
fiction, Ev.Matt.28.15.
mention, notice, description, ou)k u(/ei lo/gou a)/cion ou)de/n worth
mentioning, Hdt.4.28, cf. Plb.1.24.8, etc.; e)/rga lo/gou me/zw beyond
expression, Hdt.2.35; krei=sson lo/gou to\ ei)=dos th=s no/sou beyond
description, Th. 2.50; mei/zw e)/rga h)\ w(s tw=| l. tis a)\n ei)/poi D.6.11. the
talk one occasions,
repute, mostly in good sense,
good report, praise, honour (cf. supr. 1.4), polla\ fe/rein ei)/wqe l. . . ptai/smata Thgn.1221; l. e)slo\n a)kou=sai Pi.I.5(4).13; ple/ona . . l. *)odusse/os h)\ pa/qan Id.N.7.21; i(/na l. se e)/xh| pro\s a)nqrw/pwn a)gaqo/s Hdt.7.5, cf. 9.78; *troi/an . . h(=s a(pantaxou= l. whose
fame, story fills the world, E.IT517; ou)k a)\n h)=n l. se/qen Id.Med.541: less freq. in bad sense,
evil report, l. kako/qrous, kako/s, S. Aj.138 (anap.), E.Heracl.165: pl., lo/gous yiqu/rous pla/sswn
slanders, S.Aj.148 (anap.). l. e)sti/, e)/xei, kate/xei, the
story goes, c. acc. et inf., e)/st tis l. ta\n *)areta\n nai/ein Simon.58.1, cf. S.El.417; l. me\n e)/st' a)rxai=os w(s . . Id.Tr.1; l. alone, E.Heracl.35; w(s l. A.Supp.230, Pl. Phlb.65c, etc.; l. e)sti/ Hdt.7.129,9.26, al.; l. ai)e\n e)/xei S.OC1573 (lyr.); o(/son o( l. kate/xei
tradition prevails, Th.1.10: also with a personal subject in the reverse construction. *kleisqe/nhs l. e)/xei th\n *puqi/hn a)napei=sai has the
credit of . . , Hdt.5.66, cf. Pl.Epin.987b, 988b; l. e)/xonta sofi/as Ep.Col.2.23, v.supr.1.4.
discussion, debate, deliberation, pollo\s h)=n e)n toi=si l. Hdt.8.59; sunele/xqhsan oi( *mh=doi e)s tw)uto\ kai\ e)di/dosan sfi/si lo/gon, le/gontes peri\ tw=n kathko/ntwn Id.1.97; oi( *pelasgoi\ e(wutoi=si lo/gous e)di/dosan Id.6.138; pole/mw| ma=llon h)\ lo/gois ta\ e)gklh/mata dialu/esqai Th.1.140; oi( peri\ th=s ei)rh/nhs l. Aeschin.2.74; toi=s e)/cwqen l. peplh/rwke to\n l. [Plato] has filled his dialogue with extraneous
discussions, Arist.Pol.1264b39; to\ mh=kos tw=n l. D.Chr.7.131; metabai/nwn o( l. ei)s tau)to\n a)fi=ktai our
debate, Arist.EN1097a24; o( parw\n l. ib.1104a11; qew=n w(=n nu=n o( l. e)sti/
discussion, Pl.Ap.26b, cf. Tht. 184a, M.Ant.8.32; tw=| l. dielqei=n, dii+e/nai, Pl.Prt.329c, Grg.506a, etc.; to\n l. diecelqei=n conduct the
debate, Id.Lg.893a; cunelqei=n e)s lo/gon
confer, Ar.Eq.1300: freq. in pl., e)s lo/gous sunelqo/ntes
parley, Hdt. 1.82; e)s l. e)lqei=n tini have
speech with, ib.86; e)s l. a)pike/sqai tini/ Id.2.32; dia\ lo/gwn i)e/nai E.Tr.916; e)mauth=| dia\ l. a)fiko/mhn Id.Med.872; e)s l. a)/gein tina/ X.HG4.1.2; koinwnei=n lo/gwn kai\ dianoi/as Arist.EN 1170b12.
right of discussion or
speech, h)\ 'pi\ tw=| plh/qei l.; S.OC 66; l. ai)th/sasqai ask
leave to speak, Th.3.53; l. dido/nai X.HG5.2.20; ou) proute/qh sfi/sin l. kata\ to\n no/mon ib.1.7.5; lo/gou tuxei=n D.18.13, cf. Arist.EN1095b21, Plb.18.52.1; oi( lo/gou tou\s dou/lous a)posterou=ntes Arist.Pol.1260b5; dou=los pe/fukas, ou) me/testi/ soi lo/gou Trag.Adesp.304; dido/ntas l. kai\ dexome/nous e)n tw=| me/rei Luc.Pisc.8: hence,
time allowed for a speech, e)n tw=| e)mw=| l. And.1.26,al.; e)n tw=| e(autou= l. Pl.Ap.34a; ou)k e)la/ttw l. a)nh/lwke D.18.9.
dialogue, as a form of philosophical
debate, i(/na mh\ maxw/meqa e)n toi=s l. e)gw/ te kai\ su/ Pl. Cra.430d; pro\s a)llh/lous tou\s l. poiei=sqai Id.Prt.348a: hence,
dialogue as a form of literature, oi( *swkratikoi\ l. Arist.Po.1447b11, Rh. 1417a20; cf. dia/logos.
section, division of a dialogue or treatise (cf. v. 3), o( prw=tos l. Pl.Prm.127d; o( pro/sqen, o( parelqw\n l., Id.Phlb.18e, 19b; e)n toi=s prw/tois l. Arist.PA682a3; e)n toi=s peri\ kinh/sews l. in the
discussion of motion (i. e. Ph.bk.8), Id.GC318a4; e)n tw=| peri\ e)pai/nou l. Phld.Rh.1.219;
branch, department, division of a system of philosophy, th\n fro/nhsin e)k triw=n sunesthke/nai l., tw=n fusikw=n kai\ tw=n h)qikw=n kai\ tw=n logikw=n Chrysipp.Stoic.2.258. in pl.,
literature, letters, Pl.Ax.365b, Epin.975d, D.H.Comp.1,21 (but, also in pl.,
treatises, Plu.2.16c); oi( e)pi\ lo/gois eu)dokimw/tatoi Hdn.6.1.4; *lo/goi, personified, AP9.171 (Pall.).
a particular utterance, saying:
divine utterance, oracle, Pi.P.4.59; l. mantikoi/ Pl. Phdr.275b; ou) ga\r e)mo\n e)rw= to\n l. Pl.Ap.20e; o( l. tou= qeou= Apoc.1.2,9.
proverb, maxim, saying, Pi.N.9.6, A.Th.218; w(=d' e)/xei l. ib.225; to/nd' e)kai/nisen l. w(s . . Critias 21, cf. Pl.R.330a, Ev.Jo.4.37; o( palaio\s l. Pl.Phdr.240c, cf. Smp.195b, Grg.499c, Lg.757a, 1 Ep.Ti.1.15, Plu.2.1082e, Luc.Alex.9, etc.; to\ tou= lo/gou dh\ tou=to Herod.2.45, cf. D.Chr.66.24, Luc.JTr.3, Alciphr.3.56, etc.: pl., Arist.EN1147a21.
assertion, opp. oath, S.OC651; yilw=| l. bare
word, opp. marturi/a, D.27.54.
express resolution, koinw=| l. by common
consent, Hdt.1.141,al.; e)pi\ l. toiw=|de, e)p' w(=| te . . on the following
terms, Id.7.158, cf. 9.26; e)nde/casqai to\n l. Id.1.60, cf. 9.5; l. e)/xontes pleone/kthn a greedy
proposal, Id.7.158: freq. in pl.,
terms, conditions, Id.9.33, etc.
word of command, behest, A.Pr.17,40 (both pl.), Pers.363; a)nqrw/pous piqanwte/rous poiei=n lo/gw| X.Oec.13.9; e)ce/bale ta\ pneu/mata lo/gw| Ev.Matt.8.16; oi( de/ka l. the ten Commandments, LXX Ex.34.28, Ph.1.496.
thing spoken of, subject-matter (cf. 111.1 b and 2), l. tou=ton e)a/somen Thgn.1055; propepusme/nos pa/nta l. the whole
matter, Hdt.1.21, cf. 111; to\n e)o/nta l. the truth of the
matter, ib.95,116; metasxei=n tou= l. to be in the
secret, ib.127; mhdeni\ a)/llw| to\n l. tou=ton ei^ph|s Id.8.65; ti/s h)=n l.; S.OT684 ( = pra=gma, 699); peri/ tinos l. dielego/meqa
subject, question, Pl.Prt.314c; [to\ prooi/mion] dei=gma tou= l.
case, Arist.Rh.1415a12, cf. 111.1b; te/los de\ panto\s tou= l. yhfi/zontai the end of the
matter was that . . , Aeschin.3.124; ou)k e)/stece to\n l. Plb.8.12.5; ou)k e)/sti soi meri\s ou)de\ klh=ros e)n tw=| l. tou/tw| Act.Ap.8.21; i(kano\s au)tw=| o( l. Pl.Grg.512c; ou)x u(polei/pei [*gorgi/an] o( l.
matter for talk, Arist.Rh.1418a35; mhde/na l. u(polipei=n Isoc.4.146; pro\s lo/gon to the
point, apposite, ou)de\n pro\s l. Pl.Phlb.42e, cf. Prt.344a; e)a\n pro\s l. ti h)=| Id.Phlb.33c; also pro\s lo/gou Id.Grg.459c (s. v.l.).
plot of a narrative or dramatic poem, = mu=qos, Arist.Po.1455b17, al. in Art,
subject of a painting, zwgrafi/as lo/goi Philostr.VA 6.10; l. th=s grafh=s Id.Im.1.25.
thing talked of, event, meta\ tou\s l. tou/tous LXX 1 Ma.7.33, cf. Act.Ap.15.6.
expression, utterance, speech regarded formally, to\ a)po\ [yuxh=s] r(eu=ma dia\ tou= sto/matos i)o\n meta\ fqo/ggou l., opp. dia/noia, Pl.Sph.263e;
intelligent utterance, opp. fwnh/, Arist.Pol.1253a14; l. e)sti\ fwnh\ shmantikh\ kata\ sunqh/khn Id.Int.16b26, cf. Diog.Bab.Stoic.3.213; o(/qen (from the heart) o( l. a)nape/mpetai Stoic.2.228, cf. 244; Protagoras was nicknamed lo/gos, Hsch. ap. Sch.Pl.R.600c, Suid.; lo/gou peiqoi= Democr.181: in pl.,
eloquence, Isoc.3.3,9.11; th\n e)n lo/gois eu)ruqmi/an Epicur.Sent.Pal.5p.69 v. d. M.; l. a)kribh/s precise
language, Ar.Nu.130 (pl.), cf. Arist.Rh. 1418b1; tou= mh\ a)|dome/nou l. Pl.R.398d; h(dusme/nos l., of rhythmical
language set to music, Arist.Po.1449b25; e)n panti\ l. in all
manner of utterance, 1 Ep.Cor.1.5; e)n lo/gois in
orations, Arist.Po.1459a13; l. geloi=oi, a)sxh/mones, ludicrous, improper
speech, Id.SE182b15, Pol. 1336b14. of various modes of expression, esp. artistic and literary, e)/n te w)|dai=s kai\ mu/qois kai\ lo/gois Pl.Lg.664a; e)n lo/gw| kai\ e)n w)|dai=s X.Cyr.1.4.25, cf. Pl.Lg.835b;
prose, opp. poi/hsis, Id.R.390a; opp. yilometri/a, Arist.Po.1448a11; opp. e)/mmetra, ib.1450b15 (pl.); tw=| l. tou=to tw=n me/trwn (sc. to\ i)ambei=on） o(moio/taton ei)=nai Id.Rh.1404a31; in full, yiloi\ l.
prose, ib.b33 (but yiloi\ l., =
arguments without diagrams, Pl.Tht.165a); l. pezoi/, opp. poihtikh/, D.H.Comp.6; opp. poih/mata, ib.15; koina\ kai\ poihma/twn kai\ lo/gwn Phld.Po.5.7; pezo\s l. ib.27, al. of the constituents of lyric or dramatic poetry,
words, to\ me/los e)k triw=n . . lo/gou te kai\ a(rmoni/as kai\ r(uqmou= Pl.R.398d; opp. pra=cis, Arist.Po.1454a18; dramatic
dialogue, opp. ta\ tou= xorou=, ib.1449a17. Gramm.,
phrase, complex term, opp. o)/noma, Id.SE 165a13; l. o)nomatw/dhs noun-
phrase, Id.APo.93b30, cf. Rh.1407b27;
expression, D.H.Th.2, Demetr.Eloc.92.
sentence, complete statement, "a)/nqrwpos manqa/nei" lo/gon ei)=nai/ fh|s . . e)la/xisto/n te kai\ prw=ton Pl.Sph.262c; l. au)totelh/s A.D.Synt.3.6, D.T.634.1; r(hqh=nai lo/gw| to be expressed in a
sentence, Pl.Tht.202b; l. e)/xein to be capable of being so expressed, ib.201e, cf. Arist.Rh.1404b26.
language, ta\ tou= l. me/rh parts of
speech, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.31, S.E.M.9.350, etc.; ta\ mo/ria tou= l. D.H.Comp.6; me/ros l. D.T.633.26, A.D.Pron.4.6, al. (but e(\n me/ros <tou= cod.> lo/gou one
word, Id.Synt.340.10, cf. 334.22); peri\ tw=n stoixei/wn tou= l., title of work by Chrysippus. the Word or Wisdom of God, personified as his agent in creation and world-government, o( pantodu/namo/s sou l. LXX Wi.18.15; o( e)k noo\s fwteino\s l. ui(o\s qeou= Corp.Herm.1.6, cf. Plu.2.376c; l. qeou= di' ou(= kateskeua/sqh [o( ko/smos] Ph.1.162; th=s tou= qeou= sofi/as: h( de/ e)stin o( qeou= l. ib.56; l. qei=os . . ei)kw\n qeou= ib.561, cf. 501; to\n tome/a tw=n sumpa/ntwn [qeou=] l. ib.492; to\n a)/ggelon o(/s e)sti l. ib.122: in NT identified with the person of Christ, e)n a)rxh=| h)=n o( l. Ev.Jo.1.1, cf. 14, 1 Ep.Jo.2.7, Apoc.19.13; o( l. th=s zwh=s 1 Ep.Jo.1.1.

logo-sullekta/dhs [a^], ou, o(,
phrase-collector, plagiarist, Eust. 1309.2.
logo/-tropos, o(, a shortd. form of syllogism, Crinis Stoic.3.269.
logou/rion: u(/elos (Lacon.), Hsch. (post lo/gios); cf. logkou/rion.

logofi/lhs [i^], ou, o(,
fond of words, Ph.1.58:—also logo/-fi^los, on,
fond of argument, opp. filo/logos, Zeno Stoic.1.67.

logo/w,
introduce lo/gos
into, to\n ko/smon Procl.in Ti.2.244 D., cf.
in R.2.350 K., al.:—Pass., Plot.3.8.2, 6.8.17; lelo/gwtai, tou=to de/ e)sti memo/rfwtai Id.3.2.16. Math.,
rationalize, Iamb.in Nic.p.91 P., al. (Pass.).
logu/drion, to/, = logi/dion, Zos.Alch.p.190 B., Olymp.Alch.p.79 B., Lyd.Mag.3.73, Tz.H.12.247.
logx-a/zw, gloss on dora/zw, Hsch.

logx-ai=os, a, on, (lo/gxh A)
of or
with a spear, Suid.
logx-a/rion, to/, Dim. of lo/gxh (A), Posidon.2 J., Luc.Hist.Conscr.25; as an ornament, POsl.46.12 (iii A. D.).

logx-eu/w,
pierce with a spear, AP9.300 (in tit.).

lo/gx-h (A), h(,
spear-head, Hdt.7.69; l. doro/s S. Tr.856, E.Tr.1318 (both lyr.): also in pl. of a single spear,
the point with its barbs, to\ custo\n th=|si lo/gxh|si e)o\n o(moi/ws xru/seon the shaft alike with
the spear-head, Hdt.1.52, etc.; lo/gxai d' e)kauli/zonto kai\ custh\ ka/mac Ar.Fr.404, cf. X.Cyn.10.3 (where the shaft is r(a/bdos）; oi( knw/dontes th=s lo/gxhs the barbs
of the spear-head, ib.16.
lance-shaped birth-mark, Trag.Adesp.84.
lance, spear, javelin, Batr.129; xalke/as lo/gxas a)kma=| Pi.N.10.60, cf. S.Tr.512 (lyr.), etc.: metaph., o)mma/twn a)/po lo/gxas i(/hsin Id.Fr.157; lo/gxas e)sqi/wn, prov. of a bragging coward, a 'fire-eater', Timocl.12.5.
troop of spearmen, cu\n e(pta\ lo/gxais S.OC1312, cf. Ant.119 (lyr.); muri/an a)/gwn lo/gxhn E.Ph.442; lo/gxhs a)riqmw=| plei/onos kratou/menai Id.Fr. 286.12; xwrei=te, lo/gxh Id.Cret.45.

lo/gx-h (B), h(, Ion. for la/xos,
lot (cf. le/logxa), Ion Hist.15, SIG1013.12 (Chios, iv B. C.), Hsch.; also lo/gxai: a)polau/seis, Id.

logx-h/rhs, es,
armed with a spear, l. a)spistai/
with spear and shield, E.IA1067 (lyr.).
logx-hfo/ros, on, = logxofo/ros, Sch.rec.A.Pers.147.
logx-i/dion, to/, Dim. of lo/gxh (A), Hsch. s.v. zifu/nia.

lo/gx-i^mos, on,
of a spear, klo/noi l. the clash
of spears, A.Ag.404 (lyr.).
logx-i/s, i/dos, h(, = lo/gxh (A), Lycophronid.2.

logx-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
spearman, Hdn.Epim.78. logxi=tis, idos, h(, plant
with spear-shaped seeds, Serapias Lingua, Dsc.3.144, Gal.12.63.
Holly-fern, Aspidium lonchitis, Dsc.3.145, Gal. l.c. shrub yielding to\ *)indiko\n lu/kion, Dsc.1.100.

logxo-dre/pa^non, to/,
spear with sickle-shaped head, partisan, Suid. s.v. *gorgo/nes, Sch.Lyc.836.

logxo-eidh/s, e/s,
like a spear, lanceolate, Dsc.4.144.

logxo/-omai, Pass., (lo/gxh A)
to be furnished with a point or
head, lelogxwme/non do/ru Arist.EN1111a13; a)ko/ntion -wme/non sidh/rw| Str.3.5.1;
to be ornamented with lo/gxai, stolh\ xrusw=| lelogxwme/nh Lyd.Mag.2.4.

logxo-poii/+a, h(,
manufactory of spears, An.Ox.4.255 (prob. cj. for loxipoii/+an or logopoii/+an).

logxo-poio/s, o(,
spear-maker, E.Ba.1208.

logxo-fo/ros, on,
spear-bearing, Id.Hec.1089: as Subst.
l., o(,
spearman, pikeman, Ar.Pax1294, X.Cyr.2.1.5, Plb.3.84.14, POxy.1241 ii 16 (ii A. D.); xili/arxoi l. Sammelb.6154.6 (i B. C.), Bull.Soc.Alex.7.64.

logxwto/s, h/, o/n,
furnished with a point, lance-headed, be/los E.Ba. 761; e)/gxea B.Fr.3.8, cf. AP6.172;
lanceolate, Paul.Aeg.6.88.
composed of, or
ornamented with, spear-heads, o(/rmos IG11(2).161 B 23, al.; fia/lh ib.l.75 (Delos, iii B. C.); logxwtoi\ xitw=nes Lyd.Mag. 1.17, cf. 2.4. logxwto/n, to/, = xalkanqe/s, interpol. in Dsc.5.98, cf. Plin.HN34.124.

logw/dhs, es, = logoeidh/s 1, me/los Aristox.Harm.p.18 M.
verbal, of an argument, Thphr.Metaph.16.

lo/e, loe/ssas, loessa/menos, loe/ssomai, v. lou/w. loetro/n, loetroxo/os, v. loutr-. loe/w, v. lou/w. loia/des: ai( ko/raitw=n o)fqalmw=n, Theognost.Can.22; cf. loga/s (B). loi/ac: o( chro\s xo/rtos, Hsch.

loib-ai=os, a, on,
of or
belonging to a loibh/, Megaclid. ap. Ath.12.512f.
loib-a/omai, = spe/ndw, Hsch.
loib-a/sion, to/, = sq., Epich. 79 (pl.), cf. Ath.11.486a.

loib-ei=on, to/,
cup for pouring libations, Plu. Aem.33, Marc.2.

loib-h/, h(, (lei/bw)
pouring. only in religious sense,
drink-offering, loibh=| te kni/sh| te with
drink-offering and burnt-offering, Il.9.500, cf. 4.49, 24.70; soi\ d' au)= l. fe/ron says Odysseus to the Cyclops, Od.9.349: later, like spondai/, xoai/ (which are more freq.), in pl., Pi.N.11.6, S.El.52; loibai\ *dio/s, offered to him, A.Fr.55. -- Rare in Prose, l. oi)/nou Pl.Lg.906d, referring to Il.9.500. of
water generally, l. *stugo/s A.R.2.291.
loib-i/s, i/dos, h(, = loibei=on, Antim. ap.Ath.11.486a, IG22.1541.12 (Eleusis, iv B.C.).
loig-h/eis, essa, en, = sq., Nic.Al.207:—also loig-h/s, e/s, ib.256, Th. 921.

loi/g-ios, on, (loigo/s)
pestilent, deadly, l. e)/rga Il.1.518, 573; oi)/w loi/gi' e)/sesqai I think there shall be
sorrow, 21.533, 23.310; l. ph=ma A.R.1.469: neut. pl. loi/gia, of poisons, Androm. ap. Gal.14.37.
loig-i/stria: o)loqreu/tria, Hsch.

loigolamph/s, e/s,
balefully gleaming, cj. for logo- in Doroth. ap. Cat.Cod.Astr.1.173.7.

loigo/s (A), o(,
ruin, havoc, of death by plague, h(mi=n a)po\ l. a)mu=nai Il. 1.67; by war, 5.603, etc.; of
destruction of ships, new=n a)po\ l. a)mu/nwn 16.80; l. *)enuali/ou Pi.N.9.37; boa=| loigo\n *)erinu/s (Schütz loigo\s *)erinu/n) A.Ch.402 (lyr.); a)ndrokmh\s l. Id.Supp.679 (lyr.).—Poet. (not in Od.); mock-heroic in Cratin.171. (Cf. Lith.
pa-liegti 'become feeble, sickly'.)
loigo/s (B), o/n, = loi/gios, Nic.Th.6,733; l. *)/arhs AP7.368 (Eryc.).
loigwnti/an: fratri/an, Hsch.

loidor-e/w, fut. -h/sw D.40.48: aor. e)loido/rhsa E.Med.873, etc.: pf. leloido/rhka Pl.Phdr.241e:—Med. and Pass. (v. infr.), fut. -h/somai Ar.Eq.1400, etc.: aor. e)loidorhsa/mhn Is.6.59; Att. more freq. e)loisorh/qhn D.9.54,54.5 (v. infr.): (loi/doros):—
abuse, revile, tina Hdt.3.145; qeou/s Pi.O.9.37, cf. Ar.Nu.1140, X. An.3.4.49, BGU 1007.6 (iii B. C.), etc.: abs., E. l. c., etc.; sts. simply,
rebuke, X. Cyr. 1.4.9; oi)=non ei)s e)pi/noian l. Ar.Eq.90, cf. Plu.2.175b (Pass.): with neut. Adj., e)mauto\n po/ll' e)loido/rhsa E.Hel.1171; ou)de\n ou)de/na l. Pl. Tht.174c; l. e)/nia Arist.EN1128a31: with a predicate added, [th\n *tu/xhn] l. tuflh/n
reproach fortune as blind, Plu.2.98a:—Med.,
rail at one another, Antipho 2.1.4, Ar.Ra.857, D.54.18:—Pass., loidorou=ntas h)\ loidoroume/nous
reviling or
reviled, Isoc.2.47, cf. Phld.Lib.p.29 O.; leloidorhme/nos u(po\ . .
rebuked . . , X.HG5.4.29; ou)k e)n di/kh loidorhqei/s Pl.Phdr.275e, cf. Grg.457d. Med. with aor. Pass. in act. sense, c. dat. pers.,
rail at, tini Ar.Eq.1400, Pl.456, Ec.248, Pl.R. 395d, etc.; also l. e)pi/ tini X.Ages.7.3; tinos Ach.Tat.1.6; ei)/s tina Luc.Anach.22; pro/s tina LXX Ex.17.2: c. acc. cogn., pa/nta ta\ ai)sxra\ loidore/ontai, o(/ti . . they
use all kind of foul
reproaches, saying that . . , Hdt.4.184; loidori/an h(\n e)loidorh/qh *krati/nw| peri\ tou/twn D.21.132. —Act. never has dat. exc. in later Gr., LXX Ex.17.2, 2 Ma.12.14, Epict.Ench.34, Ant.Lib.22.5; in And.1.67 (h)nantiw/qhn kai\ a)ntei=pon —kai\ e)loido/rhsa—e)kei/nw| w(=n h)=n a)/cios) the dat. (if correct) depends on the other verbs; as does the acc. in ou(\s u(/brizes kai\ e)loidorou= Hyp. Dem.Fr.(a).—Only the Act. is found in Trag.

loido/r-hma, atos, to/,
railing, abuse, Arist.EN1128a30; to\n ptwxo\n l. poiei=sqai Plu.2.607a.
loidor-hma/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Ar.Fr.90.
loido/r-hsis, ews, h(, = loidori/a, Pl.Lg.967c (pl.): personified as place-name, LXX Ex. 17.7.
loidor-hsmo/s, o(, = loidori/a, Ar.Ra.758.

loidor-hte/on,
one must rail at, tini Max.Tyr.3.3.

loidor-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
abusive, Arist.EE1221b14, Phld.Ir.p.72 W., Iamb.VP30.171, Sch.Heph.p.300 C.

loidor-i/a, h(,
railing, abuse, reproach, Antipho 2.1.4, Ar.Fr.346, Th.2.84, Pl. Euthd.288b, Phld.Lib.p.29 O., etc.; ei)s ge/lwta kai\ l. e)mbalo/ntes D.10.75: pl., Lys.21.8, Pl.Tht.174c.
loidor-isth/s, ou=, o(, = sq., Hsch. s.v. ko/beiros.

loi/dor-os, on,
railing, abusive, e)/ris E.Cyc.534; pompei=ai Men.Per.Fr.4; r(h/mata IG14.1857; fwnai/ Phld.Ir.p.74 W. Adv. -rws Str.14.2.28. as Subst. l., o(,
railer, 1 Ep.Cor.5.11, Plu.2.177d: to\ l., = loidori/a, Arist. Phgn.808b37, Plu.2.810d; loi/dora AP5.175 (Mel.).
loi/qon: limo/s, Hsch. loi=kor: ke/gxros, Id.

loim-eu/omai, (loimo/s)
to be pestilent, LXX Pr.19.19.

loi/m-h, h(, = loimo/s,
pestilence, Hsch. (In Hp.Praec.13 loimi/hs is f.l. for loi/mhs or lu/mhs.）

loim-iko/s, h/, o/n,
pestilential, Hp.Ep.1, Plb.1.19.1, Ph.2.102, Longin.44.9, etc.; l.peri/stasis, dia/qesis, SIG731.7 (Tomi, i B. C.), IG12(1).1032.7 (Carpathus); l. dih/ghsis
about pestilence, Gal.17(2).168. Adv. -kw=s S.E.M.9.79.
destructive, l. toceu/mata Lyc. 1205.
loi/m-ios, on, = foreg., epith. of Apollo at Lindos, Macr.Sat.1.17.15.

loimopoio/s, o/n,
causing a pestilence, Vett.Val.6.29.

loimo/s, o(,
plague, once in Hom. (Il.1.61), cf. Hes.Op.243, Hdt. 7.171; loimou= skhpto/s A.Pers.715 (troch.); of the plague at Athens, Th.2.47,54, Pl.Smp.201d: pl., ib.188b, al.; coupled with limo/s, Hes. and Hdt.ll.cc., Th.2.54, Orac. ap. Aeschin.3.135. of persons,
plague, pest, D.25.80. as Adj.,
pestilent, LXX 1 Ki.1.16; a)nh\r l. kai\ ponhro/s ib.30.22, cf. Act.Ap.24.5; l. oi)=nos Sm.Pr.20.1.

loimo/ths, htos, h(,
pestilent condition, LXX Es.8.13 (16.7).

loimofo/ros, on,
bringing plague, pestilential, Gloss.

loim-w/dhs, es,
pestilential, l. no/sos
plague, Hp.Acut.5, Th.1.23, Ph.1.408, al.; e)/tos l. Arist.Pr.862a5.

loim-w/ssw, Att. loi/m-ttw, fut. -cw,
to have the plague, Gal.10.362, Luc.Hist.Conscr.15, Scyth.2, Max.Tyr.41.4, Sch.Ar.Pl.627; also e)n loimw/ttonti xwri/w| a
plague-spot, Procl.in Alc.p.256 C.
loip-a^da/rion, to/, Dim. of loipa/s, Suid.

loip-a^da/rios, o(,
one who is in arrear with taxes, POxy.136.33 (vi A. D.).
loip-a/dios [a^], a, on, prob. = loipo/s, Sch.D.T.p.542 H.

loip-a/zw,
leave, Gloss.:—Pass.,
to be left over, remain, POxy.1194.3 (iii A. D.), Sch.Ar.Pl.227, etc.;
to be in need, Anon.in EN448.23 (v.l. leip-).

loip-a/s, a/dos, h(,
remainder, PTeb.112.50 (ii B. C., lop- Pap.), PAmh.2.152.3 (v/vi A. D.), etc.

loip-asmo/s, o(,
want, cj. for e)leipasmo/s in Ps.-Luc.Philopatr. 20.
loi/p-hma, atos, to/, = loipa/s, PTeb.281.24 (ii B. C.).

loipogra^f-e/w,
allow to remain in arrear, carry over a debt, PPetr.3p.154 (iii B. C.), PTeb.112.34, al. (ii B. C.), CIG2335.23 (Delos, i B. C.), BGU362 iii 21, al. (iii A. D.), Nech. ap. Vett.Val.279.12.
loipogra^f-h/, h(, = sq., Stud.Pal.20.85 (iv A. D.).

loipogra^f-i/a, h(,
outstanding debt, arrears, BGU567.2, al., Petersen-Luschan
Reisen in Lykien p.54 No.96, Gloss.
carrying over of debt or arrears, PStrassb.77.5 (iii A. D.).

loipo/s, h/, o/n, (lei/pw)
remaining over, not in Hom., freq.from Pi. and Hdt. downwards; l. bi/otos Pi.O.1.97; l.eu)xai/ ib.4.15; l.ge/nos ib.2.15; also loipoi/
descendants, Id.I.4(3).39: in Prose the Art. is commonly added, and o( l. either agrees with the Noun or takes a dependent genitive, ai( l. tw=n new=n Th.7.72; th\n loiph\n (sc. o(do\n） poreuso/meqa X.An.3.4.46; to\ l. th=s h(me/ras ib.16, etc. loipo/n [e)sti] c. inf.,
it remains to show, etc., a)podeiknu/nai, diele/sqai, etc., Id.Smp.4.1, Pl.R.466d, etc.: also c. Art., to\ l. h)/dh h(mi=n e)sti ske/yasqai, po/teron
what remains for us is to . . , ib.444e; dianomh\ toi/nun to\ l. soi ib.535a: without inf., o(\ de\ l.
quod superest, A.Ag.1571 (lyr.); o(/ ti l. po/nwn Id.Pr.684; to\ eu)prepei/as pe/ri . . loipo/n Pl.Phdr.274b. freq. of Time, o( l. xro/nos
the future, Pi.N.7.67; pro\s to\n loipo\n tou= xro/nou D.15.16; to\n l. xro/non
for the future, S.Ph.84; tou= l. xro/nou Id.El.817; ei)s to\n l. xro/non Pl.Ep.358b; e)k tou= l. xro/nou D.59.46: so without Subst. in neut., to\ l.
henceforward, hereafter, Pi.P.5.118, A.Eu.1031, S.OT795, etc.; to\ l. ei)s a(/panta . . xro/non A.Eu.763; ta\ l. Id.Th.66, S.El.1226, Th.8.21; e)s to\ l. A.Pers.526, Eu.708, cf. Inscr.Prien.64 (ii B. C.); also tou= l. Hdt.1.189, Ar.Pax1084; e)k tou= l. X. HG3.4.9; e)k tw=n l. Pl.Lg.709e, Ep.316d; kaqeu/dete to\ l. sleep
now . . , Ev.Matt.26.45, Ev.Marc.14.41; e(spe/ra de\ h)=n l. kai\ . . it was
now evening, Jul.Or.1.24c. to\ l. and ta\ l.
the rest, A.Pr.476, 697, 699. etc.; kai\ ta\ l., = '
etc.', Aristeas 190, Plu.2.1084c, etc.; also loipo/n without the Art., as Adv.,
for the rest, further, and so freq., = h)/dh,
already, l. dh/ Pl.Prt.321c; ai)sxro\n dh\ to\ l. gi/gnetai Id.Grg. 458d. loipo/n, Adv.
then, well then, Plb.1.15.11, al., Dsc.2.83, Arr.Epict.1.24.1; ou)demi/a l. a)mfisbh/thsi/s e)stin BGU969.19 (ii A. D.).
finally, l., a)delfoi/, xai/rete 2 Ep.Cor.13.11.

loisq-h/i+os, on,
of or
for the last, loisqh/i+on e)/kfer' a)/eqlon the prize
for the last in the race, Il.23.785: pl., loisqh/i+) e)/qhke
last prize, ib. 751.
loi/sq-hma, atos, to/, = te/los, pe/ras, Hsch.

loi/sq-ios, a, on S.Ant. 895, etc.; also os, on A.Ch.500:—= sq., Pi.P.4.266, A.Ag.120 (lyr.), S.Ant.1220, etc.; ta\ l. tou= bi/ou Id.OC583: neut. loi/sqion as Adv.,
last. Id.Aj.468, Ant.1304; l. a)/llwn A.R.2.559; to\ l. E.HF23; ta\ l. Theoc.5.13.

loi=sq-os (A), on,
left behind, last, Il.23.536, Lyc.163, Euph.51.13, etc.; o( qa/natos loi=sqos i)atro\s kakw=n S.Fr.698: Sup. -o/tatos
last of all, Hes.Th.921; -ota/tas xa/ritas
the last honours (to the dead), IG14.1721.

loi=sqos (B), o(,
beam, loi=sqoi e(\c w(/ste moxloi=s xrh=sqai IG22.1673.17 (iv B. C.);
boom, gaff, or
spar, E.Hel.1597.
loi/sqwnas: tou\s a)kratei=s peri\ ta\ a)frodi/sia, Hsch.: cf. loisqw/nh: h( qrasei=a, Suid. loiteu/ein: qa/ptein, and loi/th: ta/fos, Hsch.
lo/kalos, o(, an unknown bird, Arist.HA509a21.
lo/kkh (cf. Hdn.Gr.1.314), h(, archaic word in AP11.20 (Antip. Thess.); acc. to Hsch., = xlamu/s (lo/kmh cod.); cf. le/kkh.
loko/s: lokro/s, falakro/s, Hsch.

*lokr-isti/, Adv.
in Locrian manner: h( *l. a(rmoni/a Ath.14.625e.

*lokr-oi/, oi(,
the Locrians, of whom there were three tribes,
the Opuntian, opposite Euboea, Il.2.527, Th.1.108, Str.9.3.1,9.3.17;
the Epicnemidian, on Mt. Cnemis on the Maliac Gulf, Id.ll.cc.; and
the Ozolian, on the Corinthian Gulf, Th.1.5, 103, etc.:
the Epizephyrian or Zephyrian were a colony of the last on Mt. Zephyrium in lower Italy, Pi.O.10(11).13, Th.4.24 sq.,7.1, etc.: prov. *lokrw=n su/nqhma, of deceit, Eust.275.43, Hsch., Suid.:—Adj. *lokro/s, a/, o/n, Locrian, Lyc. 1429:—also *lokriko/s, h/, o/n, Poll.4.65, etc.:—fem. *lokri/s, i/dos, Pi. P.2.19; h( *l. (sc. gh=) Ar.Av.152, etc.
lolla, h(, a plant, PLond.1.122.12 (iv A. D.).
lollw/, h(, child's word for anything 'divinely nice', Hermipp.89.

lo/mbai: ai( th=| *)arte/midi qusiw=n a)/rxousai, a)po\ th=s kata\ th\n paidia\n skeuh=s. oi( ga\r fa/lhtes ou(/tw kalou=ntai, Hsch. lombou/s: tou\s a)peskolumme/nous, Id. lombro/s, o/n, in Comp. lombro/teron, name of an in decent dance, Poll.4.105. lo/ndis: bwmolo/xos, ei)/rwn, Hsch.

lo/c-euma, atos, to/,
obliquity, in pl., Man.1.307, 4.479.

loc-eu/w,
= loco/w, to\n o)fqalmo/n Lib.Descr.30.18; leloceume/na
obscure or
symbolical language, Syn.Alch.p.63 B.

*loc-i/as, ou, Ion. *loc-i/hs, ew, o(, epith. of Apollo, B.12.148, Hdt.1.91, A.Eu.19,al., S.OT410, Ar.Eq.1047, Pl.8, etc.; expld. because the Sun traverses the ecliptic (cf. II), Cleanth.Stoic.1.123; or from Apollo's 'crooked', i.e. ambiguous, oracles (cf. loco/s 3), Corn.ND 32, etc. (loco/s)
the zodiac or
ecliptic, from its
obliquity to the equator, Anon.Intr.Arat.p.96 M.

*loc-iko/s, h/, o/n,
oblique, l. ku/klos
the ecliptic, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.194 (Rhetorius).
loco-ba/moisi (leg. -ba/mosi, from -ba/mwn）: plagi/ws peripatou=sin, Hsch.
loco-ba/ths [a^], ou, o(, = foreg., Batr.295.

loco-blepte/w,
look askance at, Thom.Mag.p.93 R.

loco-eidh/s, e/s,
oblique, of the lower ribs, Ruf.Oss.25.

loco-ke/leuqos, on,
oblique, dro/mos Nonn.D.5.233.

loco-ki/nhtos [i_], on,
moving athwart, l. ku/klos
the ecliptic, Sch. Hes.Op.381 (p.208 G.)

loco-peripa/thtos [a^], on,
walking sideways, gloss on Batr.295.

loco-pore/w,
go slantwise or
sideways, Placit.2.23.6.

loco/-poros, on,
moving aslant, of the Moon, Hymn.Is.30.

loc-o/s, h/, o/n,
slanting, crosswise, Hp.Off.11; loch/ (sc. grammh/), h(, a
cross-line, E.Fr.382.9; loca\ bai/nein, of a crab, Babr.109.1; l. o)/fis Call.Epigr.26; o( l. ku/klos
the ecliptic, Arist.Metaph.1071a16, Cleanth.Stoic.1.112, Arat.527, Gem.5.51, Cleom.1.4, Ptol.Alm.1.8 (without ku/klos Plot.5.8.7); of the milky way, Gem.5.68; tw=n a)ste/rwn l. gi/netai fora/ Arist.Mete.342a27; l. dro/mos Diog.Oen.8; l. porei/as sxh=ma Plu.Phoc.2; l. fa/lagc, a phalanx of which one wing is in advance of the other, Ascl.Tact.10.1, Onos.21.8, Ael.Tact.30.3; l. zw/|dia, i.e. locw=s a)nate/llonta, Heph.Astr.3.1; oi( l. mu/es the
oblique abdominal muscles, Gal.2.518, al.; l. th=| qe/sei pro/s ti
at an acute angle to it, Thphr.Sens.73, cf. Arist.Mu.393b15. Adv. -cw=s, ta\ loca\ [e)pidei=n] Hp.l.c. of suspicious looks, loco\n o)/mmasin ble/pein tina/ look
askance at one, Anacr.75.1; loco\n o)fqalmoi=s o(ra=n Sol.34; o)/mmasi loca\ ble/poisa Theoc.20.13; locw=| o)/mmati i)dei=n A.R.4.475; ou)/pw *zeu\s au)xe/na loco\n e)/xei Zeus has not yet turned his neck
aside, i.e. withdrawn his favour, Tyrt.11.2; but au)xe/na loco\n e)/xei, of a slave, as type of dishonesty, Thgn.536: hence metaph.,
mistrustful, suspicious, in Adv. Comp. -o/teron, e)/xein pro/s tina Plb.4.86.8. of language,
indirect, ambiguous, esp. of oracles, Lyc.14, 1467, Luc. Alex.10; loca\ a)pokri/nasqai Id.
D Deor.16.1; e)n toi=s xrhsmoi=s l., of Apollo, Id.JTr.28. (Cf. le/xrios.)

loc-o/ths, htos, h(,
obliquity, Str.2.1.37, Placit.5.9.2, Gem.2.24.
ambiguity, of oracles, Plu.2.409c.

locotro/xis, idos, h(,
oblique-running, of Lycophron's Cassandra, AP9.191; cf. loco/s 3.

loc-o/fqalmos, on,
oblique-eyed, Procl.Par.Ptol.204.

locoxrh/smwn, on, gen. onos,
uttering ambiguous oracles, Sch.Lyc. 1466.

loc-o/w,
make slanting, cast sideways, ta\s loga/das Sophr.49:— Pass.,
to be or become so, Hp.Mul.1.33, Eudox. ap. Arist.Metaph.1073b20, 29, Str.6.2.1.

lo/c-wsis, ews, h(,
obliquity, kata\ lo/cwsin ou)ranou= Epicur.Ep.2p.40U.; of the ecliptic, Ocell.2.23, Str.6.2.1, Ptol.Tetr. 98, Placit.2.12.2.
ambiguity, Tz.ad Hes.Op.412.
lopa^d-a/gxhs, ou, o(, = sq., Eub.139.

lopa^d-arpa^gi/dhs, ou, o(,
dishsnatcher, Epigr. ap. Hegesand.1.

lopa^d-eu/w,
dress as a dish, Philum. ap. Orib.45.29.25, AB105 (Pass.).

lopa^/d-ion, to/, Dim. of lopa/s 2, Ar.Pl. 812, Eub.9,38, Alex.186.7, PCair.Zen.82 (iii B.C.), etc.
oyster, Gp.20.18.
lopa^d-i/skos, o(, = foreg. I, Sch.Ar.V.962.

lopa^do-tema^xo-sela^xo-ga^leo-kra_nio-leiya^no-dri_m-u^potrim-ma^to -silfi^o-ka_ra^bo-meli^to-ka^ta^kexu^meno-kixl-epi^kossu^fo-fatto-perister-a^lektru^on-opto-kefallio-kigklo-peleio-la^gw|o -si^raio-ba^fh-tra^ga^no-pteru/gwn, Com. word in Ar.Ec.1169 (as emended by Meineke), name of a dish compounded of all kinds of dainties, fish, flesh, fowl, and sauces.

lopa^do-fu_shth/s, ou=, o(,
dish-piper, nickname of Dorion, a glut-tonous flute-player, Mnesim.10:—perh. with a play on lwto/s.

lopa/s, a/dos, h(,
flat dish or
plate, in which food was served, Ar.Eq. 1034, V.511, Men.Sam.150, Dsc.2.142, etc.
dish in sense of food-preparation, Gal.6.653, al.
frying-pan, Eub.109, Arched. 2.4; distd. from th/ganon by Eub.l.c., Pl.Com.173.12. in Com. also, = soro/s (h(), Theopomp.Com.92.
a disease of the olive, Thphr.HP4.14.3;
rotting at the root, of fig-trees, ib.5.
shell-fish, Luc.Asin.47; o)/strea kai\ lopa/das Gal.4.670; v.l. for lepa/s, Thphr.HP4.6.7.

lop-hto/s, o(,
the time of bark peeling off, Id.HP5.1.1.
lop-i/dion, to/, Dim. of lopi/s III, lopi/dia pantodapa\ a)p' a)ndria/ntwn BCH29.542 (Delos).

lop-i/zw,
peel off the bark (with v.l. lepi/zw, which Phot. condemns), in Pass., Thphr.HP3.13.1,4; cf. lopi/cai: lampru=nai h)\ lepidw=sai, Hsch.:—the word occurs in broken context, POxy.218
Fr.(b)3.

lo/p-imos, on,
easily stripped, of nuts which have a skin and not a shell, Nic.Fr.76, Sor. ap. Gal.12.420, cf. Gal.6.621, Hsch.

lop-i/s, i/dos, h(, = lepi/s 2, Ar.V.790, Nic. Al.467, Th.154. l. sidhra= iron
pin to keep a ba/lanos in place, Aen.Tact.20.3.
fragment of a)kro/basis, BCH29.541 (Delos). = lopa/s 1.1a, Schwyzer89.20 (Argos, iii B.C.).
lo/p-isma, atos, to/, = sq., Eust.1863.51, Phot.

lop-o/s or lo/pos, o(, (le/pw)
peel, kromu/oio l. Od.19.233. of a hide, l. de/rmatos
the outer part of a split piece of leather, opp. au)to\ to\ de/rma, Hp.Art.33, cf. 38.
peeling of the skin after illness, Id.Epid.2.1.7.
lord-ai/nw, = lordo/w, Hp.Art.46.

lord-o/s, h/, o/n,
bent backward, so as to be convex in front, opp. kufo/s, Id.Fract.16, Art.48, Arist.IA707b 18.

lord-o/w, as neut.,
bend oneself supinely, so as to throw the head back, Hp.Art.46, Mnesim.4.55 (anap.):—Pass., Hp.Art.48, Procop. Arc.9: sens. obsc., Ar.Ec.10, Fr.140.

lo/rd-wma, atos, to/,
a bending supinely, Hp.Mochl.38 (pl.), Art.48.

lo/rd-wn, wnos, o(,
the demon of impure lo/rdwsis (cf. lordo/w sub fin.), cf. *ku/bdasos (from ku/bda), Pl. Com.174.17.

lo/rd-wsis, ews, h(,
a curvature of the spine
which is convex in front, Hp.Art.48, Gal.18(1).493, Sch.Theoc.5.43.
lord-wto/s, = lordo/s, dub. cj. in Erot. s.v. lordo/taton.

loudotro/fos,
lanista, Gloss.

loue/w, impf. e)lou/eon, v. lou/w. lou=ka,
gruel made of wheat-meal (Cauconian), Hsch.

lou/kountlos, o(, a kind of
cake, Chrysipp.Tyan. ap. Ath.14.647d. (Lat.
lucunculus.）
loula/kion, to/, a plant, Lyd.Mens.1.21.

lou=ma, atos, to/, (lou/w)
stream, Epigr.Gr.903.2 (Sardes). lou/mata: ta\ tw=n ptissome/nwn kriqw=n a)/xura (Cypr.), Hsch. (a)ou/mata cod.); cf. a)polou/w.
lou=mai, Att. for lou/omai.

loumena/rion, to/ (Lat.
luminarium), window, PGot.7 (iv A.D.).
louno/n: lampro/n, Hsch.
lou/phs, o(, = i)kti=nos, Hierocl.Facet.257, Hdn.Epim.46.

lou/ppis,
milvus, Gloss.

lou=sis, ews, h(,
washing, bathing, PFlor.384.23 (v A. D.),
Gloss.; cleaning, tw=n balanei/wn SIG901.17 (Delph., iv A. D.).
lou=son: ko/louron, kolobo/n, teqrausme/non, Hsch.; Cypr., acc. to Eust.1246.38.

lou=sson, to/,
pith of the fir-tree, Thphr.HP3.9.7.

lous-te/on,
one must take a bath, Archig. ap. Gal.13.168.

lou/s-ths, ou, o(,
one fond of bathing, of certain birds, opp. konistikoi/, Arist.HA 633a29; a)wri\ l. M.Ant.1.16.

loutari/zhma: o(/ tines, o)/lisqon, Hsch. loute/on,
one must wash, ta\ bre/fh Sor.1.78.

lou-th/r, h=ros, o(,
washing or
bathing-tub, Supp.Epigr.4.263.10 (pl., Stratonicea, i A.D.), CIG2820 A 10 (Aphrodisias), IGRom.4.454 (pl., Pergam., i A. D.), Callix. 2, Moschio ap.Ath.5.207f, LXX Ex.30.18, al.
lou-thri/dion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Hero Spir.1.37, BGU781 ii 12 (i A. D.), Dsc.1.43.

lou-th/rion, to/, Dor. lwth/rion Tab.Heracl.1.184, = louth/r, Antiph.208, IG22.1425.371 (iv B. C.), PLond.2.193.21 (ii A. D.); louth/ria me/gista A.Fr.366. a kind of
cup, Epig.6.
lou-thri/skos, o(, Dim. of louth/r, Gloss.

lou-tia/w, Desiderat. of lou/w,
wish to bathe, Luc.Lex.2.

lou-triko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for bathing, Hsch. s.v. custrolh/kuqon.

lou/-trion, to/,
water that has been used in washing, Ar.Eq. 1401, Fr.306, Luc.Lex.4. = louth/r, l. xalkou=n me/ga CPR p.125 (iii A. D.).

lou-tri/s, i/dos, h(,
woman employed to wash Athena's temple, Hsch., Phot. w)/|a l.
bathing drawers, Theopomp.Com.37.

loutroda/i+ktos [a^], on,
slain in the bath, A.Ch.1071 (anap.).

loutro/n, to/, in Hom. always loetro/n, but contr. form in h.Cer.50, Hes.Op.753; Dor. lwtro/n, Hsch.: (lou/w):—
bath, bathing-place, Hom., always in pl., qerma\ loetra/ hot
bath, Il.22.444, al.; later qerma\ loutra/ A.Ch.670, S.Tr.634 (lyr.), CratesCom.15, etc.; qerma\ *numfa=n loutra/ Pi.O.12.19; also called *(hra/kleia loutra/ Ar.Nu.1051; loetra\ *)wkeanoi=o Il.18.489, Od.5.275; si/toisi kai\ loutroi=si in matters of eating and
washing, Hdt.6.52; loutrw=| xrwme/nous Plu.2.1109b: sg. first in Hes. l.c.; trape/sqai pro\s to\ l. Pl.Phd.115a, cf. X.Oec.9.7: in pl.,
bathing-establishment, ta\ dhmo/sia l. POxy.1252 B22 (iii A. D.), etc.
water for bathing or
washing, u(da/twn e)negkei=n loutra/ S.OC1599; e)n loutroi=s while
bathing, X.Cyr.7.5.59; lou=sai/ tina loutro/n give one a
bath, wash one with water, S.Ant.1201, Ar.Lys. 469; loutro\n pare/xein ib.377; lou=sqai loutro/n
bathe, A.Fr.366 (note); loutro/n e)stin, ou) po/tos Alex.9; numfika\ loutra/
the conveying of water to the bride (cf. loutrofo/ros), Poll.3.43; in NT, of baptism, Ep.Eph. 5.26; l. paliggenesi/as Ep.Tit.3.5. in Poets, = spondai/,
libations to the dead, S.El.84,434, E.Ph.1667, cf. Hsch. s.v. xqo/nia l.

loutro/-omai,
bathe, qermoi=s *ai)deyou= IG12(9).1240.11 (Aedepsus).

loutro-poio/s, o(,
bath-attendant, title of play by Anaxilas.

loutro-fore/w,
carry water for bathing, Harp.

loutro-fo/ros, on,
bringing water: pai=s, parqe/nos l. at Athens the boy or girl who, as next of kin to the bridegroom,
fetched him water from the fountain Callirrhoe on his wedding day, Harp. s.v., Paus.2.10.4, Poll.3.43: hence l. xlidh/
marriageceremony, E.Ph.348 (lyr.). as Subst., loutrofo/ros, h(,
black urn placed on the tomb of an unmarried person, D.44.18,30, Poll.8.66; cf. li/bus.

loutro-xoe/w,
pour into the bath, u(/dwr AP9.627 (Marian.).

loutro-xo/os, on, in Hom. always loetr-, Dor. lwtr- Call.Lav.Pall.1,15:—
pouring water into the bath: Subst.,
the slave who did this, Od.20.297, X. Cyr.8.8.20; l. tri/pous a three-legged cauldron,
in which water was warmed for bathing, Il.18.346, Od.8.435.

loutrw/n, w=nos, o(,
bathing-room, bath-house, X. Ath.2.10, Lyc. 1103, PSI5.547.24 (iii B. C.), Ptol.Euerg.3 J. (pl.), Plu.2.734b, Procop. Aed.5.3; of a baptismal font, Id.Arc.17.

loutrwniko/s, h/, o/n,
of the public baths, Cod.Just.1.4.26 Intr.

lou/w, contr. from loe/w, from which come impf. lo/eon Od.4.252: aor. inf. loe/ssai 19.320; part. loe/ssas Il.23.282: fut. Med. loe/ssomai Od.6.221: 3sg. aor. loe/ssato ib.227; loessa/menos Il.10.577, Schwyzer 633 (Eresus, ii/i B. C.): also Ep. impf. e)lou/eon h.Cer.289.—Later forms, lou/ei Hdt.6.52; inf. lou/ein Hp.Morb.2.20, Pl.Phd.115a: fut. lou/sw Call.Del.95; Dor. lousw= Theoc.5.146: aor. e)/lousa Anacr.47, S.Ant.901, Ar.Lys.19 (Ep. lou=sa Il.16.679, etc.):—Med. lou/ontai Hdt.4.75; inf. lou/esqai Il.6.508, Hp.Epid.5.70; part. louo/menoi Hdt.3.23: fut. lou/somai Ar.Nu.837, Pl.Phd.116a: aor. e)lousa/mhn ibid.; Ep.
lou/santo Il.10.576; Dor. part. lwsa/menos Berl.Sitzb.1927.157 (Cyrene): —Pass., aor. e)lou/qhn Hp.Mul.1.11, later e)lou/sqhn Lyc.446: pf. le/loumai, 3sg. le/loutai Ar.Pax868; part. leloume/nos Il.5.6, later le/lousmai LXX Ca.5.12 (cod. Vat.).—Another old form of the pres. was lo/w, whence 3sg. lo/ei Scol.25, 2sg. Med.kata-lo/ei Ar.Nu.838 (prob.): 3sg. impf. lo/e Od.10.361, 3pl. lo/on h.Ap.120; 3sg. subj. Med. lo/htai IG12(5).569.5 (Ceos, iii B.C.); inf. lo/esqai Hes.Op.749:—to lo/w also belong the foll. contr. forms, 3sg. impf. a)p-e/lou Ar.V.118, e)lou=men Id.Pl.657; pres. Pass. lou=tai Semon.7.63, X.Cyr.1.3.11, A.Fr. 366 (note); lou=ntai, e)lou=to, Hdt.1.198, 3.125, e)lou/mhn Men.363; 3pl. e)lou=nto X.Cyr.4.5.4, etc. (Dor. lw=nto, lw/onto, Call.Lav.Pall.72, 73); inf. lou=sqai Od.6.216, Hdt.3.124, Ar.Nu.1044, Pl.Lg.942b; part. lou/menos Ar.Av.1623, Pl.658, X.Mem.3.13.3: the forms e)lou/omen, lou/omai, e)louo/mhn, etc., are rejected by Phryn.165, but are freq. found in codd., Lys.1.9, etc.: the imper. form lou= (glossed by lou=sai, Hsch.), if correct, is contr. for lo/e: (Cf. Lat.
l[acaron]vo [fr.
*lovo]): —
wash, prop.
wash the body (ni/zw being used of the hands and feet, plu/nw of clothes), to\n d' *(/hbh lou=sen Il.5.905; dmw|ai\ lou=san kai\ xri=san e)lai/w| Od.4.49, cf. 6.210; lou=s' e)n potamw=|
bathed me, i.e.
let me
bathe, 7.296; ti/s a)/n sfe lou/seien; A.Th.739 (lyr.); lou/santes to\n nekro/n Hdt.2.86, cf. E.Tr.1152, S.Ant.901; l. tina\ a)po\ tw=n plhgw=n Act.Ap. 16.33; also lo/) e)k tri/podos mega/loio
washed me [with water] from a great cauldron, Od.10.361; o)i+stou\s lou=sen foini/ssa| . . *)/arhs yaka/di Simon. 106: c. acc. cogn., loutro\n lou=sai/ tina, v. loutro/n 1.2. rarely of things, l. ta\ du/o me/rh tou= balanei/ou PFlor.384.30 (v A.D.). metaph.,
purify, tina\ e)k tw=n a(martiw=n v.l. in Apoc.1.5. Med. and Pass.,
bathe, lou=sqai potamoi=o r(oh=|si Od.6.216: also c. gen., leloume/nos *)wkeanoi=o (of a star just risen)
fresh from Ocean's
bath, Il.5.6; lou/esqai potamoi=o
bathe in the river, 6.508; so a)po\ [krh/nhs] louo/menoi Hdt.3.23: c. acc. cogn., to\ loutro\n h( *(re/a lou=tai Arr.Tact. 33.4: abs., lou/santo Od.4.48, cf. Hdt.5.20, etc.; leloume/nos
freshbathed, after bathing, Id.1.126, Ar.Lys.1064 (lyr.); e)n balanei/w| leloume/nos Pl.R.495e; lou/esqai e)n phlw=| Arist.HA595a31; ei)s loutrw=nas Ptol.Euerg.3 J. (dub.): metaph., to/ca . . ai(/mati lousa/mena Simon.143, cf. Call.Del.95; leloume/nos tw=| fo/nw| Luc.DMeretr.13.3. in strict pass. sense, lou=sqai u(po\ tou= *dio/s, i.e.
to be washed by the rain from heaven, Hdt.3.124, 125. in strict med. sense, c. acc., loe/ssasqai xro/a
wash one's body, Hes.Op.522, Th.5; lou/ontai (v.l. lou=ntai） u(/dati to\ sw=ma Hdt.4.75.
lo/fa: mi/sxos, to\ peri/ptisma, kai\ to\ th=s gh=s e)/parma, Hsch.
lofa/deia: . . au)xh/n, oi(=on kata\ tou= au)xe/nos, h)\ xwri/on o(\ kalou=si *li/bussa, Hsch.: gloss on kata\ lofa/deia which is v.l. for katalofa/deia (q.v.) in Od.10.169.

lofa^di/as and lofi/as, ou, o(,
first dorsal vertebra and skin over it, Poll.2.178.

lof-a/w,
have a crest (lo/fos), of larks, Babr.88.4.
suffer from having too much crest, Ar.Pax1211 (Com. word formed like bragxa/w, liqa/w, etc.); but lofa=|: lo/fou e)piqumei=, Hsch.

lo/f-h, h(, = lo/fos,
crest, D.S.17.90.

lof-hfo/ros, on,
crested, of a lark, Babr.88.8.

lof-i^a/, Ion. lof-i^h/, h(, (lo/fos)
mane or
bristly ridge on the back of animals,
mane of horses,
bristly back of boars and hyenas (cf. Arist.PA658a30, HA 498b30, 579b16), fri/cas eu)= lofih/n, of a wild boar, Od.19.446; o)rqa\s e)n lofih=| fri/ssei tri/xas a)mfi/ te deirh/n Hes.Sc.391; a)nti\ lo/fou h( lofih\ kate/xra
the mane served for a plume, Hdt.7.70, cf. 2.71.
backfin of dolphins and similar fishes, D.S.3.41, AP9.222 (Antiphil.), Philostr.Im.1.19. = lo/fos 11,
ridge, LXX Jo.15.2, al., AP9.249 (Maec.).

lof-i/as, ou, Ion. lof-i/hs, o(,
having a back-fin, fa/gros Numen. ap.Ath.7.322f. v. lofadi/as.
lof-i/dion [fi^], to/, Dim. of lo/fos 11, Ael.NA16.15.

lof-i/zw,
raise the lo/fos, Zonar.

lof-i^h/ths, ou, o(,
dweller on the hills, epith. of Pan, formed like polih/ths, AP6.79 (Agath.).

lo/f-ion, to/, Dim. of lo/fos 111.1,
small crest, Sch. Ar.Ach.1108: also, = ka/llaion, Sch.D.T.p.196H. = lofei=on, Hsch.
lo/f-ios: a)krw/mion, h)\ a)krw/nion, Id. (Cf. loforrw=ga.）
lof-i/s: perikefalai/as qh/kh, Id.
lofni/a, v. lofni/s. lofni/dia: lampa/dia, Hsch.

lofni/s, i/dos, h(,
torch made of vine bark, in pl., AP11.20 (Antip. Thess.), Lyc.48:—also lofni/a, Clitarch. Gloss. ap. Ath.15.701a, cf. Ath.15.699d.

lofo/-eis, essa, en,
crested, Tryph.68.
hilly, Nonn.D.2.37.

lofo/-omai, Pass.,
to be raised up, grow into a ridge or
hill, Eust. ad D.P.638 (of Mt. Taurus).

lofo-poio/s, o(,
crest-maker, Ar.Pax 545.

lofo-pwle/w,
sell crests, Id.Fr.812.
lofo-rrw=ga: to\n a)perrwgo/ta tou\s w)/mous, Hsch.

lo/fos, o(,
back of the neck; of a horse,
withers, Il.23.508; u(pozugi/wn Dsc.4.185; of a man,
nape of the neck, Il.10.573: metaph., u(po\ zugw=| lo/fon e)/xein have
the neck under the yoke, i.e. obey patiently, S. Ant.292; cf. eu)/lofos 11.
crest of a hill, ridge, Od.11.596, 16.471, Hdt.2.124; so always in Pi., as O.8.17, N.5.46, and in Th.4.124, Pl.Lg.682b.
crest of a helmet, kune/hn . . i(/ppourin, deino\n de\ lo/fos kaqu/perqen e)/neuen Il.16.138, cf. 6.469, 15.537; leu=koi i)/ppioi l. Alc.15.2; xru/seos l. Il.18.612, cf. 19.383; trei=s kataski/ous l. sei/ei A.Th.384, cf. Ar.Ach.575, 586; lo/fwn e)pe/neuon e)/qeirai Theoc.22.186; of Carian origin acc. to Hdt.1.171; l. te sei/wn *ka/rikon Alc.22; l. u(akinqobafh/s, on a Persian helmet, X.Cyr.6.4.2; l. tri/xinoi PSI5.533.7 (iii B.C.); Ar. jeers at the lo/foi of Lamachus, Ach.575, 586, 965 sq., 1074.—Rare in any of these senses in Att. Prose. after Hom.,
crest or
tuft on the head of birds, whether of feathers, as the lark's crest, Simon.68, cf. Arist.HA617b20; or of flesh, as the cock's
