damage statues, etc., IG3.1417: less freq. c. dat., Ar.Eq.1408, Pl.Cri.47e, D.H.13.4, Orac. ap. Jul.Ep.88: abs.,
act outrageously, Il.1.232, 2.242. Act. lwba/w only Ps.Phoc.38, and kat-elw/bhsan in Plb.15.33.9: but pf. is used as Pass., lelwbhme/nos
mutilated, Hdt.3.155, Pl.Grg.511a, R.611b, etc.; esp. of leprous persons, Man. ap. J.Ap.1.28: also aor. Pass., mega/las lw/bas lwbhqei/s Pl.Grg.473c: and Ion. pres. 3pl. lwbe/ontai in Hp.Art. l.c.(v.l.); cf. a)po-, e)k-lwba/omai.

lwb-ei/a, h(,
leprosy, Zonar.

lwb-eu/w,
mock, make a mock of, tina Od.23.15,26.

lw/b-h, h(,
outrage, dishonour, ai)=sxos lw/bh te 18.225; lw/bhn lwba=sqai (v. lwba/omai）; tei/sete l. ye shall pay for the
outrage, Il.11.142; a)po\ pa=san e)moi\ do/menai . . l. 9.387; but l. tei/sasqai exact retribution for
an outrage, i.e. avenge it, 19.208, Od.20.169, S.Aj.181 (lyr.); e)pi\ lw/ba| for
ruin or
destruction, Id.Ant.792 (lyr.), cf. E.Hec.647 (lyr.); w(s e)pi\ lw/ba| Id.HF882 (lyr.); l. kai\ diafqora/ Pl.Men.91c, etc.; esp.
mutilation, maiming, Hdt.3.154: pl., S.Aj.1392; lw/bas lwbhqei/s Pl.Grg.473c. of persons,
a disgrace, lw/bhn t' e)/menai kai\ u(po/yion Il.3.42, cf. E.El.165 (lyr.), Herod.7.95; poihtw=n lw=bai, of the Grammarians, AP11.322 (Antiphan.); ou) ga\r *)arka/dessi lw/ba no
insult to the Arcadians, Alc. 38.
a form of leprosy, Gal.14.757.

lwb-h/eis, essa, en,
outrageous, A.R.3.801, Tryph.261.
lwb-h/mwn, on, gen. onos, = foreg., in acc. sg., lwbh/mona kh=ra Nic.Al.536 (v.l. lwbh/tora).
lw/b-hsis, ews, h(, = lw/bh, Ptol.Tetr.151.
lwb-h/teira, fem. of sq., AP9.251 (Even.).

lwb-hth/r, h=ros, o( and h(,
foul slanderer, Il.2.275, 11.385: generally,
destroyer, of the Erinyes, S.Ant.1074; a)oida=n Tim.Pers.231.
worthless wretch, Il.24.239, A.R.3.372, Tryph.21.

lwb-hth/s, ou=, o(, = foreg., l. te/xnhs
one who disgraces his trade, Ar.Ra.93.

lwb-hto/s, h/, o/n,
despitefully treated, outraged, lwbhto
 e)/qhke ( = e)lwbh/sato) Il.24.531, cf. Hes.Sc.366; kei/nhs o(rw=n lwbhto
 ei)=dos S.Tr.1069; lwbhto
 au)to
 e)kbalei=n Id.Aj.1388; mo/xqw| lwba_to/s Id.Ph.1102 (lyr.). Act.,
insulting, abusive, ai)sxra\ kai\ l. e)/ph ib.607; lwbhto
 e)mpo/lhma
baneful, Id.Tr.538, cf. Tryph.21 (v.l.).
lwb-h/twr, oros, o(, = lwbhth/r, Opp.H.4.684, AP6.168 (Paul. Sil.), etc.: as fem., lwbh/tora kh=ra v.l. for lwbh/mona in Nic.Al.536.
lwb-o/s, h/, o/n, = lwbhto/s, coinage in EM570.37.

lwga/lioi: a)stra/galoi h)\ po/rnoi, Hsch.; cf. sq. and v. lwga/s. lwga/nion, to/,
dewlap of oxen, Ambraciote and Epirote word, Luc.Lex. 3, cf. Dionys. Utic. ap. Sch. l.c.—In Suid. loga/nion sine expl., in Hsch. lwga/lion. lwga/s: po/rnh, Id.; cf. lwga/lioi. lw/gasos: taurei/a ma/stic, Id. lwga/w, = le/gw, Theognost.Can.149; e)lw/gh: e)/legen, Hsch. (e)lwgh\: e)/legon cod.), Dor.contr.from e)lw/gae. lw/gh: kala/mh, kai\ sunagwgh\ si/tou, Id.

lw=dic, i_kos, h(,
blanket or
counterpane, Lat.
lodix, Peripl.M.Rubr. 24, BGU1564.8 (ii A.D.):—Dim. lwdi/kin prob. in ib.93.24 (ii/iii A.D.); lwdi/kion, Stud.Pal.20.67.26 (ii/iii A.D.), etc.; cf. lwti/kion.
lw/essan: th\n a(/macan, Hsch. (also lw/lessan). lwi+smo/n: xw=ma h)\ klwsme/non, Id. lwi/+teros, v. lwi/+wn. lwi+th/nh: sumferwte/ra, Id.

lwi/+wn, (lw=), o(, h(, lw/i+on, to/, gen. onos; Att. lw/|wn, lw=|on, A.Pers. 526; acc. sg. and neut. pl. lw/|w S.Ph.1079, Pl.Phlb.11b; acc. pl. lw/|ous S.Tr.736: also an
o-stem lw/i+os (Hdn.Gr.1.122, Thgn.800) from which come neut. pl. lw/i+a Thgn.853, Theoc.26.32, and lw=|a prob. in Thgn.96: gen. pl. tw=n lw/|wn IG12(9).1179.36 (Chalcis, ii A.D.):—
more desirable, more agreeable, better, Hom. only in neut., polu\ lw/i+o/n e)sti, to/de l. e)sti, Il.1.229, Od.2.169, al.; tw=| se xrh\ do/menai kai\ lw/i+on h)e/ per a)/lloi si/tou 17.417: as Adv., gnwso/meq' a)llh/lwn kai\ lw/i+on 23.109; metrei=sqai Hes.Op.350; but ou)k . . a)/llh th=sde lwi/+wn gunh/ Semon. 7.30: also Comp. lwi/+teros, a, on, also used by Hom. only in neut., lwi/+teron kai\ a)/meinon Od.1.376, 2.141: masc. in A.R.3.850, etc.: fem. in Call.Aet.4.1.7, AP5.111.6 (Phld.).—In Trag. lw/|wn was used generally as Comp. of a)gaqo/s, A.Pers.526, etc.; fro/nhsin labei=n lw/|w S. Ph.1079; lw=|on fronei= Id.OT1038; lw/|ous fre/nas a)mei/yasqai Id.Tr. 736; bi/ou lw/|onos kurh=sai Id.OT1513; ei)s to\ lw=|on so\n meqe/sthken ke/ar E.Med.911: sts. also in Prose, a)/meinon kai\ lw=|on Pl.Lg.828a; a)mei/nw kai\ lw/|w Id.Phlb.11b; l. kai\ a)/meinon X.An.6.2.15, SIG398.41 (Cos, iii B.C.), 1044.4 (Halic., iv/iii B.C.), cf. Berl.Sitzb.1927.165 (Cyrene), etc. Sup. lw=|stos, h, on, Thgn.255; lw=|ston de\ to\ zh=n a)/noson S.Fr.356; ta\ lw=|sta bouleu/wn A.Pr.206, etc.; paraine/sai ta\ l. ib. 310; ta\ l. le/gein Id.Ag.1053, cf. Cratin.4 D.; w)= lw=|ste *pw=le
my good friend, like w)= be/ltiste, Pl.Grg.467b, cf. X.Smp.4.1, etc.
lw/kion, to/, a piece of furniture, Stud.Pal.20.46.25 (ii/iii A.D.), 67.40 (ii/iii A.D.).
lw/lessan, v. lw/essan. lw=lon: brw=ma e)k giga/rtwn kai\ su/kwn geno/menon, paidi/ois pefwsme/non, Hsch. lwlw/: o(/tan su=ka meta\ giga/rtwn fwsqh=|, Id.

lw=ma, atos, to/,
hem, fringe, border, of a robe, LXXEx.28.29(33), al.:—Dim. lwma/tion, to/, AP11.210 (Lucill.).
lw=nti, v. lw=.

*lw=|os (cf. Hdn.Gr.1.112, Theognost.Can.57), o(, a Macedonian month, [Ep.Phil.] ap.D.18.157, Call.Epigr.46, PCair.Zen.88.12 (iii B.C.), Plu.Alex.3, J.AJ4.4.7, Gal.17(1).21, Supp.Epigr.2.480 (Scythia, iv A.D.), Jul.Mis.361d.
lwpeu/ei: yeu/detai, Hsch.

lw/p-h, h(, (le/pw)
covering, robe, mantle, di/ptuxon a)mf' w)/moisin e)/xous' eu)erge/a lw/phn Od.13.224, cf. Theoc.25.254, A.R.2.32:—also lw=pos, eos, to/, Alc.Supp.18.2 (dub.), Hippon.3, Anacr.80, Herod. 8.36, Theoc.14.66, Ps.-Luc.Philopatr.22.—Only poetic in class. writers, though prose writers have the derivs. lw/pion, lwpodu/ths.
lwp-i/a, h(, = de/rma, EM571.1 s.v. lw=pos.

lwp-i/zw,
uncover, strip, Hsch., Suid.: found only in compds. a)polwpi/zw, perilwpi/zw, etc.; S.Tr.925, e)k d' e)lw/pisen pleura/n, belongs to e)klwpi/zw.—Cf. lopi/zw.
lw/p-ion, Dim. of lw/ph, Arist.Metaph.1006b26, Top.103a10, IG42(1).122.127 (Epid.), AP6.245 (Diod.); e)s ta\ l.: h( tw=n i(mati/wn a)gora/ (Tarent.), Hsch.

lwp-isto/s, o/n,
with a patched cloak, Com. Adesp.78.

lwpo-du^si/a, h(, (lw=pos, du/w) prop.
slipping into another's
clothes: hence,
highway-robbery, J.BJ4.3.4 (pl.), Gloss.
lwpo-du^si/ou di/kh, prosecution for lwpodusi/a, Hermog.Id.2.6.

lwpo-du^te/w,
steal clothes, esp. from bathers or travellers, Pl.R.575b, X.Mem.1.2.62, Arist. Pol.1267a4; l. e)sqh=ta Luc.
Bis Acc.34; l. tina\ e)sqh=ta Philostr.VA 8.7. generally,
rob, plunder, Ar.Ec.565,Pl.165, Diph.32.14, LXX IEs.4.24: c. acc. pers., Ar.Ra.1075, D.9.22; of plagiarists, l. *(/omhron AP11.130 (Poll.).

lwpo-du/ths [u^], ou, o(,
clothes-stealer, esp. one who steals of bathers, or strips travellers, S.Epigr.4. generally,
thief, robber, footpad, IG12.44.5, Antipho 5.9, Cratin.206, Ar.Av.497, Ra.772, Lys.10.10, Phld.Rh.2.144 S., etc.; lwpodutw=n qa/naton ai(rei=sqai D.4.47; l. a)llotri/wn e)pe/wn
plagiarist, AP11.130 (Poll.), cf. Arr.Epict.2.19.28.
lw=pos, to/, = lw/ph (q. v.).

lwri/kion [i_k], to/, Dim. of Lat.
lorica, corslet, Sammelb.7249.18 (iii/iv A. D.). lwri/on,
gallica, Gloss.

lwroka/pistron [a^], to/,
halter, gloss on r(uth/r, Sch.rec.S.Aj.235.

lwro/n: pikro/n, Hsch. (Cf. Lat.
lorum 'sour wine'.)

lw=ros, o(, = Lat.
lorum, thong, Sch.Ar.Ach.724, Moer.p.195 P., Pall.
in Hp.Fract.12.278 C., Steph. in Hp.1.211 D. = xrush/latos e)pwmi/s, Lyd.Mag.2.2.
arch, oi( lw=roi kalou/menoi tou= new/ Procop.Aed.1.1.

lwro-tome/w,
cut into thongs, Sch.Ar.Eq.764 (Pass.).

lwro-to/mos, on,
cutting thongs, Hsch. s.v. skutoto/mos, Sch.Pl.Grg.517e, Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).216.
lwrumno/n: baqu/tata, katw/tata, Hsch. lw=|stos, v. lwi/+wn.
lwstu/s, u/os, h(, dub. sens. in *)arx. *)ef. 1923.39 (Oropus, iv B. C.).
lw=tac, a^kos, o(, = au)lhth/s, Zonar., Eust.344.37.

lwta/rion, to/,
flower of lotus, Steph.in Gal.1.335 D., Paul.Aeg.3.59, 7.12 (pl.).

lwte/w,
play the flute, Zonar.
bloom, pedi/a lwteu=nta Il.12.283 (v.l. for lwtou=nta); cf. lwto/eis. lwteu=si de/, pa/xnh, a)nqei= poiou=sin ai)sxro/thtes, Hsch.
lwth/rion, v. lout-.

lwti/zomai,
cull the best, A.Supp.963; *)/arhs ga\r ou)de\n tw=n kakw=n l.
S.Fr.724 (prob. cj.):—Act. in Hsch., lwti/zein: a)panqi/zesqai, a)pollu/ein.—Cf. a)polwti/zw.
lwti/kion, to/, = lwdi/kion, Dim. of lw=dic, Sammelb.7033.38 (v A.D.).
lw/t-i^non, to/, = lwto/s III, PBaden 15.18 (i B.C.), PFay.III.II, al. (i A.D.).

lw/t-i^nos, h, on, (lwto/s III. I)
lotus, cu/lon Thphr.HP4.2.9, 5.5.6; xo/rtos PSI4.432.3 (iii B.C.); karpo/s Dsc.2.76.
made of lotus-wood, u(poqumi/des Anacr.39; koleo/n, me/ga l. e)/rgon Theoc.24.45; l. au)loi/ (cf. lwto/s III. 1 a, b) Ath.4.182d: hence l. a)hdo/nes, of flutes, E.Fr.931.
covered with lotus, o)/xqoi *)axe/rontos Sapph. p.44 Lobel.
made of the flowers of Nymphaea Nelumbo (cf. lwto/s II), ste/fanos Ath.15.677d.
lw=tis, a(, dub. sens. (perh. = lou=sis), IG22.1126.26 (Amphict. Delph., iv B.C.); dat. lw/ti prob. in SIG243D25 (Delph., iv B.C.).

lw/tisma, atos, to/,
a flower: metaph., like a)/nqos and a)/wtos,
the fairest, choicest, best, gh=s *(ella/dos lwti/smata E.Hel.1593, cf. A.Fr.99.17a.

lwto-bosko/s, o/n,
lotus-eating, fu=lon Trag.Adesp.236.

lwto-eidh/s, e/s,
lotus-like (signf. III. I), Thphr.HP4.2.12.

lwto/-eis, essa, en,
overgrown with lotus, pedi/a lwtou=nta (v.l. -eu=nta)
lotus-plains, Il.12.283; or.
blooming (lwte/w 11).

lwto-mh/tra, h(,
fruit-pulp of lwto/s II, Plin. HN22.56, PMag.Par.1.754.

lwto/s, o( （lw=ta: a)/nqh, Hsch. is perh. for a)/wta), name applied to various plants and trees (Thphr.HP7.15.3, Plin.HN14.101, cf. Hsch.) providing fodder or fruit: fodder plants,
clover, trefoil, Trifolium fragiferum, Od.4.603, Thphr.HP7.8.3, 7.13.5, Dsc. 4.111.
fellbloom, Lotus corniculatus, Il.14.348, Plin.HN22.55. = th=lis,
fenugreek, Trigonella Foenum-graecum, Dsc.2.102; l. a)/grios
wild fenugreek, T. gladiata, Id.4.111, Gal.12.65.
melilot, T. graeca, Thphr.HP9.7.3.
Italian melilot, Melilotus messanensis, Dsc.4.110, Gal. l.c. = ku/tisos,
Medicago arborea, Ps.-Dsc.4.112.
Nile water-lily, Egyptian lotus, Nymphaea Lotus, Hdt.2.92, Thphr.HP4.8.9, PHib.1.152 (iii B.C.), Dsc.4.113, Plin.HN13.107; the blue species (
Nymphaea stellata), Thphr.HP 4.8.11; also,
Nymphaea Nelumbo, Ath.3.73a. of trees found in Libya,
nettle-tree, Celtis australis, Thphr.HP1.5.3, 4.3.1, Dsc. 1.117, etc.; used for making flutes, Thphr.HP4.3.4: hence in E. (lyr.) and later poets,
flute, l. . . *mousa=n qera/pwn El.716, cf. Pae.Delph.12, AP7.182 (pl., Mel.); *li/bus l. E.Tr.544, Hel.170, IA 1036, prob. in Limen.13.
pipe inserted in the na/bla, Sopat. 10.
tube or
stalk of vaginal speculum, Aët. 16.89, Paul.Aeg. 6.73. tree growing among the Lotophagi,
Zizyphus Lotus, lwtoi=o . . melihde/a karpo/n Od.9.94, cf. Hdt.2.96, 4.177, Thphr.HP4.3.1-4, Plb.12.2.2.

lwto-tro/fos, on, (lwto/s 1)
producing lotus, lei=mac E.Ph.1571 (anap.).

lwto-fa/goi [a^], oi(, （lwto/s III. 2)
Lotus-eaters, a mythical people on the coast of North Africa, Od.9.84, Hdt.4.177, cf. X.An.3.2.25, Scyl.22, Plb.1.39.2:—their country was perh. called *lwtofa^gi/a, h(, Thphr.HP4.3.2 (dub.l.): hence Adj. fem. *lwtofa^gi=tis *su/rtis Str. 17.3.17.

lwto-fo/ros, on,
lotus-bearing, leimw/n Pherecr.109.
lwtro/n, lwtroxo/os, Dor. for loutr-. lwfa/calos: e)mphdh/sas, Hsch. lw=far: lw/fhma, Id.

lwf-a/w,
rest, give over, o(/de me\n ta/xa lwfh/sei Il.21.292; ei) lwfh/sw trei=s w(/ras dub. in Phld.Herc.1251.18. c. gen. (cf. katalwfa/w),
take rest or
abate from, recover from, xo/lou, po/qou, A.Pr. 378, 654; po/nou S.Aj.61; th=s o)du/nhs Pl.Phdr.251 c; filotimi/as lelwfhkui=an Id.R.620c; so l. a)po\ no/sou kai\ pole/mou Th.6.12. c. part.,
cease to do, prh/swn A.R.4.819, cf. AP5.187 (Leon.).
abate, of pain, Hp.Int.49; of a disease, Th.2.49, Pl.Lg.854c; of misfortunes, Th.7.77; of wind, Arist.Mete.362a7; of the sea, Id.Pr. 934b15; o(/tan lwfh/swsin oi( li/qoi X.An.4.7.6. trans.,
lighten, relieve, o( lwfh/swn ga\r ou) pe/fuke/ pw A.Pr.27: c. gen., a)xe/wn lwfh/sete qumo/n
relieve your mind
from pains, Emp.145.2.
lwf-e/w, lon. (Ep.) for foreg., A.R.2.648, 4.1627, Nonn.D.1.172.

lwf-h/i+os, a, on,
relieving; l. i(era/
expiatory offerings, A.R.2.485.

lw/f-hma, gloss on lw=far,
relief, Hsch., cj. in S.Tr.554.

lw/f-hsis, ews, h(,
abatement, cessation, tou= pole/mou a)po\ th=s *peloponnh/sou Th.4.81; tw=n o)dunw=n Aët.11.5.
lw/y: xlamu/s, Hsch. lw/|wn, neut. lw=|oi, Att. contr. for lwi/+wn, lw/i+on.
